Title: Workingkstudent Full Stack Developer (m/f/d)
Description: Hello üëã, I'm Emilia.  As a proactive digital day companion, I enable seniors to have a better quality of life, community, and closeness. My first foundation is in place and I'm already having exciting conversations with my users. But I need backup! I am looking for an Working Student Full Stack Developer (m/f/d) who will solve my technical problems and bust down bugs in my system. Together with you we can change the lives of thousands upon thousands of people for the better. Loneliness is torture, but it doesn't have to be. What is your purpose in life?  Come with me, I'll tell you more:     As a Working Student Full Stack Developer at Emilia you will   Support and collaborate with a tight-knit team of engineers, product managers and designers to build the core of the Emilia platform Code mostly in Python. Sometimes work across multiple layers of our tech stack with TypeScript, Kotlin or PHP. Code without Fear. We believe that having reliable unit/integration tests  not only make programs more stable, but also gives you the confidence to refactor code without the fear of breaking things! You will solve technical problems and bust down those bugs üëª  These responsibilities are just a starting place! We‚Äôre a small company, we don‚Äôt have rigid roles, and we have a lot to do ‚Äì we can help you grow wherever your interests take you.     You will thrive in this role if you   Are comfortable working with Python üêç . Enjoy working with different languages üåà. Believe in fully documenting your ideas. Like getting rid of bugs üêû and enjoy clean code üßΩ.  If you don‚Äôt meet 100% of these qualifications you should still seriously consider applying ‚Äì at least one of us was missing each of these at the outset!     What can you learn at Emilia?   From time to time you will read some backend code (Pythonüêç + FastAPIüöÄ) You might have some exposure to Vue 3 üññ ecosystem You will have some exposure to Dockerüê≥ / Kubernetes ‚ò∏Ô∏è / ArgoCD üêô How to unit test your code       Emilia's values  At Emilia, we not only express our values, we also clearly live them every day:   Can-do:  We believe that a positive perspective can move mountains. That is why we face every new challenge with enthusiasm and anticipation. We motivate our team members to rethink things and simply try out crazy ideas. We consciously take risks without fear of failure. This makes our actions fast and learning even faster. We create together:  We are convinced that community makes many things better - our product, the work, the successes and also making mistakes. That's why we attach great importance to a positive team culture and friendly interaction with each other. We take responsibility:  We step in, to help shape the lives of our users, to make them better and happier. This gives us a special responsibility that every single team member shares. Maximum commitment, conscientious handling of the trust placed in us and the protection of data and privacy are our top priority.     Our values are also reflected in our benefits:   Our families and life outside of our jobs are very important to us; to reflect and support this we offer flexible working hours. Open door policy and a modern home office model. The chance to make the lives of our users and thus also the world a bit better through your work - purpose and meaningfulness for real life. Fair remuneration, team lunch & events. Agile cooperation with a technically experienced and motivated team. A dynamic start-up based on more than 10 years of successful management know-how.    I could tell you so much more, but it's best to see it for yourself! Apply directly or call Leonie, our recruiting manager, on +49 1579 2451235.  If you want to get an impression of what I, Emilia, look like, visit https://mit-emilia.de/

Title: Full Stack Developer (m/f/d)
Description: Travanto is one of the largest German holiday accommodation rental and listing platforms. Travanto acts as a booking portal and, with our product ‚ÄúReichweite+‚Äù, as a channel manager to third-party portals. On Travanto.de we offer more than 80,000 vacation properties. We also operate other regional tourism portals - including the market leader Sylt-Travel.de, which has been successfully bringing together guests and hosts on the island of Sylt for 20 years. Our other products include a rental portal for goods and services, mietmeile.de.   Our company employs a team of 80 IT, marketing, tourism and communication specialists based in the heart of Hamburg between City Hall and HafenCity.   At Travanto a team of 20 IT enthusiasts awaits you, working closely together while still assuming a great deal of personal responsibility. Depending on your personal interests and areas of expertise, you can flexibly work on different products, keeping your tasks varied and challenging. We are an agile team, our development and production are entirely based on Docker, and we operate our containers on AWS. With us, you can focus on becoming a Full Stack, Backend, API, or DevOps Developer.   We are currently seeking a Full Stack Developer (m/f/d) with PHP 8, JavaScript, and SQL skills.  Your tasks:     You develop and maintain web based applications (PHP, Go or Vue.js) You ensure high levels of performance and security in the code You support troubleshooting and resolving issues     Your profile:     You are an expert developer specialized in PHP or Go or similar You have excellent knowledge of Modern Frontend Frameworks (e.g. Vue.js), HTML, CSS and vanilla Javascript You have experience with git You have solid understanding of database design and best practices (e.g. MySQL, MongoDB) You are eager to learn new technologies     We offer:     Interesting web development projects with plenty of room for your design ideas and creativity Frequent feedback chats to support you with your technical skill development Free choice of operating system and IDE A pleasant informal atmosphere with a dynamic and motivated team A flat hierarchy with quick decision-making processes Flexible working hours at 30-40 hours/week with home office possibilities and a good work-life balance Excellent transportation links (U R√∂dingsmarkt, S Stadthausbr√ºcke, and various bus lines) Gym membership subsidy Fresh fruit, cereal, and free drinks Regular company events Attractive employee discounts with popular brands and shops through our corporate benefits program    Are you interested? Apply here: http://travanto.travel/v-fdWe look forward to seeing your application!  ]]>

Title: Full Stack // Web Developer (m/f/x)
Description: Wir schauen nicht nur auf die blanken Zahlen, denn wir suchen insbesondere nach Menschen, die sich durch Talent und Motivation auszeichnen. Wenn du also glaubst, dass diese Stelle genau zu dir passt und wir voneinander profitieren k√∂nnen, du aber (noch) nicht alle Kriterien erf√ºllst, freuen wir uns trotzdem √ºber deine Bewerbung.   ------------------------------   JUST ADD AI (JAAI) hilft Unternehmen dabei, den aktuellsten Stand der KI Technologie zu verstehen und auf ihr Gesch√§ft anzuwenden. Der Fokus von JAAI liegt dabei auf der Programmierung von skalierbaren KI-L√∂sungen, die bei unseren Kunden sofort Mehrwerte schaffen. Sobald eine KI-L√∂sung marktf√§hig ist und erste Kunden und Ums√§tze verzeichnet, wird sie in eine Tochtergesellschaft ausgegr√ºndet und dort skaliert. Um das Wachstum der Ausgr√ºndungen zu sichern, werden in den Tochtergesellschaften Beteiligungen vergeben und strategische Partner an Bord geholt.   Das Arbeiten in der JAAI Group zeichnet sich durch eine offene Kommunikation aus. Probleme werden in Teams aus Top-Spezialisten der Bereiche Sprachverarbeitung (NLP), Computervision, Big Data und Robotik, sowie aus erfahrenen IT-Managern und -Architekten, gemeinsam gel√∂st. Unsere Mission: ‚ÄûUnlock Human Talent‚Äú. KI √∂ffnet durch die Automatisierung repetitiver und zeitraubender T√§tigkeiten neue Freir√§ume f√ºr die Entfaltung des vollen Potentials menschlicher Talente.   Unser Team besteht aus Top-Spezialisten der Bereiche Sprachverarbeitung, Computervision, Big Data und Robotik, sowie aus erfahrenen IT-Managern und -Architekten. Unsere Mission: ‚ÄûUnlock Human Talent‚Äú. KI √∂ffnet durch die Automatisierung repetitiver und zeitraubender T√§tigkeiten neue Freir√§ume f√ºr die Entfaltung des vollen Potentials menschlicher Talente.   Deine Aufgaben  Als Full Stack // Web Developer konzeptionierst und entwickelst du die Oberfl√§chen f√ºr unsere KI-L√∂sungen. Du begleitest den Entwicklungsprozess von der Anforderungsanalyse bis zum Betrieb. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit unserem AI-Team planst, programmierst, testest und betreibst du Software eigenverantwortlich. Du stehst in Kontakt mit unseren Kunden, um ihre Bed√ºrfnisse zu verstehen und au√üergew√∂hnliche L√∂sungen zu schaffen.   Du konzeptionierst und entwickelst mit unserem KI-Team ma√ügeschneiderte Softwarel√∂sungen von der Anforderungsanalyse bis zur Inbetriebnahme Du integrierst unsere KI-L√∂sungen in bestehende Systeme Du nutzt moderne und zukunftsorientierte Technologien Du betreust den laufenden Betrieb im Third Level Support   Dein Profil   Du hast einen Masterabschluss in Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung im IT-Umfeld Du hast fundierte Kenntnisse und Erfahrung in Angular, Node.js, Docker und Datenbanken Du denkst l√∂sungs- und kundenorientiert und gehst dabei Probleme analytisch und strukturiert an Du arbeitest gerne im Team und kannst effektiv mit Personen unterschiedlicher Profession (technisch und nicht-technisch) kommunizieren Durch deine Motivation und Selbstdisziplin erreichst du eine hohe Produktivit√§t, lieferst Ergebnisse guter Qualit√§t termingerecht ab und motivierst andere Team-Mitglieder Durch kontinuierliche Selbstkritik verbesserst du iterativ deine eigenen Qualit√§tsstandards, was sich auch an deinen Noten ablesen l√§sst   Warum wir?   Ein junges Unternehmen mit flachen Hierarchien und kurzen, direkten Entscheidungswegen Ein Team mit talentierten Spezialisten aus den verschiedensten Bereichen der KI- und Software-Entwicklung Die M√∂glichkeit, die Entwicklung aktueller Technologien voranzutreiben und jeden Tag Neues zu lernen. Flexible Arbeitszeiten, eine lockere Atmosph√§re und Spa√ü am Arbeiten

Title: Software Engineer Full-stack Developer (f/m/d)
Description: To support our development team, we are looking for a Software Engineer or Full-stack Developer(f/m/d) with a focus on Java.     What you will do with us   You work as a valuable part of our agile international team on exciting software projects. You keep your skills, abilities, and knowledge up to date ‚Äì with regular innovation time and training or conference attendance. You can actively contribute your ideas to our own products. You will develop in full-stack, though you will be able to set your own focus, plus you will have colleagues who will gladly support you in case you are stuck.     What we use  Viaboxx Technology Stack: https://stackshare.io/companies/viaboxx-gmbh     What you can show us   You have a degree in Computer Science or a comparable field of study. You have good English skills ‚Äì speaking and writing. German is a plus. Along with your specialist expertise as a developer, you bring along a healthy portion of innovative spirit and drive to realize solutions. You are interested in project and product development and you do not shy away from assuming responsibility. You wish to improve your knowledge and you love to be part of a team ‚Äì after all, only together we will reach our goals.     What you can expect from us   The drive of innovation is our top priority: We always strive to extend our knowledge and deliver success for our team and our customers. Our ideas are implemented by the whole team: We work with cutting-edge technologies, flat hierarchies, and agile methods including company-wide retrospectives. We trust each other: Instead of a time clock, we have flexible, trust-based working hours, and possibilities for home office. Develop and evolve: In our international team, you can learn from your colleagues, actively help to shape our work environment, and pick up responsibilities quickly. Dev, Ops and beyond: We love thinking outside the box, in new ways to broaden our possibilities. Team spirit is important to us: We value open and effective communication between all team members and get together whenever possible for various group activities and events.    All this in a stylish, classical villa, where our working climate feels like home.    Does this sound like your kind of thing? Then apply now!  Applications in German are also welcome.

Title: Software Engineer Frontend Development (m/f/d) Remote Option
Description: Location: N√ºrnberg, DE, 90411   Job Requisition ID: 6270   Schaeffler is a dynamic global technology company and its success has been a result of its entrepreneurial spirit and long history of private ownership. Does that sound interesting to you? As a partner to all of the major automobile manufacturers, as well as key players in the aerospace and industrial sectors, we offer you many development opportunities.   Your Key Responsibilities   Specification, implementation and documentation of web-frontends in collaboration with UI/UX experts in an agile environment Integration with backend services in close collaboration with the backend development team as well as execution of codereviews Continuous quality assurance and evolution of software solutions Evaluation and documentation of new technologies and methods Development of Java-based backend services, CI/CD and DevOps if interested and suitable Working with cloud infrastructures und -services (based on Azure)    Your Qualifications   University degree in (Applied) Computer Science/ Informatics, or akin qualification with corresponding experience Deep knowledge and experience with Typescript and expertise with Angular Knowledge in Angular Material, NgRx-Store or Redux Pattern is beneficial Interest in or practical experience with Unit Testing based on Jest or Jasmine is a plus as well as experience in REST-Interfaces Fluent in English spoken and written, German is also beneficial At ease interacting with people within and outside of the organization as well as strong analytical skills and ability to focus Ability to take decisions and to be held accountable for them as well as ability to learn new skills when needed, be it new methodologies or others and to apply them to working methods    Exciting assignments and outstanding development opportunities await you because we impact the future with innovation. We look forward to your online application.   www.schaeffler.com/careers   Your contact  Schaeffler Technologies   Kornelija Jakir   +4915151508865   Keywords: Information Technology & Digitalization;   Job Segment:  Test Engineer, Testing, Developer, Cloud, Aerospace Engineering, Engineering, Technology

Title: Full Stack Developer (f/m/d)
Description: At IONOS, the leading European provider of cloud infrastructure, cloud services and hosting services, you will work together with a wide range of teams. We are characterized by open structures, a friendly working culture and flat hierarchies with a strong team spirit. We firmly believe that work and fun are compatible, and offer you the right environment for this. Our constant growth means that we are always looking for new colleagues. Become part of IONOS and grow with us.   Your Tasks:  Become a part of our agile and technology enthusiastic team and develop individual software solutions for the hardware management and monitoring of our data centers worldwide.   As a full-stack developer, you will improve and optimize the functionality of our software in regular exchange with our users and partners in order to simplify daily work through new automatisms. In our development team you will enjoy the freedom and opportunity to contribute your own ideas, get to know new technologies and actively shape your own development.   To strengthen our Data Center Software Development we are looking for energetic and experienced support as soon as possible:   You are responsible with the team for the further development of our internal web applications in Ruby, Vue.js and others. You will take responsibility for your projects and will also be actively involved in architectural decisions. In the team you are responsible for the extension and optimization of the automatisms of our applications. Feedback from our users spurs you on to continuously develop our services. You contribute to the continuous improvement of the application quality through regular code reviews.   We Appreciate:  You have a successfully completed degree in IT or comparable professional training and ideally have extensive experience in software development. Your further qualities include:   You are familiar with the concepts of object-oriented as well as functional software development and have a solid foundation regarding algorithms and data structures and are proficient in at least one programming language. Automated build and release processes as well as code versioning with Git are a matter of course for you, as is good knowledge of relational database systems such as Postgresql or MySQL. You have good knowledge in web technologies (HTML, CSS and Javascript) and develop software from Unix based operating systems. Experience in building web applications in Ruby on Rails would be an advantage, as well as experience in interface design. You enjoy agile ways of working and have experience in development methods like Scrum and like to take responsibility. Further development is important to you and your English skills are very good.    About IONOS    1&1 IONOS is Europe's leading platform for cloud services and hosting services. We successfully support our customers in their business development.   More than 4000 employees in several countries around the world are working to meet the requirements and wishes of our 8.5 million customers.   We promote the development of our employees and their different talents, interests and languages.   We value diversity and welcome all applications - regardless of, for example, gender, nationality, ethnic or social origin, religion, disability, age as well as sexual orientation and identity, physical characteristics, marital status or any other irrelevant factor subject to applicable law.

Title: SOFTWARE DEVELOPER (m,f,d)
Description: Frontend and backend development and data visualization    Are you passionate about geodata and programming? Then you've come to the right place: we're looking for a highly motivated software developer who enjoys trying new things. Are you an investigative character who likes geodata and data visualization? If you enjoy working in an inspiring team, then join our mission to map and monitor the planet.    Requirements:  Degree in computer science or geoinformatics  Experience in developing web applications, frontend and backend  Experience with React or other front-end Javascript frameworks, LeafletJS, CesiumJS and UI/UX design  Programming experience in Java Script, HTML, CSS, REST-API  Knowledge of QGIS, PostgreSQL, Git, Python is desirable

Title: Web Frontend Developer (m/f/d) Javascript & React & Redux
Description: Location 79241 Ihringen or 10627 Berlin, Germany   THE HELLA GUTMANN PROMISE  Curiosity is our driving force. We do know and understand the vehicle like no other. Our vast store of knowledge is neither limited to brands and models nor to technology. We are interconnecting this knowledge intelligently so that our customers worldwide are able to use it in combination with practicable products and services.   Our main product range features professional equipment for automotive workshops, car dealerships and automotive testing agencies. With about 500 employees and our head office in Ihringen near Freiburg im Breisgau we belong to the Hella Gutmann Group which is a corporation of the HELLA KGaA Hueck & Co.   Hella Gutmann is the birthplace of a whole host of good ideas that bring that little bit of extra success to vehicle workshops across the globe every single day. Getting this innovative strength on the road requires a strong team ‚Äì and you can be part of it. Find out more about us and fast-track your career with Hella Gutmann.   DEMONSTRATE YOUR POTENTIAL AND JOIN US TO SHAPE THE FUTURE OF THE DIGITAL WORKSHOP   You will be a member of a large interdisciplinary team, which is responsible for the realization of our front end application on the basis of React and Redux You will also be responsible for the upgrading of our own UI-Toolkit You will support our customers so that they can experience the best possible performance - also with mobile terminal devices You will ensure the quality and functionality of the applications by performing unit tests and integration tests   THE REASONS WHY YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT FOR OUR COMPANY   You have a completed education as an IT specialist (m/f/d) for application development or a completed university degree of informatics or a comparable qualification. Lateral career movers with proven expertise are also welcome Ideally you have several years of work experience in web development especially with focus on front end development You have excellent expert knowledge of Javascript (ECMAScript2015) as well as of React and Redux frameworks You have sound specialist knowledge of the common web standards (CSS3 and HTML5) and ideally of the realization of mobile apps and SPAs Unit and integration tests are nothing new for you You have already heard the term "functinal programming" You have some years of experience in the technical supervision of software developers Excellent communication skills and capacity for teamwork are some of your personality traits You have very sound language skills in German and English Specialist knowledge in WebGL and in fault and performance analysis are also part of your professional skills   WHAT WE ARE OFFERING TO MAKE YOUR EVERYDAY WORK EVEN MORE ENJOYABLE   Interesting tasks, innovative products and great colleagues An open and cooperative business culture with direct and friendly communication and cooperation A safe workplace in a continuously growing company Development measures and further education that is tailored to you personally Modern infrastructure at the workplace Company pension scheme with subsidy "Fit with HGS": Free fruit and water, running events "Eldercare": care program for relatives Employee discounts and much more   Take the opportunity to reveal your potential within a global, family-run company that offers you the best possible conditions for progressing in your career.   HELLA Gutmann Solutions GmbH  Arkadius Birkner   Am Krebsbach 2   79241 Ihringen   +49 (0) 7668/9900-1995

Title: Software Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: We are looking for a Software Engineer (m/f/d)(Full time / Part time min. 30 hour per week) to join and support one of our agile development teams.     About the position:    You will be working with the team that develops and improves the software in the Fundraising project. This includes developing and maintaining the existing Fundraising app and infrastructure, as well as supporting the annual fundraising campaign (e.g. implementing banner designs). The position is full-stack (including backend and devops tasks), but has a focus on Frontend development  .  You will be developing open source software that puts user needs first and increases users‚Äô satisfaction. Our Fundraising efforts fuel our continued work for the Wikipedia community, our large-scale software projects such as Wikidata and Wikibase, and our efforts to help secure access to free knowledge around the globe, to name but a few examples.     What we offer:     Flexible working hours adjusted to the team and people needs A diverse and inclusive bi-lingual organisation where people are the first priority Work in cross-functional teams towards a common goal A working culture that supports releasing a good product over releasing in order to meet a deadline We dedicate one day per quarter in the department to work on any non-work-related project you want A yearly learning budget that you choose how to spend to support you in your personal and professional development You can attend local user groups during working hours Opportunity to go to conferences, both as participants and contributors The possibility of working from home as well as a modern and centrally located office space in Berlin 30 days of holidays, public transport allowance, access to complementary pension benefits, continued salary in the event of ill children, free-of-cost external life coaching; This is a permanent contract     We are looking for the following profile:     You are passionate and care about software You have some experience with object oriented programming and web development You like being in a team working towards a common goal, learning together, and supporting and lifting up your peers You are interested in learning about our software architecture and how we maintain code quality You are happy to work on legacy code just as much as on new projects You like to participate in technical discussions and are open to new ideas You want to keep learning and developing yourself You are able to communicate fluently in English     Technologies we use:    Knowledge and experience in the following technologies (except for PHP and JavaScript) is not a requirement. We believe they all can be learned on the job and WMDE, your team, and your line manager will support you in this learning. We list only a few of them here.  Most of our server side code is written in PHP and the Symfony Framework. We use Vue.js and TypeScript for our modern frontends, but have some Vanilla JavaScript and Preact code as well. For version control we use Git and GitHub. We use Ansible for deployment.  We also keep migrating our legacy code into these and newer technologies. Also, testing is important to us; we use testing frameworks and practice continuous integration across our projects.     Why Wikimedia Deutschland?    Wikimedia Deutschland promotes these ideals even beyond the free encyclopaedia; it is our aim to establish and advocate for the creation, collection, and distribution of free knowledge in all parts of society. The Wikimedia vision is to create a world in which the sum of all human knowledge is freely accessible for everyone. The main focus of our activities is the support of volunteers, the development of technology and software, and the cooperation with cultural and scientific institutions. Furthermore, we advocate on both the national and EU-level a legal framework which allows for free knowledge to become part of our everyday life.       Interested?  Then apply now! Send us your detailed application documents (resume and motivational letter (yes, we read them) via our job portal. We kindly ask you to refrain from application photos and information on date of birth, marital status and parents. We look forward to hearing from you!    Wikimedia Germany is committed to equal opportunities and does not discriminate on the basis of, for example, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or belief, political or other convictions, gender, age, disability or sexual identity or orientation.    We very much welcome a broad range of candidates, to continuously support diversity in our teams.

Title: Full-Stack Engineer at Glocally
Description: üå≥ About Us    Glocally is a tech-driven logistics startup backed by Y Combinator that enables zero-emission same and next day deliveries for e-commerce brands. Our vision is to offer deliveries for the way you life today, resulting in an Uber-like delivery experience while building a sustainable delivery network to power operations in key urban areas. By combining deep technical expertise with operational rigour, we believe that we can provide the best deliveries on earth. Learn more about Glocally here    ‚ö° Why You Should Be Excited About This Opportunity    As an Intern in Product Management, you will support our product team and partner with product, tech and business across Glocally. You will work closely with the management team and get the opportunity to join a fast growing organization supporting in building a meaningful product with a market fit. Your ultimate goal is to reduce human interaction out of redundant processes ensuring the scalability of our business model. This role works closely with our CPO.   What you will do   Together with the rest of the product team you will be a part of defining our strategic direction and shaping the future of zero-emission delivery. Build new features that impact our merchants, shoppers, and drivers within external and internal contexts. Solve complex problems with a pragmatic mindset in order to make products more accessible, more efficient and simply more fun. Talking to customers in order to understand problems, strategically position products as well as automating crucial business processes with state-of-the-art webtools like Make and Retool. Build a culture around excellence together with the rest of the team. Be a key contributor to our mission to simplify everyday lives and revolutionize e-commerce with a world-class delivery experience.    ü§© Why We Are Excited About You    You are excited about the future of logistics and want to help decarbonize the logistics industry.    Desired Skills    Currently pursuing or already completed a bachelor's or master's degree at a top-tier university. Experience in managing several internal and external stakeholders at once in your daily work. Critical thinker with a pragmatic approach to problems and curious mind to solve complex problems. You care about providing a great end-user experience and always put the customer first. Experienced in working with an agile development methodology. You have a technical and social understanding of the bridge between design and development, and how to create an internal culture that outputs seamless and beautiful user experiences.   üëâ WHY US?   Team events and offsite: We offer fun regular team events and offsites. The tools you need: We provide the best equipment for you to excel at your work. Office in the heart of Munich: Join our warm office in the heart of Munich. Coffee, tea, and snacks: Enjoy healthy snacks for your brain. Competitive compensation: We offer market-competitive salaries and stock options. You care about providing a great end-user experience and always put the customer first. Experienced in working with an agile development methodology. Title: Software Development Engineer
Description: The ideal candidate has experience in the handling with electronics and instrument applications. You should enjoy working in a development-oriented and international team.    Qualifications    Completed engineering studies in computer science, electrical engineering or comparable technical studies Good knowledge of the operating system Microsoft Windows, as well as experience with embedded Linux Good programming skills in Python as well as JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, bootstrap as well as jQuery or similar Web Application Framework Further knowledge of shell / bash scripting and ssh would be an advantage Enjoy working with real hardware such as motors, sensors, cameras, lasers and any kind of controllers Understanding of technical / physical relationships Good communication and team skills, as well as open-mindedness to new tasks Extensive analytical and technical skills Strong willingness to communicate, good organizational skills and self-motivation Good German and English, both spoken and written    Responsibilities    Design, implement, documentation and maintain software for instrument control and data analysis of life science research equipment, including: - Communication protocols such as TCP / IP based Web-Sockets, http, REST / JSON - Control flow for automated sample preparation with subsequent measurements and analyzes Development of web-based UI for device control and adjustment Software verification including code reviews, automated system tests, troubleshooting and documentation in online tracking- and documentation Systems Prepare detailed technical specifications in collaboration with the project team Development and planning of software architectures to control our devices and their implementation Promote collaborative software development and quality assurance    What We Offer    Purposeful & inspirational environment Dynamic culture in which customers are at the forefront Being part of a highly qualified team that is committed to excellence Access to cutting-edge expertise through which you can make positive impact in the world around us

Title: Full-Stack Software Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Global Savings Group is Europe's largest and most trusted shopping rewards platform, empowering millions of people to make better purchase decisions.   GSG values a culture of belonging, where you can join a talented team of 600+ people from more than 50 countries in 12 office locations. With us, you will reach millions of customers worldwide, connecting them directly to the brands they love.   You will become a part of the agile, fast-growing team of experts, including tech enthusiasts, online marketers, key account managers, and editors. You will have the opportunity to work on projects with an international footprint where we value your input and allow you to become a driver of change.    What We Offer...    A culture that cherishes your individual and professional development An open-minded team that embraces new ideas, perspectives, and methodologies Flexible working hours with the possibility of remote working Cloud-based company Beer Fridays and local and international get-togethers - once Work from Home policy is over   We are currently looking for a Full-Stack Software Engineer (m/f/d)  to join our Engineering team in our office in Munich. Our Product and Technology team  is autonomous and co-functional, operating in an agile devops environment with a strong customer focus. Our product engineering teams target outcomes rather than outputs, using OKRs to deliver our vision. You will be joining at a growth stage of the business and will be instrumental in improving the current delivery and quality processes, and support your team to deliver high quality and robust solutions for our customers and our business.   You should have:   BS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience 2+ years of experience in developing complex modular applications from technical planning to implementation Strong knowledge of Java (8 or higher) and object-oriented programming Solid experience with JavaEE, Hibernate, Spring Strong knowledge of JS (TypeScript, Angular, NodeJS), HTML, CSS Solid experience with NoSQL data stores (inc. MongoDB and Mysql) Good exposure to API development and Microservice architecture Logical, analytic thinking, structured and target-oriented approach, very good problem solving skills Passion for delivering clean code, unit/integration tests and maintainable documentation Understanding of common design/architectural patterns Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies and DevOps best practices Good communication skills in English   The following skills are a plus:   Experience with or interest in AWS, ElasticSearch, Relational and NoSql DBs, messaging and queuing solutions, GraphQl Knowledge of common frameworks (Hibernate, Spring, Jersey, Liquibase), VCS (Git), frontend technologies (HTML, CSS, TypeScript, Angular, NodeJs, Next.js, React), Docker, CI/CD solutions   Are you up for it?  Send us your CV in English  .   Any questions? Get in touch with Samia  today.   At Global Savings Group, we want to ensure that all employees can thrive in an inclusive environment. Our employment opportunities are open to every gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, ability, place of origin, or socioeconomic status. We remain committed to a culture of diversity, equity and belonging, where all employees are welcomed, respected, connected, and engaged.

Title: Fullstack Developer Early Stage Recommerce Startup
Description: reverse supply is an early-stage startup in Berlin that helps fashion brands & retailers gain access to the resale market for their products. Using our recommerce-as-a-service solution, brands can launch resale programs that allow consumers to shop & trade-in pre-owned products. Founded in late 2020, we are live with our first clients, have a functioning MVP and are funded & backed by some of the best VCs and angels in the industry.   Tasks  We are building out our MVP to a scalable platform.   You will join our first engineering team, collaborating closely with the CTO, the other founders and the operations team.   You will be working on partner integrations as well as our in-house logistics platform. The tech stack is based on AWS serverless technologies and we work with Python and Javascript.   We are looking for someone who is not afraid to work on any layer: frontend, backend and cloud infrastructure. You don‚Äôt need to be an expert in everything, though.    Requirements    You are ready to go on an entrepreneurial journey and understand very well the pros and cons of workingfor an early-stage startup. You can demonstrate first experiences in the mentioned tech areas. You are based in Berlin or willing to move to Berlin soon.   Please note you must be permitted to work in Germany. We currently have no capacity to support you with visa process and relocation.    Benefits    A great opportunity to join a startup in a rapidly growing industry, shape the future of Fashion & Recommerce You will contribute to make online retail less resource-intensive and more sustainable. You will make the world a little bit better. Lean development process that focuses on business value and technical excellence A high degree of responsibility Direct, day-to-day work experience with our co-founders The possibility to shape & drive our technology development from the beginning This role is full-time, compensated with a salary and stock options   Interested?   Please reach out to us with your profile. Links to the products you have already built and your LinkedIn profile are also welcome as well.

Title: Fullstack Developer (f/m/d)
Description: At IONOS, the leading European provider of cloud infrastructure, cloud services and hosting services, you will work together with a wide range of teams. We are characterized by open structures, a friendly working culture and flat hierarchies with a strong team spirit. We firmly believe that work and fun are compatible, and offer you the right environment for this. Our constant growth means that we are always looking for new colleagues. Become part of IONOS and grow with us.   Your Tasks:  You will develop the IONOS sales platform. Together with your agile, international team, you will work on new features, maintenance, and the technical realignment of our store platform, making our products available and tangible for end customers.   Specifically, you can look forward to the following tasks:   You will take care of the further and new development of high-quality, accessible and responsive user interfaces as well as the development of the business logic of our store platform. You will take responsibility for your features and ensure the quality of your code through automated tests and code reviews. Together with our internal customers and your agile team you exchange ideas and develop targeted solutions. You will work actively in the team to contribute your ideas and opportunities for improvement.   We Appreciate:  Software development is your passion and you are a motivated team player who likes to work independently and on your own responsibility.   You have a good technical understanding of common web technologies such as HTML, XML, (S)CSS and JavaScript. You bring solid experience in software development with Javascript, Typescript as well as Java and Spring (Boot). Ideally, you have already worked with a modern framework such as React and have experience in using build tools such as npm, Webpack or grunt as well as Maven in the Java backend. You have gained experience in unit testing and ideally also with Selenium testing and are confident using git for version control. You are open and communicative and would like to work in a team together with developers and QA in an agile environment and English is no problem for you in your daily work.    About IONOS    1&1 IONOS is Europe's leading platform for cloud services and hosting services. We successfully support our customers in their business development.   More than 4000 employees in several countries around the world are working to meet the requirements and wishes of our 8.5 million customers.   We promote the development of our employees and their different talents, interests and languages.   We value diversity and welcome all applications - regardless of, for example, gender, nationality, ethnic or social origin, religion, disability, age as well as sexual orientation and identity, physical characteristics, marital status or any other irrelevant factor subject to applicable law.

Title: Frontend Developer (m/f/d) React
Description: AVANTGARDE Experts places Software Engineering Experts for web development, mobile, data science, AI and many other areas throughout Germany - apply now for an exciting job with one of our well-known clients!   For our client, a pioneer in the field of Green Energy, we are filling from now on in the greater Munich area, the following permanent position:   Frontend Developer (m/f/d) React   YOUR TASKS   Design and further development of the IoT platform as well as integration of new product generations Front-end programming on a customer-oriented software for the control and monitoring of fuel cell systems Independent and autonomous work in an agile team in close coordination with the backend developers Continuous exchange with the rest of the embedded software team Implementation of latest device compatibility standards and user friendliness, E2E testing, mockup design, etc.    Your Qualifications   Already first practical experience in frontend development with React.js, CSS/SASS, HTML5, TypeScript Ideally already first touches with Python, MVC, GraphQL, WebSocket, etc. Experience with graphic design software (e.g. Illustrator) desirable Good application of agile team structures Very good knowledge of English, good knowledge of German    Benefits   International company with flat hierarchies as well as a collegial, family environment Many creative possibilities and freedoms Permanent position with flexible working hours, 30 days of vacation and mobile work Additional benefits such as sports offers, company pension scheme, team and company events Modern office with sun terrace, parking spaces, free e-charging station and good connections to the MVV network    INTERESTED? Title: Software Engineer - Front End
Description: About Starburst  Starburst is the fastest, most efficient analytics engine for a data warehouse, data lake, or data mesh. Our software provides fast and easy access to data, no matter where it lives, with a best-in-class MPP SQL engine that shortens the path to value for data. The Starburst Enterprise Platform leverages the power of the open source Trino (formerly PrestoSQL) to query data across any database, making it instantly actionable for data-driven organizations. Our SaaS offering, Starburst Galaxy provides all the benefits of Trino and Starburst in an easy to use, fully-managed enterprise-ready multi-cloud SaaS platform designed by Trino‚Äôs original creators and experts.   With Starburst, teams can lower the total cost of their infrastructure and analytics investments, prevent vendor lock-in, and use the existing tools that work for their business. Though Starburst has achieved a unicorn status and raised $414M in venture funding from top investors, we were founded with customers and revenue from the very beginning. Our customers love us, we operate globally, and we are proud to be named a Best Place to Work . Come join our team of All-Stars!   About The Role  As a front-end engineer on a distributed team, you‚Äôll share ownership of building out our first-class user experience. You‚Äôll work closely with engineers, UX, and product management to design and build front-end components to implement new features our customers will love. Daily tasks include developing and supporting new and existing product features, working with fellow engineers around the world, working through wireframes and mocks with our design team, learning new technologies, and collaborating with various stakeholders across the organization.   Responsibilities   Owning the user experience and implementation of UI features, and fixes that delight our customers Provide considerate and timely review of your peers' pull requests and design proposals Continuously improve our engineering processes, tests, and systems that allow us to scale the code base and productivity of the team Collaborate with teams globally and operate in a fast paced environment Provide exceptional customer support for both internal and external customers    Some of the things we look for   Passion for Software Engineering Experience developing and operating UI backend services in Java Experience implementing web based user interfaces in TypeScript using a modern web frontend framework (React, Angular, Ember, etc) Demonstration of ownership, grit, and bias for action - these are core values at Starburst    Benefits  At Starburst, we‚Äôre constantly striving towards building a place where people come first by creating an environment of transparency, honesty, and respect. We take care of our global workforce by making sure employees enjoy competitive salaries and attractive stock grants, remote-friendly work options, access to quality and affordable insurance, and flexible and generous paid time off to start a family, travel, or just relax!   Headquartered in Boston MA with offices in Warsaw and London and employees across Europe and the Americas, we are committed to hiring where the talent is.   Starburst provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.   #BI-Remote

Title: Flutter Full-Stack Developer
Description: With Widgetbook we develop the collaboration platform for frontend developers. We bring designers, developers and product owners on one platform and optimize collaboration as review processes. To achieve this goal we raise funding in ordert to grow faster and expand our team. If this sounds exciting we would be glad if you join our mission.   We are looking for candidates who will bring a positive and professional attitude and a willingness to roll up their sleeves and pitch in, who will take initiative to be the best at their jobs and who have the ambition to become a leader on their team.   We are seeking a Software Developer, who has a deep understanding of software development with Flutter. You will be responsible for architecting and building Widgetbook in close cooperation with the CTO. Building a product is a highly collaborative effort, and as such, a strong team player with a commitment to perfection is required.   Tasks   Translate designs and wireframes into high-quality code Design, build and maintain high performance, reusable, and reliable frontends with Flutter (Dart) and backends with Firebase (Node.js). Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the application    Requirements    It's at the core of our culture that we don't just accept the status quo, but enable everything in the customer's mind that leads to a better life. For this, you need a lot of energy and resilience to constantly find new ways to solve things. 3+ years of experience building backends with Node.js and/or Firebase. 2+ years experience with using Flutter and Dart. Knowledge of the open-source Flutter ecosystem and commonly used flutter packages like freezed and bloc. You're fluent in English (add-on: German)    Benefits    Work from Home, from our offices or wherever you like. We are happy to cover the costs of a co-working space near you. Opportunity to be involved in building a SaaS business and revolutionizing the way development teams work. Deep insights into the startup scene and strategic decision-making in a fast-growing startup. Close collaboration with the management and founding team. Flat hierarchies as well as short and direct communication channels. Great atmosphere in our office at the Founders Foundation in Bielefeld or Garage33 in Paderborn Germany. Room for personal development Flexible working hours

Title: Full Stack Engineer (all genders)
Description: Babbel is driven by a purpose: Creating mutual understanding through language. This means building an ecosystem of language learning offerings that helps people connect across cultures. Babbel, Babbel Live and Babbel for Business provide users with the most effective solution to be able to communicate with real people, in real situations. The key is a blend of humanity and technology. More than 60,000 lessons across 14 languages are hand-crafted by 180+ linguists, with user behaviours continuously analysed to shape and tweak the learner experience. And it works: Studies with Yale University, City University of New York and Michigan State University prove its effectiveness. From headquarters in Berlin and New York, 750 people from more than 65 nationalities represent all the differences that make humans unique. Babbel is the most profitable language learning app worldwide, with more than 10 million subscriptions sold. For more information, visit www.babbel.com or download the apps in the App Store or Play Store.   We are looking for a Full Stack Engineer to join our office in Berlin!   You will:   Deliver value iteratively by building high-quality applications and features Build, maintain, and take ownership of a rich ecosystem of applications and services Be part of feature teams and build end-to-end customer features Own architectural design and constantly propose improvements of the existing features Ensure that the systems you own are healthy, resilient, and perform well Collaborate cross-functionally on feature design, architectural decisions, and assessing technical debt Shape our coding guidelines and quality standards React, troubleshoot and solve operational events (bugs and incidents) Focus on continuous learning and improvement and drive the evolution of our engineering practices   You have:   Experience in building scalable systems and applications using Ruby, Typescript or Nodejs Strong sense for good API design and third-party API integrations Experience in using AWS, NoSQL databases Proficient knowledge in JavaScript, HTML, CSS (incl. preprocessors and CSS in JS) Knowledge in component-based frontend frameworks, ideally React and Redux Testing experience on different levels: unit, integration, contract, and E2E Willingness to cooperate with the product and business stakeholders building together a trust working environment A can-do attitude to build MVPs and iterate on them in short cycles Good understanding of lean and agile practices Good communication and interpersonal skills Fluency in written and spoken English   Nice to have:   Strong understanding of Event-Driven Architecture Knowledge of analyzing metrics about system health and performance (ideally DataDog, CloudWatch, PagerDuty, Rollbar) Experience with infrastructure-as-code,ideally with Terraform Solid sense for good API design and third-party API integrations Experience with responsive design and working with design teams   Life At Babbel   Work on a product which transforms the lives of millions A culture which fosters belonging and treats diversity as its strength Meet and collaborate with colleagues at internal events such as Babbel Innovates, Lunch & Learns, Blind Coffees, Babbel Perspectives, Stranger Talks and (virtual) parties A lively startup atmosphere in a vibrant international company with 750 Babbelonians representing over 65 different nationalities   Some perks of becoming a Babbelonian:   30 vacation days and flexible working hours BVG card or Swapfiets bike Jobbatical and Sabbatical options Many internal & external learning opportunities to choose from A yearly Learning & Development budget Visa and relocation assistance Full access to Babbel & Babbel Live classes Modern office in the heart of buzzing Berlin equipped with a family, music, faith and nap room Various internal communities to be part of including the Femgineers+, DEI Ambassadors, Accessibility & Disability Group and more   Diversity at Babbel  As part of our ongoing journey towards building a diverse, equitable and inclusive company, we welcome everyone to apply, especially those individuals who are underrepresented in tech. We are a learning company, inside and out, and we encourage you to apply even if you do not fit all the technical requirements - all candidates are assessed based on skills, qualifications and on our business needs. Please state your pronouns at the beginning of your application, and let us know if you‚Äôd like to be addressed by a name other than the one appearing on your official documents. If you have a disability or special need, feel welcome to inform us, so that we can provide you with the proper assistance in the application process.   Sounds good? We are already looking forward to hearing from you! Check out our jobs page, our blog, and our techblog for a fuller picture of #lifeatbabbel!
