Location: 100% Home Office in Germany   Salary: competitive   Languages: Fluent English (German is advantageous)   Key skills: TypeScript, JavaScript, Angular, node.js, data   modelling   Tasks   Implement and design new features Work collaboratively in an Agile environment Make contributions to improve and update workflows    Requirements    At least 2 years‚Äô experience with Software Development Strong understanding of TypeScript OR JavaScript Experience with Angular and/or node.js is a plus Fluent English (German is an advantage) Ideally previous experience in an Agile environment    Benefits    Flexible working hours and 100% Home Office Good development and progression opportunities Employee discounts Innovative onboarding process   I look forward to your application.

Title: Software Engineer - Frontend
Description: About Kittl    Job description  With Kittl we envision a global community where members inspire each other and let their creativity run free. Creating beautiful designs can be a long and sometimes even painful process. We decided to tackle this problem head-on and have built Kittl.com as the most intuitive and easy-to-use design platform on the web. With offices in Berlin and Dusseldorf, we are a diverse team of 25 creators - hailing from 10+ nationalities - and benefit from the strong support of our A-level seed investors.    About The Role    As a part of a cross-functional team including other developers, designers and a founding team, you will create and develop an amazing product that you will be proud of. Your main responsibilities include building vector graphics, fonts and modern JavaScript. You need to be familiar with object-oriented and functional programming concepts and being able to deliver high-quality code in a timely fashion.    Requirements    What you need to know:   HTML and CSS, JavaScript (ES6+), React   What's good to know:   TypeScript ESLint / prettier RxJS or similar libraries WebAssembly Storybook SQL and relational databases MongoDB or other NoSQL databases AWS S3 and CloudFront or other static hosting stack   What's great to know:   SVG, Algorithms (especially in computational geometry) Redux / MobX or other state management library styled-components Node.js, Express or similar webpack / rollup / parcel etc. Jest / AVA or other test library   Your profile:   3+ years of development experience Good understanding of web stack You know how to make complex things simple You can work fast and smart at the same time You are a great learner   Benefits & why you should join us:  Join one of the hottest start-ups in graphic design to shape the future of graphic creation and enjoy a very open, transparent and performance driven company culture with a fast and agile development cycle. You'll work closely with and learn from a passionate and talented founding team.   You‚Äôll work on an exciting new product You‚Äôll work with an amazing team of talented people Very flexible working culture where progress counts Fast interview process Competitive compensation and equity package in full-time roles   Also we have snacks, coffee, regular team dinners and rooftop parties ;)   If that sounds interesting to you let's get in touch!

Title: Frontend Developer - Online Development (m/f/x)
Description: Company Description    We are looking for the best people to be part of our adventure and create an enjoyable, focused and challenging environment that results in a great culture, we live and enjoy every day. Our small teams work closely together and can solve even the toughest business problems and find the best possible solution for our customers.   At rebuy, we believe that user experience depends on the software we design, which is why the code needs to excel. The whole architecture should be fun to use, fast, rock-solid, and simply state of the art. Of course, we also know good code can only be created by great and happy people. In order to be good, you need to feel comfortable at work. We push hard to make work equal fun and challenging so you reach new heights.   Job Description:  The frontend is the garden of our product and our goal is to make it bloom and be as beautiful as possible. Join our party on their way towards that goal and support us with your frontend skills. Groom, trim, and rake by adding new features, improving customer-related metrics, and evolve our website. Angular, Webpack and TypeScript will be your tools of trade while using CSS to let designs become reality. Take decisions for the right ingredients based on data you receive from tools like Calibre, Sentry, Google Analytics, and A/B-Tests.   As the frontend flourishes, you will also work with the backend colleagues of your team to create the APIs that your freshly planted features require. Your green thumb is still twitching? Unroot bugs and wrap your head around weird issues that frontend development unveils.   Qualifications:  Love planting, gardening, and harvesting the fruits of your whole team‚Äôs effort? Splendid! We expect that you have at least three years of pragmatic experience working with a high-traffic website built using Angular. You know the benefits of TypeScript, are open to new technologies that are not part of your current repertoire and you are especially not scared of working a little bit with PHP. Testing your code and creating applications that are on a par with current architectural standards is common sense to you. Overall, you‚Äôre in love with pragmatic decisions and enjoy the responsibility for what you do.   Compiled:   This is a senior position Experience in or willingness to learn Angular is a must TypeScript is your bread and butter CSS doesn‚Äôt have any secrets to you You are familiar with Webpack You understand the necessity of testing your code Besides naming a few design principles you understand their essence A bit of PHP background is nice to have You love to take decisions because it's your product Pragmatic, simple solutions are as important as having a strong opinion   What to expect at rebuy:   Ôªø   A successful, professional, and dynamic team where autonomy and new ideas are welcomed Flat hierarchy and transparency Brand New office in Berlin Kreuzberg just seconds away from the Spree Family- and dog friendly, flexible environment Employee Discounts Corporate Benefits Program, sustainable Benefits on Futurebens Benefits-Portal with a variety of offers and discounts Sustainable Micro Mobility Team and Company Events Massages, Workshops and Wellbeing Offers Mental Health Support 30 Vacationdays and Child-Sickness Days At rebuy all people are welcome and supported! We would like to talk, regardless of age, disability, national and social origin, skin color, religion, gender identity and sexual orientation. Just be who you are!   Additional information:  We are offering a unique job in an innovation-friendly company within an inspiring and flourishing environment. We always want you to be productive in your way. Before you join you can choose your state-of-the-art hardware: Although our eco system is built around linux/mac, we don't care whether you run Mac, Linux, or Windows. Our atmosphere is open-minded: Something you want to change or something to introduce? Let‚Äôs talk about it! The projects have a broad scope for co-decision-making. Our goals are ambitious and they will lead us to exciting paths.

Title: Frontend Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: As Frontend Engineer (m/f/d)  you will work in a cross-functional team of software engineers building web applications with a focus on performance, high availability and maintainability. The team consists of 5 people coming from 4 different countries, highly experienced in frontend engineering and pushing the limits of what is possible. But it‚Äôs just a small part of a bigger Westwing team! You will be working closely with other frontend and backend teams on business and tech features. This position is unlimited.   WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL DO   working in a cross-functional team building and architecting applications with a focus on performance. Every millisecond counts building a scalable and highly available service with all the 9s delivering the top quality UX and visuals of the application you build ensuring your service is well tested, architected, meets our coding standards and has proper logging, monitoring and alerting check out our website, WestwingNow.de, to find out more about our product    YOU COME WITH   passion for shipping. Trunk Based Development is a plus. CI/CD is a must. Putting code live every day is a given best tool for the job mentality. You are not a zealot and truly believe in the best tool for the job approach. You aren‚Äôt afraid to try something new and introduce new tech and concepts strong communication skills. You are comfortable working with any colleague from any area. You are comfortable defending your ideas or challenging others. People like to work with you. react expertise. Typescript is a plus performance is a feature, not an afterthought. You are comfortable with the ins and outs and capable of squeezing every millisecond of performance out of the browser or would like to work within this mentality architecture is something that you are passionate about‚Äì both code and infrastructure    WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT   working in an international, diverse team of experts in a dynamic and fast-paced e-commerce environment countless opportunities to grow your career and shape your professional future centrally located and dog-friendly offices with free beverages and fruits, cafeteria with different lunch options, diverse sports and health offerings and regular team and afterwork events up to 40% employee discount, volunteering day off, company pension scheme, discounted mobility options (e.g. public transport, JobRad, Swapfiets) and company daycare ‚ÄúWestwing Wichtel‚Äù state-of-the-art tech infrastructure running on AWS and Kubernetes (check out our Techradar), professionally equipped workstation (Mac, screens, peripherals, etc) of your personal choice and yearly training budget for every tech team member remote working model with designated in-office tribe weeks, read more on our Tech Blog    What are you waiting for? Apply via our online form. We are looking forward to your application including your possible starting date. If you have any questions regarding the job, please contact Andrea Galantucci.   Please note that we don‚Äôt accept Email-Applications!  Diversity is deeply rooted in the Westwing culture. Our mission doesn‚Äôt stop to inspire only your design choices, it continues to embrace an inclusive lifestyle filled with respect to everyone‚Äôs uniqueness, cultural differences and equal opportunity.   ABOUT WESTWING  Being part of Westwing  means working in an inspiring and diverse environment that enables you to grow. Our more than 2,300 international team members connect creativity and style with state-of-the-art technology and strong business fundamentals. Westwing is the European leader in inspiration-based Home and Living eCommerce with EUR 522m of revenue in 2021 across 11 countries. Our mission is: To inspire and make every home a beautiful home. Through our 'shoppable magazine', we inspire our loyal Home Enthusiast customers with a curated product selection and combine it with gorgeous content. The company was founded in 2011 and is headquartered in Munich.

Title: Reactive TypeScript Frontend Engineer at kopplr GmbH
Description: kopplr is growing and always looking for passionate programmers who are highly independent, but also a good fit for the company culture.   Tasks  Since kopplr's functionality involves a lot of front-end work we are looking for a talented front-end engineer for our stack composed of our class-based VueJs component library. We aim at improving load times, compilation times and covering more of the codebase with tests and reducing errors for our users across devices.    Requirements    Professional experience in VueJS Familiar with Apollo store for GraphQL interaction Knows about TypeScript backbone Deep understanding of functional programming At least 4 years of experience Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken German language skills will be beneficial A problem solving mindset and deadline-driven Excellent collaboration skills, with strong verbal and written communication    Benefits    Receive fair and equitable remuneration Work on cutting-edge technologies Improve your skills and learn from top-notch engineers Become part of a young and dynamic team with flat hierarchies Work remotely and organize your time freely Enjoy an open and appreciative working atmosphere

Title: Junior Full Stack Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Job Description    Here at Fashion Cloud we are transforming the fashion industry and supporting our customers through our solid base of software products. We are looking for a full stack software engineer that can help us grow and maintain our web platform.   About The Job    As a full stack engineer, you will be working in cycles of six weeks, crafting and developing the solutions to our customer's problems, in an environment with a high level of autonomy. You will be responsible for developing features and improvements from planning to production.   Our web platform's backend is written in Node.js and we use the Express web framework connected to a MongoDB database. We run on AWS, connecting our services through message queues. Our frontend is written in Angular following our style-guide along with a components library we are still developing. We write all our code in Typescript and ES6.   You'll be part of a cohesive team, pushing for getting the best results and sharing your experiences. You'll be writing highly tested JSON APIs and top notch database queries to support the frontend components you'll be creating, as well as developing our internal libraries and frameworks. We learn from each other, so you'll also pull request reviews and provide technical mentorship to expand the team's knowledge.   We love writing good software and believe in continuous learning. That means you will get time to expand your knowledge and to build a cool side project. You will be able to attend conferences, play around on different learning platforms and to get whatever you need to help you grow. Plus you'll join our company trips twice a year which are already a legendary tradition.   Curious to know more about our technology? Check out our tech blog.    Requirements    We are looking for a full stack engineer  passionate in web technologies  , who would like to relocate to Hamburg.    About You    You feel comfortable designing and writing Javascript code from the backend to the frontend You take initiative and responsibility - You own the code, it's up to you to improve it You are a definitive team player - You are awarded a silver medal in speaking and a golden medal in listening A Degree in Computer Science or related field is highly preferred You speak English fluently   What‚Äôs in it for you?   Free choice of laptop and equipment (e.g. MacBook) Relocation and VISA support - permits, flight, accommodation? We‚Äôve got you covered! Flexible working times - No 9 to 5, you are in charge of your time! Possibility to work remotely - want to work from another EU country? this is possible for up to 4 weeks a year A great office - we stick to hybrid work model with at least 2 days a week working from the office Summer Camp - a weekend away, full of fun team building activities Summer House - a beautiful location where we work and have fun during summer time Health is wealth - Sports membership discount + mental health support by nilo.health Continuous education - 1000‚Ç¨ yearly development budget, books and online tutorials from Pluralsight Regular team activities - Christmas party, Trivia nights and much more   __

Title: Software Engineer
Description: HB Studios is a driving force in the creation of sports video games and the studio behind PGA TOUR 2K Golf ‚Äì presently working on PS4, PS5, XboxOne, Xbox Series X/S and PC. We have an opportunity for a Software Engineer  to join our team of developers, creators, and fans, who are passionate about the art and process involved in video game development.   As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for designing and implementing code and script as needed for a project while ensuring high quality work is delivered on time.   Main Duties And Responsibilities   Work closely with colleagues across all disciplines on the project team Ensure that the Technical Lead is aware of the progress of assigned work Communicate issues that could disrupt agreed upon schedules with the Technical Lead Implement code and script to the required coding standards Ensure that components are designed and reviewed prior to implementation Achieve in-game performance targets as required by Production Create and maintain positive working relationships with all team members    Essential Skills, Knowledge And Experience   Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or equivalent experience Practical experience programming in C++ or C# Practical experience with game engines (Unity, Unreal) Fundamental math skills (matrices, vectors, algebra, etc.) Ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment Ability to work with a high degree of self-direction when necessary Excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills Self-motivated, creative, outside-the-box thinker    Desirable Skills, Knowledge And Experience   Passionate video game enthusiast Experience working on video games Interest in specific game programming disciplines (i.e., artificial intelligence, rendering, user interface, audio) Experience with 3D graphics programming (Shaders, DirectX, OpenGL, Vulkan) Advanced knowledge in math and physics

Title: Full Stack Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Job Description    Here at Fashion Cloud we are transforming the fashion industry and supporting our customers through our solid base of software products. We are looking for a full stack software engineer that can help us grow and maintain our web platform.    About The Job    As a full stack engineer, you will be working in cycles of six weeks, crafting and developing the solutions to our customer's problems, in an environment with a high level of autonomy. You will be responsible for developing features and improvements from planning to production.   Our web platform's backend is written in Node.js and we use the Express web framework connected to a MongoDB database. We run on AWS, connecting our services through message queues. Our frontend is written in Angular following our style-guide along with a components library we are still developing. We write all our code in Typescript and ES6.   You'll be part of a cohesive team, pushing for getting the best results and sharing your experiences. You'll be writing highly tested JSON APIs and top notch database queries to support the frontend components you'll be creating, as well as developing our internal libraries and frameworks. We learn from each other, so you'll also do pull request reviews and provide technical mentorship to expand the team's knowledge.   It will be your and your team‚Äôs responsibility to ensure we are able to adapt to new circumstances to take every opportunity we have in order to achieve organizational goals. For that, you‚Äôll need to build processes and tooling that will ensure a rapid development cycle that allows experimentation, learning, and changing courses based on the knowledge acquired. All of this needs to happen without compromising quality.   We love writing good software and believe in continuous learning. That means you will get time to expand your knowledge and to build a cool side project. You will be able to attend conferences, play around on different learning platforms and to get whatever you need to help you grow. Plus you'll join our company trips twice a year which are already a legendary tradition.   Curious to know more about our technology? Check out our tech blog.    About You    Requirements  We are looking for experienced full stack engineers passionate in web technologies who feel comfortable designing and writing Javascript code from end to end, from the backend to the frontend.   We are fervent believers in design, so you should be able to design service interfaces and data structures even before coding the endpoint path.   Managers of one thrive at Fashion Cloud. We're eager learners, laugh a lot, we are kind to each other, look up to each other and support each other. We are colleagues, here to grow together.   We value people who can take a stand yet commit even when they disagree. We subject ideas to rigorous consideration and challenge each other with the purpose of growing. That comes with direct feedback and openness to each other's experiences.   We are currently looking for people that would like to relocate to one of our two offices in Amsterdam and Hamburg. We are a highly international team so you will have to speak English fluently.   What‚Äôs in it for you?   Free choice of laptop and equipment (e.g. MacBook) Relocation and VISA support - permits, flight, accommodation? We‚Äôve got you covered! Flexible working times - No 9 to 5, you are in charge of your time! Possibility to work remotely - want to work from another EU country? this is possible for up to 4 weeks a year A great office - we stick to hybrid work model with at least 2 days a week working from the office Summer Camp - a weekend away, full of fun team building activities Summer House - a beautiful location where we work and have fun during summer time Health is wealth - Sports membership discount + mental health support by nilo.health Continuous education - 1000‚Ç¨ yearly development budget, books and online tutorials from Pluralsight Regular team activities - Christmas party, Trivia nights and much more   What happens after submitting the application?  We will start with a get-to-know-you-call with one of our friendly People & Culture Team Members.   After that we will ask you to complete a take-home-assignment where you will have to build a small application to demonstrate your technical skills.   Last but not least, you will have a technical interview with our CTO and one other member of the engineering team. We will talk about your work experience and about relevant technical details and might use small code examples to help us illustrate the questions and answers.   We are looking forward to hear from you!   __

Title: Software Engineer (m/f/d) in full- or part-time
Description: At Bayer we‚Äôre visionaries, driven to solve the world‚Äôs toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none‚Äô is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We‚Äôre doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‚Äòimpossible‚Äô. There are so many reasons to join us. If you‚Äôre hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there‚Äôs only one choice.  Software Engineer (m/f/d) in full- or part-time  In Bayer‚Äôs global Product Platform Research we thrive to continuously improve our existing product portfolio and create new products that support our scientists in Pharma on their search for new (digital) therapies. We are seeking excellent Software Engineers (m/f/d) driven by our vision ‚ÄúHealth for all, hunger for none‚Äù. As Software Engineer you will be working as part of our interdisciplinary DevOps teams sized 4-6 people where you can follow (y)our purpose and grow while working on tough challenges in a global pharma research setting. If you are passionate about creating cutting edge software together with scientists to help cure life-threatening diseases, we would love to hear from you.    Your Tasks And Responsibilities    You develop and continuously improve and deliver software products (full-stack) that are directly related to our business objectives You leverage cloud infrastructure to provide your product as a reliable, performant and well managed service Furthermore, you identify and address risks and gaps in technical approaches and develop solutions to meet your team and product goals and make your product better You take decisions to advance product development or team culture in a timely manner You identify the most important problems to solve, minimize scope and assess the value of solutions Moreover, you keep yourself informed about new tools, technologies and architecture patterns and look for opportunities to apply your findings to your tech stack You collaborate with our technical leaders and contribute to technical design and architecture choices within the team and across the domain platform You actively seek opportunities to make your colleagues and your team better by mentoring In addition, you participate in code reviews, pair and mob programming sessions and apply these to not only make your product better but also your team more resilient    Who You Are    Master‚Äôs degree in computer science (or equivalent natural science degree e.g. computational biology/chemistry) Several years of professional experience in solving technical challenges as a Software Engineer (Full-Stack/Frontend/Backend) (m/f/d) using two or more modern programming languages and frameworks (Python, Java, JavaScript and similar) Moreover, you have experience in one or more of the areas web application development, cloud based continuous delivery and environment management, micro-service design and development, large, distributed system development, software security Also, you have practical experience in agile software development and are a team player Furthermore, you enjoy mentoring other colleagues and supporting your team in its development You are resilient in challenging situations and approach challenges from multiple perspectives Fluent in English, both written and spoken, German is a plus but not mandatory   Work life balance is important to us. The position can also be taken part-time. Name your preference in your job application.We look forward to it! Be curious. Be Bayer.  YOUR APPLICATION  This is your opportunity to tackle the world‚Äôs biggest challenges with us: Maintaining our health, feeding growing populations and slowing the rate of climate change. You have a voice, ideas and perspectives and we want to hear them. Because our success begins with you. Be part of something big. Be Bayer.   Bayer welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, union membership, religion, family status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or any unlawful criterion under applicable law. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.   Location:  Berlin, Leverkusen or Wuppertal-Aprath   Division:  Enabling Functions   Reference Code:  612861

Title: Frontend Developer - Flutter (m/f/x)
Description: A job with responsibility!  SIDES is one of the leading providers of restaurant and e-commerce software in Europe. We develop solutions for all restaurant processes to facilitate the daily routine in restaurant operations through automation, from individual restaurants to large chains. Our in-house developed all-in-one POS system enables our customers to manage their resources such as manpower, time, energy as well as their delivery portals, merchandise and branch management, and much more independently and profitably. We are successfully represented in 5 countries and our European expansion is set to more than double in the coming years.   If you want to work in a determined and international team, an agile environment and an open corporate culture, then apply with us and we will change the digital world of gastronomy together!   Tasks  What you are building with us:   Involving with the development of high-performance web applications (Flutter & Angular, CSS, JavaScript and HTML) Creating fully-responsive apps and desktop applications Helping with the creation of extensions for our already existing web applications by adding new modules Further integrating Flutter in the frontend department working together with the existing developers As part of the Frontend team, you will be involved in the development and implementation of usability concepts in cooperation with our Design Team and working closely together with the Backend Team    Requirements    What you add to our team:   2 - 4 years of experience in Frontend Development in a SaaS company, ideally with a similar focus in the gastronomy sector A minimum 1 year of expertise in Flutter, automated testing, Bloc/Mobx state management, MVVM, MVP, Design Patterns, and Dart Structured and Clean Code ethics with a high level of user-orientation Hands-on pioneer mindset, proactive, comfortable with building new things in an agile and iterative manner Your English is on a fluent level, German proficiency is a plus    Benefits    What you can expect from us:   Hyper-growth stage: Over ‚Ç¨10m funding (2021) Successful company base: On the market for over 8 years and successfully represented in several European markets as well as opening several more Big impact: A lot of creative freedom to contribute your talent & ideas as well as exciting projects and personal responsibility in your daily work Flexibility (choice of location & time): Depending on the department, you decide on your personal work location (mobile working; headquarters in Berlin or office in the Netherlands) and on your working hours High-quality work equipment: You will receive the best possible equipment to be able to do your job successfully (in the office you will also have a standing desk and ergonomic chairs) People Development: Personal development and continuous learning is a top priority for us - therefore, you can expect regular feedback cycles, an individual career plan and the opportunity to regularly participate in seminars, workshops and conventions Perks: monthly mobility allowance (can be used worldwide), employee offer platform with over 350 online stores and many discounts, great and unforgettable team events Desire to work from HQ: You can expect a great, perfectly connected office in the heart of Berlin (Sch√∂neberg), chilled drinks and snacks at all times, and a dog-friendly environment as well   Sounds exactly like what you have been looking for?  We are excited to receive your application including your expected salary and your earliest possible starting date.

Title: Software Developer (f/m/d)
Description: At IONOS, the leading European provider of cloud infrastructure, cloud services and hosting services, you will work together with a wide range of teams. We are characterized by open structures, a friendly working culture and flat hierarchies with a strong team spirit. We firmly believe that work and fun are compatible, and offer you the right environment for this. Our constant growth means that we are always looking for new colleagues. Become part of IONOS and grow with us.   Your Tasks:  The 1&1, IONOS, WEB.DE, GMX and MAIL.COM brands rely on the reliable processing of electronic payments and smooth interaction with the backend systems involved.   As a software developer in our agile team, you will develop and operate innovative payment and fraud prevention applications that meet high security standards. As a competent contact person, you will play an active role in the project process, which follows current technology trends, thinks outside the box and thrives on a daily willingness to learn. You will bring in your creativity without ignoring the customer's point of view. We are looking for immediate reinforcement for our dedicated team. Your tasks include:   Connection of modern online payment systems to United Internet's business systems. Implementation and further development of fraud prevention measures. Contributing to a secure and highly available system. Working closely with other DEV, IT teams and external service providers. Rather than a temporary project engagement, you will work continuously to improve our services. Architecture and design discussions emanate from the team at our company. With us, you have the opportunity to help shape things.   We Appreciate:  The cornerstone of your success is a university degree in computer science or a comparable qualification. You have sound experience in object-oriented software development, ideally with distributed Linux systems. What you should absolutely bring along is a passion for programming. You have the best prerequisites if the following applies to you:   You have a good knowledge of PHP and/or Go and service-oriented architectures. Security in software development is very important to you. You like to think outside the box, want to take responsibility and contribute your ideas. Experience in the payment environment/eCommerce as well as a high interest in internet technologies are an advantage. Fun, high motivation and creativity complete your profile.    About IONOS    1&1 IONOS is Europe's leading platform for cloud services and hosting services. We successfully support our customers in their business development.   More than 4000 employees in several countries around the world are working to meet the requirements and wishes of our 8.5 million customers.   We promote the development of our employees and their different talents, interests and languages.   We value diversity and welcome all applications - regardless of, for example, gender, nationality, ethnic or social origin, religion, disability, age as well as sexual orientation and identity, physical characteristics, marital status or any other irrelevant factor subject to applicable law.

Title: Angular Developer | Technologist (f/m/x) | Stuttgart or Berlin
Description: zigzag is an independent, international design agency with a focus on user experience and digital product design. We accompany and guide our clients through the entire product development process, from strategy, user research, interaction, and visual design, to prototype and software development. Since our foundation in 2012, our team has been working for Fortune 500 companies and start-ups in various industries such as financial services, automotive, transportation, health care, and more. Awards including the iF Design Award, Red Dot Design Award, and the German Design Award testify to the excellence of our work.    We believe this excellence is rooted in collaboration, trust, curiosity, passion, and diverse teams based on mutual respect. That is why zigzag is all about people; people who share our values and jointly strive to bridge user needs, business, technology, community, and the planet.     Want to join? Currently we are seeking Technologists (f/m/x) with a focus on Angular Development to join our multidisciplinary team in Stuttgart or Berlin (Berlin office coming soon), partly remote option. The position is available at different career levels: entry-, mid-, and Senior-level.     ÔªøRESPONSIBILITY - What you will do   You participate in/ are responsible for technology platform research and experimentation, prototyping and software development, as well as ideation within the creative process for designing user experiences in software. You collaborate closely with our creative team to express concepts and designs in the form of interactive prototypes, user experience simulations, technical proof-of-concepts, and UI/presentation layer components and templates as reference material for design validation and the software development process. For some projects, we go all the way which means you get to develop and implement production quality frontend software components in our agile development team.     SKILLS - What you must have   Professional experience collaboratively designing and developing user interfaces, UX concepts, and/or software applications on diverse technology platforms: up to 3 years (entry-level), 2 to 5 years (mid-level), or more than 4 years (Senior-level) A strong understanding of web development with an emphasis on frontend implementation Experience with Angular, JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML, and CSS Experience with building custom reusable UI components Thorough experience with state of the art web development technology: npm / Node.js, Postman (or similar), Jlint (or similar) and others Familiarity with RESTful APIs Familiarity with collaborative development and version control (Git) Experience in any of the following technologies is a plus: Other Web technologies (React, Vue.js), iOS development, Android development, Flutter, Unity (C#), Microsoft .NET Experience in creating animations (e.g. with CSS Animation or in JavaScript) Experience with Sketch/Zeplin, Figma or Abstract Experience with creating Progressive Web Apps (e.g. with IONIC) or Electron Apps An eye for state-of-the-art UI designs Proactive team player with strong written and verbal communication skills in English, German a plus Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äòs degree in software development, engineering, or a creative discipline     BENEFITS - What we offer   Building your skills within a team of multidisciplinary and international professionals Challenging projects for global clients in a surrounding without hierarchies and restraints Opportunity to pursue your interests and to implement own ideas Competitive and fair salary plus a performance-based bonus Part-time options available on request (full-time is 40 hours/week) 30 vacation days per year (for full-time positions) Work in a modern and welcoming studio atmosphere located in the heart of Stuttgart or join our emerging team in Berlin (office coming soon) Option to work partly remote from a location in Germany (details on demand) Support with German work permit and relocation to Stuttgart/Berlin, if needed Corporate pension plan Financial support and paid leave for further education and training Business mobile, state of the art hardware and equipment Financial support for public transport tickets and job bikes Benefits like regular team events, free drinks, coffee, sweets, and fruit     Sounds like you?    Please apply online using the "Apply" button on top of the ad or send us an e-mail along with your CV and portfolio to play@zigzag.is.    By sending an e-mail you confirm to our data privacy statement for e-mail applications. Find more information here: https://zigzag.is/data-policy-for-applications/    Any open questions? We are looking forward to hearing from you!     Sophie Frank   Operations & HR    zigzag GmbH  Kronprinzstr. 11  70173 Stuttgart  Germany     play@zigzag.is   +49 711 504 547 12     Ôªøwww.zigzag.is

Title: Front End Developer
Description: We are expanding our development teams and although we don‚Äôt care much about titles, we call this role Front End Developer and the key is to have solid experience in Front End development with Angular or React.  Our vision is to build multidisciplinary teams which directly manage projects in an AGILE way to find and implement the best solutions üòä   What will you do?   You will develop projects from scratch under minimal supervision and with the collaboration of the rest of your team. You will participate in the design of architectures and the decision-making process in a constructive environment with co-creation dynamics. You will work under the SOLID principles. You will be a key player in the development of best practices, clean and reusable code. You will be up to date with the latest tools and technologies in the market.    Requirements   3+ years of experience working with React or Angular. Backend (Node.js or .NET) knowledge is also desirable. Experience in architectural design. Knowledge and experience applying design patterns. Knowledge in CI/CD application as an essential part of software development. Fluent German and good English level (international environment). Good interaction and ability to work with the different teams throughout our global offices. Passion for technology and software development. Constant drive to learn and ability to learn quickly. A team player.    Benefits   Salary determined by the market and your experience ü§ë Flexible schedule 35 Hours / Week üòé (1year trial period) Fully remote work (optional) üåç Individual budget for training and free Microsoft certifications üìö Birthday day off üå¥ü•≥ Monthly bonus for electricity and Internet expenses at home üíª Plain Camp (annual team-building event) üé™ ‚ûï The pleasure of always working with the latest technological tools!    With all this information you already know a lot about us. Will you let us know you better?   The selection process? Simple, just 3 steps: a call and 2 interviews with the team ü§ò   And you may wonder‚Ä¶ Who is Plain Concepts?   Plain Concepts is made up of 400 people who are passionate about technology, driven by the change towards finding the best solutions for our customers and projects.   Throughout the years, the company has grown thanks to the great technical potential we have and relying on our craziest and most innovative ideas. We currently have over 14 offices in 6 different countries. Our main goal is to keep growing as a team, developing the best and most advanced projects in the market.   We truly believe in the importance of bringing together people from different backgrounds and countries to build the best team, with a diverse and inclusive culture.   What do we do at Plain Concepts?   We are characterized for having a DNA 100%. We develop customized projects from scratch, technical consultancy, training, and our own product: Sidra Data Platform üíú   We don‚Äôt do bodyshopping or outsourcing Our teams are multidisciplinary, and the organizational structure is flat and horizontal We are very committed to AGILE values Living is sharing: We help, support, and encourage each other to expand our knowledge internally and also towards the community (with conferences, events, talks‚Ä¶) We always look for creativity and innovation, even when the idea might seem crazy to others Transparency is key to any relationship    We make our clients‚Äô ideas and solutions a reality with a high degree of technical excellence, for more information you can visit our website:   ‚û° https://www.plainconcepts.com/es/casos-estudio/   At Plain Concepts, we certainly seek to provide equal opportunities. We want diverse applicants regardless of race, colour, gender, religion, national origin, citizenship, disability, age, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Software Developer (Front End)
Description: Application Deadline:  21 July 2022   Department:  Technical   Employment Type:  Full Time   Location:  Europe, Remote   About Us  Description  Altmetric analyses the online activity around scholarly content to measure the broader impact of science and research. We deliver and support products such as the Altmetric details pages, Altmetric Explorer and the Altmetric badges. Our customers include institutions around the world and scholarly publishers such as Springer Nature, Wiley, Taylor & Francis and MIT Press.   We develop software in a friendly and flexible working environment, processing hundreds of thousands of scholarly mentions and serving tens of millions of API requests every day.   We are part of Digital Science, a pioneering technology company, where our vision is of a future where a trusted and collaborative research ecosystem drives progress for all. We believe in better, open, collaborative and inclusive research. In creating the next generation of tools and working in partnership with the community we tackle some of the biggest challenges to research. In order to achieve our vision, we need innovative, inspiring and dynamic people to join our team. Want to join us?   What You‚Äôll Be Doing  You will be part of a team responsible for the development and maintenance of our user-facing web applications. Using best practices, you will continuously deliver our products to customers around the globe and shape our engineering culture. As a more experienced member of the team, we will be looking to you for leadership, help increase our technical competencies, and offer mentorship to others on the team.   You will be working particularly closely with our Product Team and in particular our UX Designer to help develop a front end strategy for our products.   What You‚Äôll Bring To The Role  Our main technologies are Ruby (mainly Rails), PHP and Javascript (Node.js for the API and React for the Explorer). We also use PostgreSQL and Redis.   If you have transferable skills into any of the above, then we'd love to hear from you. Ultimately though we're looking for developers who are comfortable working with a variety of languages and technologies, who will help ensure that the technology choices we make best suit our needs.   Our vision and values  We invest in, nurture and support innovative businesses and technologies that make all parts of the research process more open, efficient and effective.   The talent we secure is fundamental to us achieving our vision and our growth plans. The values we live by are:   We are brave in the pursuit of better  We are collaborative and inclusive  We are always open-minded  We are from and for the community  We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status

Title: UI Developer (f/m/d) - GER, UK, NL, PL
Description:
is Germany's best-known AI company. We develop neural networks to help people work with language. With DeepL Translator, we have created the world's best machine translation system and made it available free of charge to everyone online. Over the next few years, we aim to make DeepL the world's leading language technology company. Our goal is to overcome language barriers and bring cultures closer together. What distinguishes us from other companies? DeepL (formerly Linguee) was founded by developers and researchers. We focus on the development of new, exciting products, which is why we spend a lot of time actively researching the latest topics. We understand the challenges of developing new products and try to meet them with an agile and dynamic way of working. Our work culture is very open because we want our employees to feel comfortable. In our daily work we use modern technologies - not only to translate texts, but also to create the world's best dictionaries, and solve other language problems. When we tell people about DeepL as an employer, reactions are overwhelmingly positive. Maybe it's because they have enjoyed our services, or maybe they just want to get on board with our quest to break down language barriers and facilitate communication. Your choice We are constantly looking for outstanding employees! Currently we offer remote work in Germany, the Netherlands, the UK and Poland. Whether you would like to work from home in one of these countries or from one of our offices in Amsterdam, London, Cologne or Paderborn: the choice is yours. No matter where you choose to work from, our way of working is designed to make you an essential part of the team. What will you be doing at DeepL? Thanks to our unique neural networks, DeepL is able to deliver the world‚Äôs best translation quality. In order to keep it that way, we are constantly improving our apps and adding exciting new features - and this is where your experience in developing great interfaces comes in: our products only really shine and help our users when they are presented well. In addition to the classic challenges of frontend development such as UX design, we are particularly interested in your ability to build functional (and pretty) UIs and your knowledge of CSS and current related technologies. You will be part of a highly motivated team that values top quality and efficient code. Important design decisions are made by the whole team in open discussions.

Desired Skills and Experience

Your Responsibilities Further design and develop our web applications Create new components for our frontend together with your team Test your work and make sure it is of high quality Work directly with our designers to build up and maintain our functional and good looking UI What We Offer A product used by more than 100 million worldwide Interesting problems applying the latest research results in our development Code review, pair programming, and a focus on high quality An extremely good team with a lot of trust and short decision making processes; English speaking team A comfortable office in Amsterdam, London, Cologne or Paderborn (or suitable equipment for your home office) and a lot of flexibility About You Very good knowledge in JavaScript and/or TypeScript Very good knowledge in CSS and related technologies (Sass, Tailwind, ...) Experience in building components in a current web framework (we use React) A degree in computer science or comparable, alternatively several years of professional experience in software/web development You enjoy solving difficult problems and learning new things Fluent in English, knowledge of other languages is advantageous We are looking forward to your application!

Title: Frontend Engineer (d/f/m) Vermietet. de
Description: Berlin   At Vermietet. de we have been revolutionizing the real estate market in just a few years. With our market-leading property management product for private landlords and the support of our powerful partner ImmoScout24, we are creating the largest digital ecosystem for the property sector in Germany.   We are building solutions for a market that has been completely overlooked to date. Title: Associate Software Engineer*
Description: Join Tecan!   Join the market leader!   Work in an international and dynamic environment, share our success!    Join our Research & Development Team in Wiesbaden, Germany as an     Associate Software Engineer*     Join the Tecan Software Team and contribute to our empowering solutions at Tecan, a world leader in laboratory automation.With projects that support the treatment and diagnosis of cancer and other diseases, we make the world a healthier place and positively impact people's lives. We have thousands of customers and a global team of engineers. Join us and contribute to our mission to make the world a better place.     Your role:  Your team is committed to developing the best software applications for our instrumentsand to making a significant impact on a laboratory worker daily life by both making new features available that give easy access to results and by improving their user experience. Our quality is not negotiable and always meets the requirements for the development of medical devices.  We strive to improve the accessibility and simplicity of automation in every lab.You will work in a cross-functional team of Software and Verification Engineers, Usability and Regulatory Experts, Project Leads and Quality Engineers.     You have:   A bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical field of study, or vocational training as a Fachinformatiker Anwendungsentwicklung (m/f/d) or a related field Starting experience within object-oriented software development using C# / C++ or Java Ability to work with multi-functional (global) and remote teams Good communication in English and German, both written and verbal The passion to learn and grow with us     You will:   Develop products in the region of laboratory automation systems, either as cloud services or desktop applications Be responsible for implementing, optimizing and documenting new software functionalities using Microsoft technologies Full stack/backend development with recent technologies (e.g., .NET Core, C# and AngularJS) Improve and expand modular platforms in our project and develop new products building upon that Work alongside our experienced software engineers on different projects in a Scrum team     Why Tecan?   Great product with purpose.  Help improve Life Sciences and Diagnostics, and empower the healthcare industry to become even more innovative and productive Secure job:  We are a proven business and a leading global provider of automated laboratory instruments and solutions Welcoming company culture:  We live team spirit and work together to achieve bigger goals Work-Life-Balance:  Flexible working hours, remote work, trust-based working hours You are more than a number to us:  Work in long-term, sustainable projects and have an impact in your daily work Career development:  Career plans, in-house trainings and personal development budget; work internationally and have the opportunity to grow with a worldwide-operating holding     Look no further and apply now!  Join Tecan, a great place to work! Read about our recent certification from Great Place to Work:   https://www.en.greatplacetowork.ch/workplace/item/3358/Tecan  We are looking forward to receiving your application online.  For questions, please contact Lena Weyers: lena.weyers@tecan.com    *We welcome applications from people of all genders.     We care about people ‚Äì Join the market leader  People every day all around the world will benefit from more personalized healthcare. The promise of better, faster, more cost efficient solutions is now within our grasp. And that's the world in which Tecan plays a vital role ‚Äì helping advance healthcare ‚Äì through advanced life science research and diagnostic solutions. We constantly seek new ways to steer innovation.     Every lab. Every day. Empowered.  Our vision is to empower every laboratory, every day, around the world with Tecan technology, products and support. We will help shape the future of automated workflows in life sciences and clinical diagnostics through unrivaled expertise, products and customer support.     We care about our culture.  Our values ‚Äì trust, highest standards and ambition ‚Äì are the cornerstones of our business, and give us the framework for the Tecan culture. We foster a positive and empowering environment, which allows us to bring our passion and energy to work. This helps us deliver on our customer promise ‚Äì ‚ÄôAlways there for you‚Äò.     Tecan Software Competence Center GmbH  Peter-Sander-Stra√üe 41 a, 55252 Mainz-Kastel   www.tecan.com

Title: Front End Software Engineer
Description: We are looking for a user-centred front end engineer  who translates one of a kind user experiences into clean, technical solutions.   For this role we highly encourage female candidates and candidates from our markets of operation (Sub Saharan Africa, South, and Southeast Asia) to apply.   üåç Who is Village Data Analytics?  Village Data Analytics (VIDA) is a map-based software to help reach the SDGs. Allowing it‚Äôs users in the fields of electrification, healthcare and agriculture to channel investments, run projects and measure impact. VIDA integrates different data streams such as satellite imagery, survey data, sensor data and predicts outcomes and allows teams to collaborate. Our mission is to streamline the complex work of our change-makers in the impact world.   Tasks  What you will be working on:  With VIDA we have created a map-based tool that simplifies and streamlines the collaboration of stakeholders who are involved in different types of developmental projects. Even though they are located in different countries or timezones, VIDA allows them to analyse, plan, monitor and interact in any geographical area, all in one map. You will add your magic by making the usability of this powerful tool a simple, easy and accessible breeze. Since we are still a small team your input is needed not only in implementing pre-defined, actionable features but rather in shaping the whole product and user journey. We have an ambitious vision to make VIDA the new standard for how people work in the developing sector. And to achieve that we need you to shape the tools and put them in our users' hands.    Requirements    Your skills:   You have at least 3 years experience in front end development. Having worked in a start-up or fast growing environment is a plus. Experience in working with map-based platforms even better! Your eye for style and your ability to create intuitive user experiences is what makes you a great engineer Your innovative ways of thinking solve significant problems and create simplicity out of complexity The code you write is sparkling clean and you don‚Äôt shy away from technical documentations You're familiar with HTML, CSS, Javascript, Typescript and Angular framework. We always encourage our team to make pragmatic suggestions about our frontend tooling You are fluent in English (written and spoken) Rather than just finishing off tasks everyday, you challenge yourself to learn new things and grow not just your own skillset but also lift up your co-workers And last but not least: you are a dedicated team player, who even in times of remote work knows how to stay connected through good communication skills and contagious humour.    Benefits    Ok, and what is VIDA bringing to the table?   Opportunity to work in a diverse team to enable the use of a highly impactful and innovative product at the intersection of technology and social impact. We have an exciting team of software and renewable energy engineers, data scientists, designers, BizDev‚Äôs and strategists who interact in cross-units A culture of diversity and inclusion with team members from 8 countries, speaking 9 different languages, that bring in a variety of professional and personal experiences to empathise with the work we do Open atmosphere that encourages the team to think and experiment in new ways with software, hardware and business development A small, collaborative team where your ideas, insights and decisions have a lot of weight and help steer the product in the right direction Opportunity to work remotely: >50% of our VIDA team works remotely from countries such as Rwanda, Ukraine, Sweden and UK Option to work from our Munich office   If any of this sounds interesting to you just drop your CV and a friendly line! üì¨   In case your experience doesn‚Äôt fit all of the criteria, make sure to get in touch anyways!

Title: (Junior) Software Developer (m/f/d) - Web Services
Description: With our software product Enscape‚Ñ¢, we revolutionize how architects and designers communicate their projects by means of 3D evaluations. Enscape offers a photo-realistic representation of projects based on the latest rendering techniques. Enscape runs parallel to CAD software or directly in Virtual Reality, for example, the Oculus Rift.   Enscape has been in development since 2013 and has been successfully on the market since 2015. Our customers include companies from over 80 countries and 83% of the internationally renowned TOP100 architectural firms.   You will be part of a team of more than 100 people, based in a light-flooded office in a revitalized industry building in the business park "Raumfabrik Durlach", working with passion around our product Enscape. We strive to be number one - with an exciting product, enthusiastic customers, a rapid growth rate, and a collegial working atmosphere. Do you want to be part of Enscape?   Do you want to learn more about us?   Location  ***Position is based in Germany (on-site or remote)***  More than just a job  Do you want to live out your passion for programming in a productive, agile environment? As a Developer of the Webservices team, you will design, implement, and maintain all our web services that provide functionality to the Enscape plugin as well as internal tooling. Apply at Enscape!  Your Tasks   Your daily tasks consist of designing Webservices based on feature requirements as well as implementing them on AWS using the .NET ecosystem You participate in analyzing and fixing any issues with the live systems You ensure code quality by identifying and removing technical debt Assisting internal stakeholders with the integration of our web services and in-depth customer inquiries is also part of your tasks   Your Profile   You have good knowledge of C#, the .NET Framework, and relational databases You have sound practical experience with developing web services on ASP.NET or with AWS cloud infrastructure You communicate in a target group-oriented manner, also beyond your department, enjoy working constructively in a team, and always have the solution in mind You have a good command of written and spoken English   You want   Freedom of design and make a difference To be part of a competent and dynamic team that celebrates success together A modern equipped workstation adapted to your needs and wishes (for example, three monitors, height-adjustable table, etc.) To develop yourself continuously and learn new things - free of prescribed courses or similar Agile processes and software development according to SCRUM   You benefit from   Personable, humorous colleagues and a pleasant working atmosphere that makes work-life balance a priority Diverse, exciting tasks and the opportunity to contribute with your ideas An air-conditioned, light-flooded office in a revitalized industry building located in the business park ‚Äú Raumfabrik Durlach‚Äù Short decision-making paths that leave room for creativity and free space for experimentation and discussion Language courses, regular corporate events, and shared leisure activities Attractive salary and diverse career development opportunities Free drinks, delicious coffee, breakfast bar, and snacks Occupational pension, optional capital-forming payments, and an optional job ticket   Contact  Madeleine Clark  Human Resources  P +49 721 132 060 61  E jobs@enscape3d.com   Enscape GmbH  An der RaumFabrik 33b | 76227 Karlsruhe | Germany  www.enscape3d.com

Title: Full Stack Developer (Python/Angular) at Serviceware AI (m/f/d)
Description: back to the job offers   Your perspectives with us   What do you work on?   You develop cloud services that enable large organizations to automate their customer service with the help of natural language processing (NLP). These cloud services build upon question answering, intent recognition, entity extraction, and clustering algorithms.  How is this special?   We are solving problems on a high level of abstraction; each solution needs to usable for many enterprises (and not only for one). As most users do not have a technical background, usability needs to be excellent so that it‚Äôs easy to understand how models work, which impact they have and how they can be improved.  What do you need to know about Serviceware?   Serviceware is a leading provider of software solutions that facilitate the digitization of service processes and includes more than 500 employees across 14 locations. In 2019, we started an innovation center focusing on Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) in Darmstadt, where we take advantage of the recent scientific progress to develop new features in fast iterations.   These tasks are waiting for you   You design, develop, test, and deploy software services that leverage AI & ML for our customers. You design and implement web-based user interfaces that are inspired by our UX researchers and regularly improved by user feedback. You contribute to the selection of technologies and the design of IT architectures.   What you have to offer   Passion for writing beautiful and maintainable code. Strong experience with Python or a similar programming language. Experience in modern, web-based frontend technologies, such as Angular or React. Willingness to contribute to continuous knowledge exchange and team learning. Effective communication skills (fluent in English).   What we offer you   You will work on a modern tech stack including Python, Angular, Docker, Git, PostgreSQL, the HashiCorp Stack (Nomad, Terraform, Vault), Keycloak and the ELK Stack (Elastic Search, Logstash, Kibana). You have the chance to substantially influence our service management platform, which is used by over 1,000 companies every day. We offer multiple options to improve your professional skills, in particular through our collaboration with the technical university in Darmstadt. You work two days per week in our office, which is located centrally in Darmstadt and offers a large roof top terrace and modern air conditioning. You will join our international team which does not only build great software, but also likes cooking, biking, gardening, and playing the guitar.   What working environment do you enter?   The best mix of: many opportunities to take responsibility & shape the future offered by a small company, and the ambitions & possibilities of an organization listed on the stock-market. Being part of a fast-moving team, a scalable solution needs to be established while an entrepreneurial spirit is required to regularly experiment with new ideas.   Your contact at SERVICEWARE   Vanessa Rivera   Human Resources   +49 6434 9450 0   Are you thrilled to join the team?! We can‚Äôt wait to read your application. Please consider the following guidelines when applying at Serviceware:   Applications are possible in English as well as in German. We expect you to write a short cover letter that tells us why you like to work at Serviceware. (Please don‚Äôt use stock cover letters. We‚Äôd love to hear why you like this particular job.) While we enjoy reading about your experiences, please keep your CV focused on the main points. We are not looking for CVs with more than two to three pages.   back to the job offers

Title: Software Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: We are Paigo  We set out to make financial relationships between people and businesses simple ‚Äì even if it is sometimes a little complicated. In a nutshell, we at Paigo are a FinTech that stands for consumer-oriented receivables management. Our mission: We enable people to regain their financial self-determination. With our experience in financial processes, we support companies from all kinds of future-oriented industries, such as mobility, ecommerce, banking and telecommunications. In our daily work, we focus on innovative technologies, data analytics & machine learning, agile mindset and appreciative collaboration. We are enablers, designers, data detectives, IT experts, creatives and customer enthusiasts. At Paigo, you get the freedom you need to test, challenge and successfully implement your ideas. One thing is for sure: we are the right organisation for people who want to move things forward.    Our Company Is Looking For a    Software Engineer (m/f/d)  (unlimited) at the Baden-Baden or Verl location   What You Can Expect From Us    Agility: You will strengthen an agile team that develops innovative business products in the context of Arvato InnoLab Individuality: You are the expert and define how your workplace should look like Variety: In InnoLab, evaluation and application of new technologies is part of the daily business Support: We support our team members individually so that they can develop according to their own ideas (e.g. via certifications, conferences, training platforms, mentoring)    What You Bring To The Table    You have a degree in computer science or business informatics or a comparable education You are interested and familiar with Agile Development Practices You believe in writing clean and maintainable code following Clean Code Principles and consider ‚ÄúUncle Bob‚Äù to be your ‚ÄúTech Uncle‚Äù You have experience in some of the following technologies: C#, .NET, .NET Core, TDD, BDD, DDD, SQL Server, MongoDb, Gherkin, Cucumber etc. You are a developer at heart, who enjoys pioneering projects and is relentless about solving problems You have good German or English skills (spoken and written) You enjoy working in a team to achieve common goals You enjoy responsibility and are willing to take initiative to reach your goals    Nice To Have    Any previous experience with MS Azure is a bonus Any previous experience with Serverless Architecture, Function as a Service (FaaS) or Event Driven Architecture patterns is a bonus Any experience with building CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps or other cloud platforms is a bonus Any experience with Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) on Azure, AWS, GCP or OpenStack is a bonus    We Are Worth The Journey    Is there no match between the role and your profile? No, don't worry. Just create your role yourself. What is important to us is what you can do and what experience you have already gathered. If the role and its requirements do not match your experience 100 % - no problem. We believe that every talent in a growing organisation, like Paigo, can develop freely and contribute valuable input.    On Top Of That, We Have This For You    Future-proof job with cool start-up-like spirit in the corporation Up to 80% mobile working within Germany 30 days' holiday and flexible working hours with overtime compensation Regular socialising events, such as fancy summer and Christmas parties, team events and fun at work Sports courses, company runs, company bicycles and discounts at fitness studios Holiday and Christmas bonuses, profit-sharing and company pension scheme Employee discounts for books and magazines etc. from the Bertelsmann cosmos Further development opportunities via Bertelsmann University, free LinkedIn Learning and over 4,000 other e-learning and training opportunities Depending on the location: a wide range of culinary options in our on-site canteen or to go for mobile work, free fruit and water   By the way, at Paigo we are neither "Dear Sir or Madam" nor "Sie". I am simply Andreza and I look forward to getting to know your strengths and you. We are not that complicated, just send us your CV. Check in with Paigo now!    We Keep What We Promise    More information at www.arvatokarriere.de  Are you already convinced? Then we look forward to your online application with CV, salary expectations  and the earliest possible start date  .   We look forward to applications from candidates who contribute to the diversity of our company. We relate diversity in particular to the dimensions of cultural or social origin, religion, age, disability, gender and sexual identity. Title: Frontend Software Engineer - Fulltime

Title: Software Developer (w|m|d)
Description: Working at COSMO CONSULT is different .  Explore the COSMO CONSULT universe and let yourself be inspired by the positive energy of the COSMOnauts.   Shape the future for people and with people. Grow with us.   Experience genuine respect in an environment where you can feel safe, a place full of passion and innovation, no matter where and when you want to do your work.   Join our team and become part of one of the world's leading Microsoft partners for business transformation and digitalization.   Make your job  different ‚Äì send us your application to be a   Software Developer (w|m|d)  This is what makes you different .We are on the same wavelength if you:   take smart decisions. You don't always have to make the right decisions, but always decide with the best conscience towards our customers, colleagues and COSMO. you put people at the center of all your considerations. You pay attention to the needs of all people and act with empathy and compassion. take responsibility. You are attentive to yourself and your fellow human beings. You can also be relied on beyond your area of responsibility. support us in building great teams. All for you and you for all - be stronger together. You make the difference in your team. always give your best. You don't have to be the best, but out of deepest respect for yourself and your environment you always go for excellence. have the courage to grow. You don't think in terms of challenges, but in terms of opportunities. You love to develop yourself further, look for new ideas and actively bring them in. do things with passion. You know what drives and inspires you, live your passion, inspire your environment, you have more fun at work and you are more successful.    Your personality and motivation is what defines you.Therefore, we take the time and look through all applications individually.  Make your job different* .   *exciting. You manage to turn good ideas into perfect solution-oriented applications. Software development is your profession, code is your friend and relational databases are your playground. *creative. You design and develop frontend and / or backend applications (HTML, XML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax) and / or mobile apps (Android, iOS, Xamarin, React) based on customer requirements efficiently and appropriately and test your created work. Besides that you are technically well versed with Microsoft.NET and Angular. *prescient. Before you implement a task, you first deal with the analysis and the well-founded conception. *consistent. Whether technical documentation, test execution or quality assurance ‚Äì you master the entire keyboard and play it in accordance with our standards. *versatile. You will work within a project team for various national and international customers mostly in english and german. *dedicated. Fixing error messages, even tricky ones, is one of your core competencies. You dig in and don't give up until you have successfully solved the search for clues. *cooperative. Together, we live out our values within the framework of the project and beyond it.    We can also be different .This is us:   With us, everyone is part of the team - your voice is needed, even when it comes to our own company development. It is important to us that you feel valued and supported. Location-independent and flexible working is a matter of course for us. International cooperation is daily business for us - discover other cultures and new worlds. A safe and positive work environment is our top priority. We live transformation - we don't stand still. Shaping your further development together with you is close to our hearts. Diverse and unusual careers are possible with us. We take our responsibility towards people and the environment seriously.    We are looking forward to getting to know you!  PS: Benefits such as health management, accident insurance, company pension schemes, JobTicket, JobRad and COSMO events are just a few examples of our employee offering.   Do you want to become part of the team ?  Apply directly online with your informative application documents, stating your salary expectations and your earliest possible start date.   Do you have questions ?No problem.  Kim Helmig   Tel.: +49 251 59689100   career@cosmoconsult.com   Do you want more #insideCOSMO ?

Title: Full Stack Developer (m/f/d) @MVST.
Description: MVST is on a mission to launch products and services for companies that have a meaningful impact on the world. MVST is unique in more ways than one. We are well known for innovative design, progressive ways of working, and cutting-edge technology - and on top of that, we¬¥re completely independent. We also don‚Äôt take ourselves too seriously, though - it‚Äôs all about enjoying the journey. Being a member of MVST means being passionate about our industry, digital products, and their power to change human behaviors.   Tasks  YOUR MISSION   Solve difficult problems and build beautiful and intuitive features within a cross-functional team of technologists, designers, product owners, and agile coaches   Collaborate with a programming team of 2-4 to realize a creative vision throughout the development cycle Work closely with all other disciplines (Design, Product, etc.) to help everyone achieve their creative and project goals Build new product features from start to finish: through conception, research, maintenance, and polish Ensure code quality and ensure good working practices are developed and maintained Work with the newest technologies and have the freedom to try out new things regularly    Requirements    YOUR PROFILE   We are looking for people with curious, competitive and highly energetic ambitions.   Our tech stack is built around javascript and typescript, mainly Node and React.js. Also, we are pretty open to other languages and experiences (Ruby, Flutter etc.) Not ideological about technology: To you, technologies and programming languages are about tradeoffs. You may be opinionated, but you're not ideological and can learn new technologies as you go Good working understanding in user-centered processes and in the latest development tools likewise, you keep up always with the latest trends in technology Always thinking beyond our customers and aspire to offer the best customer experience Being part of a learning culture. You have a passion for coding and enjoy sharing your knowledge with colleagues to bring new insights and ideas to the team You care about the business implications of anything you build. You are not just going after cool stuff - You understand the balance between craft, speed, and the bottom line You don't fear trying something different, brake imaginary barriers, and aim for innovative design Fluent English skills complete your profile    Benefits    WHY US?   Stylish and open office in the heart of Munich   Hybrid/remote working possibility Exchange program between our offices Munich <> Barcelona Competitive salary within the startup industry Sponsored training opportunities with Udemy Free German classes Corporate Benefits at over 800 top brands Urban Sports Club sponsorship Apple hardware being the service of our choice Free coffee, water, fresh fruits and snacks, granola bar for breakfasts Team building/ after work events (weekly friday beer, team offsites, ‚Ä¶)
