Title: Fullstack Engineer (m/w/x)
Description: About Grover    Grover makes access to tech easy, affordable, and sustainable‚Äîwith flexible tech rental subscriptions. No deposits, no commitment, just tech when you want it for as long as you need it.   With around $1.3 billion in financing, Grover is one of Germany's best-funded scale-ups, and we're growing fast. Since 2015, we've gone from a small startup operating out of a Berlin apartment to a team of 500+ people, bringing flexible tech subscriptions to renters across Germany, Austria, the USA, Spain, and The Netherlands.   And we're just getting started. This year, we're expanding into even more countries and launching even more innovative ways for people to access the tech they need.   Our Mission & Vision   We're making it possible for more people to get the best out of life‚Äìwith flexible, affordable access to the tech they need. That was our bold vision when we started back in 2015, and‚Äîwith over 1 million renters across 5 countries‚Äîwe're right on track.   We're also proud to champion a more sustainable way to use tech. With over 500,000 devices returned, refurbished, and recirculated so far, we've already saved 1,500 tons of e-waste from ending up in a landfill.   Want to join us on our mission to give more people flexible access to the tech they need? We'd love to have you on the team.   We are looking for a Fullstack Engineer  (Backend oriented) with different levels of seniority to join our Engineering team!   Our Software Engineers often describe the projects as complex, but fun. We offer a great engineering culture: our team is still small, we value creativity and knowledge, and we don't take anything for granted!   You can work from our HQ in Berlin, or remotely.   As a Fullstack Engineer, you will:   Develop new features working with cross-functional squads, within a distributed team Use creative thinking - we are building most of our features from scratch and our product is unique (no competition!) Solve complex, but fun, technical problems Take active part in designing and creating services, APIs, and improvements to existing components Actively partner with frontend and data engineers to learn from each other and make well-rounded solutions and own end to end feature development Have space for ownership and to implement your ideas, hone your skills and explore new approaches and technologies Participate in the creation of our engineering culture, take part in guilds, knowledge-sharing, and other initiatives to help our entire team do their best work Contribute to our hiring strategy and onboard new team members    You care about:   User experience driven: you understand that products, concepts and implementation plans should all be accessible and ready for human consumption. Readable APIs and machine-readable UI are both a key part of working for our team. Ownership: you easily communicate ideas, implement them, and take responsibility for your actions Fast-paced startups: you love adapting to different situations, and you know how and when to iterate fast and with high quality Our product: you believe in our vision, and are willing to give your best to build the future of Grover and you like (or are interested in learning) the following topics: Cloud based, micro services driven architecture CI / CD Test driven development and to spark your curiosity, we currently work with the following tech stack: Typescript (NodeJS, NestJS, NextJS, React) for our services Data: Postgres, ElasticSearch and MongoDB GraphQL and REST APIs Messaging: Kafka (Confluent) Infrastructure as code: Terraform to maintain our AWS infrastructure (Microservices - ECS with EC2 and Fargate, as well as serverless with API Gateway and Lambda)    We are looking for a passionate teammate with:   2+ years of experience as a Software Engineer in complex environments Hands-on experience with our tech stack is preferred Focus and investment in good architecture and design principles Strong knowledge of relational databases, especially PostgreSQL Interest in message brokers and event-driven architecture (personal projects or working experience with Kafka are really nice to have) Experience with infrastructures using Docker, Infrastructure-as-Code and cloud providers (AWS or GCP) Eagerness to grow with the team, experiment with different approaches and learn as we go    What we offer:   Competitive salary and benefits. Flexible working hours combined with a semi-remote work structure. Office? Remote? Figure out the balance that works best for you. Entrepreneurial responsibilities and upward career growth. Engaging, open office located in central Berlin. Diverse global team of 40 nationalities (and counting)! Genuinely the nicest group of colleagues who will soon become friends. Team events, Grover tech discounts, and expanding perks.

Title: Software-Developer - Frontend / Typo3 (f/m/d)
Description: At IONOS, the leading European provider of cloud infrastructure, cloud services and hosting services, you will work together with a wide range of teams. We are characterized by open structures, a friendly working culture and flat hierarchies with a strong team spirit. We firmly believe that work and fun are compatible, and offer you the right environment for this. Our constant growth means that we are always looking for new colleagues. Become part of IONOS and grow with us.   Your Tasks:  For our online store platform, which is currently available in 9 countries and 5 languages, we are looking for a software developer. You will be part of the store development team and actively work on the technical realignment of our platform, making our products available and tangible for end customers.   Specifically, you can look forward to the following tasks:   You will independently develop responsive HTML templates and integrate them into our web applications. In addition, you will take on the implementation of JavaScript code using React. You will take responsibility for your features and ensure the quality of your code by automated tests and code reviews via pull requests. Technical support and functional development, as well as maintenance and updates of our TYPO3 instances used for the store platform. Together with our internal customers and their team, you will exchange ideas and develop targeted solutions.   We Appreciate:  You have practical experience in web and TYPO3 development, both frontend and backend, and are eager to push our store platform further.   You bring experience in common web technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP and MySQL and ideally in TypoScript and Extbase/Fluid. You have already worked with a modern framework like React or Angular and have experience with build tools like npm, Webpack or grunt. You appreciate neat, maintainable and testable code, pay attention to details, are tech-savvy and excited to use new methodologies. You enjoy working in a team. You like to work your way into new topics and constantly develop your knowledge independently.    About IONOS    1&1 IONOS is Europe's leading platform for cloud services and hosting services. We successfully support our customers in their business development.   More than 4000 employees in several countries around the world are working to meet the requirements and wishes of our 8.5 million customers.   We promote the development of our employees and their different talents, interests and languages.   We value diversity and welcome all applications - regardless of, for example, gender, nationality, ethnic or social origin, religion, disability, age as well as sexual orientation and identity, physical characteristics, marital status or any other irrelevant factor subject to applicable law.

Title: Javascript Engineer - Tools (m/f/d)
Description: Javascript Engineer - Tools   Parity Technologies builds core infrastructure for blockchains and the future Web ‚Äî one that respects the freedom and data of individuals ‚Äî and helps empower developers to create better services through decentralized technologies.   At the Parity Tools Team we build tooling and libraries for developers and advanced users, both internal and external, such as block explorers, exchanges, and staking-ops teams. Our tools empower users to integrate and harness Substrate blockchains to their fullest. We believe that a well built tool should be a joy to use, precise in scope and feature set, be hackable, discoverable and composable.   As a team, we write roughly equal amounts of JavaScript/TypeScript and Rust and often collaborate with other Parity teams, notably the SDK, ecosystem development and developer relations teams. While the main focus of this role is on the JavaScript side of things, an ability to read Rust is highly beneficial, and there will be plenty of opportunity to get more involved in the Rust side of things as well over time if that interests you.   Examples of the technologies you will be working with:   Substrate: https://github.com/paritytech/substrate   Polkadot-JS API: https://polkadot.js.org/   Substrate-api-sidecar: https://github.com/paritytech/substrate-api-sidecar   Your role will include:   Designing and building http APIs to help external teams build their projects. Supporting the entire project lifecycle (concept, design, build, test, release and support). Keeping up to date with the blockchain space in general and the Substrate/Polkadot ecosystem in particular. Work with the integration and ecosystem teams to ensure we build what people need. Collaborating with the core Substrate team to plan and implement new features and improvements.    Your Background:   Experience and enthusiasm for working with a range of different JavaScript APIs and Frameworks. We use TypeScript. Ability to work autonomously, be proactive, prioritize, communicate often, and function well in a distributed team. Some exposure to, and interest in, Rust. You've probably played with it in your spare time, if not at a previous job. Ability to learn new technologies and concepts quickly. Ability to come up with technical solutions and application architecture. Passionate about bringing the vision of a decentralized web to the world.    Nice-to-haves:   Open Source experience. Knowledge about blockchain technologies. Knowledge in other programming languages than JavaScript/TypeScript. Public speaking/writing.    Benefits:   Globally competitive compensation. Opportunity to become an expert in latest blockchain technologies. Working at Parity means focusing on stuff that matters: building cutting-edge technology for a better and more decentralized internet. Our teams enjoy a high degree of freedom and autonomy to achieve that goal. Because we value initiative and learning, all employees have a generous personal budget to attend conferences or other learning tools of your own choosing. We think you know what's best for you! Parity is a diverse company with people from various countries and we will support you with German language courses and relocation where needed (and desired). We have a remote-friendly company setup. Bringing the team together is something we value a lot and we have regular company retreats (as the current pandemic safely permits).    To see how we use your data please see our Applicant Notice.

Title: Full Stack Engineer - Remote
Description: Cherry Ventures is supporting our portfolio company with this foundational hire.    Introduction  Return Protocol is ready to welcome a Full Stack Engineer  who will lead integrations between blockchain and the traditional. processes as well as interact with APIs to keep the newest data constantly available. You will have the opportunity to drive the mass adoption of environmental offsetting by leveraging blockchain technology. This role will play an integral part in building Return, alongside shaping capabilities new and in the future.   We are on a mission to accelerate the mass adoption of regenerative finance to solve the climate crisis. This first chapter of the Return journey starts with blockchains, as we strive to leverage the awesome tools web3 provides to make anybody's life sustainable with a single click and   payment, incentivised through social tools.   We're an early stage startup that has recently closed a Pre-Seed round of $2.5m from some amazing partners and are growing at an incredible rate.   Why join us? This is a unique opportunity to pioneer a brand new industry by playing a pivotal role in building an early-stage startup alongside founders from Tesla and DraftKings.   This is a great opportunity to drive forward our core values:   We are wildly ambitious in the pursuit of growth and the belief that anything is possible. Nothing is more important to us than our users' experience and feedback - which extends to any    stakeholder that comes into contact with us.   We strive to create meaningful work and relationships. We always tell the truth, even when it's difficult. We don't know what we don't know, but stay awake at night trying to figure it all out.    Your Role   Building a user-centric decentralized application to enhance the user experience. Develop a system to connect frontend, backend and blockchain interactions into a set of efficient    full-scale AWS based applications.   Working with the entire engineering team to enable logical system design and infrastructure,    whilst optimizing for and ensuring responsiveness of applications and proper error handling.   Maintaining attention to detail to collaborate with and subsequently deliver UI/ UX designs    alongside the creative team.   Staying ahead of developments in web applications and programming languages, including a    willingness to accept what you don't know, and learn it!   Your Background   Relevant work experience at a fast-growing software technology or blockchain focused startup. Enjoy and thrive both with building beautiful frontend applications and functional, secure and    scalable backend infrastructure. You can stitch together many different services and processes   even if you have not worked with them before.   High energy and an enthusiasm for building a new product from the early stages ‚Äì we are looking    for a self-starter who likes to experiment, build and own new approaches, and is comfortable in   an entrepreneurial environment.   BS degree in computer science or mathematics is a plus. Desired technologies:    ‚óã HTML, CSS and JavaScript (Angular JS or React).   ‚óã Python, TS, or other server-side languages/ technologies.   ‚óã SQL, especially using MySQL on AWS RDB.   ‚óã Note: We are flexible and open minded about our tech stack, the above list is just our   current focus.   If you resonate with our values and are motivated by the Return mission, we want to hear from you!   Cherry Ventures is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

Title: Software Engineer (Go/Python) (m/w/x)
Description: About Us    In today‚Äôs software-centric economy, speed is everything. The pressure to deliver more, faster, falls squarely on development teams. Sauce Labs accelerates software development by removing testing as a bottleneck. Our automated testing cloud ensures that the web and mobile applications people use everyday work flawlessly on any browser or device. With Sauce, innovators accelerate their software development cycles, improve quality, deploy with confidence and reduce costs. We call that automated testing. But you‚Äôll probably just call it awesome.    About The Role    The Core Services team is responsible for the orchestration layer which maintains a lifecycle of all resources required by customers to successfully execute their tests. We help customers build digital confidence by providing an entry point to access the Sauce Labs vast amount of testing resources.   Being a Senior Software Engineer at Core team means you will take care of all new and existing services, API's and other resources our team owns. It includes not only software artifacts but also architecture design, wide inter-team collaboration and product requirements discussion.    Responsibilities    Implement features and improvements to the orchestration layer of our test platform. Actively collaborate with Product-Engineering stakeholders to maintain high expectations for quality in our iterative environment. Advocate for improvements to our platform scale, performance, architecture and engineering quality. Propose and implement solutions to improve our team efficiency. Specifically addressing tech-debt and hidden dependencies. Make choices for the adoption of new technologies based on your extensive experience. Try to ship small features and improvements on a regular basis with minimum guidance. Actively help the team to collaborate with bigger initiatives. Participate in weekday and weekend on-call rotations to help teams troubleshoot urgent customer facing problems and other engineering issues. Participate in our team process of software delivery which includes refinement of work items, discussion about priorities and outcomes the team defines for the coming time period.    Advanced    Requirements:   HTTP Go GCP Kubernetes Prometheus/Grafana Python 2/3    Familiar/Intermediate    GitLab Envoy HAProxy Redis Terraform Protobuf Webdriver Git Docker or compatible technology   Principles   Observability/Alerting - SRE handbook Building scalable software > 10k requests/second Testing best practices    Security Responsibilities At Sauce    At Sauce, we will commit to supporting the health and safety of employees and properties, partnering with internal stakeholders to learn and act on ever-evolving security protocols and procedures. You‚Äôll be expected to fully comply with all policies and procedures related to security at the department and org wide level and exercise a ‚Äòsecurity first‚Äô approach to how we design, build & run our products and services.   Sauce Labs is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity/expression/status, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status.  Please note our privacy terms when applying for a job at Sauce Labs.   #Remote #SauceEU

Title: Frontend Engineer (m/w/d) - Hybrid or Remote
Description: About Tilta    We're a team of experienced fintech entrepreneurs, engineers and data scientists. We believe the future of finance belongs to builders, not bankers. Access to capital should be fair & instant and we're working hard to make that happen. That is why we are building Tilta, an AI-enabled credit line that embeds seamlessly into e-commerce platforms, providing funding for businesses even before the need consciously arises. Backed by top-tier investors, we enable everybody to join our mission of supporting small businesses!   Your opportunity  We are looking for software engineers who want to work on the next-generation of financial user experiences and make a dent on how businesses access capital.   As an engineer at Tilta, you will be working in a team of talented minds from business and tech, all united in creating user-friendly experiences and developer-friendly APIs for the next generation of financial services to be used by tens of thousands of businesses every day.   More specifically, you will be working on the various responsive frontend web-applications as well as embeddable and customisable UI widgets that we serve to our partners and end-users.   Designing and building user experiences for checkout experiences are challenged with high requirements for performance and reliability that guarantee and optimise the critical conversion rate expectations of our partner platforms.   Given the early stage of Tilta, you‚Äôll be presented with a green field in many areas and are challenged to assume ownership and responsibility for researching, deciding, testing, documenting and maintaining unknown approaches to known problems all while applying the profound experience that you bring to the table.   Also, if interested, as a JavaScript Frontend Engineer in an all-JavaScript tech stack, you‚Äôll be presented with development opportunities to become a Full-Stack Engineer.   Technologies we build and run on   NodeJS & Express Python ReactJS & Redux Typescript SaSS Kafka Redshift Kubernetes PostgreSQL Amazon AWS Terraform   Tasks   Developing new features and designing their implementation Assuming ownership for the quality of your implementations Reviewing, analysing and fixing bottlenecks and bugs Improving our processes through agile development practices Maintaining and improving our deployment infrastructure and pipeline Learning and sharing through pair programming, collaboration and code review Joining product managers in partner conversations for first-hand problem feedback    Requirements    Strong ReactJS / JavaScript (incl. Redux) expertise with 3+ years of relevant experience Web application development and object-oriented programming Design and consumption of RESTful APIs Solid understanding of software architecture best practices Ability to quickly adapt languages and technologies   Nice to have   TypeScript expertise AWS deployment expertise Previous agile development experience Fintech background    Benefits    We ask you for nothing less than helping us to make a lasting change on how businesses do business. It's an invitation to an exciting journey with complex challenges, hard work and all the support needed to succeed as a team, be it remote or onsite. Here is what we have for you:   Competitive salary Equity programme Minimum 28 days of holiday per year Dedicated personal development budget Permanent contract from the start Flexible working hours Home office equipment support Choose your own hardware Flexible mobility allowance Relocation package for remote employees Referral bonus Tilta Swag 5 baby days Bi-annual company offsites Cool Berlin office with rooftop terrace And most of all, growth opportunities

Title: Frontend Engineer (m/f/d) - Inkitt Web and Mobile Team
Description: We believe every author should have an equal opportunity to succeed. Therefore, our mission is to discover hidden talents and turn them into globally successful authors.   Inkitt is a pioneer at the forefront of Data Driven Publishing. We have forever changed the traditional publishing model by inventing an algorithm which analyzes users' reading behavior to identify hits, in turn removing subjectivity from the equation. This gives Inkitt the unique ability to discover hidden talents that might otherwise have gone unnoticed.   At present, we are an international team of 85 passionate and dedicated inventors and entrepreneurs and we are growing quickly. We invent new solutions to problems we encounter, as opposed to simply iterating upon existing solutions.   Are you a builder? Are you looking for more than just innovating? We are looking for the changemakers of the world; the people who just build the solution anytime they are unsatisfied with the status quo.   Be a part of the revolution to develop new ways of distributing our audiobooks, creating games, and video series!   Come build the Disney of the 21st Century with us!   This Frontend Engineer (m/f/d) position is for all of you, experienced builders, out there who seek challenges and want to solve problems by being creative and hands-on. Join our Inkitt Web and Mobile Team!   Your Role:   Help architect, build, iterate, and manage our global mobile application, Inkitt (you can find it in the App Store / Google Play) Build and ship new features at high velocity and high quality Work closely with our Product Managers and Designers to achieve product goals Contribute your ideas to the product's roadmap Drive the architecture and technology choices that enable a world-class user experience Continuously explore new technologies that will elevate the user experience of customers in order to be at the forefront of a rapidly changing digital environment Stay close with our users, to understand why they are using the product, collect feedback and apply it in your work    Your Profile:   5+ years of experience working within large, well-maintained codebases Experience using JavaScript, React Native, and React You have a desire to take ownership, driven by your product engineering mindset, and an excellent feel for good UX Excellent communication skills for collaborating with other teams, while experience in mentoring juniors is a plus A drive to raise the bar of the team on Code Quality, User Empathy, and Delivery Speed Experience in working with mobile apps as well as understanding a release process in App Store/Google Play is a plus    What we offer you:   Top of the line health benefits that align with your local market Generous parental leave and support with growing your family Ways to help you save and invest in your future Opportunities to continuously grow, learn and develop yourself Time away - no set holiday or vacation policy, observe what works for you Free access to our Galatea App, as well as an unlimited budget for books Fantastic office spaces in Berlin and San Francisco - and always coming up with the next best way to keep our remote colleagues connected    At Inkitt, we strive to build a company culture and provide employment opportunities based on diversity and inclusion. We believe every author should have an equal opportunity to succeed, as should our team members. As a growing team from 20+ countries, we welcome everyone to apply.   We look forward to hearing from you!   Check out our careers blog and follow us on Instagram & LinkedIn! #weareinkitt

Title: Frontend Web Developer (m/f/d) - Osnabr√ºck / Remote in Germany
Description: Testsieger is one of the largest customer-centric platforms for test reports and customer ratings in Germany.   Tasks   Build amazing consumer experiences, taking responsibility for code quality, usability, reliability and performance Quickly prototype new ideas and run experiments to identify features that customers love Help shape the frontend design Collaborate with a diverse group of people, giving and receiving feedback for growth A passionate focus on quality, writing testable code that performs well for our consumers A desire to help our team continuously improve    Requirements    Min. 2+ years frontend experience with Javascript and HTML / CSS Experience with Symfony 3.x+ Fair understanding of React.js and or Vue.js and its core principles UI/UX understanding Basic knowledge of Typescript Experience with unit testing Basic knowledge of RESTful APIs Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM You are enthusiastic about new things, have high-level of awareness and you don‚Äôt think that your jobs stops at the moment when you commit your code You like to challenge proposed solutions and love to learn from code reviews You have good spoken and written knowledge of English    Benefits    Well-funded and proven startup with large ambitions and competitive salary Entrepreneurial culture where pushing limits and taking risks is everyday business Open communication with management and company leadership Home office options in Portugal Small, dynamic teams = massive impact   Looking forward to meet you!

Title: Full Stack Software Engineer
Description: Tasks   You have full ownership of your code & project, from concept to deployment. You will constantly be learning new skills. In your first month, you will be familiarized with our team and have already resolved some bugs and small requests. Your code has gone live multiple times in the first month. In the following months, your knowledge of our codebase has drastically increased and you are offering your help in fundamental software architecture decisions. You also feel confident enough to suggest improvements to the team's workflow when you see it doesn't work. At the end of your first year, you have successfully contributed to a wide range of projects, even spanning across multiple elements of our system, from backend to mobile. You have established yourself as a self starter and clearly spoken member of our team.    Requirements    You have professional experience on both ends (3+ years) - Frontend (React, or similar) and Backend (ASP.NET). Hands-on experience deploying projects to production servers. You understand the core of CI/CD pipelines. You can comfortably propose technical solutions to business problems and clearly communicate them to your colleagues. You are transparent, mindful and empathetic towards your teammates. You can easily express your ideas in written and spoken English    Benefits    The opportunity to establish yourself as a core member of the SEAL App at this early stage. An international team with a wide range of backgrounds A salary that matches industry standards A respectful atmosphere with a focus on professionalism A family-friendly work environment State of the art equipment to ensure that you can focus on the right things Daily paid lunch at our local canteen Paid Overhours Yearly budget for individual professional development   We‚Äôve found that cover letters are a great way to separate your application from the sea of applicants. We strongly recommend submitting a cover letter together with your CV.  We are only considering applicants with EU work permission.

Title: Software Engineer C# (m/f/d)
Description: BICOis the leading bio convergence company in the world, equipping hundreds of laboratories and thousands of scientists with cutting-edge life science technologies. By combining different technologies, such as robotics, artificial intelligence, computer science, and 3D bioprinting with biology, BICO enables customers to improve people's health and lives for the better.    The Business Area BIOSCIENCESis one of the three business areas of BICO and combines the knowledge and innovative technology of five life-science companies: CYTENA, DISPENDIX, CYTENA Bioprocess Solutions, ECHO and BIOSERO. Driven by the BICO vision to create the future of health, we develop technologies and products for sorting and analysis of single- and multi-cell applications, such as single-cell omics, liquid handling, cell imaging and cell line development.    Our vision is: Create the Future of Health.    We are looking for a Software Engineer C# (m/f/d)to join our BIOSEROteam at our offices in Freiburg or to work remotely.       Responsibilities   Develop instrument control drivers using .NET/C# for Green Button Go software Test and deploy drivers and support other teams in the use and implementation of Green Button Go drivers Work with the team and independently to develop custom software solutions for laboratory automation and integration, then test and deploy those solutions in the lab Work with customers to gather requirements and implement custom software solutions that fit their needs Integrate BIOSERO software solutions with a wide variety of data and informatics systems Contribute to the development of new software products       Qualifications   University degree in computer science, software engineering or comparable fields, preferably with some knowledge of lab automation and scheduling software Excellent programming skills in C# Experience in Pharma/Life Sciences industry and using laboratory instruments is a plus Working knowledge of communication technologies (Serial, TCP/IP, CAN, etc.) and the ability to debug networking issues is advantageous Experience using and building applications using Cloud Infrastructure and technologies (Azure, AWS, IBM Cloud, etc.) is a plus Availability to travel occasionally to customer sites for developing GBG methods and to resolve software and driver issues       What we offer  Joining the Business Area BIOSCIENCESmeans being part of something big and shaping the future of medicine. We are a fast-growing life sciences company with award winning products and a fun, cool team that is friendly and supportive.     Agile start-up culture  : being a dynamic and international company and still benefit from a flat organizational structure. We work agile (SCRUM) in cross functional teams that is very progressive. Freedom  : There is a lot of opportunity to get involved in new projects and have an impact. There is a level of freedom to take ownership and responsibility and work on projects you enjoy. Development  : We regularly celebrate individual accomplishments and develop new skills through training courses. We have a talented team you can learn from and gain hands-on knowledge outside of your main responsibilities. Flexible working  : We focus on results not working hours, we want our employees to be as productive and happy as possible. Depending on the position and tasks also mobile working is possible. Team building:  Teamwork is a top priority for us! We are open-minded, help each other and enjoy organizing team events. Benefits:  We offer a wide range of benefits like free fruit, water, coffee in a modern stylish office with chillout area and many more‚Ä¶ Company Pension plan:  The future of our employees is important to us. It is possible to participate in the company pension plan by our insurance partner with attractive conditions and subsidized by the employer. A chance to make a difference:  We are in the life sciences industry and our work is an excellent way to contribute to the development of new drugs and treatments that will be used to help hundreds of thousands of people worldwide.    Do you want to become part of our success story? Then apply online via our job portal. Please note that for Data Privacy compliance we are not able to accept any e-mail applications!    At BICO, we don‚Äôt just accept difference ‚Äî we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our community. We are an equal opportunity workplace and will always pride ourselves on being a collaborative environment.

Title: Frontend Developer (m/f/d) - remote in Germany
Description: Would you like to work in an energizing and entrepreneurial environment where you will face new challenges each day? You have an analytical mind, very good coding skills and you are passionate about building up a unit and their projects from the scratch? Then become our new Frontend Developer (m/f/d) in our international remote working teams - remote based in Germany!   YOUR FIELD OF ACTIVITY.   You will be part of a new unit that will launch new online marketplaces (websites, APIs) across multiple services and technologies, You work in an agile team that is designing and developing software with premium publishers internationally, You will solve running issues by using Open Source Software, it's community and first of all the internal know-how of the team, You will meet up with fellow developers to deep-dive and present new technologies, discoveries and quick hacks, Continuously improve and regularly challenge the team‚Äôs status quo by embracing new ideas and openly engaging in discussions, You make sure that the code is of high quality and tested when passing through the CI/CD pipeline.  YOUR MINDSET & EXPERIENCES.   You have an open-minded, hands-on and self-organized attitude which is positive, enthusiastic and empathetic, You are experienced with agile development methods as well as the willingness to work in a self-organized environment, You have professional experience as a Frontend Developer, You are very confident in using HTML, CSS and sufficient knowledge in different JavaScript frameworks, for example Node.js and / or Vue.js, Knowledge of TDD and best practices within the mastered frameworksYou are familiar with Ruby on Rails, Jekyll and major templating systems, Desirable: Completed studies in (business, media) computer science, training as an IT specialist for application development or career changer with relevant professional experience.  WHAT WE OFFER.   Flexible trust working hours in a remote work environment, which we equip with state-of-the-art hardware (e.g. MacBook pro), monitors, height-adjustable desks / portable solutions and ergonomic chairs, among other things with a 500‚Ç¨ budget Unlimited employment contract, 30 days of vacations, Tax-Free allowance of 50 EUR/month, WiFi reimbursement of 20 EUR/month, Co-Working Access, Regional Ticket or reimbursement of public transport ticket, Participation in an exciting and healthy growing company that offers you a lot of room for your personal development and your impulses and ideas, Transparent decision-making processes with our three founders as well as leads with a distinct start-up mentality, Ambitious and at the same time warm and appreciative international teams from over 12 nations, Regular virtual team events for exchange and brainstorming, but also informal "e-get-togethers" to maintain contacts, As soon as possible again: memorable regional and meaningful multi-day events etc.  HOW TO APPLY   There is a lot going on at Savings United! You want to know more? Then simply upload your CV and answer last detailed questions.   Marno from the People & Culture-Team is looking forward to getting to know you better!

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d) (Remote)
Description: At Yelp, it‚Äôs our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp‚Äôs unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and businesses around the globe, from a review of a coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.   The Data Science & Analytics team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp‚Äôs products and users. We are adept at tasks like modeling user preferences, inference from user and marketplace experiments, and generating insights about the health of local economies. With diverse backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.   This opportunity has the option to be fully remote throughout Germany.   We‚Äôd love to have you apply, even if you don‚Äôt feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we‚Äôre looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.    Where You Come In    Join a team of Data Scientists and Data Science Analysts that develop analytical frameworks and reliable measurement strategies for Yelp products. Design, execute, and analyze complex business and user experiments. Partner with other Data Scientists and Data Engineers to set the vision for and develop our experimentation platform. Devise and evaluate models for diverse business needs, such as identifying growth opportunities, estimating the impact of new features on our platforms, and personalizing the user experience. Proactively research and build ETL pipelines for product and marketplace metrics Communicate key insights from analyses, experiments and data products to stakeholders.    What It Takes To Succeed    MS/PhD in quantitative field and a few years of industry experience in a senior quantitative role. Ability to apply statistical, analytical and technical expertise to product and business problems. Prior experience structuring and leading impactful data science projects independently. Oral and written communication skills to mentor colleagues, and work effectively with partners on engineering, product and business teams. Expertise in SQL, and R or Python for data analysis and platform development. Enthusiasm for building a culture of learning and development.    What You'll Get    Full responsibility for projects from day one, a collaborative team, and a dynamic work environment. Competitive salary with equity in the company, a pension scheme, and an optional employee stock purchase plan. 30 days paid vacation per year plus one floating holiday. ‚Ç¨150 monthly reimbursement to help cover remote working expenses. ‚Ç¨89 caregiver reimbursement to support dependent care for families. Flexible working hours and meeting-free Wednesdays. Regular 3-day Hackathons, bi-weekly learning groups, and productivity spending to support and encourage your career growth. Opportunities to participate in digital events and conferences. Complementary elective German lessons for international employees. ‚Ç¨67 per month to use toward qualifying wellness expenses. Quarterly team offsites.   Yelp values diversity. We‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other protected status.  Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Javascript Developer - Perm
Description: For one of our clients we are looking for a Javascript Developer   Overview    The client is a fast-growing leader in open, digital banking technology solutions. It combines unparalleled expertise in advisory and cutting-edge technology to deliver highly customer-centric digital banking propositions across the globe. The fidorOS digital banking platform powers the most innovative financial organisations in Europe, Africa, the Middle East and Asia. While the movement for open and digital banking is in its infancy, Fidor Solutions stands apart with its ten years of experience in pioneering the use of APIs and designing, running and growing digital banks from zero to success.   With offices in Berlin, Munich, and Dubai, we have become a partner of choice for incumbent banks aspiring to transform and non-banks wishing to diversify, by offering its open API platform to launch cutting-edge digital banking solutions that provide unique customer experiences.   At Fidor Solutions , more than 40 nationalities unite to create an outstanding banking experience for our customers ‚Äì what are you waiting for?   For improving the customers experience in accessing the bank account over a new dashboard web interface design, Fidor is searching for a Senior JavaScript Engineer with great proficiency in ReactJS and related technologies.    Tasks    It's about a full redesign of a prototype dashboard frontend application and shall make available the majority of Fidor's banking functionalities for managing personal bank accounts. Due to its complex nature this position is planned as long-term assignment, including design, development, support and maintenance activities. It's an ideal position for people looking for a deep dive into fintech, which are well versed in design, development and interpersonal communication skills as listed in the following: Redesign from scratch the user interface dashboard for our customers, using newest design trends and internet banking technologies Work together with UX designers and product owners to create the best possible user experience Use your ideas and creativity to contribute to the design, inspire and influence all stakeholders according to your proven expertise and experience in all areas Maintain, debug and test your design and all related services and applications making it a configurable product usable for customer within different market segments Help define and refine requirements, create software designs and architectures, translate them into code with attention to testability and strong QA awareness  Sought after qualifications:   Academic / Technical degree in computer science or similar education Minimum of five years professional experience in building consumer faced web applications with modern HTML, CSS and JavaScript / ES6 High level of technical experience with single-page applications written in React/Redux, Webpack, Babel, Jest, or related tools Familiarity with RESTful JSON APIs in distributed systems Excellent verbal and written communication skills, organizational skills, and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment Disciplined, focused and highly committed to consistency Experienced in working in a formal development environment with strong preference towards code quality, like design and code reviews, unit testing and general technical discussions Collaborating with peers and seniors both within your team and across the organization to share best practices and knowledge of emerging technologies Experience with agile development processes and how to apply its principles    The Client Offers    Fidor is among the top 50 FinTech companies worldwide ‚Äì you have a unique opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies to build the future of digital banking Tons of responsibility and a stepping stone for your career in FinTech ‚Äì the sky is the limit International horizons ‚Äì work with international teams and clients from all corners of the world Power to implement your own ideas right from the start More than just a job ‚Äì a unique opportunity to be part of a banking revolution Attractive Salary Modern app for lunch refund of up to 97,50 Eur per month FlexTime system for flexible working hours and independent scheduling Independent mobile work for more flexibility 30 days of paid annual leave Fidor Team Spirit - employee events, goal-oriented success strategies, shared visions and plans Transportation allowance for permanent employees Table soccer, fresh fruit, coffee and more Office located near the city center

Title: Frontend Developer (m/f/d) React
Description: For our client, a pioneer in the field of Green Energy, we are immediately filling the following position in a permanent position in the greater Munich area:    FRONTEND DEVELOPER (M/F/D) REACT    YOUR REQUIREMENT PROFILE   Design and further development of the IoT platform as well as integration of new product generations Front-end programming on a customer-oriented software for the control and monitoring of fuel cell systems Independent and autonomous work in an agile team in close coordination with the backend developers Continuous exchange with the rest of the embedded software team Implementation of latest device compatibility standards and user friendliness, E2E testing, mockup design, etc.    YOUR QUALIFICATION PROFILE   Already first practical experience in frontend development with React.js, CSS/SASS, HTML5, TypeScript Ideally already first touches with Python, MVC, GraphQL, WebSocket, etc. Experience with graphic design software (e.g. Illustrator) desirable Good application of agile team structures Very good knowledge of English, good knowledge of German    BENEFITS   International company with flat hierarchies as well as a collegial, family environment Many creative possibilities and freedoms Permanent position with flexible working hours, 30 days of vacation and mobile work Additional benefits such as sports offers, company pension scheme, team and company events Modern office with sun terrace, parking spaces, free e-charging station and good connections to the MVV network    Interested  Then we look forward to receiving your meaningful application including salary expectations and earliest starting date via our online portal.

Title: AI Full Stack Engineer (f/m/d)
Description: At paretos, we deliver Data Science to go. This means, that we are eager to make data-informed decision-making available for everybody. As a ‚Äúremote-first company‚Äù with team members all over the world, we strongly believe that this ambitious path is only possible with a great and diverse team.   Paretos is an inclusive company with equal opportunities for everybody. Our culture is guided by the principles of GUNG HO ‚Äì we believe in the synergy of worthwhile work, being in control of achieving a shared goal, and the importance of cheering each other on. We are proud to have brought together passionate, high-performing, and caring individuals of all genders, cultures, backgrounds, and viewpoints. All together, we make up the heart of the company and push us to the next level on a daily basis.   Tasks  At paretos, you are part of the engineering team to develop and operate the paretos software. As a part of this product-focused team, you will work together with our geeks (mathematicians, physicists and AI specialists) and engineers on the solutions of tomorrow. Your focus is to make the great ideas of our geeks accessible for our current and future customers!    Requirements    2+ years of experience as a full-stack engineer, preferably in an AI or mathematic intensive environment Experience with JavaScript/TypeScript/Node.js, React, Redux and a passion to develop great front-ends would be a great fit Knowledge in Python (especially Flask) and HTTP API Design would be appreciated Understanding of cloud technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) and system engineering (12-Factor-App, system quality attributes) would be appreciated You are used to work autonomously and self-determined Motivation to work together in a team of brilliant minds Bonus Point: You have practiced end-to-end testing and know tools like Selenium to automate them    Benefits    These little perks will be waiting for you if you become part of the paretos-family:   We are a remote first company ‚Äì nevertheless you‚Äôre still very welcome to work at the office and enjoy the great view over Heidelberg At the office you can test your barista skills and brew some great coffee to keep you going throughout the workday or enjoy some coffee talks with your fellow paretoneers. (You might even be awarded the next ‚Äúparetos office barista of the year‚Äù at our Christmas party!) Talking about the team: you‚Äôll complement a highly skilled & motivated team of paretoneers ready to hit the road and have fun along the way We regularly enjoy professional and fun events online and IRL with the whole team You‚Äôll get the office equipment you need to show off your full potential. We believe that your capabilities shouldn‚Äôt be limited by hardware components Work whenever it fits best for you with flexible working hours Receive a mobility budget to access various kinds of transportation whilst setting off your carbon emissions If you are part of the paretos dog club, feel free to bring your furry friend to the office   We are continuously expanding our benefits as we grow to ensure an environment where our team members feel comfortable and happy to work at.   This is it from our side for now. What about you? Are you ambitious to disrupt the AI and Optimization world with us? Then send us your application!   Note: We encourage you to apply for this role, even if you don‚Äôt match all the requirements 100%. As long as you inherit the eagerness to learn, we are happy to be convinced that you are the right fit for us.

Title: Full-Stack Developer (m/w/d)
Description: We are specializingin IoT and Artificial Intelligence (AIoT). With our smart services, we increase the performance of technical assets and enable new, innovative business models. All applications are based on our robust, highly available IoT and machine learning platform.   We are looking for a Full-Stack Developer to begin as soon as possible at our headquarters in Bonn, Germany (or home office). We are a dynamic digitally driven company. We value teamwork in our modern office facilities as much as effective online collaboration when working from home office.   Tasks   Drive web application development to next level, where AI meets IoT Work in close conjunction with our other development teams, e.g. ML, DevOps Participate in the entire application lifecycle, focusing on coding and debugging Learn and apply cutting-edge approaches to web development Write clean code for our core product including unit tests    Requirements    Solid knowledge of:   Kotlin and Spring Boot Typescript, Angular 2+ (we always use the latest major release), HTML/CSS, RxJS, NgRx, OpenAPI Python 3, FastAPI, Poetry PostgreSQL, Redis Docker   Furthermore:   Good understanding of modern frameworks At least one year of experience as full-stack, or back-end/ front-end developer Experience in developing microservices-based web applications Strong analytical skills Fluency in English   This would be an advantage:   Degree in computer science, mathematics, or related technical field Experience with agile software development    Benefits    Early joiner in a fast-growing scale-up and potentially the most exciting market of the century so far ‚Äì Artificial Intelligence! An opportunity to plan, design and develop microservices and frontends from scratch Involvement in the development of functionalities for cutting-edge data analysis and machine learning technologies Possibility of actively shaping future-oriented and unique AI solutions that are directly applicable in the industry Possibility of personal development in a team of highly qualified Product Owners, Consultants, Data Scientists and Developers with fully open discussion rooms (on-site and virtually) This job can be performed remotely or at our headquarters in Bonn, Germany And of course, we trust in the tech startup basics: Plenty of coffee as your daily fuel, choose your hardware, no dress code (‚Äúwithin reason‚Äù for customer meetings), flexible working hours and (currently virtual) team events.   If you want to actively shape future markets, work independently and become part of a creative and innovative team, we are looking forward to receiving your application and salary expectations.

Title: JavaScript Engineer (m/w/d) - Hybrid or Remote
Description: About Tilta    We're a team of experienced fintech entrepreneurs, engineers and data scientists. We believe the future of finance belongs to builders, not bankers. Access to capital should be fair & instant and we're working hard to make that happen. That is why we are building Tilta, an AI-enabled credit line that embeds seamlessly into e-commerce platforms, providing funding for businesses even before the need consciously arises. Backed by top-tier investors, we enable everybody to join our mission of supporting small businesses!   Your opportunity  We are looking for software engineers who want to work on the next-generation of financial user experiences and make a dent on how businesses access capital.   As an engineer at Tilta, you will be working in a team of talented minds from business and tech, all united in creating user-friendly experiences and developer-friendly APIs for the next generation of financial services to be used by tens of thousands of businesses every day.   More specifically, you will be working on the various RESTful APIs, third-party integrations as well as the backend logic and orchestration that makes up the glue in between.   Designing and building backend services are challenged with high requirements for performance and reliability that guarantee and optimise the critical conversion rate expectations of our partner platforms. Further, as an infrastructure product, delivering on high standards for our API design and documentation nurtures love for our solution amongst our partners and their respected developers.   Given the early stage of Tilta, you‚Äôll be presented with a green field in many areas and are challenged to assume ownership and responsibility for researching, deciding, testing, documenting and maintaining unknown approaches to known problems all while applying the profound experience that you bring to the table.   Also, if interested, as a JavaScript Backend Engineer in an all-JavaScript tech stack, you‚Äôll be presented with development opportunities to become a Full-Stack Engineer.   Technologies we build and run on   NodeJS & Express Python ReactJS & Redux Typescript SaSS Kafka Redshift Kubernetes PostgreSQL Amazon AWS Terraform   Tasks   Developing new features and designing their implementation Designing, building, and documenting APIs for frontend and backend consumption Researching, integrating and maintaining third-party upstream services Assuming ownership for the quality of your implementations Reviewing, analysing and fixing bottlenecks and bugs Improving our processes through agile development practices Maintaining and improving our deployment infrastructure and pipeline Learning and sharing through pair programming, collaboration and code review Joining product managers in partner conversations for first-hand problem feedback    Requirements    Strong NodeJS/JavaScript expertise with 3+ years of relevant experience Web application development and object-oriented programming Design, implementation and consumption of RESTful APIs Solid understanding of best practices in software architecture Ability to quickly adapt languages and technologies   Nice to have   TypeScript expertise AWS deployment expertise Previous agile development experience Fintech background    Benefits    We ask you for nothing less than helping us to make a lasting change on how businesses do business. It's an invitation to an exciting journey with complex challenges, hard work and all the support needed to succeed as a team, be it remote or onsite. Here is what we have for you:   Competitive salary Equity programme Minimum 28 days of holiday per year Dedicated personal development budget Permanent contract from the start Flexible working hours Home office equipment support Choose your own hardware Flexible mobility allowance Relocation package for remote employees Referral bonus Tilta Swag 5 baby days Bi-annual company offsites Cool Berlin office with rooftop terrace And most of all, growth opportunities

Title: Mobile Engineer
Description: About the opportunity    We are looking for a Mobile Engineerwho will help to take our app to the next level. Since we‚Äôre an early-stage company, the right applicant will be comfortable with change and will enjoy bringing new ideas to the table. You should expect to be right in the cockpit of a high-growth startup, getting the exciting opportunity to write high-quality code and keep on top of novel technologies. Join us and become part of our journey to empower the lives of millions!     What you can expect   Be a mobile specialist. You will be tasked with several key frontend activities such as developing new user-facing features, writing reusable code and libraries, and enhancing applications for maximum speed and scalability Collaborate with the design/UX/UI teams. You will define the way our mobile application looks and how it works. Further, you will bridge the gap between graphic design and technical implementation, helping to translate UI/UX design wireframes to actual code Consistently iterate with the backend and product teams. You have a proven track record of being able to cooperate with the backend developers and product teams to successfully manage a uniform product. You can validate inputs before submitting them to the backend Growth. You will directly experience and take part in the scale-up of a high-growth business     Job requirements   3+ years of professional experience** in mobile software development. Preferably in high-growth, venture-backed startups. Excellent knowledge of React Native. Working knowledge of DOM and modern frameworks such as React/Redux is also required. Adherence to engineering best practices. You are knowledgeable about design patterns and testability; you have experience with Cypress/Jest/Detox for unit, integration, and performance testing. Proven track record developing and delivering high-impact applications for Web, iOS, and Android. Fluency in English. German is a plus Nice to have: knowledge of native mobile application development is a plus, as well as working with Expo for your React Native applications     Why us   üå± Opportunity to work in a company with direct social impact üí∞ Attractive compensation & stock options üá∫üá¶ Open & International environment üèõÔ∏è Fantastic location in the heart of Berlin & flexible WFH policy ü•≥ Regular team events ü•ò Free lunch at the office üíª Latest equipment, to ensure you have everything needed     About the company   Kadmos is on an ambitious mission to revolutionize salary payments to migrant workers. The Berlin-based startup was founded in 2021 by MIT graduates Justus Schmueser and Sasha Makarovych to bring fintech, low margins, and transparent FX to industries riddled with opaque mark-ups, kickbacks, and physical cash transactions.   Backed by renowned VCs Addition and Atlantic Labs, Kadmos has raised more than $10 million in just a year. The company intends to use the funding for expanding across industries and further accelerating product development. For more information, visit https://www.kadmos.io/.

Title: Mobile App Developer (m/f/d)
Description: About The Position    "uptodate", which was created in cooperation with Versicherungskammer Bayern, is looking for support from "Mobile App Developers (m/f/d)" as soon as possible. With the help of innovative solutions, we are working to create a new type of digital ecosystem around the topic of life and living, which makes people's everyday life easier. We currently offer smart products through our online shop and the successful smartphone app Earnest, which is the first mover in Germany to encourage sustainable living at home. At uptodate, an agile startup culture and a focus on innovation are combined with a solid investor.   As part of this, we developed the Earnest app  . With over 500,000 downloads, it is THE companion for a sustainable life and already helps many users step by step to become more sustainable in their everyday life and thereby make a valuable contribution to the planet.   Your tasks   Design and develop new products together with our development and project teams and bring existing solutions from MVP to maturity level Take new features live quickly - but always with an eye on the big picture and quality Code reviews and automated tests are part of your daily routine Develop our products "mobile first" and improve and maintain the CI/CD pipeline Work in an agile Scrum team - in close collaboration with product owners and designers You will work with React, React Native, TypeScript, HTML5, CSS, AWS, serverless and much more. On our Uptodate Radar you can get a more detailed overview on how and with what tools we are working.   Your profile   Interested to do mobile app development (experience not necessarily needed) You have knowledge of the following standards such as React Native, Expo, JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML5 and CSS You have a strong interest in developing and publishing mobile applications Ideally, you already have some experience with AWS and backend development You always wanted to be a developer - because programming is your passion! You have a good command of written and spoken English   Why us?   Challenging, varied and independent tasks Responsibility right from the start - great creative freedom with regard to our products and processes A great international team and collegial atmosphere with a lot of fun An open corporate culture with flat hierarchies, short decision-making processes and a hands-on mentality Regular (virtual) team events Participation in corporate benefits of the Versicherungskammer such as fitness offers and canteen Flexible working hours and home office arrangement (a location within Germany/outside of Munich is possible by arrangement) A new, modern office with free drinks and fresh fruit Attractive salary package and 30+ vacation days   Sounds great? So does our 3-steps recruitment process, which takes around 2-3 weeks, is very transparent and simple - with detailed feedback at every stage if you wish. You want to be a part of uptodate? Please apply via one click on our website.

Title: Mobile / Full-Stack Developer (f/m/d)
Description:
We are looking for a Mobile Engineer, who ensures the best possible access to health data on iOS & Android. About Thryve Thryve empowers digital health services globally to provide better care with a unified access to health data. While we currently serve 2.000.000+ users for our corporate customers, we grow rapidly in line with healthcare digitalization. Your mission As a core part of our mobile engineering team, you are responsible for designing, implementing, testing and releasing new features from user story to production. You are working closely together with our senior engineers and appreciate the freedom to choose the best stack of tools and methodologies for any given task. Why join For clients and millions of users globally, Thryve provides a key element to improve the single most important thing for humanity: health. As we grow rapidly, this is an exciting opportunity to join an evolving global player and shape the growth of our fantastic, international team (backgrounds in 10+ countries & speaking 15+ languages). While our lovely industrial loft office in central Kreuzberg has free food and drinks (and fantastic lunch & bar options around), we're flexible in remote work and working hours. If you join, you benefit from competitive salaries and equity opportunities, as well as benefits in kind (e.g. your new bike sponsored by us). We are an equal opportunities employer and strive for an open and inclusive work atmosphere. Join us and shape tomorrow's health care, globally.

Desired Skills and Experience

You are experienced in front end development preferable in Swift or Kotlin, with Cross-Platform being a plus (Flutter, React) You have a degree (minimum bachelor) in computer science, with job experience being a plus Experience with web technologies (e.g. Angular.js) is a plus, as is knowledge in ReactNative Experience with the full mobile development life cycle, ideally in a start-up environment is a plus You feel comfortable working with high autonomy in an open, agile and clean-code environment You have good communication skills in English, with German being a plus

Title: Software Developer (f/m/d) - Java and Process Development
Description: At IONOS, the leading European provider of cloud infrastructure, cloud services and hosting services, you will work together with a wide range of teams. We are characterized by open structures, a friendly working culture and flat hierarchies with a strong team spirit. We firmly believe that work and fun are compatible, and offer you the right environment for this. Our constant growth means that we are always looking for new colleagues. Become part of IONOS and grow with us.   Your Tasks:  Our department is responsible for the ordering and contract processes at IONOS, which are used thousands of times a day by our customers. Thus, we play a central role in our business systems.   We rely on self-organization, agile methods and an open mindset. Currently, we work in three self-organized teams of 6-8 people according to Scrum or Kanban and rely on pair and mob programming. We strive for improvement and provide the necessary space. At least once a year we organize our "Innovation Week", where the whole team can work on their own ideas or prototypes or experiment with new technologies. We rely on Java, Camunda, Docker and Elasticsearch, among others, and are constantly renewing our tech stack, most recently by introducing MicroProfile GraphQL to our interfaces. Whether as speaker or listener - join us at (international) conferences or take advantage of our wide range of internal conferences and communities. We live DevOps - operations and development belong together and work hand in hand. You have an idea that you would like to pitch? Then take part in the IONOS Ship Up! day, our internal 24h hackathon.   We Appreciate:  You have experience in backend development, ideally in the Java ecosystem. Modern software craftsmanship methods (e.g. Clean Code, TDD, DDD, etc.) are not foreign to you. We work in an international company, so the exchange of written and spoken English is no problem for you.   What else we would like to tell you:  No cover letter and resume at hand? No problem. We are happy to get in touch with you. But if you still want to give us some information, you can of course upload your cover letter or resume directly or later. We are looking forward to your application!    About IONOS    1&1 IONOS is Europe's leading platform for cloud services and hosting services. We successfully support our customers in their business development.   More than 4000 employees in several countries around the world are working to meet the requirements and wishes of our 8.5 million customers.   We promote the development of our employees and their different talents, interests and languages.   We value diversity and welcome all applications - regardless of, for example, gender, nationality, ethnic or social origin, religion, disability, age as well as sexual orientation and identity, physical characteristics, marital status or any other irrelevant factor subject to applicable law.

Title: Front-end Developer - Insided by Gainsight
Description: About InSided    inSided  is the leading Customer Success Community Platform that uses the power of community to measurably improve our client‚Äôs customer engagement. Customer Success  is at the heart of everything that we do. It is our motto to bring success to all our customers.   Our B2B customer base has nearly tripled 2021, with rocketship growth forecast for 2022. We are on a mission to make Customer Success Communities  an essential part of at least 1000 brands worldwide.   To achieve this we are looking for A-Players - people who share our passion  , embrace change, take initiative and adopt high standards for themselves - to join our team and help us shape the future of customer success.   We proudly achieved a big milestone in 2022, when Gainsight  successfully acquired inSided  !   The deal pairs Gainsight‚Äôs leadership in Customer Success with the power of community-led growth, through inSided‚Äôs  unique capabilities that drive product engagement and adoption, increase retention and build lasting customer relationships. inSided‚Äôs platform is currently used by hundreds of companies including Gainsight, Gong.io, ProductBoard, Sprout Social, Guru, and Zapier.   inSided (by Gainsight)  is based in Amsterdam with offices in Manhattan, New York City. On both sides of the pond, we have a motivated and entrepreneurial team, who love to brainstorm on new ideas together, and regularly celebrate our continued success (ask about our champagne waterfalls üçæ). We currently have around 80  employees and are growing rapidly.   What you will do   Contribute to the growth and development of our product by writing and maintaining code, focusing on quality and maintainability. We believe that our teams own the code they build. Share your knowledge, both inside and outside your own team. We believe that everyone has something to teach others, regardless of seniority. Design, implement, test, and monitor valuable solutions that achieve the team‚Äôs goals while keeping a smooth delivery flow and balancing tradeoffs between scope, time, and effort. We believe that is possible to achieve a balance between getting things done and doing things properly. Continuously improve your and your team‚Äôs way of working, expanding the boundaries of your team‚Äôs autonomy and self-organization. We believe that these two principles lead to stronger, happier, and more performing teams.   What you must have to fit the role   Have at least 3 years of professional experience as a frontend engineer Solid CSS and HTML skills and are proficient in JavaScript Proficient with front-end automated testing frameworks Experience in React (hooks, class-based) at least 2 years Willingness to work with Preact Master English language in both spoken and written format A Continuous Improvement mindset. Title: Full Stack Developer (m/f/d)
Description: Are you passionate about moving the B2B world to a more sustainable future? Are you comfortable working in an agile, fast-paced environment? Then you've come to the right place! At Ecotrek, you will help companies to achieve sustainable procurement through sustainability data mining.   Tasks  Your opportunity to make an impact   Be our tech chameleon! Maintain and enhance our state-of-the-art web-development practices Work across our interdisciplinary functional data & software development environment and have no problem being the firefighter within the tech team, helping out where you are needed Assure & optimize our data-to-customer flow from the data pipelines, to the frontend Be an example and a guard for our company culture and values.    Requirements    3+ years of full-stack web development experience Degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics or equivalent experience Proficient in JavaScript and familiar with general-purpose languages like Python or Java Expert knowledge in technologies and frameworks like REACT, Vue.js, NodeJS, GraphQL or Cypress, to name a few Extensive know-how in system design and software architecture Extensive experience with the use of Single Page Applications (SPA) and Server Side Rendering (SSR) Solid experience with setting up backend services and storing user data (incl. authentication services) Solid knowledge of testing and design concepts Fun, pragmatic, dedicated and willing to dive into new domains Fluent in English (German not mandatory)    Benefits    Vacation: 30 paid vacation days Working time: 40h per week Place of work: flexible, hybrid or completely remote working culture with an easily accessible office in Berlin-Mitte Bahncard 50 Work from abroad 12 weeks per year Community days Team-Workations "We love to create" To create a significant positive impact in the world we want work to be fulfilling, engaging and fun. As a group, we value constructive feedback. Authentic, honest and fair communication is important to us. We hope to welcome more nationalities, genders, sexual orientations, ages, races, physical/mental abilities to our team - Fighting with us for a meaningful cause. "Push & Pull" Work here is about ownership and solving problems together. Ask questions and receive answers - no black holes in the communication chain. We like to keep communication and deep focus in a natural balance. "We trust and care for each other" Every contribution is valuable and everyone's impulse is important. We adapt work to individual needs and priorities and let everyone decide if remote work is suitable and what day plan fits best to their work-life balance. We trust and care about each other and want everyone to be engaged with passion. Help us define new tasks for the greatest impact! "Idea to realization in one day" We set our goals high! That‚Äôs why we need to be ambitious, have courage, and move fast, whilst staying healthily grounded in a strong team. Thinking big leads to great opportunities, making mistakes and overcoming doubts along the way is part of it - good thing, we are all one team.
