Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d) (Remote)
Description: At Yelp, it‚Äôs our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp‚Äôs unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and businesses around the globe, from a review of a coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.   The Data Science & Analytics team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp‚Äôs products and users. We are adept at tasks like modeling user preferences, inference from user and marketplace experiments, and generating insights about the health of local economies. With diverse backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.   This opportunity has the option to be fully remote throughout Germany.   We‚Äôd love to have you apply, even if you don‚Äôt feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we‚Äôre looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.    Where You Come In    Join a team of Data Scientists and Data Science Analysts that develop analytical frameworks and reliable measurement strategies for Yelp products. Design, execute, and analyze complex business and user experiments. Partner with other Data Scientists and Data Engineers to set the vision for and develop our experimentation platform. Devise and evaluate models for diverse business needs, such as identifying growth opportunities, estimating the impact of new features on our platforms, and personalizing the user experience. Proactively research and build ETL pipelines for product and marketplace metrics Communicate key insights from analyses, experiments and data products to stakeholders.    What It Takes To Succeed    MS/PhD in quantitative field and a few years of industry experience in a senior quantitative role. Ability to apply statistical, analytical and technical expertise to product and business problems. Prior experience structuring and leading impactful data science projects independently. Oral and written communication skills to mentor colleagues, and work effectively with partners on engineering, product and business teams. Expertise in SQL, and R or Python for data analysis and platform development. Enthusiasm for building a culture of learning and development.    What You'll Get    Full responsibility for projects from day one, a collaborative team, and a dynamic work environment. Competitive salary with equity in the company, a pension scheme, and an optional employee stock purchase plan. 30 days paid vacation per year plus one floating holiday. ‚Ç¨150 monthly reimbursement to help cover remote working expenses. ‚Ç¨89 caregiver reimbursement to support dependent care for families. Flexible working hours and meeting-free Wednesdays. Regular 3-day Hackathons, bi-weekly learning groups, and productivity spending to support and encourage your career growth. Opportunities to participate in digital events and conferences. Complementary elective German lessons for international employees. ‚Ç¨67 per month to use toward qualifying wellness expenses. Quarterly team offsites.   Yelp values diversity. We‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other protected status.  Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Frontend Software Engineer
Description: Do you love to explore and experiment with new ideas? Do you like designing flexible and reusable components? Do you want to master not just React, but also the fundamentals of JavaScript? If so, you‚Äôve come to the right place.  Our Marketing Solutions Technology team is building future-proof marketing automation solutions to power trivago‚Äôs Price Search  . To make this happen, we are redesigning our existing systems to support our Performance Marketing and Marketing Intelligence teams to restart the travel industry after the global COVID-19 pandemic.  As a Frontend Software Engineer  on our team, you‚Äôll contribute to this exciting adventure by helping us provide our users with tech solutions and support our efforts to leverage search engine marketing (SEM) potential for trivago.  How you‚Äôll make an impact:   Build responsive, scalable, accessible, and performant UIs using a modern technology stack and write clean, maintainable, and testable code Help identify areas of improvement in our code base and contribute to solving technical problems of high scope and complexity Collaborate with frontend, backend, QA, UI & UX teams Stay up to date with current frameworks, tools, techniques, and libraries Share your technical know-how within and outside the team and document your tests, solutions, concepts, and approaches for future reference Conduct code reviews to ensure our tech remains state of the art   Our Technology Stack:   Javascript Kotlin / PHP React.js Kafka Redis / MySQL Docker / Kubernetes Google Cloud Platform (GCP)   What we‚Äôre looking for:   Professional experience with React.js or other modern Javascript component-based frameworks (Vue.js, etc.), HTML, and CSS Good understanding of core web and browser concepts Experience consuming APIs and backend services from Javascript-based frontend applications A desire to constantly learn and improve. We will help you by providing internal and external training A team player. You enjoy working with people and sharing your knowledge and ideas in a simple and clear way Understanding of design principles and the value of following them Fluent English (our company language) language skills   What makes you stand out:   Knowledge of PHP Symfony Experience in agile software development supported by CI/CD pipelines Experience in test-driven development with frameworks like Jest, React Testing Library, etc   You‚Äôd be working with a lot of top-notch engineers and freaking smart people. Any form of formal education in a STEM field is appreciated but don't let these nice-to-haves stop you from applying for the job! As long as you have relevant experience and the right attitude, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.  What you can expect from life at trivago:  Entrepreneurship:  The freedom to take ownership of your work and drive initiatives independently. It‚Äôs the idea that counts, not the position.  Growth:  Support for your development, constant new opportunities, regular peer feedback, mentorship and training.  International  workforce  :  Collaboration with international talents from 80+ nations bringing different perspectives, backgrounds and expertise together to ensure a truly global focus.  Flexibility:  Self-determined working hours and the opportunity to split your time between home and our campus in D√ºsseldorf: At least 4 days in the office per month and the rest at home. We also offer further flexibility for parents of young children and talents with severe disabilities or health conditions.  Relocation  and integration  :  Support with relocation costs, insurance, work permit and visa questions.  Equal  o  pportunity:  Commitment to creating an all-inclusive workplace, because we know representing the diversity of our users in our talent base enables us to create a more meaningful product.   A note from our recruitment team:   We know that applying for a new job can be both exciting and intimidating, but don‚Äôt worry, we‚Äôve got you. Our recruiting team will be on hand every step of the way, but if you have any questions or concerns before applying, feel free to reach out to us at   joinus@trivago.com  . You can also find out more about our hiring process  here  .  We look forward to your application!

Title: Full Stack Software Developer (w/m/d)
Description: About Workist    Founded in 2019 and supported by Serial Entrepreneurs and VCs, we turned on the turbo this year and are on a strong growth path to become the leading provider of B2B transaction automation. We already connect thousands of companies and automate transactions with a volume of several million euros every week.   So that even more companies can automate their B2B transactions with our product, we are looking for passionated and talented employees who will take the product and the company to the next level.   This is your mission  We are looking for a Fullstack Developer (w/m/d) who is passionate about what they do and ready to take on responsibility. You will be an integral part of the product team where we build AI-based applications to automate repetitive business processes such as data extraction and entry, email classification, email data extraction, and business transaction routing.   Decide on technical architecture and infrastructure Develop software along our Definition of done Develop software in the entire tech stack Provide feedback to team members on where and how to improve Help out and mentor other team members to ensure overall development quality & velocity Live ‚ÄúContinuous improvement‚Äù by identifying opportunities for streamlining work and reducing waste Be accountable for service levels Write documentation where necessary Take care of IT Security and Data Privacy   Your profile  We‚Äôre looking for people that are passionate about what they do and ready to take over responsibilities. We‚Äôre creating a work environment where people should follow their curiosity and have a strong urge to put the business forward to help fulfill our mission.   Since you will work very closely with our founding team on our AI Technology we believe it is important that you feel comfortable with at least some of the points below.   Fluent in Python or if you consider yourself polyglot Experience with Typescript, React JS, and Apollo Experience with Django, Flask, or similar CI/CD Experience Experience working with Graphql Kubernetes Experience   It would be even greater if you find your self in the next list:   Due to our customer base, German is a plus Some first experience with Machine Learning You have some experience in setting up cloud infrastructure with terraform   Why us?  Do you want to really take over responsibilities and do not face micromanagement from an incompetent boss? Then you‚Äôre at Workist in the right place. We commit as founders and as a company to build an organization that promotes domain ownership and gives people the freedom to decide within their domain independently. This does not mean that you‚Äôre on your own.   On the contrary, we believe in teamwork and helping each other out. We want to achieve great things together and believe in working in small iterations towards a big goal. Therefore we follow agile best practices in business and tech teams and set sprint, quarterly, and yearly goals to work efficiently towards them. Everyone is welcome to contribute to our company goals and also raise red flags when something is not going as planned.   At Workist, we strive to build an organization that encourages ownership and gives employees the freedom to make independent decisions in their own areas. This doesn't mean you're on your own.   We believe in teamwork and helping each other. We want to achieve great things together and believe in working towards a big goal in small steps. That's why we follow agile best practices in business and tech teams and set sprint, quarterly and annual goals to work together efficiently. Everyone is welcome to contribute to our business goals and also to point out challenges when something is not going as planned.   Your benefits as a Workie:   With strong ownership from day one, you will actively shape an early stage SaaS startup 30 days annual leave BVG ticket or JobRad for the way to work Annual budget for personal training Tax-free benefits Work equipment of your choice Flexible home office plan and the opportunity to work completely remotely outside Germany for 4 weeks a year Regular team events, fresh fruit and beverages in our modern office in Berlin Mitte Competitive salary, extensive individual feedback sessions and great development opportunities Work in a flat hierarchy with an open and transparent communication culture Participation in the (Virtual) Stock Option Plan

Title: Frontend Developer (Vue) (f/m/d)
Description: JOIN US!  __Comgy is an ambitious Berlin-based start-up in the field of energy / proptech and currently has a vacancy for a Frontend Developer!   We move, and are moved by, the generational topic of climate protection. If you also want to make a difference and have a desire to work with purpose, then you are exactly right with us!__   YOUR ROLE   You extend, improve and maintain the frontend of our meter-, tenant- and gateway management web app (Vue + Vuetify) You build our new tenant portal web app (Vue + Tailwind) You will become an expert for our jsonapi-conform REST API on the consumer side You implement visualizations for live data feeds (meter heartbeats, meter data, gateway data, decryption/decoding queue) You work alongside an experienced team of designers and implement flow-based UIs You take ownership of the UX and usability of the interfaces you build You make informed decisions about technologies, architecture and processes   OUR PERFECT MATCH   You have strong logical thinking skills and proven persistence in problem-solving (e.g. achieved through a B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Maths, Computer Science or Engineering) You have +3 years of professional work experience in web development You have experience with component-based frontend technologies like Vue or React You have extensive knowledge of utility-first CSS libraries like Tailwind You have very good communication skills and are comfortable working in an English-speaking team Bonus: exposure to and interest in Agile development methods/practices (Scrum, Kanban, Lean, etc.) Bonus: You are more of a generalist than a specialist, meaning you have had exposure to adjacent topics like UI/UX design, QA, data science, design thinking or backend technologies like Ruby on Rails or Elixir/Phoenix   WE OFFER   A very deep stack, from low-level data to processing and visualization, not another CRUD app A promising startup within an exciting sector of property & energy management which we are disrupting via digitalization and innovation The option to take more responsibilities over time and take the next step in your career path, e.g. becoming Lead Frontend Designer Profit from working closely with experienced serial entrepreneurs who co-founded 3 successful companies within the last 10 years Freedom to design and use the latest technologies where relevant (‚ÄúBest tool for the job‚Äù approach) Stay on top of current industry trends and join tech conferences to present your work, and meet-ups all around the globe A hybrid working model with the option of remote / mobile-work in order to allow room for your individual preferences In addition to 5 days of educational leave per year, we also offer further internal training and regular knowledge exchange Company pension scheme Urban Sports Club membership or heyday account with a variety of perks & benefits Access to regular sessions for physical and mental health (Actio Teams) An office in the heart of Berlin (Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg) with a good supply of drinks, fruit, muesli and snacks :)   REFERRAL  Sounds good, but not for you?  Feel free to spread the word. There is a ‚Ç¨2000 referral bonus  for referrals that lead to employment.    Additional Information    Please note that for this position it is obligatory to include a cover letter.  Start  : immediately ‚Äì Job type  : full-time, on site or remote ‚Äì Location:  Berlin Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg ‚Äì Timezone: ¬±1 h   OPEN APPLICATION  No suitable job found, but the area of Software Engineering sounds interesting?  Then feel free to apply on your own initiative!____

Title: .NET Developer
Description: The Developer is responsible for the overall performance of the product through applying principles of software engineering to the design development maintenance testing and evaluation of the software. The Developer ensures timely delivery of high quality software within the release timelines and guidelines.   What You Will Be Doing   Develop code based on functional specifications and thorough understanding of product code; identify refactoring opportunities and architectural improvements Test code to verify it meets the technical specifications and is working as intended, before submitting to code review Create and apply automated tests and test principles to software changes, including (but not limited to) unit tests Contribute to standards and processes as applicable to software development methodology, including planning, work estimation, solution demos, and reviews Complete logic and algorithm design in alignment with established standards Perform moderately complex peer code reviews Read software requirements and understand impact on design specifications Contribute to the implementation of delivery pipeline, including test automation, security, and performance. Understand business, application, and coding tasks to make data-driven recommendations for internal process improvements and product documentation Provide troubleshooting support for moderately complex production issues or software code issues to ensure the stability of the application Comply with all corporate and departmental privacy and data security policies and practices, including but not limited to, Hyland‚Äôs Information Systems Security Policy    What Will Make You Successful   Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience Experience with data structures, algorithms, and software design Experience with continuous software delivery Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, C/C++, C#, Objective C, Python, or JavaScript. Experience working in Windows/Linux development environment, working with open source tools/platforms Experience with build environments and delivery pipelines Experience with test automation and continuous integration tools Knowledge of software application testing tools, methodologies, and process framework Good oral and written communications skills that demonstrate a professional demeanor and the ability to interact with others with discretion and tact Good collaboration skills, applied successfully within team as well as with other areas Good critical thinking and problem solving skills Self-motivated with the ability to manage projects to completion with oversight Ability to work independently and in a team environment Good attention to detail Driven to learn and stay current professionally Passionate, competitive and intellectually curious Sharp, fast learner with technology curiosity and aptitude Ability to provide technical and constructive feedback to team members Up to 10% travel time required    What you can expect next:   Hyland Recruiters thoroughly review every application and will contact you within 1 to 2 weeks regarding next steps. Be sure to add Hyland to your contacts list and check your spam folder so you never miss a message from us! Do you have any follow up questions? Email your Recruiter directly at Careers@Hyland.com .    Employee Perks and Programs  Flexible Schedule. Paid Time Off. Volunteer Time Off. Wellbeing Initiatives. Career Development and Training. Sabbatical Program. Reach out to your Hyland Recruiter for more information.   Welcome to  #HylandLife  Since 1991, it has been Hyland‚Äôs mission to help our employees, customers and partners exceed their potential with our industry-leading content services platform . Title: Software Engineer (Go/Python)
Description: About Us    In today‚Äôs software-centric economy, speed is everything. The pressure to deliver more, faster, falls squarely on development teams. Sauce Labs accelerates software development by removing testing as a bottleneck. Our automated testing cloud ensures that the web and mobile applications people use everyday work flawlessly on any browser or device. With Sauce, innovators accelerate their software development cycles, improve quality, deploy with confidence and reduce costs. We call that automated testing. But you‚Äôll probably just call it awesome.    About The Role    The Core Services team is responsible for the orchestration layer which maintains a lifecycle of all resources required by customers to successfully execute their tests. We help customers build digital confidence by providing an entry point to access the Sauce Labs vast amount of testing resources.   Being a Senior Software Engineer at Core team means you will take care of all new and existing services, API's and other resources our team owns. It includes not only software artifacts but also architecture design, wide inter-team collaboration and product requirements discussion.    Responsibilities    Implement features and improvements to the orchestration layer of our test platform. Actively collaborate with Product-Engineering stakeholders to maintain high expectations for quality in our iterative environment. Advocate for improvements to our platform scale, performance, architecture and engineering quality. Propose and implement solutions to improve our team efficiency. Specifically addressing tech-debt and hidden dependencies. Make choices for the adoption of new technologies based on your extensive experience. Try to ship small features and improvements on a regular basis with minimum guidance. Actively help the team to collaborate with bigger initiatives. Participate in weekday and weekend on-call rotations to help teams troubleshoot urgent customer facing problems and other engineering issues. Participate in our team process of software delivery which includes refinement of work items, discussion about priorities and outcomes the team defines for the coming time period.    Advanced    Requirements:   HTTP Go GCP Kubernetes Prometheus/Grafana Python 2/3    Familiar/Intermediate    GitLab Envoy HAProxy Redis Terraform Protobuf Webdriver Git Docker or compatible technology   Principles   Observability/Alerting - SRE handbook Building scalable software > 10k requests/second Testing best practices    Security Responsibilities At Sauce    At Sauce, we will commit to supporting the health and safety of employees and properties, partnering with internal stakeholders to learn and act on ever-evolving security protocols and procedures. You‚Äôll be expected to fully comply with all policies and procedures related to security at the department and org wide level and exercise a ‚Äòsecurity first‚Äô approach to how we design, build & run our products and services.   Sauce Labs is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity/expression/status, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status.  Please note our privacy terms when applying for a job at Sauce Labs.   #Remote #SauceEU

Title: Frontend Engineer
Description: Founded in late 2020 as a spin-off of the CISPA Helmholtz Center for Information Security, we strive totransfer research excellence to real-world products that support businesses and their surroundingecosystem in understanding their vulnerability to attacks. Our mission is to provide actionable insights tosecure your IT-infrastructure and protect our customer's business against attacks.   By combining OSINT and human ingenuity, our platform provides continuous monitoring of a company'sexternal assets, allowing to proactively secure their entire attack surface. We collect and consolidate thepublicly available information as observed from an attacker's perspective, prioritize them, and deliveractionable insights to reduce our customer's external attack surface. We are a young company created by agroup of security specialists and are at this point actively searching for and welcoming applications frommotivated new team members.   Aufgaben   As a frontend engineer, you are responsible for all design-relevant processes including the look & feel of our platform You will be a part of the product development team where you are going to create mockups and implement GUIs Help us to develop innovative and responsive UI/UX   Qualifikation   Modern Javascript (better Typescript) is a must HTML5/CSS is a must Modern frontend frameworks such as React, Angular or vue is a plus    Benefits    Flexible working hours, part-time possible Family-friendly company Competitive salary and innovative product Great international team with mixed industry & academic backgrounds Atmosphere of learning and growing Young company with a flat hierarchy and lots ofchances to get involved and have a say Tight connection to the world-class security research conducted at CISPA Helmholtz Center forInformation Security and Saarland Informatics Campus

Title: Flutter Developer
Description: Your Role  We are seeking ambitious, self-motivated engineers with experience in cross-platform mobile development (flutter,IOS, Android) to help us take Fastic to the next level. You should enjoy working in a fast paced fully remote  and a customer-oriented environment.    Responsibilities    Improving the customer experience by continuously implementing new features, optimising user flows, and increasing technical performance Be responsible for shipping cross-platform application for Android and iOS Use your experience in front-end technologies to identify frameworks, libraries, techniques and strategies to be used to build world class mobile apps Stay always up to date on Play/App store requirements and mobile application capabilities and trends to be able to help inform Product teams on possible roadmap features, including implementation breakdowns and prototypes Collaborate with our user experience (UX) team and our designers to identify and solve key usability challenges for multiple applications Develop integrations with various 3rd party tools and data platforms Actively work with our backend team to define and implement APIs and rule sets for data access Participate in code reviews with other team members    Essential Requirements    You have 3+ years of experience in building customer-facing applications You have 1+ years experience working with Flutter ‚Äì including BLoC pattern, animations and 3rd party library integration You have experience in publishing and managing mobile apps in the Apple App Store/Google Play Store You have experience with Firebase services like Auth, Analytics, Firestore, and Crashlytics You write well-structured, efficient and maintainable code and actively keep the quality of the code base in check You have a strong understanding of UI/UX principles and a critical, detail-oriented eye for design and mobile UIs You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills You have the ability to analyze problems and implement solutions that trade off architectural, usability, performance, reliability, scalability, level-of-effort, and time-to-market You have the ability to think/work creatively, independently and as part of a team You are passionate about continually up-skilling and learning new technologies You have strong verbal and written communication skills   Application Process   Screening Call - People and Culture Manager (30-45minutes) Technical Call - Lead Flutter Developer (30-45minutes) Technical Task - Home Assignment Final Interview - CTO (30 minutes)

Title: Javascript (Operations) Engineer
Description: Job Description  About Kisi  Kisi is a security platform with offices in Brooklyn and Stockholm and a global remote team spanning from America, Europe, Africa and Asia. We create hardware and software that helps businesses connect and control their spaces through the cloud.  A little bit more about our team:   We value being forward, human, trusted, and responsible. As a team, we make a tangible and lasting impact on the real world. Our productis an award-winning access control solution. We are a design focused company and recently won the coveted GOOD DESIGN award as well as the prestigious iF Design Award. Our customers and users come first - We are rated 4.9 in the and 4.8 on . Our team is unique (and a bit quirky) and diverse. We hail from 25 nationalities (& counting!) and look forward to our annual global meetup to bring the whole team together. We are building a supportive and flexible working environment by offering health & retirement benefits (location based), generous vacation time and daily challenges and growth.    About The Role  Kisi is looking for an Javascript Engineer to implement and connect all internal and external systems, data and tools. This role will be an integral part of our Marketing team while also working cross functionally to ensure a seamless connection across all departments. The ideal candidate comes from a strong tech background with a forward thinking and proactive approach to company processes and networks.   Responsibilities:   Oversee and execute internal network implementations for any new technology Collect data and provide feedback on procedures and processes Build custom tools both internally and externally to streamline departmental processes Contribute towards updates to the company website, helping the Marketing team improve and launch more pages Sync data between tools company wide to ensure maximum efficiency and minimize issues    Requirements  Requirements:   1-2 years of experience with technology integrations Experience with node.js, heroku, sanity.js, javascript and API‚Äôs preferred Proven success with introducing and implementing new tools and technologies Results driven with a knowledge of handling internal company processes

Title: Frontend Engineer (all genders) - MEAN Stack
Description: We at McMakler are disrupting dusty structures and merging tradition with innovation. Our goal is to establish the real estate market within the age of digitalization while enhancing quality and efficiency sustainably. With our all-in-one solution we are combining the latest technology with the individual service of classic brokers. As a PropTech Startup founded and based in Berlin we are working on the realization of our innovative business model. Around 600 employees at over 100 locations throughout Germany, Austria as well as France belong to our great and ambitious team.   Sounds great? Then join our McMakler family and become a part of our success story. Together we celebrate milestones while realizing our vision.   Tasks  We are looking for someone who takes pride in the craft and wants to be part of a team of talented engineers working to further McMakler's growth. You'll partner with engineering teams, product managers, analysts to design, build, and maintain our technology platform. Prior knowledge of the real estate industry is not required, but is a plus. We can teach you all you need to know.   Our current Tech-Stack:   JavaScript, TypeScript React, Angular 2 Material-UI GraphQL (MongoDB and gRPC) node.js, Golang Unit/e2e testing (Jest, Cypress) CI/CD Gitlab pipelines   Experience with some of these would be helpful. We'll teach you the rest!    Requirements    What Makes You a Great Fit?   5+ years as a MEAN stack developer, including NoSQL and JavaScript on client and server side Strong understanding of web browser technologies (semantic HTML, CSS, cross-browser compatibility, performance, responsive design) Professional experience designing and implementing web applications using RESTful APIs or GraphQL Have created multi-transactional and highly redundant systems from ideation to production Familiarity with Agile processes Experience with at least one cloud platform such as AWS, Azure, or GCP    Benefits    You will become part of a highly motivated and international team of development, user experience, marketing and operations experts Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, you have the option to work remotely (and may continue to do so after the pandemic is over) You gain the unique opportunity to experience and shape the setup of one of the fastest growing companies in Germany You will work with the latest technologies and have influence over technological decisions You can grow with a high degree of freedom

Title: Full Stack Web Developer in Robotics (m/f/d)
Description: We make controlling industrial robots as easy as using a smartphone. With the drag&bot no-code approach, you don't need extensive robot training or engineering background to use robots. Instead of replacing existing employees with automation, drag&bot qualifies them to become robot operators. This is how we help manufacturing companies to master the 4th industrial revolution!   Tasks   You are actively developing the web-based robot application "drag&bot" You extend the UI based on our roadmap and customer requirements You optimize the software for an outstanding user experience, functionality and elegance You work in the frontend with the Angular Framework and develop at the backend with Node.js and MongoDB You support the team in the implementation and iteration of project-related tasks    Requirements    You are enthusiastic about software and you have an eye for good design You hold an university degree in computer science, media sciences or engineering You have experience in the development of web applications and a secure handling of modern frameworks for GUIs and web frontends You are responsible, a team player and goal-oriented You have good knowledge of German and English    Benefits    You can start immediately Agile working method based on Scrum Exciting tasks with plenty of creative freedom in a dynamic start-up environment Homeoffice & flexible working hours in our Stuttgart office A motivating and open working atmosphere Flat hierarchies and short decision paths   Are you interested?  Send us your CV to via JOIN and tell us what are your interests, passions and which projects did you work. We are looking forward to your application!

Title: Software Engineer Digital Payment (m/f/d)
Description: In our office in Frankfurt, our technology addresses changes of the payment world. We provide reliable, secure and modern banking solutions and many more. To strengthen our team, we are looking for an experienced Software Engineer Digital Payment (m/f/d)  to start as soon as possible!   You are responsible for the development of innovative services in the payment and banking environment in direct coordination with our technical analysts, product managers and other stakeholders. Key tasks include the development of web-based front-end applications as well as the real-time integration of customer and Worldline services in international projects.   Your Tasks   You will assist in the validation of internal and external requirements. You will maintain a close and constructive collaboration with technical analysts and product managers. You will play a key role in the analysis, design and implementation of innovative software solutions in a service-oriented architecture. You will be central part of the local and global "Issuing Assets" department and responsible for the development and enhancement of the services and products you manage. You will support internal stakeholders with problems and advise on appropriate solutions.    Your Profile   You have a university degree in computer science, business information technology or close equivalent, or comparable vocational training with equivalent professional experience. Your quick comprehension, analytical thinking and structured approach will give you a good understanding of cross-system processes and their integration. You have experience developing object-oriented software systems on the Java EE platform and of the software development lifecycle. You have experience in the technologies Java EE, Web Services (Soap and Restful) and persistence frameworks and in conveying your solutions using UML. You have experience in responsive web UI development with Angular, Vu.js or equivalent frameworks. You have experience working service integration patterns and frameworks, for example Apache Camel. Thanks to your high sense of responsibility and motivation, you can meet your own very high quality standards. For you, working in a team is an important aspect of your working environment and essential aspect for learning new topics. You should have very good English and good German skills, both spoken and written.    What we offer:   A diversified and challenging job in exciting international projects A proactive interdisciplinary exchange with colleagues from other areas Numerous opportunities for further education and training programs Flexible working hours and remote work 30 days of vacation A friendly and welcoming work environment    Join us on the ride to the digital future!   Do you have any questions? Please feel free to contact Denis G√∂tze under +49-151-44-161-295

Title: Software Engineer at Wybe
Description: Wybe is looking for a Software Engineer ‚Äì based in Freiburg and surrounding area ‚Äì to help build the first social network that connects people in the real world, bridging the gap between online and offline world, and helping millions of users to shre what really matters: happiness. We're looking for makers with wide-ranging technical knowledge who thrive in leadership roles, but are not afraid to venture into the unknown and build features that defy and shape social norms.   The best candidates will have experience developing cross-platform mobile applications with Dart and Flutter, be proficient with Firebase and Firestore, and have successfully deployed and maintained apps on both iOS and Android.   Wybe's mission is to digitalize social life all around the world. As part of the team, you will work, do business, and have fun in technical hotspots everywhere, including, but not limited to, San Francisco, London, and Berlin.   Tasks   Build and maintain mobile application features, working with a Flutter frontend and Firebase backend Work with user interface designs to build rich, intuitive mobile user experiences Quickly test and iterate existing product features with the help of user insights Take ownership of features at a product level, and actively shape the direction of the company Lead future technical hires by building agile work flows, ensuring efficiency and accountability across the company    Requirements    Significant experience with Dart and Flutter Significant experience with Firebase Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to influence and lead cross-functional teams Comfortable working in a fast paced start-up environment Bonus: Experience wir ARCore Bonus: Experience with TensorFlow or other machine learning frameworks Bonus: An appreciation for behavioral psychology and social dynamics    Benefits    Competitive salary and meaningful equity: Seeing millions of people interacting with your technology every day, can be the most rewarding work you will ever do. Free travel: Full compensation of flights, food, and accommodation. Free selection of meals, drinks and snacks: No predetermined choices ‚Äì choose whatever helps you feel and perform best. Free gym membership and access to meditation classes: Choose where and how you want to unwind, stay fit, and relax. Parties, sports, movies, and more: What other people call leisure, you will call work. Take part in our mission to connect people, as we meet users at house parties, basketball matches, movie marathons, study sessions, and more.   If you are smart, driven, and dedicated to impact millions, we look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d) (Remote)
Description: At Yelp, it‚Äôs our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp‚Äôs unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and businesses around the globe, from a review of a coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.   The Data Science & Analytics team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp‚Äôs products and users. We are adept at tasks like modeling user preferences, inference from user and marketplace experiments, and generating insights about the health of local economies. With diverse backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.   This opportunity has the option to be fully remote throughout Germany.   We‚Äôd love to have you apply, even if you don‚Äôt feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we‚Äôre looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.    Where You Come In    Join a team of Data Scientists and Data Science Analysts that develop analytical frameworks and reliable measurement strategies for Yelp products. Design, execute, and analyze complex business and user experiments. Partner with other Data Scientists and Data Engineers to set the vision for and develop our experimentation platform. Devise and evaluate models for diverse business needs, such as identifying growth opportunities, estimating the impact of new features on our platforms, and personalizing the user experience. Proactively research and build ETL pipelines for product and marketplace metrics Communicate key insights from analyses, experiments and data products to stakeholders.    What It Takes To Succeed    MS/PhD in quantitative field and a few years of industry experience in a senior quantitative role. Ability to apply statistical, analytical and technical expertise to product and business problems. Prior experience structuring and leading impactful data science projects independently. Oral and written communication skills to mentor colleagues, and work effectively with partners on engineering, product and business teams. Expertise in SQL, and R or Python for data analysis and platform development. Enthusiasm for building a culture of learning and development.    What You'll Get    Full responsibility for projects from day one, a collaborative team, and a dynamic work environment. Competitive salary with equity in the company, a pension scheme, and an optional employee stock purchase plan. 30 days paid vacation per year plus one floating holiday. ‚Ç¨150 monthly reimbursement to help cover remote working expenses. ‚Ç¨89 caregiver reimbursement to support dependent care for families. Flexible working hours and meeting-free Wednesdays. Regular 3-day Hackathons, bi-weekly learning groups, and productivity spending to support and encourage your career growth. Opportunities to participate in digital events and conferences. Complementary elective German lessons for international employees. ‚Ç¨67 per month to use toward qualifying wellness expenses. Quarterly team offsites.   Yelp values diversity. We‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other protected status.  Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Full Stack Web Developer (m/f/d)
Description: At Bayer we‚Äôre visionaries, driven to solve the world‚Äôs toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none‚Äô is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We‚Äôre doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‚Äòimpossible‚Äô. There are so many reasons to join us. If you‚Äôre hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there‚Äôs only one choice.  Full Stack Web Developer (m/f/d)   Your Tasks And Responsibilities    You will lead the development of both, front-end applications and back-end services, which will support our IoT, computer vision, machine learning and big data activities Design and develop full stack web applications by evaluating, prototyping and implementing scalable solutions Work in a cross functional SCRUM team with end-to end-product responsibility Interact with a team of developers, data scientists, agronomists and engineers that solve real world problems in farming You will leverage a state-of-the-art technology stack and access to consultants, training and conferences to deepen your expertise, continuously develop your skills and leverage your knowledge for our products Ensure a fast delivery pipeline by following current practices of CI/CD Design and implement infrastructure as code, test automation, continuous integration, continuous delivery, and monitoring solutions following DevOps practices    Who You Are    Bachelor or Master of Science in Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics or related fields Working experience in developing full stack web applications with modern JavaScript frameworks (React preferred) including automation such as Grunt, Gulp, Brunch, etc. Experienced in developing REST APIs with Python, Java etc. and strong knowledge of standards like HTML5, CSS3, browser API's, OAuth and web security Experienced with SQL, relational and non-relational databases Experienced with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and serverless computing Experienced with DevOps practices and tools for continuous integration, test automation, continuous delivery and monitoring Experienced with software testing and practices like TDD, Unit-, End2End-testing and testing frameworks Very good English skills, both written and spoken   YOUR APPLICATION  This is your opportunity to tackle the world‚Äôs biggest challenges with us: Maintaining our health, feeding growing populations and slowing the rate of climate change. You have a voice, ideas and perspectives and we want to hear them. Because our success begins with you. Be part of something big. Be Bayer.   Bayer welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, union membership, religion, family status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or any unlawful criterion under applicable law. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.   Location:  Leverkusen   Division:  Crop Science   Reference Code:  539146

Title: Full Stack Software Engineer
Description: Our mission is to empower businesses to make data-driven decisions faster and more effortlessly than ever before. Therefore, we are building an advanced analytics platform to reason why key performance indicators (KPIs) change.   Our company is built at Merantix, a Venture Studio focussing on artificial intelligence. This means that we are part of an ecosystem of engaged employees who will help us along the way.   Tasks  As our Full Stack Software Engineer...   You shape the company and its vision from the ground up You develop frontend and backend applications which will be used within organizations of all sizes You architect and implement multi-tenancy You build reliable software with high quality and security standards You collaborate closely with our CTO and CEO to bridge the gap between the analytical core of our product and its user interface, as well as with our Design and Product Team    Requirements    We define ourselves by a culture of collaboration and ownership.   We‚Äôre looking for you, if...   You are an experienced Software Engineer and built applications in the past You mastered Typescript, Node.js and React for 2,5+ years You have gained knowledge in technologies and frameworks such as HTML/CSS, Next.js GraphQL, to name a few    Benefits    We invest in your personal growth  - learning & development budget will help you on your career path   We beliefe in trust and ownership  - flexible working hours, flat hierarchies as well as regular feedback are part of it   We live our values  - a dynamic, diverse and very motivated team which support and mentor each other   We promote our culture  - regular team events and intensive exchange with all Merantix companies   We offer a strong base  - drinks, snacks, muesli and fresh fruits at our office at the heart of Berlin

Title: Software engineer
Description: If you love technology and space, and want to know more about how the universe works, welcome to GMV! If you don't know us yet, we are an engineering and innovation company that works in different areas, one of them is space, where we participate in flight segment activities, satellite navigation, ground segment, data processing and space mission support among many others.   We are looking for a software developer for our activities in the areas of Space Surveillance and Tracking (SST) and Space Traffic Management (STM). We at GMV are leading the European activities in the domain of SST and STM, for national and pan-European clients. GMV engineers use cutting-edge technologies to develop the solutions of the future. We are looking for engineers who bring new ideas, new ways of working, and above all, passion for challenges. As an engineer, you will work on specific projects related to SST and STM with opportunities to switch team, location and project as GMV grows and evolves. Space Traffic Management (STM) is becoming a more and more relevant topic in the space sector due to the need to manage the traffic of the population of objects orbiting the Earth, both space debris and operational satellites. The environment in space is growing at an unprecedented rated and is expected to increase even more dramatically due to the launch of large constellations.   You will be part of our team, full of talent and desire to innovate, where you will:    Design and implementation of the web User Interface. Development of new functionalities in the backend for microservice based architecture, and designing of data models    DO YOU WANT TO BE PART OF OUR TEAM?  If you want this position to be yours, we would like you to have the following knowledge/experience:    C++, Java (Spring boot and Hibernate) Javascript (Typescript and React) PostgreSQL    Nice to have:    Aerospace engineering Orbital Mechanics Python Linux Docker    WHAT DO WE OFFER?   Join our GMV team and culture by entering into technological and innovative projects within multicultural and multidisciplinary teams. Professional career development and training plan. You will be able to acquire or perfect knowledge in the technologies we use as well as in skills. We also offer a language learning program. We are flexible! We have flexible hours and intensive working hours during the summer months. In addition, you can work from home to improve your work-life balance. We care about your well-being. You will have private health insurance with dental and accident insurance. You will be able to make part of your salary more flexible through our flexible salary plan where you will have several options such as restaurant tickets, childcare tickets, medical insurance for a family member.‚Ä¶ Join our team activities, events and sports competitions. No dress code! Be comfortable at work. Are you coming from another country? We offer you a relocation package. Do you want to switch off? You will find fruit and coffee at your disposal in our canteen. We promote equal opportunities in recruitment and we are a company committed to inclusion and diversity.    WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR?  If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact Pablo Dur√°n √Ålvarez  , in charge of this vacancy.   Pablo Dur√°n √Ålvarez

Title: Backend Software Engineer (f/m/x)
Description:
Here at üçã .markets while reading and thinking about how to make the best Job Description for a Software Engineer we got as bored as you of seeing the same generic and soulless text over and over again. Desired Skills and Experience

Title: Full Stack Developer (m/f/d)
Description: WILL YOU JOIN OUR TEAM?  In order to keep up with our rapid company growth, we are looking for a full stack developer (m/f/d) for our company‚Äôs headquarters in Munich.  Are you interested in working with a great team and would you like to help us grow our company?    YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES   Analyze client business needs and recommend innovative solutions that leverage technology to provide market differentiation, efficiency improvements, and better user experiences Developing, maintaining and testing high quality software products Provide technical assistance and support for incoming requests and issues related to web applications Troubleshoot client issues in web applications, mobile application, and in database Analyze and determine root cause of application issues    YOUR PROFILE   +3 years of application design & development experience Solid experience with OOP, PHP 7, HTML5/CSS3, Web Services, JSON, JavaScript/AJAX, jQuery Experience with one of the following technologies ‚Äì Laravel, Symfony, Lumen is required Good knowledge of the LAMP stack (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP) Git experience (e.g. GitLab, GitHub, BitBucket) Basic Linux OS knowledge Good level in spoken and written English Good knowledge of MVC architecture is mandatory Familiarity with Agile development and tools, such as Jira    IT WOULD BE AWESOME, IF YOU ALSO HAVE   Experience with Vue.JS Experience with resource availability projects Experience with Docker Familiarity with databases and data modeling/design techniques; data interface protocols; database software installation; database tuning; proven experience with distributed caching systems such as: Redis / Memcached proven experience with distributed queue system (Redis) working with complex architectured software solutions    WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US   Challenging and inspiring work environment with a lot of opportunity to initiate your own projects. Title: Fullstack Developer (m/f/d)
Description: Koch Media GmbH - Munich   Koch Media is an international media company with more than 2000 employees worldwide. As a leading and independent producer and marketer of digital entertainment products in Europe and the USA, our business areas include the production of films and games, the purchase and sale of film license rights, the distribution of digital media products and games publishing under the Deep Silver label.   In order to address new challenges in the Internal Software Development, we are looking for an experienced Fullstack Developer (m/f/d)  who can help us with the implementation of new services and improve the workflow and capabilities of all departments. Be in charge of new services for internal purposes and participate in leveraging Koch Media to the next level of business. The broad range of competencies in the company extends the software domains from game backends and developers‚Äô requirements to business-driven web applications and intra-net extensions in an international environment. Our agile structure allows the use of the latest technologies and patterns with plenty of scope to try out something new or to apply proven concepts.   Your Tasks   Develop microservices with the focus on Product Information Management Implement appealing frontends with respect to usability and functionality Interface with existing systems and integrate new services into our ecosystem Participate in architectural decisions for new software systems Keep track of the project and coordinate individual development steps Make use of modern tools and implement newest technologies Be part of an agile team and foster DevOps thinking    Your Profile   3+ years of work experience in a relevant field Experience in developing web applications Proficiency in a web programming language (preferably JavaScript / TypeScript) Familiarity with modern frontend frameworks (preferably Angular) Familiarity with microservices and database access (e.g. Node.js, Express) Working knowledge of CI/CD systems (e.g. Git, Jenkins, Containerization, Kubernetes) a plus Knowledge of message queues and databases a plus (e.g. NATS, MongoDB) Flexibility and enthusiasm for changing projects Fluent level of English is required (written and verbal), German is an advantage    What we offer   Employment in one of the most exciting industries in the world: the film and games industry Partnership-oriented working atmosphere in a modern and broad-based media company Wide range of training and development opportunities as part of our Koch Media Academy Company benefits such as employee events, fitness cooperation with Urban Sports, bicycle leasing, flexible working hours, 30 days vacation, company pension plan, free drinks, fresh fruit, etc. Opportunity to share your passion for movies and games with colleagues    Do you want to be part of our success story? We look forward to receiving your application!  The more comprehensive your documents are to us, the better we can get a picture of you. You should upload at least one cover letter and your CV. Please prefer to use our online application form. If you have any further questions, please send an e-mail to jobs@kochmedia.com.   Koch Media GmbH - Lochhamer Str. 9 - 82152 Planegg - www.kochmedia.de

Title: Full Stack Engineer (m/f/d) - React/Typescript/Node.js/AWS/Serverless
Description: Are you ready to be a technology leader in the SaaS space? Join epilot!    epilot is building a SaaS product to sell complex products online, focusing first on solving ecommerce in the rapidly transforming energy market. Our mission: Make selling complex products as easy as selling a pair of shoes online.  As Software Engineer at epilot you will be a driving force in shaping this mission. What makes working as a Software Engineer at epilot so special? Our unique engineering culture is defined by a few core engineering principles:  Among others, you can expect freedom and responsibilitybecause we hire smart people who we can trust. We operate by principles and expect our teams to cultivate a strategic mindset.  We believe in ownership: you build it, you run it. We subscribe to this core principle of the DevOps movement. There is no dedicated Ops team who you can pass on the responsibility to take your code and make sure it runs reliably and scales to customers‚Äô needs.  You should always show, don‚Äôt tell: Deliver working software early and frequently. We believe in the basic Agile principle of ‚ÄúRelease early and release often‚Äù. This approach helps us manage risk and make better decisions by creating fast feedback loops between ourselves and our users.  We design software APIFirst. Before we write a single line of code, we design the APIs of a service in a way that any other team, whether internal to epilot or external, can use the APIs interface with our service without prior knowledge.    Does this sound like an environment you want to work in? Then you could bet the right person to be an engineer at epilot!    Check out our promise to you: promise.epilot.cloud    We "epilots" are a team of experts from the fields of software development, energy management, product management and sales. In order to bring our solution even faster to the top in the energy world, we are looking for you as a Full Stack Engineer (m/f/d).     What awaits you   You‚Äôll get familiar with our tech stack with microfrontends, serverless AWS and best-in-class developer tooling & automation. More info about our stack: https://docs.epilot.io/docs/architecture/overview/#tech-stack You are part of an agile cross-functional team of full-stack, backend and frontend developers, as well as designers and product managers who are growing together and helping one another You will participate in exciting and diverse development projects using agile methods and the chance to pair and collaborate You will coach others to learn more as well as be constantly learning new technologies yourself. In close collaboration with our product management and design teams, you deliver end to end features for our users You will not only help us to put our product vision into practice, but you will also play an active role in shaping it.     What you bring   Ideally you have experience with React or other JavaScript frameworks Experience crafting and implementing RESTful micro-services or GraphQL Understanding of SaaS, PaaS, IaaS industry with hands on experience with public OR private cloud offerings (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) You are familiar with microservices based architecture patterns Experience in taking ownership of features, with a team on short and long-running projects Practical knowledge of agile software development methodologies (e.g.,scrum, XP) You think like an entrepreneur - you understand our business goals and how your daily decisions influence them. You don't see problems as a problem, but as a great opportunity for you personally, your team and epilot. You are a doer and have a strong Do-IT mentality. You make quick, smart decisions and weigh the risk intelligently. You are a TEAM player, motivating and inspiring your colleagues.     What we offer you   The opportunity to help building the most successful SaaS platform in the energy market. Start-up mentality: dynamic atmosphere and great team spirit. To lead a broader product management team in the future, to help shape our PM culture, and to have a decisive influence on our product direction. A rapidly growing company with an open communication culture, motivated colleagues and an international corporate culture. Exponential learning curve - epilot is growing rapidly and we expect the same from you. You never stand still, you are permanently challenged, you learn from your mistakes a la Fail Fast and Often. A central location in the heart of Cologne with cool cafes around the corner (But of course full remote jobs are also available). Performance is rewarded with us - We take your desired salary seriously and talk openly about it with you. Transparency - We maintain a very flat and open corporate culture, everything is visible and open for discussion. Regular epilot summits @ our HQ in Cologne where all employees from around the world come together to have fun and catch up. Coffee, cold drinks, fruits and much appreciation.    We are looking forward to your application!

und Tools f√ºr CI/ CD, Testautomatisierung und Monitoring Erfahrung mit Software-Tests und Praktiken wie TDD, Unit-, End2End-Tests und Test-Frameworks Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse, sowohl in Wort als auch in Schrift   IHRE BEWERBUNG  Dies ist Ihre Chance, sich mit uns gemeinsam den gr√∂√üten globalen Herausforderungen unserer Zeit zu stellen: die Gesundheit der Menschen zu erhalten, die wachsende Weltbev√∂lkerung zu ern√§hren und den Klimawandel zu verlangsamen. Sie haben eine Stimme, Ideen und Perspektiven, die wir h√∂ren m√∂chten. Denn unser Erfolg beginnt mit Ihnen. Seien Sie dabei!   Bayer begr√º√üt Bewerbungen aller Menschen ungeachtet von ethnischer Herkunft, nationaler Herkunft, Geschlecht, Alter, k√∂rperlichen Merkmalen, sozialer Herkunft, Behinderung, Mitgliedschaft in einer Gewerkschaft, Religion, Familienstand, Schwangerschaft, sexueller Orientierung, Geschlechtsidentit√§t oder einem anderen sachfremden Kriterium nach geltendem Recht. Wir bekennen uns zu dem Grundsatz, alle Bewerberinnen und Bewerber fair zu behandeln und Benachteiligungen zu vermeiden.   Standort:  Leverkusen   Division:  Crop Science   Referenzcode:  539146

Title: Frontend Developer (f/m/x) ‚Äì SaaS Web Applications
Location: Cologne Bonn Region, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany
Description: If (  ‚¨ú   // I want to contribute to a product with impact.    &&  ‚¨ú   // I love step-debugging client-side code.    &&  ‚¨ú   // I draw joy from releasing code to users.    \== true) keep_reading() else throw(exception);  We are looking for naturally agile problem solvers to join our team and help us bring our startup to the next level!   We need a highly skilled Frontend Developer to enhance our product engineering team with hands-on experience and best practices from the world of web application development. This role would involve implementing changes and enhancements to our frontend web applications in the form of user stories, non-functional requirements and bug reports. Currently, our web application portfolio consists of a Multi-tenant Content Management System and an Admin Panel.   Tech stack excerpt: TypeScript, ReactJS, Redux, Firebase, ExpressJS, Flutter Mobile, Infrastructure on AWS, no Google Sheets: I promise   Our methodologies: GitLab flow, Merge Request Reviews, git push -f, Pair Programming, best of Scrum, Kanban and Shape Up,   Our tools: Gitlab, Right-click > Inspect, Slack, notion, Google Workplaces, maxed out MacBook Pro (M1) or a similar renewed every 24-months.   At how.fm, we are a small ‚Äì and experienced ‚Äì team of long-time colleagues and friends. We have made it our purpose to give everyone a fair chance to learn no matter their background. To achieve this we are on a mission to train 1 million deskless workers across the world in their own language. And that is just the beginning!   We have a modern office in Cologne, though we primarily work remotely and encourage all our team to work where it suits them. At least once a month we have workshops or events where we meet as a team in Cologne. So even if we don't have to commute every day, it is important that you are able to do so regularly.   Tasks  YOUR EVERYDAY ACTIVITIES  Your mission is to be a major contributor to how.fm‚Äôs web applications as we continue to lift the whole system to a higher state of enterprise readiness.   Participating in all stages of the agile software delivery lifecycle: Planning meetings, story writing, solution design, design workshops, kanban board, retrospectives. Make and implement user interface and interaction design decisions. Undergo and execute merge request reviews ‚Äì also outside of web frontend code. Collaboratively decide on used programming languages and frameworks to solve problems. Independently maintaining software documentation, automated tests, deployments, and reliability measures. Proactively drive improvements to the underlying code-base with experience, as well as research of best practices to improve certain system quality attributes, reduce technical debt and enable contribution from less experienced web engineers. Collaboratively make architectural decisions, make plans, and implement them. Rethink deployment and distribution of how.fm Web Applications and drive improvements. Ensure uptime and reliability of deployed services via effective logging, monitoring, and other DevOps practices.    Requirements    YOU WILL NEED   Around 5 years or more of relevant work experience in a software team following lean & agile methodologies. Innate orientation towards user, customer and business value. Thorough knowledge of software architecture fundamentals. Either native English or German language ability, with at least excellent English skills, both written and spoken. Any other language is a plus ‚Äì even programming languages. Proven intercultural competence including excellent written and verbal communication for collaboration in a remote-first environment. High-quality software engineering skills including: TypeScript, ReactJS with Redux and responsive HTML and CSS Engineering of SaaS, CMS or B2B Platforms DevOps: Automation, packaging, deployment & monitoring Test automation with Unit Tests and E2E Tests Along with a growth mindset for other technologies.    Benefits    Depending on experience & expertise the salary range for this position is between EUR 60K and EUR 80K gross per annum.   You are a how.fm fit and a fit for this role if you identify with the following:   We are humble and goal-oriented: there are a lot of things that we still don't know, but we always want to know why we are working on a specific project. We work with a lean approach on a path guided by the Kaizen philosophy. Make a plan, try it out early, fail, improve it and eliminate waste. We embrace change and adapt when our mission and team need it. We are always there for each other, like in a tribe, we know that together we are better.   If you want to know more about our team and how we work visit: www.how.fm/family.   If you like what you read and want to join us or want to apply and ask us more about the position, go ahead!   We are looking forward to hearing from you :)

Title: FrontEnd Developer (Remote)
Description: #WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We‚Äôre looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.    About The Role    We‚Äôre building a welcoming & flexible team that prizes collaboration over competition, one which provides opportunities to learn new skills, mentor junior developers and contribute to the direction of both the team and the products we‚Äôre responsible for. This is a high trust environment where we allow team members to manage their own time, take holidays as they need it and reward them with competitive salaries and equity.   Our stack is EmberJS, but if you've used frameworks like React, Angular or Vue then you're just the kind of person we're looking for and we'll help get you up to speed.  EmberJS is a productive, battle-tested JavaScript framework for building modern web applications. It includes everything you need to build rich UIs that work on any device.   CrowdStrike is a staunch supporter of the emberJS community. Many of our engineers actively contribute to the development of the EmberJS framework and even attend/present at Ember conferences across the globe.   As we support only evergreen browsers we can push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible on the web as a platform, on top of a system that strips any hyperbole from the term ‚Äúbig data‚Äù. In close collaboration with analysts & clients, you‚Äôll get to see the apps & visualisations you‚Äôre building used every day to hunt for hackers and protect systems.   Our ideal candidates are sensitive to the needs of the users of their software & love learning more about their tools every day.  The candidate will join the Intel Product Group. We are an internal engineering department that develops and maintains internal and external-facing tools to support analyst and customer efforts to identify, mitigate, and secure against breaches.    Find Out More About Our Threat Intelligence Products    Falcon X Recon - https://www.crowdstrike.com/products/threat-intelligence/falcon-x-recon/ Falcon X Threat Intelligence - https://www.crowdstrike.com/endpoint-security-products/falcon-x-threat-intelligence/    We Invite You To    Find out why you should join CrowdStrike recognised as a pre-eminent market and technology leader in cybersecurity - https://bit.ly/3GMSqll Find out how is it to have Autonomy, Mastery & Purpose - https://bit.ly/3qPh38T Work with Better Tech & Have a Bigger Mission - https://bit.ly/3c92J73 Meet our Engineers - www.youtube.com/watch?v=910FGi7VSWU Meet virtually CrowdStrike's Romania Team - http://y2u.be/gGPjGsr5Kw4    You Will    Work as part of an Agile Scrum engineering team to implement user interface designs and functionality based upon clearly defined and agreed project requirements. Take an active role in defining and refining project requirements. From concept to completion, our engineers are involved in every step. Be empowered to own your workload and tasks. You set your own pace and tell us what can be delivered, not the other way round. Write unit and integration tests to ensure our code is of the highest quality. We take the time to test our code against pre-defined acceptance criteria. Engage with other engineers to review each other's code. We encourage collaboration, communication and knowledge sharing. Liaise with our Quality and Accessibility Analysts to fix issues and improve our code. We want you to take pride in the final product. Help steer our development process through regular feedback and review sessions. We value your feedback and we want to create processes that enable you.    You‚Äôll Need    Strong skills in front-end development A deep understanding of JavaScript and considerable experience building thick-client applications with modern frameworks such as Ember, Angular, Vue, Backbone or React A desire to collaborate closely with users, designers, & testers to deliver quality software that solves problems Experience with testing frameworks, tools and methodologies such as Jtest, QUnit, Mocha & Selenium Comfortable with Agile Scrum and Kanban processes    Nice To Have Skills    Functional knowledge & interest in developing genuinely accessible interfaces Strong HTML & CSS skills, with bonus points for experience with animation, knowledge of approaches to scalable/modular CSS, and preprocessors such as SCSS & LESS Familiarity with client-side build processes & tools - Grunt, Gulp, Ember CLI etc. Experience creating or contributing to open source projects Experience with graphics & visualisation tools such as D3 or ThreeJS Interest and experience with design & data visualisation    Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike    Remote-first culture Market leader in compensation and equity awards Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits Physical and mental wellness programs Paid parental leave, including adoption A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration   We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve.   CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Title: Junior Software Entwickler UI5 / Fiori (w/m/d)
Description: Capgemini ist einer der weltweit f√ºhrenden Anbieter von Management- und IT-Beratung, digitaler Transformation sowie Technologie- und Ingenieursdienstleistungen. Deine Benefits   Flexible Arbeitszeit- und Auszeitmodelle Mobiles Arbeiten ‚Äì auch hybrid von Zuhause aus Jobfahrrad-Programm Vielf√§ltiges Weiterbildungsangebot und ein internationales Netzwerk Familienservice ‚Äì auf die individuellen Bed√ºrfnisse zugeschnittene L√∂sungen Deferred Compensation ‚Äì im Ernstfall und im Alter gut abgesichert Verl√§ngerte Entgeltfortzahlung ‚Äì materielle Sicherheit im Falle einer ernsthaften Erkrankung Gesundheitsangebote Attraktiver Arbeitsplatz f√ºr Menschen mit Behinderungen Work-life-balance Mitarbeiterrabatte Und viele weitere    Bewirb dich jetzt   Get the future you want ‚Äì Bewirb dich direkt √ºber den Bewerben-Button. Bei Fragen steht dir Isabell Wollenweber  unter career.de@capgemini.com zur Seite.   Diese Anzeige ist online, solange die Stelle verf√ºgbar ist. Bitte habe Verst√§ndnis, dass wir keine postalischen Bewerbungen ber√ºcksichtigen und Originalunterlagen nicht zur√ºckgeschickt werden k√∂nnen.   Capgemini lebt Vielfalt am Arbeitsplatz. Diversit√§t sorgt in unserem Unternehmen f√ºr Inspiration und Innovation. Wir freuen uns besonders √ºber Bewerbungen von qualifizierten Talenten, unabh√§ngig von Herkunft, Nationalit√§t, Geschlecht, Hautfarbe, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion, Alter, Behinderung, sexueller Orientierung und Lebensphase.   Erfahre hier mehr zu unserem Bewerbungsprozess und erhalte Tipps f√ºr deine Bewerbung. Steig jetzt bei Capgemini ein und profitiere von unseren zahlreichen Benefits. Mehr Informationen zu den IT-Berufsfeldern bei Capgemini und unseren Standorten in Deutschland findest du auf unserer Karriereseite: capgemini.de/karriere   Informiere dich auf glassdoor und kununu, wie unsere Mitarbeiter*innen Capgemini als Arbeitgeber bewerten.

Title: Frontend Engineer (f/m/d)
Description: tokenstreet - enable access to world-class investments  We are tokenstreet and we aim for nothing less than enabling equal opportunities in the capital market and open up top-tier investments for everyone.   How do we do that? As a D2C Asset Management Platform (App) we want to start by making venture capital funds accessible accessible to everyone - simple and straightforward. Next steps will be private equity, real estate investments and more.   Tasks   Build our investment platform and new features such as reference accounts, savings plans, or secondary market trading functionalities Build a cross-platform mobile App with React Native Develop a well tested and clean application    Requirements    3+ years of working experience with React/React Native Experience with TypeScript would be a big plus You are confident in using Git on a daily basis CSS doesn't scare you, and you know what flexbox is Working with testing frameworks like Jest or the React Testing Library is not new to you You are able to use REST-based backend services You have the motivation to constantly learn something new You have an urge to improve and optimize code permanently You have a feeling for good / bad user experience An eye for details (including potential challenges) when implementing design specifications You are fluent in German and English    Benefits    To work on an absolutely hot topic Join an amazingly passionate team Competitive salary based on experience Beautiful office (coming soon - currently in Factory GP)   Know someone for whom this might be interesting. Forward them to us and receive a ‚Ç¨1500 referral fee upon successful hire.  We are looking forward to your application! üòä   Stay safe and all the best from your tokenstreet Team!
