Title: Frontend Developer (m/f/d)
Description: About Bookingkit     bookingkit  is a growing company and already we are Europe‚Äôs leading booking and reservation management software for tours and activity providers. Our 2025 strategy is set in stone and we have challenged ourselves to digitise and revolutionise the Tours, Activities & Attractions market directly.   We need YOU, to propel us in this journey as we #trust in you and your ambition to be one of us. In return, we give you transparency and ownership so that you #grow with us and we rely on each other for the success of bookingkit  .   At bookingkit  , we believe experiences arise from the community. This is why we work together as a group of currently 80 people with diverse backgrounds - sharing our common goal of creating an environment for every team member to grow as an individual and professional. #bookingkindness   Too hard to believe? Check our Kununu ratings Or Glassdoor   Our Vision and Mission  We already know where we want to be in 3 years and the impact we want to have in 10 years, bookingkit  vision is to create a world where our technology makes operating and marketing experiences easy and fun, along with the mission of making bookingkit  the most integrated booking technology for professional European attractions.   We are looking for you as a Frontend Developer (Vue.js) (m/f/d).  You will be reporting to Maciej Ple≈õnar   Your Day-to-Day Working With Us In This Role   You build beautiful, usable, and high-performing single-page applications in the Vue.js framework and other frontend technologies. As part of a Scrum team, by working together with other engineers, you deliver sprint goals. You collaborate with product managers and product designers to conceptualize and design innovative and scalable software for our customers. You care about the quality of the product and the code by following good practices and design patterns, using TDD and BDD techniques, performing code reviews, and collaborating with QA engineers. You act as a real craftsman, you pay attention to details and enjoy writing a clean, maintainable code.   We Are Match, If   Frontend Engineering Skills    You are a front-end developer experienced in JavaScript and familiar with modern JavaScript frameworks (Vue.js / React / Angular ‚Ä¶)    Engineering Experience    You have a minimum of 3 years of commercial experience in building modern single-page applications.   Patterns and standards  You are familiar with modern patterns, standards, and principles that allow you to write a clean code.   Quality  You use testing frameworks, linters, and the TDD approach to achieve a good quality of the code.   Collaboration  You have advanced knowledge of GIT and repository flows, which allows you to work efficiently with other engineers.   Extra Awesome, If  Cyperess.io  You are familiar with Cypress.io end-to-end testing framework.   DevOps  You know how to build pipelines for continuous integration and continuous delivery, especially with GitLab.   Web applications  You know how modern web applications are designed and implemented also on the backend side.   Our team setup  Head of Technology leading 3 Scrum teams with 13 engineers in Software Engineering and 3 in Product Development.    Perks And Benefits    Flexible Work Time: Our teams have a hybrid work model to spend some time in our freshly renovated office in Berlin or working from home. Some teams even have remote-first, working mostly from home. Our goal is always to find a perfect individual work-life-balance for all bookingkids. Annual Private Travel Subsidy: We are part of the tourism, events, and travel industry - so obviously travel is great! Even in our current times we subsidise private travel with up to 150‚Ç¨ annually per bookingkid. Public Transportation Subsidy: We subsidise public transportation cost in EU countries with a flat fee. Depending on location this can be up to 50% of the total transportation cost. Extra Charity Day: We love when bookingkids are involved in charity work. We support you with one extra day of leave for charity work. Gym Subsidy: We subsidise Urban Sports Club memberships to stay active and fit for bookingkids in Germany. Team Events: Our bookingkit BBQ in Berlin is a tradition that we are happy we can now offer again. It‚Äôs just great to meet in person. Beyond our regular BBQ we have summer and winter events to meet in person. Corporate Discounts: We take part in company discount programs with partners and other startups.   Our Interview Process   People And Culture Screening Call (30 minutes) Hiring Manager Interview (45 minutes) Technical Screening (60 Minutes) Meet The Team (30 minutes)__

Title: Full Stack Developer (f/m/d)
Description: About Us    We are Cosuno, one of the fastest growing start-ups in Germany. We are all about the digitalisation of the construction industry. With our innovative tendering software, we are currently turning the market upside down and setting new standards in process management, cloud technology and user-centric design. Together, we are building the world's largest tendering platform, which is already being used by the industry giants of construction companies and project developers in the DACH region. We are supported by the who-is-who of construction and VC investors, such as Spark Capital, Cherry Ventures, PERI and the SIGNA Group.   Our success is due to our unique and talented employees who work with power and passion on our common mission. We believe in diversity as a driver for good decisions and the basis for great teams. We are committed to equal opportunities and to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We welcome applications from individuals of all ethnicities, religions, marital statuses, ages, nationalities, origins, sexual orientations, gender identities or any other form of diversity.   As a part of Cosuno you will be working with enthusiastic, skilled and ambitious people, shaping tomorrow‚Äôs construction industry. Come build the future with us!   Technology at Cosuno  At Cosuno, we use React in the frontend and Node.js in the backend. Our entire codebase is written in TypeScript. Our API is based on GraphQL and we use Prisma for communicating with the database. We use relational databases as well as Elasticsearch. We write comprehensive end-to-end tests using Cypress in addition to unit tests. Our infrastructure is based on AWS and Kubernetes. For monitoring, we use tools like Datadog and Sentry. We have a well-functioning CI/CD pipeline and deploy to production multiple times a week.   Tasks  __As a full stack developer, you will work on the frontend as well as the backend side of our product and therefore will take full ownership over the features you are creating. After you develop a comprehensive understanding of the components of our product, you are given full responsibility to extend them and build on them in ways that makes our product more valuable, more reliable and better structured to ensure future maintainability.   Specifically, we have a frontend based on React and a backend written in Node.js. They interface with each other using GraphQL and Apollo. We utilize TypeScript for the entire codebase to improve code quality and reliability. We use relational databases as well as Elasticsearch. We write comprehensive end-to-end tests using Cypress in addition to unit tests. Our infrastructure is based on AWS and Kubernetes. We have a well-functioning CI/CD pipeline and deploy to production multiple times a day.    Qualifications    At least 3 years of hands-on software engineering experience Substantial experience working with React and Node.js Profound experience with JavaScript and familiarity with TypeScript Generalist mindset; eagerness to learn about new technologies and tackle unfamiliar problems Experience in agile product teams as a contributor Startup mindset and pragmatic, hands-on attitude Fluency in English and good communication skills    Benefits    Shape a product that solves real-life problems in the construction industry. Work in an open-minded, collaborative, dynamic, and international team. Personal training budget of 2,000 EUR and extra training days. Work fully remote or from our offices in Berlin or Amsterdam. Be your own manager. Freedom in your working hours. It‚Äôs the results that count. Company offsites and regular team events (offline and online). Competitive compensation, a permanent contract, and modern work equipment. Open feedback culture with regular 1-on-1s and development calls.   We believe that maintaining the highest engineering standards and using modern technologies are critical factors for the success of our product. If you have a similar mindset, we are looking forward to your application!__

Title: Typescript Engineer
Description: Typescript Engineer     Location: Fully Remote (in Germany)     Salary: ‚Ç¨60,000 - ‚Ç¨85,000     Start Date: ASAP    Even a really big fish might be hard to spot in a big enough pond.    And it can sometimes feel that way when you‚Äôre doing a great job for a massive company. You have great ideas and initiative, but still struggle to be heard.    But in a start-up things could be very different. You‚Äôll have your say and make an impact from day one.       What you will bring...   A highly motivated can- do attitude, who wants to make a difference and work on challenging software projects 3+ years experience building modern web applications Solid experience working with: React, Angular, Vue, TypeScript and JavaScript frameworks Great communication skills with ability to work in cross-functional teams Great self-organisation and interest in taking on responsibility at an early stage     What you will be doing.,.,   Collaborate with agile teams and act as the ''go-to guy'' for your colleagues and clients Create, maintain and operate service from end to end that interact with the platform Influence analysis, architecture, deployment, monitoring, security and every other aspect of the software life-cycle Analyse and optimize the existing platform Develop innovate and scale solutions based business challenges     Company perks...   Learn from an experienced, talented, and motivated group of individuals Join a supportive working team environment with international talent A work atmosphere that believes in open doors and a flat hierarchy 100% remote work - with flexible working hours Continuous education and access to self-study modules     BC- TE-P

Title: Frontend Software Engineer - React
Description: Tasks   The opportunity to take on responsibility for your frontend projects. You will have an active role in the structuring and implementation of frontend projects. In your first month, you will be familiarized with our team and have already resolved some bugs and small requests. Your code has gone live multiple times in the first month. In the following months, your knowledge of our codebase has drastically increased and you are offering your help in fundamental software architecture decisions. You also feel confident enough to suggest improvement to the team's workflow when you see it doesn't work. At the end of your first year, you have successfully contributed to a wide range of projects, even spanning across multiple elements of our system, from backend to mobile. You have established yourself as a self starter and clearly spoken member of our team.    Requirements    Solid development background (3+ years) in frontend development, preferably professional experience working with React. Ideally you have experience in other areas of software development outside of frontend development (backend, frontend, infrastructure, etc.) You can comfortably propose technical solutions to business problems and clearly communicate them to your colleagues. With Sauce, developers are free to innovate and accelerate their software development cycles, improve quality, deploy with confidence and reduce costs. Our automated testing cloud gives our customers the ability to deliver a flawless digital experience to their customers by ensuring the web and mobile applications people use every day work on any browser or device. We call that automated testing, but you‚Äôll probably just call it awesome!    The Role    You will contribute to the design and implementation of our user interface, i.e. the web console. You will have a chance to work directly with our end-users, engineers and leads from leading technology companies. You will collaborate with the rest of the engineering team, including our SDK, systems, and toolchain engineers, to bring a differentiated engineering-centric solution to market. Our UI is built in a cutting-edge front-end technology (ReasonReact). This position leans heavily toward UI work, but would include the opportunity to also work on our service APIs. The position is remote and our engineering team is distributed across the globe.    Key Responsibilities    Implement new features using of our apis Iterate with product managers & users to continuously improve our UX    Job Requirements    3+ years of frontend engineering experience. Fluency using Javascript, HTML/CSS, ReactJS, git    Nice To Have    Experience in React/ReasonML    Security Responsibilities At Sauce    At Sauce, we will commit to supporting the health and safety of employees and properties, partnering with internal stakeholders to learn and act on ever-evolving security protocols and procedures. You‚Äôll be expected to fully comply with all policies and procedures related to security at the department and org wide level and exercise a ‚Äòsecurity first‚Äô approach to how we design, build & run our products and services.   Sauce Labs is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity/expression/status, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status.  Please note our privacy terms when applying for a job at Sauce Labs.   #Remote #SauceEU

Title: Frontend Engineer (Angular) - Hamburg, London, Zurich
Description: At Pexapark, we are passionate about the growth of green energy to create a more sustainable world. Our vision is to become the operating system for buying, selling, and managing renewable energy. We work towards creating an efficient market for renewable energy to attract more investment capital and lower the transaction costs so that companies can attain their net-zero targets faster, and accelerate the buildout of renewable energy towards a more sustainable world.   At Pexapark, we are passionate about the growth of green energy to create a more sustainable world. Our vision is to become the operating system for buying, selling, and managing renewable energy. We work towards creating an efficient market for renewable energy to attract more investment capital and lower the transaction costs so that companies can attain their net-zero targets faster, and accelerate the buildout of renewable energy towards a more sustainable world.   If you share our vision and want to make a lasting impact on the way the renewable industry works and support the decarbonization of our planet, we want to hear from you!   Tasks  As a Frontend Engineer at Pexapark, you join our effort to build the software suite that acts as the new Operating System for renewable energy companies. Our suite covers the full spectrum from sourcing, negotiating and closing PPA transactions to monitoring entire portfolios of renewable energy assets in terms of revenue and risk.   You will analyze, design and implement features to extend product functionality, as well as continuously work on reducing technical debt and improving the development process. You will work in a cross-functional team located in Zurich, London, Hamburg, and Lviv.    Requirements    WHAT MAKES YOU A GOOD FIT   Solid development experience with a modern frontend stack of 3+ years Strong Experience in HTML5 and CSS3 Strong Experience in ES6+ (TypeScript is a plus) Experience in Angular (or React, Vue or similar) Strong UI styling skills Familiarity with CSS Preprocessors (SASS, LESS etc.) Experience with backend technologies (preferably Java) is a plus, but entirely optional    What You Can Expect From Your Fellow Pexans    Respect and appreciation of others Curiosity and a strong learning mindset Self-drive and willingness to achieve the goals you set yourself, even if it‚Äôs hard You‚Äôre proactive, and you share your ideas Ambition to deliver high-quality code and make sure it works exceptionally well Good communication skills in English A high degree of self-motivation Strong analytical skills and ability to solve complex tasks Be willing to travel between our locations occasionally Team player who enjoys working with others A good sense of humor    Benefits    A start-up culture with flat hierarchy and no bureaucracy We use state-of-the-art infrastructure and technologies to build our products International team, working together with colleagues from across Europe Highly flexible work environment ‚Äì both in terms of time and location We want you to continuously learn and grow Free choice of state-of-the-art developer machine (MacOS, Windows or Linux) 25 workdays paid vacation, paid sick leaves   Are you ready to apply for your professional future at Pexapark? Don't hesitate and send through your application - we're looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Software Engineer Web (m/w/d)

As universal multi-carrier pick-up points, PaketConcierges accept all packages of registered consumers, regardless of where or what is ordered and which carrier handles the delivery. Our iterative approach and release pipeline enables us to move quickly and react to consumer feedback. Title: Frontend Developer
Description: üöÄ Our mission  At crowd, we‚Äôre on the mission to build the software stack for the era of community-driven companies.   From open source software over web3 to productivity tools: community is moving into the center of business. In 2022, 87% of companies investing in community agreed that community is critical to their business success [CMX Report]. But building a strong community is hard. Organizations have to continuously find community members and maintain a high engagement among them. Once a community is thriving, organizations are stuck managing endless tools, working with incomplete data, and failing to bring the return of community back to their business.   We want to solve these problems for all organizations that put community-first - be it startups, DAOs, or enterprises. Our ambition is to make community building more accessible and enjoyable, letting people focus on what they can do best: building relationships with other people.   ‚Äç    ü¶∏ About This Role    This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in the frontend development of an application built for developers, using a modern state-of-the-art tech stack. You will work closely with the whole team, including the co-founder and CTO, and take a critical role in developing exciting community-focused products. You would build features for both community professionals and community members, and have a high impact on UI and UX of the application. Furthermore, we are big believers in the power of open-source and are taking big steps toward opening our code base. You will have the chance to help open sourcing and maintaining an already existing code base.   ‚Äç   ‚öôÔ∏è Tech stack  We are using a modern and light-weight tech-stack to yield an enjoyable and productive development experience.   We use Vue.js for frontend development, together with Tailwind CSS and Element UI for styling. The backend is built in Node.js, backed by Postgres SQL. The architecture is powered by AWS, using a mix of container-based and serverless processes. We use Python for data-related tasks.   Tasks   Build the Vue.js applications for products that will change the work lives of community-led companies and community members alike, actively participating on every step of the process (Ideation, Implementation, Testing/Reviewing and Deploying) Translate mocks to remarkable user interfaces and experiences using TailwindCSS, ElementUI, and our very own design system Integrate these interfaces with our Node API and other services, following (and improving) our current software design patterns Work closely with the whole development team on the technical big picture, and contribute to strategic and company-wide decisions with the whole team.    Requirements    2+ years of professional experience working with modern frontend frameworks Proficiency in Vue.js and Typescript Experience with testing frontend components Product-oriented mindset: Ability to think about the experience of customers and how to improve it Having previously built or maintained an open source project is an advantage A strong team player, whiling to put on many hats and contribute towards the goals of the team Professional proficiency in written and spoken English    Benefits    Competitive compensation package including salary, stock options, and benefits. We want everybody to be a true owner. Remote-first - you work wherever you want (or join some team members in our co-working space in Berlin) Regular team off-sites somewhere in Europe 30 days of paid vacation Be part of a small, ambitious team and have true potential to advance   We're looking for people with passion, curiosity, and integrity. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description. You might be the perfect person. We‚Äôre truly committed to building a culturally diverse team. Your gender, race, location, sexual orientation, or any other personal attribute don't play a role for us. We seek diverse perspectives and embrace people who aren't afraid to take on challenges.   Let's talk soon! üôÇ

Title: Frontend Developer (m/w/d) (48_CL_6_1)
Description: For our partner we are looking for a Frontend Developer for their location in Rostock. What are your tasks? -You will implement our single page application frontends in collaboration with product and UX designers, managers, and other engineers, based on given requirements and designs, using Typescript, JavaScript, ReactJS and VueJS. -You actively create ideas on how our user interface can improve in features and usability. You communicate your ideas into product development team. For this you actively exchange with our other teams about the needs and pains of our target group. You aim to understand our customers. -You will design, discuss, maintain and continuously improve the code structures of our frontend, based on the requirements of our business logic. You ensure that our frontend is always flexible, stable, and future-proof. -You help shape which technologies and services we use on the frontend side and communicate technical issues clearly inside the team. -You collaborate with backend team, product team and QA team about your ideas and proposals and you work as a team towards a common goal. -You ensure a code base that complies with best practices of good code and modern standards. What you can expect? -State-of-the-art Tech-Stack -Impact. As a Frontend Engineer, you‚Äôll have a major influence on our user‚Äôs experience. Your opinion matters, regarding the future composition of our tech stack and tools. We maintain short decision paths from idea to implementation. -Personal Growth. Continuous learning is the basis for personal growth. We allow working hours for free employment with desired topics. We pay for courses and training. -Purpose. We help companies becoming more digital and secure. We create the infrastructure for modern organizations and New Work approaches. -Team. You will work with an international team of developers, designers, product managers and testers, who strive to win together. You will find progressive and open-minded people around you.   What do we expect from you? -Above all, yourself! authentic and clear. The following points describe our idea of the characteristics that make a great frontend developer. Maybe you convince us in a different way. We like to avoid stereotypes. -Passion and Energy for amazing user interfaces. Your enthusiasm for clear, engaging and powerful user interfaces is contagious. You understand UI design as a collaborative process, which you would enjoy being part of. You are satisfied only when support gets obsolete due to amazing usability. -Passion for good code. Efficient, well-structured, understandable, exciting to read. Like a good story. We understand that this is an art ‚Äì and we appreciate that. Like a user interface, code should be self-explaining. -Relevant project experience with our current tech stack. We would be delighted if you already built beautiful single page applications using Javascript, Typescript and Vue.js. -Precise Communication Skills. You express yourself clearly. You like to share and discuss ideas and you listen to colleagues as well. Because software development is teamwork. -Empathy for customers and target groups. To implement amazing user experiences you should be able to put yourself into the user‚Äôs perspective. You should strive to continuously improve your understanding of our target group. -Conversational English Skills. It is the primary working language of our international development team. -Progressivity. Strong interest in future-oriented technology and the start-up scene. -Education. A master‚Äôs degree or similar in IT or any software development thematically related courses. If not, feel free to explain why you have a broad background in Software and IT in any other form. What do we NOT care about? -Your age, your gender, your appearance, your clothes, your origin, your religion.

Title: Software Engineer (Go/Python) (m/w/x)
Description: About Us    In today‚Äôs software-centric economy, speed is everything. The pressure to deliver more, faster, falls squarely on development teams. Sauce Labs accelerates software development by removing testing as a bottleneck. Our automated testing cloud ensures that the web and mobile applications people use everyday work flawlessly on any browser or device. With Sauce, innovators accelerate their software development cycles, improve quality, deploy with confidence and reduce costs. We call that automated testing. But you‚Äôll probably just call it awesome.    About The Role    The Core Services team is responsible for the orchestration layer which maintains a lifecycle of all resources required by customers to successfully execute their tests. We help customers build digital confidence by providing an entry point to access the Sauce Labs vast amount of testing resources.   Being a Senior Software Engineer at Core team means you will take care of all new and existing services, API's and other resources our team owns. It includes not only software artifacts but also architecture design, wide inter-team collaboration and product requirements discussion.    Responsibilities    Implement features and improvements to the orchestration layer of our test platform. Actively collaborate with Product-Engineering stakeholders to maintain high expectations for quality in our iterative environment. Advocate for improvements to our platform scale, performance, architecture and engineering quality. Propose and implement solutions to improve our team efficiency. Specifically addressing tech-debt and hidden dependencies. Make choices for the adoption of new technologies based on your extensive experience. Try to ship small features and improvements on a regular basis with minimum guidance. Actively help the team to collaborate with bigger initiatives. Participate in weekday and weekend on-call rotations to help teams troubleshoot urgent customer facing problems and other engineering issues. Participate in our team process of software delivery which includes refinement of work items, discussion about priorities and outcomes the team defines for the coming time period.    Advanced    Requirements:   HTTP Go GCP Kubernetes Prometheus/Grafana Python 2/3    Familiar/Intermediate    GitLab Envoy HAProxy Redis Terraform Protobuf Webdriver Git Docker or compatible technology   Principles   Observability/Alerting - SRE handbook Building scalable software > 10k requests/second Testing best practices    Security Responsibilities At Sauce    At Sauce, we will commit to supporting the health and safety of employees and properties, partnering with internal stakeholders to learn and act on ever-evolving security protocols and procedures. You‚Äôll be expected to fully comply with all policies and procedures related to security at the department and org wide level and exercise a ‚Äòsecurity first‚Äô approach to how we design, build & run our products and services.   Sauce Labs is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity/expression/status, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status.  Please note our privacy terms when applying for a job at Sauce Labs.   #Remote #SauceEU

Title: Full-Stack Developer (m/w/d)
Description: About Enzo    Enzo is revolutionizing homeowners insurance. We are leading a paradigm shift in a ‚Ç¨100+ billion market that has barely improved customer experience for over 100 years. With cutting-edge technology, a consistent customer focus, and the value-driven mindset of a startup, we are building the most advanced homeowners insurance on the market.   Our belief is that holistic protection must be more than just insurance coverage. That's why we don't just wait for a loss to happen but rely on proactive, preventive service, and smart home technology to ensure that a loss doesn't happen in the first place. Because at the end of the day, the best insurance policy is the one you never have to use.   Tasks  We‚Äôre looking for a Software Developer who‚Äôs experienced in delivering cutting-edge cloud software. You work closely with the founding team and work with us on improving and expanding our software platform. You'll work with state of the art software tools and use modern in-demand toolchains    Requirements    At least 2 years experience working as a software developer, startup experience is a plus Excellent communication skills in English Love for clean code, and clear software design Understanding of cloud software & architecture Knowledge about React, NodeJs, TypeScript, Git, and Unit Testing Self-learning individual who is up-to-date about tools and loves to pass on their knowledge to others Knowledge about PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and ORMs is a plus Knowledge about Next.js is a plus    Benefits    You have the opportunity to change one of the biggest industries in the world for the better and become part of an international hyper-growth startup Build a product with us that will make the lives of thousands of people in many countries easier and protect valuable natural resources Work alongside entrepreneurs who have already co-built successful companies Flat hierarchies, honest and direct communication with an open-minded startup culture Attractive compensation Great career and personal development opportunities   We look forward to receiving your application and meeting you.

Title: Software Engineer Tools & Infrastructure
Description: Intrinsic is a robotics software and AI company at Alphabet. Our mission is to make industrial robotics accessible and usable for millions more businesses, entrepreneurs, and developers. We are a multidisciplinary team of engineers, roboticists, designers, and technologists who are passionate about unlocking the creative and economic potential of industrial robotics.   Role  As a software engineer for tools and infrastructure, you possess strong coding skills to supercharge our engineering productivity. We are a fast-paced Alphabet startup with a large base of on-prem hardware and software moving real hardware in real time, with a solid presence in the public cloud. Building and testing our systems for this heterogeneous system will be an exciting challenge. You will have the opportunity to partner with passionate engineers and researchers to make robots significantly more capable than they are today, and make them more dependable in relieving people from dirty, dull, or dangerous tasks.   Areas we expect you to make an impact   You will decouple Intrinsic's build and test infrastructure from the Google-internal systems- this is an opportunity to design and build a best-in-class developer infrastructure from the ground up You will develop and evangelize best practices for building, packaging and deploying the next generation of robotics systems    What Skills You Should Have    Worked on a collaborative software project (2+ contributors) Experience with at least one of the following: Golang, build systems, distributed build farms, CI/CD systems, or IDEs    Skills We Hope You Have    Experience with build systems (e.g. Blaze, Bazel, CMake, Ant, Maven, Gradle, Pants, etc.) Experience with distributed build farms (e.g. Buildbarn, Buildfarm, GCC CompileFarm, etc.) Experience with CI/CD systems (e.g. Jenkins, Travis, Circle CI, Spinnaker, Terraform) Experience with Golang Experience with integrating IDEs (e.g. Visual Studio, IntelliJ, Eclipse, etc.) into developer infrastructure Experience with Google-internal build/test infrastructure   At Intrinsic, we don't just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.   If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at: candidate-support@intrinsic.ai.

Title: Frontend Developer (m/f/d) üöÄ
Description: Help us to make ProvenExpert even more successful!   Do you really want the perfect job? üßê Or do you want the next step in your career to be deeply impactful? I can‚Äôt offer you perfect, but I can offer deep impact. üí™ I have a successful 11-year-old SaaS product that needs awesome skillsets (maybe yours?) to reach new heights. üßó As a team we‚Äôre killing it in DE for our niche, but we have a lofty road map ahead of us (#disruptUSA) üí• and a bus with a few key seats ü§© we still need to fill.   Still reading? Awesome. Let me intro myself, hi my name is Remo. I‚Äôm the co-founder of ProvenExpert. You will be working closely with me; therefore, I want to give you context on us, what the role is about and what we‚Äôre looking for.   Me and my colleagues are fighting for the little (wo)man ‚Äì the small business owners and one-(wo)man-bands who grind each and every day to master their craft. They want to focus on delivering outstanding work and getting more clients ‚Äì not sales and marketing. That‚Äôs where we come in as ProvenExpert ‚Äì we provide a SaaS platform for small business owners to manage feedback and enable them to direct their online reputation.   As a Frontend Developer (m/f/d) your focus is on the (further) development of the user interface and you thereby improve ProvenExpert. Your thoughts are all about making sure the platform is working and the users are happy. You want to develop yourself and your skills and become a luminary in your field? You want to implement your own ideas and thus further improve Provenexpert? Then you've come to the right place.   Tasks  Where your expertise is needed ‚≠êÔ∏è   Develop and maintain our current systems Implement new frontend features Transfer the current design in a new frontend system    Requirements    You‚Äôll be great for this role if you have experience in üí™   This is what we think we‚Äôre looking for, but perhaps you have other skills that are a great fit for the role which we haven‚Äôt considered; we encourage you to still apply.   Profound experience in HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript Experiences with React Experiences with responsive web design You have very good communication skills and you work proactively to ensure that working processes are smooth and efficient You love a good challenge and enjoy finding creative solutions to problems You are a team player, can work independently, and strive to achieve high-quality work Your English is very good so you can read, write and discuss tasks within an international team; German is a plus    Benefits    ü•≥   Safety first: During Covid-19, you'll have the opportunity to work from home or in the office with a safety and hygiene concept You choose your hardware, which suits you best (PC/ Mac and desktop/notebook) You have the opportunity to take over responsibility, develop your skills according to your interests and to try things out A great team of PHP and JS freaks, creatives, database tamers, social media junkies and concept gurus as well as many other people is waiting for you Work from home or one of our gorgeous modern offices in Berlin, Madrid, or Krakow. Flexible hours. Are you a night owl, a day lark, or an early bird? All are welcome. Equipment you actually want. Let us know your preferred machine, we will make it work. Being part of a successfully growing company - creative freedom, flat hierarchies and the opportunity to take on responsibility. Well stocked kitchen with free drinks (coffee, tea) and many delicious snacks (fruit), though some high caloric nibbles (chocolate).   Does this sound like your next challenge? Then send us your complete application in English in a PDF document including earliest start date and salary requirements! Your contact Sabine Sandig is looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: Fullstack Engineer (all genders) at meshcloud GmbH
Description: Introducing meshcloud  meshcloud offers a central and integrated platform with numerous functions such as the management of all cloud projects, self-service interface for cloud access and authorizations or control over cloud costs. This makes meshcloud a strategic transformation tool that offers companies agile deployment options and sustainably changes and simplifies their way of working in the digital domain. At meshcloud, best practices of multi-cloud use across companies and industries are bundled and implemented so that our customers' more than a thousand users can focus on their core business: Developing digital applications in industries like automotive, finance and energy.   Join our team and help us accelerate the digital transformation of the Global 2000 companies. With us you can expect real team spirit and the common will to achieve great things üôÇ   Tasks  Do what you love  You will be directly involved in the further development of the meshcloud platform. Developers like you should like to use it: Your view as a developer is important to us! You will advance our platform with new features, integrate further cloud platforms and deployment practices. Senior developers at meshcloud are responsible for significant architecture and technology decisions. You can look forward to an exciting environment with deeply technical challenges that provides plenty opportunity for personal growth.    Requirements    Why you are our perfect match   Significant experience in Kotlin or Java and their standard libraries Well-versed in the development of web applications and REST APIs (HTTP) Strong skills working with relational (SQL) or document databases (RavenDB, MongoDB) Practical knowledge using version control (git), CI/CD tools, issue trackers and working with agile methods   Additionally, the following skills and experiences would be interesting for us and nice-to-have:   Experience in other programming languages, frameworks and technologies Experience in working with Kubernetes, OpenShift, OpenStack or Cloud Foundry Experience with "cloud native" tools like Docker, Prometheus, Grafana, Helm, Terraform or Ansible Experience with public cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)Experience with distributed database systems such as Elasticsearch, Redis, MongoDB or RavenDB Contributions to open source projects and/or programming communities such as Stackoverflow   We believe that every technical skill can be valuable! No matter how extraordinary the technology you may be particularly well versed with, you have certainly learned something special that will help make us and our platform even better! At the end of the day, it is your motivation and love for technology that matters.    Benefits    Why you shoud apply  Our vision "Empower Humans to build a better future" is not only related to the opportunities we offer our customers, but is also reflected in our everyday work. That's why your ideas are important to us! With the help of lean and fast processes, our teams effectively drive improvements and have a great impact on the development of our product and meshcloud every day.   Our benefits and perks include:   We support your personal and professional development! In consultation with you, you will receive development and training plans tailored to your needs Work in small, self-organized teams with clear goals Freedom and the possibility to make independent decisions are a standard for us, but of course you can count on teamwork and mutual support Mobile Work within Germany possible, after onboarding option to World Office Many free snacks & drinks in our office in Frankfurt (dogs also welcome) Regular live team events and weekly virtual coffee dates For all bookworms: Access to over a hundred books in our meshBib on topics like coding, leadership, personal development, etc. Benefits app for our employees, which includes budgets for lunch, gym, internet and mobility   For those interested, here is an overview of our current tech stack.   Apply now and become a meshi!   If you have any questions, please feel free to contact our HR assistant Joanna at 069/ 3487 267 70.   You can submit your documents in either German or English.   We look forward to receiving your application and will get back to you as soon as possible.

Title: Full Stack Developer (m/w/d) at LIFEBONUS Gesundheitsmanagement GmbH
Description: Wer wir sind  Wir sind ein Team von Trainern, √Ñrzten, Therapeuten und IT-Experten- mit dem Ziel betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement neu zu denken und umzusetzen.   Was wir tun  Die LIFEBONUS Gesundheitsmanagement GmbH ist ein Spezialanbieter im Bereich des betrieblichen Gesundheitsmanagements und der Arbeitsmedizin. Wir entwickeln jobspezifische analoge und digitale Gesundheitsprogramme, die bereits mehrfach ausgezeichnet wurden und wissenschaftlich belegt sind.Wir sind ein internationales Team mit flachen Hierarchien, flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und einer Hands-on-Mentalit√§t und freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!   Aufgaben   Du bist Teil eines internationalen agil agierenden Teams, um unsere neue jobspezifische App zu entwickeln, zu betreuen und immer wieder neu anzupassen Du arbeitest eng mit den Entwicklerkollegen und dem Product Owner zusammen und gemeinsam findet ihr L√∂sungen und Umsetzungen zur Realisierung unserer App Du begleitest neue Gesundheitsinformatik-Bachelorstudenten bei ihrem Einstieg in die Softwareentwicklung   Qualifikation   Abgeschlossenes Studium (FH/Uni) aus dem Bereich (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung mit relevanter Berufserfahrung Vertiefte Kenntnisse in der Softwareentwicklung mit Schwerpunkt auf Backend-Technologien wie z.B. GraphQL, NodeJS, Docker, NestJS und ExpressJS Tiefes Verst√§ndnis f√ºr die mobile Entwicklung mit Technologien wie React Native, Swift, Objective C, Java Erfahrungen in JavaScript, TypeScript, NodeJS, HTML, Sass and CSS, SQL und NO-SQL Datenbanken Erfahrungen mit Micro Services / Server-less Software und API-Architekturen sowie mit Software Test-Automatisierung sind von Vorteil ebenso Kenntnisse mit Cloud Native Umgebungen und Deployment & Monitoring (vorzugweise AWS) Sehr hohe Teamorientierung Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse    Benefits    Ein internationales Team mit unterschiedlichsten Pers√∂nlichkeiten mit offenem, herzlichem und wertsch√§tzendem Umgang Flache Hierarchien und schnelle Entscheidungswege Flexible Gestaltung der t√§glichen Arbeitszeit (Gleitzeit) und arbeiten im Homeoffice Individuelle Weiterbildungs- und Entwicklungsm√∂glichkeiten Verschiedene kostenfreie Benefits, z.B. Nutzung unseres Fitnessstudios; Getr√§nke und Obst, Beratung durch unsere BGM-√Ñrztin M√∂gliche Zimmeranmietung in unseren Werkswohnungen bei Bedarf oder eine g√ºnstige Mietwohnung Keinen Stillstand ‚Äì wir entwickeln uns, unsere Produkte immer weiter und sind immer auf der Suche nach neuen Trends, die zu uns passen Arbeitsplatz in einer Zukunftsbranche   Wir freuen usn auf deine Bewerbung!

Title: JavaScript Developer in Retool (m/f/d) - Remote
Description: Sastrify supports Tech, Finance and Procurement teams in buying and renewing SaaS subscriptions so they can focus on what matters while we save their time and money by applying best practices in SaaS buying and using a dedicated procurement team that benefits from a large database of benchmarks.   Join us on our new adventure to reshape the software-as-a-service industry!  What you'll do as our JavaScript Developer in Retool (m/f/d)   We like to move fast. So we take advantage of Retool, a low-code solution to iterate quickly on our internal processes. You will be in charge of enabling our CSM and Knowledge teams with tailored solutions using Retool, JavaScript, SQL and REST APIs For this you will collaborate closely with your colleagues to understand the requirements and bring fast iterations into production.    Our Technologies   We use JavaScript to write custom code inside Retool Our Retool applications use REST APIs and SQL to connect to datasources Everything we build runs in the cloud    Requirements   You have experience with JavaScript and preferably with Low Code solutions You are comfortable in consuming REST APIs and writing SQL queries For you it's normal to take ownership of your work You are passionate about collaboration and being part of a team You are a good communicator who enjoys discussing problems and solutions with others You believe in continuous learning and improvement and consider mistakes part of achieving great results You are fluent in English and keen to work remotely (we don't have an office)    Benefits   Full responsibility from day one Work with our amazing international team Monthly Virtual Team Events 30 vacation days Learning budget State of the art equipment (also for your home-office) Remote-first mindset (you can work from anywhere between CET-1 and CET+1)

Title: Full Stack Developer (m/w/d)
Description: The Role And a Bit About Us    The role presents an opportunity to become an integral part of our tech team with plenty of room to perform computer programming tasks including both front and back-end coding, providing an end-to-end service in the development of our products.   We are seeking a Full Stack Developer responsible for designing, developing, deploying and integrating our products with different platforms.   We are a team of hungry entrepreneurs and engineers driven by the opportunity to positively shape our collective future. We have the technology, the team and the timing to decentralize businesses, markets and even economies, creating more open, sustainable and inclusive ways of living and working.   If you identify with the above, you‚Äôre not just looking for a 9-5, and are ready to take complete ownership of this position - we look forward to hearing from you.   Tasks  Things you will do   Working on the full-stack development of our products; Working on unit testing, test coverage, and static code analysis; Working in high-performing agile teams using SCRUM or Kanban; Working and building products autonomously; Building scalable and robust APIs; Building quick shippable MVPs.    Requirements    What you bring to the table   Experience as a full-stack developer; Experience with MERN stack; Experience in any cloud platform (AWS, Azure, GCP) with the familiarity of cloud services like auto-scaling, elastic load balancing, serverless functions; Experience and knowledge of code and memory profiling and optimization; Good knowledge of TypeScript, React, and JS ecosystem in general; Ability to communicate in English (written and spoken); Maker‚Äôs mindset. Hunger for shipping MVPs, not for corporate processes.   Nice to have   Experience with Python and Rust programming languages; Exposure to UI/UX development, no panic when you don‚Äôt have design mockups; Knowledge of Github Actions and/or No-Code tools to automate routines; Knowledge of docker containers; Open-source software background; Understanding how CI/CD process works in general; Passionate about blockchain technologies and bringing a decentralized web to the world.    Benefits    What you can expect   The opportunity to contribute to innovative projects in a new and exciting industry that has the potential to positively shape our world. High growth potential. Warm and open corporate culture at an international company with many different nationalities. An environment that values freedom, autonomy, team spirit and open communication. Flexible working hours. Decentralized (remote) working possibilities.    What Guides Us    We believe that great teams consist of Missionaries rather than Mercenaries. We believe that great teams can only deliver great results consistently if they work under conditions that give them creative freedom and a manageable workload, creating full focus on what's important. We want to work with humans, not with robots. This is why we build a team that finds its strength in diversity & authenticity. This is why we want to give you the freedom you need to be great at what you do. This is why we aim to create a space where people can do what they love and live up to their talents.   We look forward to working with you.

Title: Frontend Engineer - Design System (m|w|x)
Description: Job Description  Millionen von Besucher:innen vertrauen t√§glich darauf, dass sie mit idealo das f√ºr sie passende Produkt zum besten Preis finden.   Dazu ist ein benutzerfreundliches, barrierefreies und performantes Frontend von gro√üer Bedeutung.   Um einer m√∂glichen Inkonsistenz in der Benutzeroberfl√§che entgegenzuwirken und gleichzeitig die Autonomie in den Webentwicklungsteams hochzuhalten, arbeiten wir an einem Design System, das von allen Teams gemeinsam genutzt werden soll und die Verbindung zu UX festigt. Damit wir mit der Arbeit richtig Fahrt aufnehmen k√∂nnen, freuen wir uns auf Dich als Unterst√ºtzung als Frontend Engineer (m|w|x) in Vollzeit oder Teilzeit!   Deine Aufgaben   Du entwickelst als Teil eines im Aufbau befindlichen, Teams unser Design System technisch weiter. Du fungierst als Schnittstelle zwischen der bestehenden Frontend Community in den Produktteams und dem User Experience Team. Dabei identifizierst du die Anforderungen in Bezug auf bestehende Prozesse, Tools, Dokumentation und Asset-Management, treibst erforderliche √Ñnderungen voran und stellst sicher, dass diese effizient umgesetzt werden Du pflegst eine klare und proaktive Kommunikation auf allen Ebenen, legst Wert auf effektive Beziehungen im gesamten Entwicklungsbereich und stellst Alignement her. Du arbeitest u.a. mit folgenden Tools an unserem Design System: Storybook React Styled Components TypeScript GitHub GitHub Actions    Job Requirements  Das bringst Du mit   Du verf√ºgst √ºber sehr gutes Wissen zu JavaScript/TypeScript. ‚ÄúServer-Side-Rendering‚Äù ist Dir nicht unbekannt. Du hast ein fundiertes Verst√§ndnis f√ºr die Arbeitsweise in interdisziplin√§ren Produktteams und insbesondere f√ºr den End-to-End-Designprozess. Du arbeitest gerne kollaborativ, teilst Dein Wissen und Deine Erkenntnisse aktiv mit anderen und hast Spa√ü daran, verschiedene L√∂sungsans√§tze gegeneinander abzuw√§gen und im Team zu diskutieren. Du hast eine Begeisterung f√ºr professionelle Softwareentwicklung (Design Patterns, Clean Code, agile Prozesse) und verstehst Dich als ‚ÄúPragmatic Software Craftswoman/Craftsman/Craftsperson‚Äù. Du verf√ºgst √ºber ausgepr√§gte schriftliche, m√ºndliche und zwischenmenschliche Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch    Bei idealo erwartet Dich   Ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell: Weil individuelle Bed√ºrfnisse mehr denn je z√§hlen, kannst Du bei idealo Deinen Arbeitsort innerhalb Deutschlands frei w√§hlen. Wir sind einer der besten Arbeitgeber Deutschlands, bei uns genie√üt du ein familienfreundliches Umfeld, in dem Du als Mitarbeiter:in wertgesch√§tzt wirst. Kein Stillstand! Bei uns ist immer was los! Wir bieten Dir individuelle Weiterbildungsm√∂glichkeiten f√ºr Deine Fach- oder F√ºhrungskarriere. Ein hoch motiviertes Team, das sich jetzt schon auf Deine Unterst√ºtzung freut und darauf, mit Dir gemeinsam Strategien zu entwickeln und gemeinsame Ziele zu erreichen. Verschiedenste Entwicklungsm√∂glichkeiten und Projekte, die Du mit viel Eigenverantwortung vorantreibst. Eine offene Unternehmenskultur, in der Ehrlichkeit, Mut und Toleranz im Mittelpunkt stehen. Ein wettbewerbsf√§higes Verg√ºtungspaket und verschiedene attraktive Zusatzleistungen, die nicht nur unseren Mitarbeiter:innen zugutekommen, sondern auch einen nachhaltigen Lebensstil f√∂rdern.    √úber idealo   idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer:innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Bei uns arbeiten √ºber 1200 Mitarbeiter:innen aus 60 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shoppings. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verh√§ltnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.   Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Unser Produktportfolio ist so vielf√§ltig, wie die Menschen, die daran mitarbeiten. Chancengleichheit, Diversit√§t und Inklusion geh√∂ren zu unserer bunten Unternehmenskultur. Deswegen wollen wir Dich so, wie Du bist. Unabh√§ngig davon, wo Du herkommst, welche Hautfarbe Du hast, woran Du glaubst, mit welchem Geschlecht Du Dich identifizierst, wen Du liebst oder ob Du eine Behinderung hast.   Hinweis f√ºr Bewerber:innen mit Behinderung: Als Bewerber:in mit Behinderung kannst Du Dich w√§hrend des Bewerbungsprozesses von unserer Schwerbehindertenvertretung (SBV) beraten lassen.   Arbeiten im B√ºro und von wo immer du m√∂chtest.  idealo erm√∂glicht Dir das Arbeiten, von da wo du bist. Im Rahmen unseres Hybrid Work bei idealo entscheidest Du, ob und wie oft Du vom B√ºro in Berlin oder remote arbeitest, weil Du in einer anderen Stadt innerhalb Deutschlands lebst, oder das Caf√© bei Dir um die Ecke einfach den besten Milchschaum macht. Nur etwa einmal pro Monat wird es verbindliche Office-Tage geben, um die idealos auf Unternehmens-, Bereichs- oder Teamebene zusammenzubringen, atemberaubende Aussicht von unserer Dachterrasse inklusive. Was sich genau hinter Hybrid Work bei idealo verbirgt, erf√§hrst Du hier und in einem gemeinsamen Gespr√§ch!

Title: Frontend Developer (w/m/d)
Description: About Us    XOM Materials is the go-to online platform that simplifies trading materials such as steel, metals, and plastics. We provide intelligent, ready-made procurement and sales solutions tailored specifically to the needs of the materials industry. In this way, we enable companies to digitize their processes easily and quickly without having to invest in developing their own technology. Founded in 2017, we operate from our office in Berlin with more than 40 employees. We aspire to become the hub of a digital ecosystem for the materials industry.  To get there, we‚Äôre building a digital platform that connects buyers with sellers and facilitates transactions across the materials value chain for substantial efficiency improvements that ultimately increase revenues and cut costs.   Role Mission   As part of our development team, you will help architect, implement and test new features, improve our existing code-base and help to get our products to shine brightly. Integrated in a strong team there comes plenty of opportunities to improve your technological skills, understanding of methodology and feel the direct impact of your code.Member of a team of skilled Senior Software Engineers Hands on coding in a non-trivial architecture as well as trust and feedback from the team Exciting, new and international e-commerce solutions with the potential of enormous growth in the industrial sector   Aufgaben   Design, implementation and enhancement of our B2B e-commerce solutions for materials Implementation and enhancement of tools and algorithms which are a unique challenge in the material business Maintenance and improvement of our system architecture Delivery of scalable and maintainable solutions Collaboration with your fellow engineers, product owners, and UI/UX designers to get the most out of our platform Work in an agile team and be part of the full software development lifecycle   Qualifikation   University degree (field Computer Science/ Mathematics/ Engineering or a similar study) At least 3 years of experience with HTML5 and CSS in a professional setup Good knowledge in JavaScript Frameworks (e.g. Angular) Familiarity with git or similar version control systems, git-flow is a plus Hands on attitude, self driven, analytical mindset combined with a strong interest in technology Experience or interest in working in an agile environment (SCRUM, Kanban) Fluency in English (verbal communication of technical topics)    Benefits    Competitive salary and permanent employment contract 30 vacation days and a contribution to the company pension plan Flexible working hours, mobile working and additional benefits (meditation app, group accident insurance, etc.) High-quality technology (software and hardware) to enable comfortable working, also outside the office Budget for personnel development - several internal and external trainings Numerous health promotion measures, e.g. ergonomic workplace and health days International team in a family-friendly start-up   Sounds interesting?  Then please send us your application documents with salary requirements and earliest possible start date.

Title: Software Developer / Software Engineer C++ (m|f|d)
Description: The Job Responsibilities    As part of product development, e.g. in the field of mobile gas detection technology or alcohol and drug detection, you will develop the software for our products. Together in an agile software team, you will help shape our products. In addition to software implementation, you will provide support in requirements analysis, software design and test automation. Your tasks also include the continuous development of our products that are already in use. In internal communities and initiatives, you work with your colleagues on the continuous improvement of the development department. This includes, for example, the selection of innovative technologies and methods.    Your Qualifications    You have a degree in computer science, software engineering or comparable fields and preferably already have several years of professional experience in software development. Title: Frontend Developer (m/f/d)
Description: We are looking for you as a  Frontend Developer (m/f/d)  located in Berlin (80% mobile office) to build the next generation fintech products.  Arvato offers customers payment solutions that make everyday life simpler!    (Y)our Mission    Our solutions contribute to flexible and customer-friendly payment alternatives. We offer consumers the opportunity to choose when and how they want to pay, whilst guaranteeing a steady and predictable cashflow for merchants. Our products make us proud, but not content and we have high ambitions for our existing as well as upcoming products. We have a strong commitment to building the future of FinTech ‚Äî human-centric and sustainable. With investments to back it up. You will be part of a new and quickly growing product & tech organization, having the opportunity to shape our new teams as well as build the next revolutionary products.    A Snapshot Of Your Responsibility    You design, build, test, and maintain web applications as part of a cross-functional team. You act as an application developer to create interactive, user-engaging features. You act as an UI engineer and you create robust, reusable UI components. You take initiative to improve quality across different aspects of frontend: accessibility, performance, consistency, maintainability, robustness, etc. You seek, evaluate, and recommend new technologies, concepts, and best practices. You analyze business and design requirements. Contribute to shared understanding through documentation and collaboration.    What You Bring    You have a minimum of 2 years working experience developing for the web. You are skilled in the core building blocks: HTML, CSS, and JavaScript You are proficient with at least one modern component framework/library (Vue, React, Angular, standard Web Components using e.g. Stencil or Lit). You are understanding of web standards and browser capabilities. Responsive design is your default, with good understanding of layout techniques like CSS Flex and Grid. You are knowledgeable of HTTP and experienced working with REST APIs. You use English as your professional language. Good experience to have: TypeScript, automated frontend testing, creating maintainable style architectures (we use Sass and CSS Custom Properties), working in design tools (we use Figma), and backend development (we use .NET).    About The Technologies We Use    Our teams have autonomy when it comes to tech choices. Example below will give you a bit of flavor, and we look forward to discussing this further with you.   User research and product design expressed in componentized Figma screens -reflected in reusable Web Components created with Stencil -styled with a combination of SASS variables and CSS Custom Properties -used in an Angular application -deployed to a CDN - using a REST API - served by a .NET Core backend - deployed to a Kubernetes cluster - consuming events from our microservice ecosystem via RabbitMQ - with all infrastructure defined using Terraform and quite a bit of automated tests along the way.    What‚Äôs In It For You    Start-Up spirit in a corporate Bertelsmann group Challenging tasks that are also helping you to develop in the fintech field and within the company in an international context. Working together with our UX/UI designers with the possibility to impact the end user experience for a lot of people. Flexible working hours as long as you‚Äôre there for your team members. Work in an inspiring atmosphere flooded with humor and awesome people, on top socializing events, sports races, and discounts for local fitness studios. Being part of a dedicated product team working together towards a common goal ‚Äì testing and learning together. Access to trainings from Bertelsmann University, free LinkedIn learning, exclusive nano degree programs from Silicon Valley and over 4,000 e-learnings   Please note, that you need EU citizenship and/or a valid work permit for Germany.    Who We Are    Let's be honest, finance is complicated.   So we at Arvato Financial Solutions are proud to be guiding international as well as renowned local companies through the complex world of cash flows. Whether our customers sell shoes in e-commerce or offer telecommunications services, our services ensure efficient credit management for the best possible financial performance. Our approximately 7,000 employees solve new challenges in payments and complex data riddles every day, and do so cleverly, analytically and with an eye for every little detail as that is our DNA. We are seeking colleagues who want to take an active part in this - whether they are young professional, IT specialists, data analysts, advisers, managers or lateral entrants. And thanks to our presence in around 20 countries with a focus on Europe and America, there will usually be the right job available nearby.   Innovate Yourself.    We Keep What We Promise    Find more information and other interesting positions at www.innovateyourself.de. Are you already convinced? Then we look forward to your online application with salary expectations and the earliest possible start date.We look forward to applications from candidates who contribute to the diversity of our company. We relate diversity in particular to the dimensions of cultural or social origin, religion, age, disability, gender and sexual identity.   Company:  Arvato infoscore GmbH   Country:  Germany   State/Region:  Berlin   City:  Berlin   Postal Code:  10623   Job ID:  201761   Date: Jun 26, 2022   Location:   Berlin, BE, DE, 10623   Job Segment:  .NET, Application Developer, Web Design, User Experience, Programmer, Technology, Creative

Title: React Native Developers
Description: We are a digitally native technology services company where innovation, design and engineering meet scale. We use some of the latest technologies in the digital and cognitive field   to empower organizations in every aspect.   Right now, we are looking for React Native Developers  to join our UI Studio at Globant  !   This Studio specializes in building the next generation of digital products leveraging the latest UI technologies and architectures.    You Will Get The Chance To    Work with professionals who have created some of the most revolutionary solutions in their fields. Make an impact. Work in large-scale projects globally. Develop your career in our Studios. Each Studio represents deep pockets of expertise on the latest technologies and trends and delivers tailored solutions focused on specific challenges. Develop your career within an industry or multiple industries. Work in the city you want, and be nourished by cultural exchanges. Be empowered to choose your career path: we have more than 600 simultaneous projects, so you can decide where and how to work. Be part of an agile pod. Driven by a culture of self-regulated teamwork, each team -or POD- works directly with our customers with a full maturity path that evolves as they increase speed, quality, and autonomy.    What Will Help You Succeed    Believe and love what you do. Being flexible & goal oriented. Upper Intermediate English skills. Having a creative mindset and ‚Äúout of the box‚Äù thinking. Being a fast learner and having an agile mindset. Experience working with JavaScript and/or TypeScript. Experience working with React Native or tools such as Expo. Understanding of the React framework and its component model. Experience implementing visual design specifications using React Native components and layout techniques. Experience working with redux or similar state management applications. Sound skills in Object-Oriented and Functional Programming. Experience writing unit tests using libraries such as Jest, Mocha, among others. Experience working with native iOS development (Cocoa Touch) or Android SDK, is a plus! Experience implementing native features in React Native applications, is a plus!   Are you ready?   At Globant we believe that an inclusive culture and a diverse environment makes us stronger. We encourage people to have an inclusive spirit as our global footprint expands. We seek to generate a place of inspiration and growth for everyone. A safe space, based on equity as a value, where everyone's careers can be promoted and developed in the same way. There is no innovation without diversity and there is no improvement without plurality.  Job Segment:  Developer, Equity, Engineer, Technology, Finance, Engineering

Title: Frontend Engineer
Description: About Us    In today‚Äôs software-centric economy, speed is everything. The pressure to deliver more, faster, falls squarely on development teams. Sauce Labs accelerates software development by removing testing as a bottleneck. Our automated testing cloud ensures that the web and mobile applications people use everyday work flawlessly on any browser or device. With Sauce, innovators accelerate their software development cycles, improve quality, deploy with confidence and reduce costs. We call that automated testing. But you‚Äôll probably just call it awesome.    The Role    The Insights Team is responsible for real time analytics. Our mission is to help users to create high quality systems and make data-driven decisions based on metrics and signals from their development process.   Being a developer at the Insights team in the Sauce Labs Organization means you‚Äôll take care of our new and existing frontend components and APIs, collaborate in architecture design and product engineering.    Key Responsibilities    Implement frontend and applications Strive for constant improvement and contribute to the power of our agile development culture Collaborate with other teams on building our platform    Job Requirements    Proficiency in modern JavaScript (ECMAScript 2015+), HTML and CSS Experience with React and Redux Experience with Node.js Understanding of asynchronous programming paradigms. Hands-on experience with container orchestration technologies such as Kubernetes and Helm. Familiarity with service oriented architecture and microservices. Experience designing REST APIs. Strong sense of ownership and passion for engineering great products with stellar user experiences Understanding and past experience in working in a cloud environment (preferably GCP)    Nice To Have    Experience with Kafka and event streaming Experience contributing to open source projects Experience with Python    Security Responsibilities At Sauce    At Sauce, we will commit to supporting the health and safety of employees and properties, partnering with internal stakeholders to learn and act on ever-evolving security protocols and procedures. You‚Äôll be expected to fully comply with all policies and procedures related to security at the department and org wide level and exercise a ‚Äòsecurity first‚Äô approach to how we design, build & run our products and services.   Sauce Labs is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity/expression/status, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status.  Please note our privacy terms when applying for a job at Sauce Labs.   #Remote #SauceEU

Title: DevTools Engineer, VS Code
Description: RapidAPI is a team of creators building for developers. We are the world's largest API Hub where over 4 million developers find, test, and connect to 40,000 APIs (and growing!) ‚Äî all with a single account, single API key, and single SDK.   Our users range from independent developers to the largest companies in the world. We work hard to ensure it's easy for developers to build, discover, and connect to APIs faster while providing enterprise-wide visibility and governance. As a result, entrepreneurs and enterprises can concentrate on creating value and business outcomes.   We operate at a significant scale, but the opportunity is even bigger. You have an unprecedented opportunity to make a massive difference and empower developers to build modern software through API innovation while doing the most critical work of your career.    About The Team    The DevTools team's mission is to create developer love by bringing RapidAPI services and Developer Experience into code editors. As developers, we tend to lose focus when switching context between applications. Bringing our services to the code editor will allow developers to find quickly, create, test, etc., their APIs.   Our team works closely with the teams managing and building the RapidAPI services.   You Will   Develop existing and new developer tools with Node.js , TypeScript, and React Help to maintain the code quality to a high standard Implement and deliver improvements and features quickly Give feedback, be kind, mindful, and collaborate with other team members.   You Have   An interest in code editors and how you can create better developer experiences A good technical background in building web or Node.js applications Experience working with modern JavaScript frameworks (TypeScript, React) Experience with VS Code extension development is a plus Good communication and team-player skills Experience in working in an agile environment A passion for learning, building and exploring   This is an opportunity to play a key role in a fast-growing and high-scale startup company distributed across the US, Europe, and Israel. You'll be taking our product to the next level within a high talent density team and out-of-the-box thinking. Having raised $150 million in a Series D investment round in 2022; you‚Äôll be working with a team that is scaling globally, fast.   If this sounds like you, click apply below! We‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Title: Software Engineer - Backend (d/f/m)
Description: At Stylight, we‚Äôre on a mission to build the world‚Äôs best search platform for Fashion, Beauty and Design. We're always looking for talent to join our engineering team, and help connect millions of users with their favorite products across 16 countries.  You‚Äôll get to work with systems that handle thousands of requests per second, from custom analytics solutions to multi-regional search and ranking pipelines. We operate at a scale of billions of data points per month, which means you'll never run out of fun challenges waiting to be solved. Sounds exciting? Read on!     Your Responsibilities   Build, deploy, and monitor our live systems across four global regions. Implement, deploy and AB test new features for millions of website visitors. Foster technical excellence within the team, and contribute engineering best practices. Help us grow our engineering culture, from knowledge sharing sessions to hackathons.     Your Profile   At least 4 years of relevant experience in a software development role. Proficient with Python, Scala or Java. Willingness to learn new languages. Demonstrated experience with one or more of the following topics: Search Infrastructure, Distributed Systems, Machine Learning or Batch Processing (Terabyte-scale). Big plus: working knowledge of Docker, Elasticsearch, Kubernetes, Spark or BigQuery.     Our Tech Stack   Most of our services are written in either Python or Scala. We run our systems on AWS, and Google Cloud Platform. We use CircleCI to test, package, and deploy Docker containers to Kubernetes. We monitor our services with Datadog, Kibana, Sentry, Cloudwatch, and PagerDuty.     Your future team   We‚Äôre an international team with different backgrounds: Machine Learning, Data Science, Engineering. We love solving problems with a pragmatic approach - good enough is better than perfect. We work in two-week sprints, value autonomy, open communication and having few meetings. We love Slack. Besides sharing bad jokes and memes, it‚Äôs also where our alerts show up.     Why join Stylight?    üìà Shape the way Stylight grows!With 160m yearly shoppers in 16 countries and >1,500 shops we are the world's leading online search platform for Fashion, Beauty, and Design.   üåé Worldwide vibes! Our team is made up of individuals from over 25 countries, who speak 41 languages, and represent many different backgrounds. You will be inspired by talented colleagues from around the world.   ü§ì Curiosity is our compass!We support you in achieving your goals by providing you with an annual personal development budget and days as well as regular feedback sessions with your peers and manager.   üöÄ Always one step ahead!Bi-monthly Innovation Days foster knowledge sharing throughout the whole company.   üíª Hybrid Working Model:Balance is the key to our success! Through a mix of office, remote and semi-remote opportunities, we give you the ability to manage your own work and personal life.   ü§ô You are not alone!You will be assigned a buddy who will help you navigate through your first weeks of onboarding.   üç∫ Prost, Cheers, Salute !We celebrate our success in every language!     ÔªøWant to know more? Check out:about.stylight.com andblog.stylight.com.    Up for the challenge?  If you want to work in a fun, exciting, challenging and dedicated environment, then don't hesitate and apply today via https://about.stylight.com/jobs. We're looking forward to reading your complete application (cover letter, CV, references, certificates, GitHub profile) in English!
