Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description: Welcome to John Deere, the leading innovator of agricultural, forestry, construction, lawn and grounds care equipment supported by comprehensive parts and financial services solutions. With around 73,500 employees worldwide, we develop and produce connected and technologically advanced machines with a total sales of $39 billion. By joining us you grow individually and become a key contributor in managing the biggest global challenge: supplying 7 billion people with food, clothing and infrastructure.   With around 600 employees, the European Parts Distribution Centre supplies all John Deere dealers in Europe, Africa and the Middle East, as well as national parts warehouses, with parts and accessories. It also manages parts deliveries for all products manufactured in Europe. About 320.000 different parts are stocked in an area covering 130.000m¬≤.   Our division Order Fulfillment in Bruchsal is looking for a   Data Scientist‚ÄØ(m/f/d)  Duties and Responsibilities:   Responsible for working closely with the key leading economic indicators, developing a service parts forecasting model and determining causal relationships between sub groups of part level forecast and leading indicators Maintain statistically based econometric service parts models and statistical forecasts by product-line, utilizing statistical software applications and working with service providers on the customization necessary for modeling a product line for service parts demand forecasting Coordinate the forecast accuracy process in different regions and by specific platforms Perform all necessary tasks to ensure engagement of all forecast inputs and to increase forecast accuracy Coordinating/creating presentation related to Economic condition, marketing program and forecast accuracy performance Effectively present/educate forecast inputs about the process and tools. Build and nurture relationship with stakeholders. Maintain accuracy of data. This includes continuing to update parts catalogs to product lines and add/modify product lines requested by forecast inputs Perform various quantitative analysis to continue to improve forecast accuracy Initiate and conduct research/analysis to leverage best practice within Deere and across industry    Required Skills and Experience:   University Degree in Economics, Statistics or Actuarial Science Expert knowledge of statistical analysis, econometrics and time series forecasting (performs more complex functions, understand principles, may teach others) Ability to work with large data set and ability to conduct statistical analysis using hundreds of Excel files Knowledge of statistical programming language (SAS, SPSS, R, Matlab, STATA), advanced user in Excel-VBA and proficient in MS Access Strong analytical skills and ability to independently translate academic research into practice Proficient in English (reading, writing, listening and speaking) Strong presentation skill, ability to present technical concepts to non-technical audiences Demonstrate initiative, commitment, good interpersonal, negotiation and conflict resolution skills Expert skills in Data Visualization tools Power BI and Tableau Knowledge in EDL, Business Objects and SAP and good knowledge in project management would be desired but not required    What You‚Äôll Get:   an attractive compensation package including variable pay program competitive pension, holidays, life cover/income protection benefits flexible working solutions to balance family and career development and learning opportunities to support current needs and future aspirations    This tariff position is based in Bruchsal and vacant as soon as possible.   End of Posting:  27th April 2022   John Deere Bruchsal  Human Resouces   Maren Schuhmacher   We look forward to your online application in English language!   Additional Information:  To process applications, we use our online platform at our John Deere career page. We are not able to process applications through e-mail or post and ask for your understanding. Please complete the online application form, if you want to apply for a position at John Deere.   If you have any questions about your application, please contact: SchuhmacherMaren@JohnDeere.com .   Job Segment:  Agronomy, Developer, ERP, SAP, Agricultural, Agriculture, Technology

Title: Software Developer C# (m/w/d)
Description: W√ºrdest du gerne innovative Software f√ºr Energieprodukte mitdesignen?   Du arbeitest gerne im Team, um komplexe Probleme zu beheben und L√∂sungen zu erarbeiten?   Komm in unser Softwareentwicklungsteam.   Unser Oilfeld-Service-Digital-Team arbeitet in unserer Spate um intelligente und vernetzte Technologien bereitzustellen. Wir entwickeln und warten Programme und Werkzeuge f√ºr unsere internen und externen Kunden in den Bereichen der Datenerfassung und -verarbeitung, sowie -visualisierung. Dabei arbeiten wir mit verschieden wissenschaftlichen Disziplinen zusammen, z.B. Maschinenbau, Elektrotechnik, Physik und Geologie, um innovative Firmware und Anwendungssoftware zu entwickeln.   Mit den Besten zusammenarbeiten   Als Softwareentwickler:in √ºbernimmst du die Verantwortung f√ºr den Entwicklungsprozess und stellst sicher, dass sich der Code stetig verbessert. Du wirst vielseitige Produkte und Dienstleistungen f√ºr die Energieindustrie konstruieren und entwickeln.   Als Softwareentwickler:in √ºbernimmst du die Verantwortung f√ºr:    Entwicklung und Wartung von Applikationen in Bezug auf Datenerfassung, -verarbeitung und -visualisierung, Sicherstellung von kontinuierlichen und technologischen Verbesserungen Konzepterarbeitung und Softwaredesign zur Erstellung und Verbesserung von heutigen und zuk√ºnftigen Applikationen Implementierung neuer Infrastruktur, um das Potential von vernetzten Produkten und Dienstleistungen zu entfalten (Industrial Internet of Things) Zusammenarbeit mit funktions√ºbergreifenden Teams in einem vielf√§ltigen und multikulturellen Umfeld um Innovations- und Verbesserungsm√∂glichkeiten zu identifizieren Zusammenarbeit mit Stakeholder:innen um Anforderungen in ein technisches Projekt oder Produktdesign zu √ºbersetzen    Befeuere deine Leidenschaft   Um in deine Rolle erfolgreich zu sein, solltest du folgendes mitbringen:    Abschluss in Informatik oder √§hnlichem, andernfalls eine Demonstration deiner professionellen F√§higkeiten Tiefgehendes Wissen des .NET technology stack in C# Praktische Erfahrung in der agilen Softwareentwicklung mit SCRUM Selbstst√§ndige Arbeitsweise und ein gutes Teamspiel Kenntnisse von Konzepten und Methoden in Bezug auf Analyse, Design und Implementierung in einer objektorientierten Umgebung Kenntnisse in WPF/PRISM/Visual Studio und TFS/Azure DevOps Flie√üendes Englisch (Sprache und Schrift) und gute allgemeine Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten    Arbeite so wie es zu dir passt   Wir wissen, dass jeder Mensch verschieden ist und dass jeder auf eine andere Art arbeiten m√∂chte um sein Bestes zu geben. In dieser Rolle k√∂nnen wir folgende flexible Arbeitsweisen anbieten:    Arbeiten von Zuhause oder einem anderen Ort (bis zu drei Tage die Woche) Flexible Arbeitszeiten ‚Äì Teile deine Arbeitszeit √ºber den Tag verteilt selbst ein    Mit uns arbeiten   Unsere Angestellten sind am Herzen von Baker Hughes t√§tig. Wir wissen, dass wir am besten sind, wenn alle unsere Mitarbeiter:innen voll und ganz bei der Sache sind. Deswegen investieren wir in die Gesundheit und das Wohlergehen unserer Arbeitskr√§fte. Au√üerdem f√∂rdern und belohnen wir Talente und entwickeln F√ºhrungskr√§fte auf allen Ebenen, um das Beste aus einander herauszuholen.   Unsere Erfindungen haben die Energieindustrie mehr als ein Jahrhundert revolutioniert. Um morgen weiter voranzukommen, m√ºssen wir auch heute Grenzen √ºberschreiten. Wir legen Wert auf Arbeitskr√§fte die sich Herausforderungen stellen, diese erfahren unsere Wertsch√§tzung und Belohnungen. Wenn du f√ºr uns arbeitest, kannst du mit folgendem Rechnen:    Zeitgem√§√üe work-life Balance Regelungen und Wohlergehens Aktivit√§ten Sicherheitsnetz von Lebensversicherungen und Berufsunf√§higkeitsprogrammen Ma√ügeschneiderte Finanzprogramme Zus√§tzliche ausgew√§hlte oder freiwillige Leistungen    √úber uns   Mit Betrieben/T√§tigkeiten in mehr als 120 L√§ndern, bieten wir unseren Kunden bessere L√∂sungen und unseren Mitarbeiter:innen bessere M√∂glichkeiten an. Als einer der f√ºhrenden Partner in der Energieindustrie haben wir uns dazu verpflichtet bis 2050 Klimaneutral zu sein, um dahin zu kommen suchen wir Personal die uns zu diesem Ziel bringen. Menschen, die genauso leidenschaftlich wie wir daran interessiert sind, Energie sicherer, sauberer und effizienter zu machen.   Komm zu uns   Suchst du eine M√∂glichkeit, in einem Unternehmen mit globaler Reichweite und spannenden Dienstleistungen und Kunden einen echten Unterschied zu machen? Title: Full Stack Developer (Python/Angular) for Cloud Cost Management Solutions (m/f/d)
Description: back to the job offers   Your perspectives with us   What do you work on?   You develop software services that enable large enterprises to export, harmonize, and analyse their cloud costs which have been incurred from AWS, Azure and GCP. You enable integrations with our existing IT financial management solution and ensure that costs cannot only be analysed in terms of money but also in terms of carbon emissions.  How is this special?   There is plenty of complexity to handle: The offerings of AWS, Azure and GCP are rapidly evolving, terminology varies widely across cloud providers, and consumption can be organized differently (e.g., with nested accounts, enterprise agreements, ‚Ä¶). As the solution addresses the enterprise segment, flexibility in data transformations and scalability are of particular importance.  What do you need to know about Serviceware?   Serviceware is a leading provider of software solutions that facilitate the digitization of service processes and includes more than 500 employees across 14 locations. In 2019, we started an innovation center focusing on Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) in Darmstadt, where we take advantage of the recent scientific progress to develop new features in fast iterations.   These tasks are waiting for you   You design, develop, test, and deploy software services that extract, transform and load cloud costs into our existing IT financial management solution. You design and implement web-based user interfaces that are inspired by our UX researchers and regularly improved by user feedback. You contribute to the selection of technologies and the design of IT architectures.   What you have to offer   Passion for writing beautiful and maintainable code. Strong experience with Python or a similar programming language. Experience in modern, web-based frontend technologies, such as Angular or React. Good knowledge of software engineering practices and database fundamentals. Willingness to contribute to continuous knowledge exchange and team learning. Effective communication skills (fluent in English).   What we offer you   You will work on a modern tech stack including Python, Angular, Docker, Git, PostgreSQL, the HashiCorp Stack (Nomad, Terraform, Vault), Keycloak and the ELK Stack (Elastic Search, Logstash, Kibana). You have the chance to substantially influence our service management platform, which is used by over 1,000 companies every day. We offer multiple options to improve your professional skills, in particular through our collaboration with the technical university in Darmstadt. You work two days per week in our office, which is located centrally in Darmstadt and offers a large roof top terrace and modern air conditioning. You will join our international team which does not only build great software, but also likes cooking, biking, gardening, and playing the guitar.   What working environment do you enter?   The best mix of: many opportunities to take responsibility & shape the future offered by a small company, and the ambitions & possibilities of an organization listed on the stock-market. Being part of a new team, a sustainable foundation needs to be established while an entrepreneurial spirit is required to open up new areas.   Your contact at SERVICEWARE   Vanessa Rivera   Human Resources   +49 6434 9450 0   Are you thrilled to join the team?! We can‚Äôt wait to read your application. Please consider the following guidelines when applying at Serviceware:   Applications are possible in English as well as in German. We expect you to write a short cover letter that tells us why you like to work at Serviceware. (Please don‚Äôt use stock cover letters. We‚Äôd love to hear why you like this particular job.) While we enjoy reading about your experiences, please keep your CV focused on the main points. We are not looking for CVs with more than two to three pages.   back to the job offers

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Description: Intro   Our mission is to build spaces that provide older individuals with the peace of mind and conveniences of modern technology to enjoy their later lives to the fullest. It's modern co-living for the generation 65+.   In Germany alone, we are faced with a shortage of over 500,000 wheelchair accessible apartments, while waiting periods of over 3 years are common. The situation all across Europe isn't much better. It is high time that we tackle this challenge together ‚Äì so we can look forward to our lives in old age with the pleasure and excitement we all deserve.   We are a highly multidisciplinary team of designers, software engineers, caretakers, civil engineers, and architects. We combine deep expertise in care and real estate with the dynamism of an agile and customer-centric software startup.    Responsibilities    Work with us on our center piece responsive web application (based on React and Node) Develop stable integrations of our digital products with our IT systems (ERP, restaurant management, care management, property management) Implement improvements of our marketing website (Gatsby + DatoCMS) and its integration with our CRM (Hubspot) Learn and apply engineering best practices (agile development, CI/CD, test automation, monitoring)     Requirements   1-3 years of full-stack engineering experience or comparable education Strong written communication skills Enjoys learning new tools and languages Experience with modern programming languages Experience with Typescript is a plus   What we offer   The opportunity to join a young and fast growing company early on A highly multidisciplinary team in which different disciplines exchange ideas freely, learn from one another, and have the opportunity to create a genuinely new product that is greater than the sum of its parts Flat organisation and "speak up" mentality that fosters a diversity of perspectives Competitive salaries Apple or Lenovo equipment according to your preference Sunny, industrial-chic office in a very well-connected part of Berlin

Title: Frontend Developer
Description: Be part of the next big thing in travel and join Zizoo, the world‚Äôs leading boat holiday platform. Named one of Forbes‚Äô top ‚ÄòTravel Tech Startups Taking Europe by Storm‚Äô, Zizoo is bringing boat holidays to the mass market, offering over 30,000 boat products across 500+ destinations worldwide. Zizoo‚Äôs unique business model and tech suite sets it apart from the competition by monopolizing supply and demand while offering a seamless booking experience to the end customer. Familiar with creating SEO friendly markup. Active advocate of code reviews, unit testing, logging, instrumentation and documentation. Obsessed with learning and mastery. Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.    Benefits    What we offer:   Leadership growth opportunities - strong support for mastery Remote working or hybrid working policies An opportunity to play a key role in the growth one of Europe's leading travel tech startups with an international talented team Transparent data-driven environment where good ideas flourish. Got a good idea? We‚Äôll test it! Opportunity to work in high performance purpose driven and   autonomous teams   Cross-company personal development and training budget strong support for mastery Possibility to experiment with cutting-edge technology Discount on gym membership Team building events and a sailing holiday for the whole team And, of course, boat holiday discounts

Title: Fullstack Javascript Developer (w/m/d)
Description: K√ºchenheld Tech disrupts the kitchen industry developing tools to allow employee and customer centric processes.   Who We Are Looking For    A passionate coder, who is curious and always longs for learning something new, A dependable person, who trust us and who we can rely on, A creative mind that always looks for alternative tools and approaches to develop our stack, and A team player, who is looking for a great team to belong to. Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung inklusive Deines gew√ºnschten Eintrittsdatums an recruitment@kuechenheld.de. Deine Ansprechpartnerin ist Anna aus dem People & Culture Team.

Title: Full-Stack Developer - Insided by Gainsight
Description: About InSided  inSided  is the leading Customer Success Community Platform that uses the power of community to measurably improve our client‚Äôs customer engagement. Customer Success  is at the heart of everything that we do. It is our motto to bring success to all our customers.   Our B2B customer base has nearly tripled 2021, with rocketship growth forecast for 2022. We are on a mission to make Customer Success Communities  an essential part of at least 1000 brands worldwide.   To achieve this we are looking for A-Players - people who share our passion  , embrace change, take initiative and adopt high standards for themselves - to join our team and help us shape the future of customer success. The deal pairs Gainsight‚Äôs leadership in Customer Success with the power of community-led growth, through inSided‚Äôs  unique capabilities that drive product engagement and adoption, increase retention and build lasting customer relationships. inSided‚Äôs platform is currently used by hundreds of companies including Gainsight, Gong.io, ProductBoard, Sprout Social, Guru, and Zapier.   inSided (by Gainsight)  is based in Amsterdam with offices in Manhattan, New York City. What you will do   Contribute to the growth and development of our product by writing and maintaining code, focusing on quality and maintainability. We believe that our teams own the code they build. Title: Frontend Developer - Desktop/React
Description: Welcome to Lightcurve, Berlin's most dynamic blockchain studio! Title: Full Stack Developer (m/f/d)
Description: The Hornetsecurity Group is the leading cloud security provider in Europe, which protects the IT infrastructure, digital communication and data of companies and organizations of all sizes. Its services are provided worldwide via 9 redundantly secured data centers. The product portfolio covers all important areas of email security, including spam and virus filters, legally compliant archiving and encryption, as well as defense against CEO fraud and ransomware. With around 200 employees, the Hornetsecurity Group is represented globally at 10 locations and operates in more than 30 countries through its international distribution network. The premium services are used by approximately 40,000 customers including Swisscom, Telef√≥nica, DEKRA and Claas.   For our location in Hannover  we are looking for a motivated Full Stack Developer (m/f/d)  for 40 hours/week to start immediately or as soon as possible.   Tasks   You work on new features for our Altaro product line. You are involved in learning about and improving our cloud-based services and technologies as well as creating new functionality and developing new projects for the company. You will form part of our Cloud Services Development team and help to design and implement projects ranging from highly interactive single page applications with cloud hosted RESTful Services to Windows Desktop products. You work closely with colleagues from our subsidiary in Malta, the management team as well as other team members from the Support, QA and Marketing departments. You develop highly interactive single page applications utilizing JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, JSON, Angular JS and Angular 9. You develop and integrate Restful API's in C# Web API 2.0 or Node.JS.    Requirements    You have at least 2 years‚Äô experience. You are proficient in Angular JS and/or Angular 2.0 or later versions. You are experienced with Javascript, Node.JS and related frameworks with a good understanding of server side, accessibility and security compliance. You possess expertise with HTML5 including CSS3, and JavaScript. You have expertise in developing and integrating Restful API's in C# Web API 2.0. You have experience in consuming Restful API's. Expert knowledge and experience with JSON / XML / RESTful Web Services and services integration with Angular apps. You have a good understanding of web technology stack including experience in Angular stack and web sockets. You know the best UI practices. You have a good knowledge of relational and non-relational databases. You score with understanding of code versioning tools such as GIT Repository, documenting code, writing unit test cases, agile Development methodologies and Knockout JS. You are fluent in English, both written and verbal.    Benefits    Free space for innovation and independent action. Short decision paths and flat hierarchies in an open work atmosphere. Personal and professional development opportunities. Attractive and performance-related compensation. No dress code ‚Äì you can come to work as you like. Delicious coffee, tea and fresh fruit every day for free. Free Book Policy ‚Äì we will order your reference books. Regular pizza meetings for an interdisciplinary exchange. Unlimited contracts. Fast growing international company with a promising future and no limits to growth in your professional career.   Do you want to help shape the growth and success of the Hornetsecurity Group? Then apply now with your CV or XING/LinkedIn profile and let us know your earliest possible start date and your salary expectation.   All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence

Title: Full-Stack Developer - Insided by Gainsight
Description: About InSided    inSided  is the leading Customer Success Community Platform that uses the power of community to measurably improve our client‚Äôs customer engagement. Customer Success  is at the heart of everything that we do. It is our motto to bring success to all our customers.   Our B2B customer base has nearly tripled 2021, with rocketship growth forecast for 2022. We are on a mission to make Customer Success Communities  an essential part of at least 1000 brands worldwide.   To achieve this we are looking for A-Players - people who share our passion  , embrace change, take initiative and adopt high standards for themselves - to join our team and help us shape the future of customer success. The deal pairs Gainsight‚Äôs leadership in Customer Success with the power of community-led growth, through inSided‚Äôs  unique capabilities that drive product engagement and adoption, increase retention and build lasting customer relationships. inSided‚Äôs platform is currently used by hundreds of companies including Gainsight, Gong.io, ProductBoard, Sprout Social, Guru, and Zapier.   inSided (by Gainsight)  is based in Amsterdam with offices in Manhattan, New York City. What you will do   Contribute to the growth and development of our product by writing and maintaining code, focusing on quality and maintainability. We believe that our teams own the code they build. Continuously improve your and your team‚Äôs way of working, expanding the boundaries of your team‚Äôs autonomy and self-organization. We believe that these two principles lead to stronger, happier, and more performing teams.   What you must have to fit the role   Have at least 3 years of professional experience as a full-stack engineer, building both front-end and back-end features. Proficient with PHP and React Practice test-driven and behavior-driven development Experience in React (hooks, class-based) at least 2 years Master English language in both spoken and written format Willingness to work with Preact A Continuous Improvement mindset. Title: Software Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Ihr Arbeitsumfeld    We are Software Innovation and Development Berlin, a digital unit inside Volkswagen Group IT. Our mission is to support our company‚Äôs NEW AUTO strategy with innovative software solutions. The focus of our product development lies in the digital support to Volkswagen‚Äôs core processes such as production planning, supply chain management and sales management. We are looking for passionate and empathetic digital talents like you to join a team of more than 80 energetic and diverse individuals from all over the world. Our workspace is located in the vibrant Berlin Friedrichshain alongside the river Spree and is a great space for collaboration, exchange and innovation. As a software engineer you will work together with product designers and product managers in multidisciplinary and agile product teams through the entire lifecycle of digital products. We promote a culture of diversity and respect, and encourage learning and knowledge sharing within and beyond our organization.    Ihre Aufgaben    You will be developing backend, frontend and mobile applications, in various tech stacks. You will be involved in all phases of the development process ensuring you and your team build reliable software by applying test-driven development (TDD), and following clean code principles. You share product responsibility with your team and ensure smooth operation of the software through DevOps.     Ihre Qualifikationen    You like test-driven software development (TDD) and coding in pairs when needed and you ideally have first experience in AWS. You are open-minded, friendly, like to learn continuously and share your knowledge. You preferably have at least 3 years of relevant experience in ideally two technologies such as Kotlin, Go, Node, Javascript/Typescript, Python, Angular, ReactJS, Swift or similar. You like to give and receive feedback for continuous personal development and work actively to improve our products. You have a university degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or a comparable qualification and have good English skills. Not sure if you meet all of these requirements? Please apply anyway! Volkswagen is committed to creating a diverse working environment and prides itself on being an equal opportunity workplace. All candidates are considered in the hiring process regardless of origin, skin color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or age. If becoming part of our international team excites you then we cannot wait to hear from you! Your benefits: 30 vacation days + Dec 24th and Dec 31st 35-hour week Employee pension Flexible working hours Mobile work option Training programs Special conditions for car purchase and leasing

Title: Frontend Developer (m/f)
Description: We are the leading e-commerce company in the window and door sector in Europe. Behind our online shops is Neuffer Fenster + T√ºren GmbH, founded in Stuttgart in 1872. Title: Software Developer for Cloud Applications (m/f/d)
Description: WS Audiology   Formed in 2019 through the merger of Sivantos and Widex, WS Audiology combines over 140 years of experience in pioneering better solutions to help people with hearing loss. With a passion for impact, our 11.000 employees are committed to achieving our purpose: wonderful sound for all.   With brands like Signia, Widex, Audio Service, Rexton and Vibe, and with diverse assets across wholesale retail, online, managed care and diagnostic solutions, we are active in over 125 markets. Going beyond together, we achieve annual revenues of around EUR 2 billion.   As a global leader, our ambition is to unlock human potential by making wonderful sound part of everyone‚Äôs life.   Learn about us on www.wsa.com and take a look at why you will love working here:   The Team  This team is part of R&D where two types of software products are developed. One is audiological fitting applications used at hearing care centers to adjust hearing aids. The other is mobile apps for hearing aid users to control their hearing aids and support their lives.   The Role   As a Software Developer (m/f/d) in our R&D department in Erlangen, you will work in an international, scrum team. The team is part of a SAFE train that is developing a cloud-based application used by Hearing Care Professionals to help serve their patient's needs. We hire people who are motivated and excited about building sustainable and high-quality software solutions. As a global company, we welcome a diversity of cultures, ideas, and personal backgrounds.   You will report to our Agile Software Manager.   In this role you will have the following responsibilities:   Design, develop, test and maintain a cloud-based web application in your Scrum team Use methods like Pair or mob programming, Test Driven Design approach and Clean Code architecture to ensure the highest quality and usability of our application Integrate continuously, be responsible for the whole product and deliver continuously Plan, collaborate and celebrate with product owners, software architects, and other teams from our SAFE train    Requirements  You most likely fit the following profile:   Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, or similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience Working Experience with C# or another object-oriented language Ability to speak and write English fluently, German at the intermediate level Willingness to work in a pair or mob programming setup Working Experience in modern architectures (microservices, clean architecture, event-focused, or similar) Working experience with .NET Core and C# Experience within frontend development (e.g. SPAs with Angular/React using Typescript) Experience with cloud technologies (especially Azure) Experience in out-of-process transport mechanisms (web-sockets, event bus, or similar) Experience in scaled agile environment (e.g. LESS or SAFE)    Our corporate language is English, so you need to be confident in English, both verbally and in writing.   What we offer   We are driven by innovation and development so working with us is a constant learning curve. You will be located in our site in Erlangen with dynamic and progressive colleagues, who are highly skilled and empathetic.   We offer flexible working times & opportunities for working from home. You can always get free coffee at the office. We are part of the IG Metall tariff agreement offering attractive compensation and futher benefits like contributions to the company pension plan or child-care.   Join WS Audiology   If this opportunity sounds interesting to you, please submit your application stating your earliest starting date and your salary expectations and we will get back to you as soon as possible.

Title: Frontend Developer (Remote in Germany)
Company Name: devterm IT Solutions GmbH & Co. KG
Description: We love to create great software for the needs of customers ranging from the next big startup to major corporations. Our goal is to deliver a product that isn‚Äôt only great today but also builds a solid foundation for whatever happens in the future.   We founded devterm  in 2020  , have been growing since and now need your help to strengthen our team as a frontend developer.   Tasks   What The Job's Like    You will be developing web, mobile, or cloud apps for a wide variety of customers while being responsible for testing and documenting your code properly. Since we aim for the best codebase possible, you‚Äôll be taking care of code reviews for other members of the team while they review your contributions. You will take care of triaging our customer‚Äôs feature requests and bug reports so that these are ready for the next sprint planning session.    Requirements    What we‚Äôd want from you   You should have mastered HTML, (S)CSS, TypeScript as well as one major frontend framework, such as Angular, Vue, React (or comparable). You should be comfortable using git and a terminal in general. An understanding software architecture and design patterns is important too. As every piece of code has to be tested properly, experience with testing and test driven development would be of big help. Since we are using GitHub or GitLab for our projects, experience with either would be appreciated. We‚Äôd be truly excited if you have experience with web design, visualisation or DevOps in general.    Benefits    How we work   Though we work remotely, we‚Äôre going to speak to each other at least once a day in daily stand-ups or in our planning sessions and retros. In addition to that, we try to meet in person every couple of weeks. We value quality in our work and products, hence we‚Äôve developed processes and guidelines to aid with that. But since nothing‚Äôs ever perfect, we‚Äôre constantly improving these and want your input as well. Inspired by open source software projects, continuous integration and delivery pipelines help us find issues before they become problems while getting the finished product out of the door as quickly as possible. The most important thing for us is giving and accepting feedback so that we can grow together.    What We Can Offer You    You‚Äôre free to work wherever and whenever you want, but if you ever feel the need to work out of an office, we can always get another desk in one of the coworking spaces we‚Äôre using (currently in Stuttgart or Darmstadt). We‚Äôll be paying you a fair wage depending on your skill level in a 35h/week and 30 days of vacation/year contract. You‚Äôll get a budget to choose the equipment you‚Äôre happy to work with as well as the software you need to do your job. You'll get a subsidy for office furniture. You'll get an education budget of 2000‚Ç¨ per year. Join us for regular knowledge-sharing meetups. We‚Äôre happy for you to use part of your time on the job to develop your professional skills and pursue your goals. If the circumstances allow it, we‚Äôd like to organise a summer party.   All we need from you to prepare for a talk to get to know each other is your CV and if applicable your GitHub account or other references.

Title: Frontend Developer (m/f/d)

Your approaches count: In official exchange formats or spontaneously at the coffee machine. At Northern Data, it's the best idea that counts - not the hierarchy. We‚Äôre looking forward to getting your inputs! High performance at scale: As a Northern Data engineer, you will innovate on one of the largest GPU clusters in the world. Best-in-class partners: The best work with Northern Data. This means a knowledge and time advantage from which your career and our customers benefit equally. Green by heart: Sustainability is at the core of Northern Data. With us, you actively work on the carbon neutrality of datacenters worldwide. Beginning with our infrastructure and continuing with the solutions for our clients, we work towards a green future.

Title: Software Engineer (Fullstack) (F/M/X)
Description: What we're looking for   Dive with us into the unknown, be creative, innovate and let us build great digital products together üöÄ - We're looking for people that are happy to work in entrepreneurial, flexible but fast growing and changing environments.   üí° We are looking to establish a diverse team - for us that means that we are both welcoming people who are like us and people who are unlike us. This includes but is not limited to gender, ethnicity, age, academic or professional background, character traits etc. No matter what your background is, feel free to apply at hubblr.    About Us    hubblr is a young company with a lot of passion for software developing and innovation. As an independent, young and agile team we develop with our clients comprehensive software applications while also consulting them in topics like product market fit, UI/UX-design and strategic software development.   The hubblr team loves and lives product innovation. Therefore we also work on our own, internal projects creating new business models, testing them in their market segments and, if successful responses are measured, we bring them together to life.    Benefits    A young and sympathetic team Flexible working hours A lot of room for your own ideas. We always highly encourage you to work on them together with the team. üí° Modern offices at Hamburg "Oberhafenbr√ºcke", the M√ºnster "Prinzipalmarkt", at the "G√∂rli" park in the factory Berlin, in the GRO36 space in J√∂nk√∂ping Sweden or fully remote and in our VR-office in Spatial - that's up to you! Choose your tech equipment and education material A free public transportation ticket or bike with a maintenance agreement in the city you work in Regular team events and a creative working atmosphere CCC Ticket or other educational trainings / tools on request Bring your dog to work üê∂ A progressive work environment - we provide VR Glasses (Oculus Quest 2) for you to experience immersive meetings from a distance A steep learning curve on internal and client projects and lots of ownership and responsibility from day one     Responsibilities    You will be joining a growing team of 17, located in M√ºnster, Hamburg, Berlin, Munich, Cologne, Aachen and Sweden Together with our team you will be working mainly on client-projects and sharing your experience with team members You will be working mainly on backend and frontend related tasks in our projects You will be actively participating in architectural and technological decisions for software projects You will take over own responsibilities in projects, estimate developing tasks on your own and giving other coworkers advice on their work You'll be reviewing code from other coworkers and actively be part of continuous improvement When working on client-projects you will be partly responsible of communicating with their CTO / Stakeholder, joining conference calls/meetings on status update, time estimation and project management     Qualifications    Experience in modern web technologies (Vue.js, React.js or similar framework) Experience in modern backend technologies (i.e. Golang, Node.js, Laravel/PHP, Python) Familiarity with agile software developing methods Communication skills for constructive team feedback and client calls Experience in common API techniques (HTTP, GraphQL, GRPC - at least 1 of them) Experience in E2E tests is a plus Experience in TypeScript is a plus Experience in TailwindCSS is a plus Experience in CI/CD processes is a plus Continuous independent learning Remote-work environments are cool for you Fluent in English Living in the European Union    How to Apply   üì´ Does this position sound like a good fit? Just fill out the form below - it only takes a few minutes.  How will the application process look like?   ‚ú® Our aspiration to a good job application process will guide you from your initial email to a final job offer within 3-4 weeks.  Weekly Screening (up to 1 week)   You can expect us to screen your application within one week. You'll definitely hear from us - no matter the outcome of our decision    First Round: Cultural Fit (1 week and 1 meeting)  You get to meet one of our hiring managers (see above üëÜ) in a 30 - 60 min. google meeting where we'll discuss why you want to work at hubblr  personal values & cultural fit  overview about hubblr & our clients  overview about your job @hubblr and future perspective  salary expectations   Second Round: Job Fit (1-2 weeks and 1 meeting + challenge)  We'll evaluate with you how well you fit to the job at hubblr Depending on the type of job you're applying for this might include   Coding challenge (typically 1 week time to work on it) (for Coding related jobs) Discussion about job related tasks & approaches to your work and solutions  The round will end with a meeting where we can talk about the job fit  further questions / expectations / start date   Final Decision (up to 1 week)   We'll discuss within our team your fit We'll reach back to you within a week after the second round    Does this position sound like a good fit?  We would be very happy to welcome you! ü§ò

Title: Frontend Engineer (f/m/x) Website - Berlin or 100% remote
Description: Your role at zolar  The Tech team at zolar ensures that we create a customer-centric environment and a positive contribution to the climate. Our focus is to develop software and web pages that provides and enhances new - and in some cases previously untapped - opportunities for climate action, and generates business value. Each of our development teams takes full responsibility for a specific product, independently ensuring that the software or web pages are delivered quickly as well as functionally and completely. The tech stack for the website is Wordpress (Headless), TypeScript, React, Next.js, TailwindCSS, Docker, AWS   As a Frontend Engineer (f/m/x) Website  , you develop our website and conversion funnel sites to provide potential customers the most convenient access to renewable energy and take ownership for a high-quality website experience. You will take on the following tasks at zolar:   Together with our marketing team you will work on ideas and concepts to continuously improve the experience of our customers and candidates on our website. Use your knowledge of JavaScript and React as well as headless CMS (Wordpress) to develop flexible extensions for our website. In doing so, you'll not only be able to provide great visuals and build different, coordinated web pages; you'll also understand the world and ecosystems behind each web page and be able to create connections to our key tools and systems while incorporating content APIs. You will gather relevant data and information to constantly improve our conversion funnel with a view to these through various initiatives and optimizations.    Your Qualifications    You have about 3 - 5 years of experience in software development or web development, preferably in a marketing or agency environment. You have excellent knowledge in JavaScript and ReactJS. You are an expert in working with CMS systems, Wordpress experience is an advantage. You have experience with serverside coding and content APIs, experience with PHP is a plus. You enjoy working with various business stakeholders to bring ideas and our company vision to the website.    What Zolar Offers You    100% remote working (within Germany) possible // Stay flexible: Whether you want to save yourself the commute to work or want to see your colleagues in person ‚Äì you are free to choose how many days you work remotely or in the office. In addition, you also have the option of working in another EU country for four weeks a year. Mental health & yoga // Stay healthy: Be it during COVID-19 or normal times ‚Äì your mental and physical health is a matter close to our hearts. In addition to a mental health programme, we also offer free yoga sessions and a discounted M membership at Urban Sports Club. Meeting-free days: Two half-days each week are kept completely free of meetings to ensure you can focus on your work without interruptions. Remote work equipment // Ready for work: We want you to be able to work as well at home as you can in the office, so we provide you with a one-off budget to purchase a desk, chair or monitor for your remote work. Dog policy // Bring your own dog: A variety of four-legged feel-good managers provide natural entertainment in the office and enjoy the attention of their two-legged colleagues. Company pension plan // Live well tomorrow: A world worth living in is a matter close to our hearts, which is why we offer our employees support in their private retirement planning with the help of responsible providers. Leapsome feedback // We love feedback: We are proud of our open feedback culture, but we know that it is sometimes difficult to share your opinion out loud. For such cases, there are weekly Leapsome surveys, where you can submit your input on different topics anonymously. zolar Academy & CPD budget // Stay inquisitive: The zolar Academy offers you interesting presentations and insights into different fields (of work) every month. Speaking of interesting insights: an annual CPD budget means you can take a deep dive into topics that both interest you and further your career. All-hands meetings // Stay informed: The latest company figures and goals are discussed transparently at monthly all-hands meetings. Onboarding day & buddy programme // Involved instead of just employed: Get off to a great start ‚Äì with a comprehensive onboarding process, a buddy by your side and regular team events. Climate protection // One love: From Veggie Wednesday to certification as a climate-neutral company ‚Äì climate protection truly is a matter close to our hearts.   Your contact person  Robert Linke is looking forward to your application!   Our career webpage https://www.zolar.de/career gives you a first impression of our company culture.__

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description: At Laserhub, we have metal running through our veins, and with our procurement platform for metal parts we are leading the very traditional sheet metal industry into the glorious age of full digitalization. At laserhub.com, end customers, and metal parts manufacturers come together via a lean, digital process. Instead of spending many days or weeks on a single order, everyone can work with unprecedented efficiency, fulfilling their demands just in a few days and for multiple orders. Since 2017, our team of experts has demonstrated that our concept is well received by the market ‚Äì now we want to play a big part in making the entire metalworking industry digital. To achieve our goals, we are looking for an ambitious employee for our sales team as   Data Scientist (m/f/d)  In this position, you are an indispensable part of the Product team and a fundamental contributor to the product's success. You collaborate with cross-functional teams and work closely with Product managers, Metal tech experts, and Designers to create the best offers for our customers and enable the best fulfillment of orders. You contribute with understanding our data, building relevant models, and driving decision-making for topics such as offer creation, pricing, order allocation, fulfillment reliability, etc. You will help to create innovative and valuable solutions for the complex requirements of our B2B environment.   Your mission:   Become an expert in our domain - Gain a deep understanding of our business and processes; build strong relationships and trust with stakeholders, and recognize the biggest opportunities Create the pathway - Evolve the necessary infrastructure to support the data science initiatives, including liaising with the data team, defining data structures & pipelines, gathering & processing data, building necessary tools, etc. Design, deploy, evaluate, and update data-driven models and analytical solutions, considering the behavior of customers, suppliers, and relevant stakeholders Drive growth - Monitor key product metrics, confirm/disprove hypotheses, communicate insights, make recommendations, and contribute to decision making and requirements definition inside the Product team and organization. Collaborate strongly with creating the best commercial offer for customers and resource allocation models for order fulfillment Make customers the core - Put customers at the center of your initiatives, understanding their needs and deriving data science initiatives that will deliver real value to them Build the future - Create the foundations for future initiatives involving forecast models, machine learning, AI, etc   Your profile:   Completed studies (Bachelor, Master or PhD) in quantitative field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, or related fields 3+ years of practical work experience (not only academic) in quantitative analysis and statistical methods, including time series, hypothesis testing, clustering, regression analysis, forecasting, etc. Sound knowledge of programming, Python data science stack (pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow), SQL, cloud technologies (preferably GCP, AWS) Impressive problem-solving skills and critical mindset. Able to find patterns, analyze complex scenarios, execute tests and derive effective actions Enjoy working on a complex product while being entirely passionate about technology and the digitalization of the traditional manufacturing industry. You challenge the status quo everyday and strive to improve our products and processes Great written and verbal communication skills in English. You are well structured and able to interact with stakeholders inside and outside the company   Your milestones:   By 1 month: You‚Äôve become knowledgeable to a high degree of our data structures, tools, and main challenges. You understand our business model well By 3 months: You‚Äôve become an important collaborator of the Product team, by generating insights, making recommendations and contributing to decision-making By 6+ months: You‚Äôve become a fully knowledgeable Product team member, that drives growth and helps shape Data Science within the organization   Why Laserhub?   A one-time opportunity to help build an exciting B2B business model with scaling potential We believe in fairness, transparency and helpfulness in everyday work Your personal development is important to us, therefore we promote the internal transfer of knowledge and strengthen your ‚Äúzone of genius‚Äù All our employees hold company shares in Laserhub You can arrange your working day according to your needs with flexible working hours, home office days and the No-Meeting-Wednesday   Location:  Stuttgart / remote | When do you start?  As soon as possible   If you would like to bring in new ideas and take ownership, our startup environment seems to be the perfect fit. Let‚Äôs upload your application via the ‚ÄúApply button‚Äù at the job ad on our careersite!   Laserhub GmbH, Neckarstr. 189-191, 70190 Stuttgart, [  www.laserhub.com ](http://www.laserhub.com/)

Title: Software Engineer - Python (d/f/m)
Description: We are looking for a Python engineer to join our SEO team in Munich and drive organic user acquisition of Stylight‚Äôs 16 domains. You will be inspired by talented colleagues from around the world.   ü§ì Curiosity is our compass!We support you in achieving your goals by providing you with an annual personal development budget and days as well as regular feedback sessions with your peers and manager.   üöÄ Always one step ahead!Bi-monthly Innovation Days foster knowledge sharing throughout the whole company.   üíª Hybrid Working Model:Balance is the key to our success! Through a mix of office, remote and semi-remote opportunities, we give you the ability to manage your own work and personal life.   ü§ô You are not alone!You will be assigned a buddy who will help you navigate through your first weeks of onboarding.   üç∫ Prost, Cheers, Salute !We celebrate our success in every language!     Want to know more? Check out:about.stylight.com andblog.stylight.com.     Up for the challenge?  If you want to work in a fun, exciting, challenging and dedicated environment, then don't hesitate and apply today via about.stylight.com/jobs. We're looking forward to reading your application (CV only is fine) in English! Your contact: Sebastian Breuer.

Qualifikationen   Du hast ein Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eines vergleichbaren Studiengangs Du besitzt mehrj√§hrige Erfahrung in Backend- (Spring Boot, Node.js) und Frontend-Entwicklung (Angular, React oder Vue.js) Du beherrschst bei git mehr als nur die Befehle push und pull Du bist vertraut in der Handhabung einschl√§giger DevOps-Tools (z.B. Title: Web Developer Full-Time, Saarbr√ºcken or Albuquerque
Description: YOUR MISSION    You will...   Work with other engineers to help architect, build and scale our set of web components and BBj Plugins Design and implement new features, enhancements, and optimizations Participate in technical discussions, research, and develop new innovative ways to improve our product Contribute to knowledge tools, communities, and documentation Employee support and induction     YOUR PROFILE    Ideally, you combine a certain number of the following skills:   5+ years of professional software development experience. You like working on complex systems for professional users? You like the work with international clients of various sizes and industries across Europe and North America? Then this position is for you!  BASIS Europe is the German subsidiary of BASIS International, headquartered in Albuquerque, NM (USA). We make Java-based tools for professional software development and support our customers with technical support, trainings and projects, and we develop complex apps and business applications for our customers.  Key benefits:   Training and qualification program Modern, open company culture with flat hierarchy and lean decisionmaking processes Flexible work hours, home office allowance Attractive, performance-oriented salary package Free beverages Parties and Events Jobticket program for public transport     ABOUT US    BASIS software and software tools have been used to develop business solutions for both international corporations and SMEs for over 30 years. More than 1.7 million users across the globe work with the IT solutions tailored to specific customer requirements by BASIS, or its clients and partners.  Operating its own sites in North America and Europe and working with partners in more than 30 countries, BASIS is well positioned on the international stage. The ‚Äúbig little software company‚Äù is privately owned and operated.    BASIS Europe is based in Saarbr√ºcken, Germany. From the European Development Center, BASIS creates modules and customer-specific solution components based on BBj, Java and other technologies, for easy integration with the heterogeneous software environments found in most companies today.

Title: Frontend Engineer (m/f/x)
Description: At koppla we want to enable the construction industry to deliver even their most complex projects with ease. By providing an intuitive, collaborative and data-driven scheduling tool we make staying on time fun.   We are a fast-growing B2B SaaS company that is looking for talent that wants to grow with us.   Tasks   You‚Äôll be contributing to the product's success by implementing features, code reviews, and discovering new solutions You‚Äôll work closely together with the Product Team, challenge them and help them develop our product roadmap and implement it on a large scale You'll improve our processes and bring your own ideas on how we can run even more efficiently and scale with ease.    Requirements    Minimum   You can decompose tricky problems and work towards a clean solution, by yourself or with teammates. Good knowledge of TypeScript, including concepts like asynchronous programming, closures, types, and modern build systems like Webpack, Vite, and Rollup Experience with at least one modern frontend framework (React, Vue, Angular, ...) and state management 3+ years of programming experience 3+ years of experience with web technologies: HTML, CSS, etc.    Preferred    Experience with VueJS and GraphQL You have experience creating components and component libraries, and are familiar with tools like Storybook, Tailwind Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a relevant technical field Experience with testing tools like Cypress, Jest, and Testing Library You have already worked in a SaaS company 5+ years of programming experience    Benefits    Company: We are solving real-world problems that can change an entire industry and have already shown that it works Growth: 1500‚Ç¨ learning budget per year to foster your personal growth and the growth opportunities of a startup Flexibility: flexible working times, the ability to work remotely, and a beautiful dog-friendly office in the heart of Potsdam (soon also in Berlin) Team: A smart, young, and highly motivated team Shares: participate in our success via stock options   Does that sound like the perfect environment, where you can personally and professionally get to the next level? Amazing! We are looking forward to receiving your application and getting to know you!

Title: Frontend Engineer - React Native (f/m/d)
Description:
Are you interested in shaping the future of mobility? Then come join us! At ioki we work towards mobility concepts that serve as a supplement to public transport, such as mobility analytics, autonomous driving and especially, demand responsive transportation services. We combine innovative and existing concepts to connect people and restore lost living space. With decades of experience provided by our parent company Deutsche Bahn and openness of an agile start-up, we are unique as ioki. Fascinated by the developments in the mobility industry? Then we should definitely meet! For our office in Frankfurt am Main we are looking for you as React Native Developer (m/f/d). These Will Be Your Tasks You develop and maintain our application as part of our React Native team. You ensure that the application lives up to our and your standards, performs well on the road and follows best practices. You will make technical decisions about the architecture and future development of the application. You will work closely together with our Design team to create the most delightful user experience. You will brainstorm with Product Management about upcoming features and improvements. You will learn new React Native, JavaScript and mobile technologies while working together in a highly motivated and experienced team.

Desired Skills and Experience

You have experience with modern JavaScript, its toolchain, and preferably React. You do not need previous experience with React Native, but it would be a plus. You have experience building client applications for HTTP APIs using RESTful JSON. You have a disciplined approach to development, testing, documentation and code structure in an agile, team-based environment. You have written tests to improve the design and quality of your code and see the value in automated testing. You are courageous and open for new things, you enjoy sharing your experience as well as spreading your enthusiasm. You are a communicative and open person. You have a very good knowledge of spoken and written English, because English is the company language in our international team. This Is What You Can Expect From Us A healthy work-life balance, diversity, a hands-on-mentality and agile work are not only a major part of our culture recorded in writing, but we also gladly live by. In addition to fair payment, we offer many social and fringe benefits: a job ticket, driving concessions in local and long-distance transport, company pension, company bike, sports and health offers, affordable holiday- and leisure activity offers and much more. We invest in your personal development: every year you have a fixed training budget at your disposal. We provide you with an experienced agile coach who offers you agile coaching adapted to your individual needs. With flexible working hours, home office days and choice of your software and hardware accordingly to the ioki standard, you are free to fully customize your working space. Our modern office is located in the heart of Frankfurt and therefore easily accessible. Working with us means meeting an absolutely dedicated and interdisciplinary team. Of course, coffee, tea, fresh fruits and even a candy bar are free for all of our employees to enjoy. Find out more about the ioki Devs and an overview of our Tech Stack in this podcast (German only).

Erfahre hier mehr zu unserem Bewerbungsprozess und erhalte Tipps f√ºr deine Bewerbung. Steig jetzt bei Capgemini ein und profitiere von unseren zahlreichen Benefits. Mehr Informationen zu den IT-Berufsfeldern bei Capgemini und unseren Standorten in Deutschland findest du auf unserer Karriereseite: capgemini.de/karriere   Informiere dich auf glassdoor und kununu, wie unsere Mitarbeiter*innen Capgemini als Arbeitgeber bewerten.

Title: Junior Android Engineer (all genders)
Description: Babbel is driven by a purpose: Creating mutual understanding through language. This means building an ecosystem of language learning offerings that helps people connect across cultures. Babbel, Babbel Live and Babbel for Business provide users with the most effective solution to be able to communicate with real people, in real situations.   The key is a blend of humanity and technology. More than 60,000 lessons across 14 languages are hand-crafted by 180+ linguists, with user behaviours continuously analysed to shape and tweak the learner experience. And it works: Studies with Yale University, City University of New York and Michigan State University prove its effectiveness. From headquarters in Berlin and New York, 750 people from more than 65 nationalities represent all the differences that make humans unique. Babbel is the most profitable language learning app worldwide, with more than 10 million subscriptions sold.   For more information, visit www.babbel.com or download the apps in the App Store or Play Store.   We are looking for an (Junior) Android Engineerto join our Experience Area in our office in Berlin, Germany!  In your role as Android Engineer  , your mission will be to change the future of language learning  .   You will work closely with the product & engineering managers, product & learner experience designers, subject matter experts, and cross-platform engineers to bring this mission to reality for Babbel learners.   You will:   Support in all phases of development like talking to our users, proposing solutions, implementing, reviewing, deploying, and testing Collaborate cross-functionally to inform API design and architectural decisions Maintain and make use of a good overview of the overall technology stack and infrastructure Independently focus on continuous learning and improvement and drive the evolution of our engineering practices   You have:   Have several complex Android apps behind you developed with Kotlin (RxKotlin, Compose), Java Have a testing mindset on many levels. You unit, integration, contract, and E2E test your code Analyse. Developing, supporting, and monitoring system, health, and performance metrics makes you sleep better when you're on 24x7 duty (voluntary with bonus pay) Know how to balance technical dept and delivery speed Love UX and working with design teams in a lean environment Have fluency in written and spoken English   Some perks of becoming a Babbelonian:   30 vacation days and flexible working hours BVG card or Swapfiets bike Jobbatical and Sabbatical options Many internal & external learning opportunities to choose from A yearly Learning & Development budget Full access to Babbel & Babbel Live classes Modern office in the heart of buzzing Berlin equipped with a family, music, faith and nap room Various internal communities to be part of including the Femgineers+, DEI Ambassadors, Accessibility & Disability Group and more   Diversity at Babbel  As part of our ongoing journey towards building a diverse, equitable and inclusive company, we welcome everyone to apply, especially those individuals who are underrepresented in tech. We are a learning company, inside and out, and we encourage you to apply even if you do not fit all the technical requirements - all candidates are assessed based on skills, qualifications and on our business needs. Please state your pronouns at the beginning of your application, and let us know if you‚Äôd like to be addressed by a name other than the one appearing on your official documents. If you have a disability or special need, feel welcome to inform us, so that we can provide you with the proper assistance in the application process.   Sounds good? We are already looking forward hearing from you! Check out our jobs page, our blog, and our techblog!

Title: Junior Frontend Developer (m/w/d) Stuttgart
Description: Du m√∂chtest gerne interaktive Web-Portale und -Anwendungen entwickeln? Am liebsten mit React oder Vue? Mit der geballten Erfahrung aus √ºber 20 Jahren realisieren wir E-Business-L√∂sungen f√ºr Kunden wie den FC Bayern M√ºnchen, Carl Zeiss, EDEKA, E.ON, Lieferando und Ravensburger.   diva-e besch√§ftigt rund 900 Mitarbeitende an insgesamt zehn Standorten in Deutschland, Bulgarien (Sofia) und den USA (Cincinnati). Besonders stolz sind wir auf unsere Unternehmenskultur.   Respekt, Vertrauen und Verantwortung werden in unseren Teams im t√§glichen Miteinander gelebt ‚Äì und das √ºber den Arbeitsplatz hinaus.   Zur Verst√§rkung unseres Teams suchen wir dich als   Junior Frontend Developer (m/w/d) in Stuttgart  unbefristet, in Vollzeit   Gemeinsam mit einem bunt gemischten Team aus CMS- und Applikationsentwicklern, UX und UI, SCRUM Coach und Product Ownern treibst du die Umsetzung anspruchsvoller Web-Projekte voran und hilfst unseren Kunden dabei, ihre Marke auf UX-optimierten   Oberfl√§chen online besser zu pr√§sentieren. Hier findest du einen √úberblick √ºber unsere Referenzprojekte in der Frontendentwicklung!   Was du bei uns machst   Du entwickelst mit deinen Kollegen moderne, interaktive und responsive Webportal- und Mikro-Frontends sowie Web-Applikationen und programmierst diese mit einem H√∂chstma√ü an Qualit√§t und Effizienz. Du arbeitest eng mit unserem Konzept- und UX-Team zusammen und unterst√ºtzt die Kollegen bei der Erstellung von Konzepten und der Architektur. Du unterst√ºtzt au√üerdem bei der Pflege und Weiterentwicklung bestehender Portale und Applikationen sowie bei der Erstellung von Aufwandssch√§tzungen. In der Frontendentwicklung gehst du gerne neue Wege und stellst auch Altbew√§hrtes infrage. Den daf√ºr notwendigen Freiraum bieten wir dir gerne!   Wann du zu uns passt   Du bist ein echter Teamplayer. Einer f√ºr alle, alle f√ºr einen ‚Äì das ist dein und unser Motto. Du bringst ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Wirtschafts-/Medieninformatik, Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation mit. Au√üerdem hast du schon erste Erfahrungen mit Frontend-Technologien wie z.B. CSS, HTML oder Javascript sowie mit Frontend-Frameworks wie React oder Vue sammeln k√∂nnen. Du bist kommunikationsstark, mindestens auf Deutsch. Gutes Englisch ist w√ºnschenswert. Technologische Neuerungen sind dir eine Freude, keine Last. Du hast den Willen, zu lernen, dich kontinuierlich weiterzuentwickeln ‚Äì und dein Wissen weiterzugeben. Dabei unterst√ºtzen wir dich gerne mit einer Vielzahl an Weiterbildungsma√ünahmen und internen Angeboten!    Was du von uns hast    Deine Erfolgsmomente sind unsere Inspiration. Bei uns bist du Mensch ‚Äì und keine Nummer!  Wir legen sehr hohen Wert auf einen freundschaftlich-kollegialen, aber auch ehrlichen Umgang miteinander. Respekt, Vertrauen und Verantwortung werden bei uns gro√ügeschrieben. Ellenbogenmentalit√§t findest du bei uns nicht. Jedes Projekt bringt neue, spannende Herausforderungen mit sich. Wir wissen, dass wir diese erfolgreich nur im Team meistern und helfen uns daher gegenseitig. Das gemeinsame Arbeiten, Aust√ºfteln, Umdenken, Umsetzen und Optimieren macht uns Spa√ü und wir lernen jeden Tag dazu. Bei uns gewinnen die besten Ideen und deine sind uns jederzeit willkommen. Deine Work-Life-Balance nehmen wir sehr ernst. Viele von uns haben gerade eine Familie gegr√ºndet oder zeitintensive Hobbys. Wir glauben, dass ausgeglichene Mitarbeiter das Team deutlich weiterbringen, als wenn wir ihnen √úberstunden aufb√ºrden. Daher achten wir darauf, dass diese m√∂glichst gar nicht erst anfallen, setzen dich auf m√∂glichst wenigen Projekten parallel ein und unterst√ºtzen dich beim eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten ‚Äì und im Umgang mit deinen eigenen Ressourcen.   Deine Vorteile   Flexible Arbeitszeiten: Wir tun alles daf√ºr, damit du Privatleben und Beruf unter einen Hut bringen kannst. Freie Zeiteinteilung und mobiles Arbeiten geh√∂ren dazu. Hardware frei w√§hlbar: Bei uns kannst du die Hardware, mit der du arbeiten m√∂chtest, aus unserem Hardwarekatalog frei w√§hlen. Fachwissen: Wir haben einen sehr hohen Anspruch an die Qualit√§t unserer Frontendentwicklung und an die Fortbildung unserer Mitarbeiter. Deswegen gibt es auch‚Ä¶ Weiterbildung satt: Ob interne Chapter Sessions, Hackathons, die diva-e Akademie oder der Besuch von Konferenzen und Barcamps ‚Äì f√ºr deine Weiterbildung tun wir alles und sind dabei offen f√ºr deine W√ºnsche.   Du passt zu uns? Dann bewirb dich!  Du hast Lust auf tolle Kunden, mit denen du spannende Web-Projekte realisieren kannst? Du bl√ºhst bei Teamwork erst so richtig auf? Du brennst f√ºr das, was du tust und wagst dich aus der eigenen Komfortzone? Du willst unsere Zukunft aktiv mitgestalten? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!  Ein Anschreiben ben√∂tigen wir nicht, aber wir sind schon neugierig, was dich an dieser Stelle interessiert. Nach Bewerbungseingang melden wir uns schnellstm√∂glich bei dir. Passt der erste Eindruck, findet ein erstes Gespr√§ch in der Regel schon innerhalb einer Woche statt. Und wenn da die Chemie stimmt, machen wir einen zweiten Termin, in dem du im Rahmen einer kleinen Fallstudie deine fachlichen Skills unter Beweis stellen und das Team und deine Arbeitsumgebung kennen lernen kannst.   Du hast noch Fragen?  Fragen zum Bewerbungsablauf beantwortet dir Sandra Rang aus dem HR-Team. Sie freut sich auf deinen Anruf +49 89 954590 33 oder deine E-Mail an hr@diva-e.com! Vernetze dich gerne direkt auf XING oder Linkedin mit ihr oder schau dir an, was Mitarbeiter und Bewerber auf kununu √ºber uns sagen.

Title: JavaScript UI Engineer (m/f/x)
Description: Introduction   At Dedrone we‚Äôre building high performance distributed sensor systems for drone detection, identification and mitigation. Our sensors are state-of-the-art computing devices which use signal processing and machine learning to detect and identify drones and communicate with our cloud-based platform for sensor data fusion, alerting, reporting and analytics.   We are looking for an expert in JavaScript UI development. You will join a team of experts for UI, API and backend development and help architect and build our future solutions for drone detection. You will be working on the UI for our DedroneTracker software, our internal tools as well as help creating our new cloud-based solution.    Responsibilities    Architecting, developing and maintaining JavaScript-based web applications Writing UI-relevant backend code for data aggregation and transfer in Java Working with our field engineers to analyse and solve UI issues coming up during day-to-day use of our system Writing and maintaining tooling for day-to-day development in Python Peer-reviewing your colleagues‚Äò JavaScript code Documenting your work in a SCRUM-based issue management system    Qualifications    At least 5 years of experience in professionally designing and writing code in JavaScript Good working knowledge in JavaScript (ECMAScript 2015+), HTML5, REST, CSS3 Knowledge of object-oriented programming and software design patterns Experience with web technologies such as Qooxdoo, Websockets, WebGL, WebAssembly Experience in other programming languages (e.g. C/C++, Java, Python) is a plus Degree in computer science or similar field or experienced autodidact Basic Linux CLI knowledge Experience with agile methods in software development   We offer   At Dedrone, you can expect to work in a startup-like atmosphere, expect excitement, and expect tasks that are diverse in nature. We‚Äôre a highly-qualified, international team that‚Äôs passionate about what it does and where it wants to go. Our hierarchies are flat and we offer plenty of room for individual ideas to develop. We are quick in our decision-making and like to keep our processes lean. We also offer permanent positions from day one, flexible working hours, joint events, fresh fruit, sweets, refreshments and much more like a match at the table soccer.

Title: Full-Stack Developer Nodejs / React / Flutter / PHP at M.E.N. Media Entertainment Networks GmbH
Description: Wir die M.E.N. Media Entertainment Networks GmbH   entwickeln gemeinsam im Team und mit unseren Kunden Apps im TV und Medienbereich. Wir arbeiten an innovativen Projekten und suchen zum n√§chstm√∂glichen Zeitpunkt zur Verst√§rkung unseres Teams einen Full-Stack Developer Nodejs / React / Flutter / PHP (m/w/d). Title: Flutter developer (m/w/d) (48_CL_6_4)
Description: For our partner we are looking for a Flutter developer for their location in Rostock.   What are your tasks?   Developing mobile applications in a user-centred fashion using in an agile environment You actively create ideas on how the product(s) can improve in features and usability. You communicate your ideas to the product development team. For this you actively exchange with our other teams about the needs and pains of our target group. You aim to understand our customers. -You will design, discuss, maintain and continuously improve the code structures of our product, based on the requirements of our business logic. You ensure that the development is always flexible, stable, and future-proof. -You help shape which technologies and services we use and communicate technical issues clearly inside the team. -You collaborate with the product team about your ideas and proposals and you work as a team towards a common goal. -You ensure a code base that complies with best practices of good code and modern standards. What can you expect? -State-of-the-art Tech-Stack -Impact. As a Flutter Engineer, you‚Äôll have a major influence on our user‚Äôs experience. Your opinion matters, regarding the future composition of our tech stack and tools. We maintain short decision paths from idea to implementation. -Personal Growth. Continuous learning is the basis for personal growth. We allow working hours for free employment with desired topics. We pay for courses and training. -Purpose. We help companies become more digital and secure. We create the infrastructure for modern organizations and New Work approaches. -Team. You will work with an international team of developers, designers, product managers and testers, who strive to win together. You will find progressive and open-minded people around you.   What do we expect from you? -Above all, yourself, authentic and clear. The following points describe our idea of the characteristics that make a great flutter developer. Maybe you convince us in a different way. We like to avoid stereotypes. -Passion and Energy for amazing user interfaces. Your enthusiasm for clear, engaging and powerful user interfaces is contagious. You understand UI design as a collaborative process, which you would enjoy being part of. You are satisfied only when support gets obsolete due to amazing usability. -Passion for good code. Efficient, well-structured, understandable, exciting to read. Like a good story. We understand that this is an art ‚Äì and we appreciate that. Like a user interface, code should be self-explaining. -Ideally, 2 years of professional experience in framework-supported front-end development with modern web technologies (e.g. Flutter, Angular, Ionic, etc.) -You have experience working with Android or IOS development -You are comfortable writing code in at least one of the following languages: Java, Kotlin and Swift -You are comfortable working in an agile environment (SCRUM or KANBAN) -Precise Communication Skills. You express yourself clearly. You like to share and discuss ideas and you listen to colleagues as well. Because software development is teamwork. -Empathy for customers and target groups. To implement amazing user experiences you should be able to put yourself into the user‚Äôs perspective. You should strive to continuously improve your understanding of our target group. -Conversational English Skills. It is the primary working language of our international development team. -Progressivity. Strong interest in future-oriented technology and the start-up scene. -Education. A master‚Äôs degree or similar in IT or any software development thematically related courses. If not, feel free to explain why you have a broad background in Software and IT in any other form. -You have experience with Unit Testing and CI systems (a big plus) What do we NOT care about? Your age, your gender, your appearance, your clothes, your origin, your religion.

Title: Full Stack Developer
Description: Vanilla Steel is a new digital B2B platform serving the European steel industry supported by data and innovation with the mission of simplifying how steel and other metals are traded today. We offer an e-auction platform where sellers list new material weekly and buyers can bid for it.  We are a team of passionate tech entrepreneurs that combine more than 50 years of digital experiences with a passion for solving existing challenges through digitization.  It is an exciting time to join Vanilla Steel as we recently raised financing from the best European VCs to grow our tech team to build a world-class product and we are looking for a Full Stack Developer to join our tech team. The role is based in Berlin.  We are looking for someone who is self-driven and ambitious, and with solid experience in frameworks like HTML, CSS and JQuery on the Front-end and Golang and Node.js on the Back-end.  Tasks  As Full Stack Developer, you will be responsible for delivering a truly innovative digital experience for our users by leveraging best in-class solutions and technologies..   Design, develop and optimize data structures, features and backend endpoints Build stable, secure and maintainable code Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability. Develop high-leverage user-facing features to optimize UX Provide high-quality graphics and visual elements. Work closely with a small agile development team.    Requirements    4+ years Full Stack development experience You worked on at least one published project like a marketplace or platform Proven expert in Golang, PostgreSQL, Google Cloud, Docker, Git Proficiency with HTML/CSS, Javascript, Node.js, Web Components Test-driven development is not new Solid experience working in an agile development environment, remotely and on-site Passion for clean code Strong understanding of different software development practices, infrastructure, and how each can help bring more value to customers Self-starter, able to deliver projects on time meeting high quality standards Strong analytical and critical thinking Good verbal and written communication skills Proficiency in English; German language skills is a plus    Benefits    Unique opportunity to join a promising Berlin B2B start-up as an early employee Work closely with an experienced Founder team Unrivalled autonomy with flexible schedules and ownership Open and fun shared working environment/culture Office located in the heart of Berlin. Laptop assigned. Apple/Linux/Windows. Competitive compensation with equity incentives

Title: Frontend Developer (all genders)

Title: Full Stack Developer (w/m/x)
