Title: Frontend Engineer (f/m/d)
Description: Your mission   Be part of a highly motivated, product-focused and customer-obsessed team. Build scalable APIs and reliable 3rd party integrations with our financial partners. Fully own your product, from system design to infra operations. Work side by side with the CTO in a tight-knit, agile, inclusive team. Engage in the team‚Äôs problem space and actively participate in the shaping of technical and architectural solutions. Be an ambassador for your products, while dealing with both internal and external customers. Promote a culture of knowledge sharing and mutual trust.   Your profile  What will make you succeed:   The capacity to deliver quality results while understanding the business demands of a very fast-paced fintech start-up. You have already some experience dedicated to building single-page applications and integrating with REST and/or GraphQL APIs. Proudly own your product, from the whiteboard to development, to testing and delivering. Wholehearted passion for engineering, namely building clean and reusable web components (e.g., React, Vue). Experience with styling technologies (e.g., Tailwind, Tachyons, Styled components/system, Sass). Love for amazing UX and the capacity to evolve our design system. Familiarity with cloud technologies (e.g., Docker, AWS). Easiness with tooling, such as package managers (e.g., webpack, npm, yarn), integrating with CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab), user metrics and analytics. Having a commitment to efficiency and automation. To think big and to elevate the team along with yourself. Always aim for high standards! Industry experience in banking, financing or payments is a plus. Experience with server-side rendering and state management is also a plus. A valid work permit for Germany.   Our offer   A competitive salary and participation in our share options programme. This is a full-time position for our office in Berlin. We offer the possibility to work remote (within Germany), or from our cosy office in the centre of Berlin. Our team stands out: here, you will get to work with a team of seasoned industry experts that still strive to learn every day. By joining us as an early employee, you will have unrivalled autonomy and ownership of engineering at Banxware. The tools you need to do your job: your choice of laptop, operating system, productivity software and desk set-up. Potential to grow into a senior role as we continue to extend our team quickly.   _ _You belong here  We are big fans of diversity. At Banxware, everyone is accepted, included and celebrated, irrespective of their sexual orientation, culture, gender, religion, physical ability or the absence of any of these.   We encourage people without degrees to apply - we believe what you‚Äôve worked on and achieved is way more important (if you could include your GitHub profile or a link to your portfolio that would be great!)   We encourage the Women in Tech community actively to apply: our Co-Founder Miriam is the role model in this respect.__

Title: Junior Frontend Developer (m/w/d) Leipzig

Was du bei uns machst   Du entwickelst mit deinen Kollegen moderne, interaktive und responsive Webportal- und Mikro-Frontends sowie Web-Applikationen und programmierst diese mit einem H√∂chstma√ü an Qualit√§t und Effizienz. Wann du zu uns passt   Du bist ein echter Teamplayer. Einer f√ºr alle, alle f√ºr einen ‚Äì das ist dein und unser Motto. Du bist kommunikationsstark, mindestens auf Deutsch. Gutes Englisch ist w√ºnschenswert. Technologische Neuerungen sind dir eine Freude, keine Last. Du hast den Willen, zu lernen, dich kontinuierlich weiterzuentwickeln ‚Äì und dein Wissen weiterzugeben. Dabei unterst√ºtzen wir dich gerne mit einer Vielzahl an Weiterbildungsma√ünahmen und internen Angeboten!    Was du von uns hast    Deine Erfolgsmomente sind unsere Inspiration. Bei uns bist du Mensch ‚Äì und keine Nummer!  Wir legen sehr hohen Wert auf einen freundschaftlich-kollegialen, aber auch ehrlichen Umgang miteinander. Respekt, Vertrauen und Verantwortung werden bei uns gro√ügeschrieben. Ellenbogenmentalit√§t findest du bei uns nicht. Jedes Projekt bringt neue, spannende Herausforderungen mit sich. Wir wissen, dass wir diese erfolgreich nur im Team meistern und helfen uns daher gegenseitig. Du brennst f√ºr das, was du tust und wagst dich aus der eigenen Komfortzone? Du willst unsere Zukunft aktiv mitgestalten? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!  Ein Anschreiben ben√∂tigen wir nicht, aber wir sind schon neugierig, was dich an dieser Stelle interessiert. Nach Bewerbungseingang melden wir uns schnellstm√∂glich bei dir. Und wenn da die Chemie stimmt, machen wir einen zweiten Termin, in dem du im Rahmen einer kleinen Fallstudie deine fachlichen Skills unter Beweis stellen und das Team und deine Arbeitsumgebung kennen lernen kannst. Du kannst nicht alle unsere Anforderungen erf√ºllen? Das sollte Dich nicht davon abhalten, Dich trotzdem zu bewerben. Nicht zuletzt stehen bei uns Begeisterungsf√§higkeit und der Wille sich in verschiedene Fachgebiete einzuarbeiten im Vordergrund.   Wir leben Vielfalt und Chancengleichheit und freuen uns deshalb nat√ºrlich √ºber Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung. Alle personenbezogenen Formulierungen in dieser Stellenanzeige sind geschlechtsneutral zu betrachten.

Title: Software Engineer JavaScript Backend (m/f/d)
Description: We are looking for a  Software Engineer JavaScript Backend (m/f/d)  Work from Berlin, Verl, Tallinn, Amsterdam or any of our other locations within Europe   Key Responsibilities And Main Tasks    Develop decision workflows and business logic on the workflow engine that forms the core of our risk decision platform in the area of e-commerce and payments Design, modeling and automation of processes for credit risk assessment and fraud prevention Integration of third-party APIs and machine learning models Work within an agile, cross-functional development team Contribute to various business analysis activities from conceptualizing new features with stakeholders over technical solution design to specifying acceptance criteria and final acceptance testing Support quality assurance, test automation and release management    Skills And Qualifications    Successfully completed studies in software engineering, computer science or a comparable qualification Professional experience in software or workflow development, in particular in the area of e-commerce and payments Excellent skills in programming JavaScript and integrating services via JSON REST APIs Good understanding of modern cloud infrastructures Familiarity with agile software development practices and processes Experience in process modeling (BPMN or similar) Knowledge of data analysis with SQL and GraphQL Good analytical skills and a proactive and solution-oriented approach Fluency in English as the main working language    We Offer You    Flexibility: We support you with flexible working time models and opportunities to work mobile up to 80% of your working time within the country you are employed. Training & Development: Develop your professional skills and your personality in a fast-growing international company. With our very own Bertelsmann University you get access to over 4,000 e-learning and training offers and exclusive nanodegree programs from Silicon Valley. Diversity: We support diversity in the company - in every regard. International team spirit: You will have fantastic colleagues from different areas and spread within Europe. We work together, solve problems together and celebrate success! The feel-good factor: We hold annual Christmas parties, summer parties and after-work parties for our employees (in times of Covid-19 we for sure switched to virtual formats...). Valuable benefits: We offer you a competitive salary and benefit scheme.    Who We Are    Let's be honest, finance is complicated.   So we at Arvato Financial Solutions are proud to be guiding international as well as renowned local companies through the complex world of cash flows. Whether our customers sell shoes in e-commerce or offer telecommunications services, our services ensure efficient credit management for the best possible financial performance. Our approximately 7,000 employees solve new challenges in payments and complex data riddles every day, and do so cleverly, analytically and with an eye for every little detail as that is our DNA. We are seeking colleagues who want to take an active part in this - whether they are young professional, IT specialists, data analysts, advisers, managers or lateral entrants. And thanks to our presence in around 20 countries with a focus on Europe and America, there will usually be the right job available nearby.   Innovate Yourself.   AfterPay  At AfterPay we have a clear goal: to be the leading partner for pay-after-delivery solutions in the European e-commerce market. A central part of our strategy is a convenient and safe payment process via   the AfterPay portal requiring just a few finger taps. Whether by invoice, direct debit or instalment payments ‚Äì customers decide how and when they want to pay and are provided with many innovative tools. AfterPay is clearly focused on the wishes and needs of its users: our highest aim is customer satisfaction, with which we want to achieve long-term, successful customer loyalty.    We Keep What We Promise    Find more information and other interesting positions at www.innovateyourself.de  Are you already convinced? Then we look forward to your online application with CV, salary expectations  and the earliest possible start date  .   We look forward to applications from candidates who contribute to the diversity of our company. We relate diversity in particular to the dimensions of cultural or social origin, religion, age, disability, gender and sexual identity.   Company:  Arvato infoscore GmbH   Country:  Deutschland   State/Region:  Berlin   City:  Berlin   Postal Code:  10623   ID:  206521   Datum: 05.06.2022    Standort    Berlin, BE, DE, 10623   Jobsegment:  Test Engineer, Software Engineer, Testing, Cloud, Fraud Prevention, Engineering, Technology, Security

Title: Software Engineer, Control Systems - Cell Engineering (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
Description: What To Expect    Tesla is accelerating the world's transition to sustainable energy. Revolutionary strategies and products were developed within a few years and successfully launched on a large scale. This is only possible through extraordinary speed, innovation and efficiency. Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg forms the perfect basis for rolling out Tesla's incredible success story in Europe. The most important pillar for this are our employees. Their passion, motivation and engagement ensure that we achieve our goals. We are looking for you to continue and expand this success story together.    What You‚Äôll Do    Cell Controls Engineering team is looking for a Software Automation Engineer to join our team. You will help to ensure the great quality of our equipment management software for current and next-generation application design. As a Software Automation Engineer the primary responsibility will be automated control processes that have never been automated before. You will work with the Automation Control team to plan, design, develop and execute the automated process, validate and deploy with the engineering team to the production line.    What You‚Äôll Bring    Familiarity in a major programming language such as Java, C#, Python, Swift, Go, and strong scripting skills in at least one common language (JavaScript, ASP, JSP, PHP, Tcl, etc.). Have a strong understanding of software fundamentals including software design, CI/CD, algorithm development, data structures, code modularity, and maintainability. Demonstrate strong understanding of testing concepts including white box and black box testing, regression testing, performance testing, etc. Strong attention to detail Experience with GIT and version controls system, development workflow. Experience with system profiling or static code analysis tools a plus Qualifications B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or Computer Engineering Programming expertise in Golang/Java/Python/C#/JavaScript Experience in technology software product, manufacturing/hardware not required Software Engineering, Data Structures and Algorithms Able to demonstrate role in a large-scale software development project Data Science, Data Analytics, Data Modeling Apache Spark/Hadoop MySQL JupyterHub/Python MapReduce TensorFlow, Pandas GraphQL, REST API Additional Preferences: Familiar with Industrial PC/PLC controller and development environment like Beckhoff and Siemens Familiar with CAD simulation tools like Dassault Systemes 3DX Delmia or Siemens Process Simulate Familiar with industrial robot like Fanuc and KUKA robot Knowledge of WinAppDriver and/or Selenium Web Browser Automation and scripting Knowledge of HTML, XML, PHP, Perl, TCL, Angular programming/scripting languages is plus Self-motivated and able to work under minimal supervision Willingness and ability to learn new technologies and take on different assignments

Title: Fullstack Javascript Developer (w/m/d)
Description: K√ºchenheld Tech disrupts the kitchen industry developing tools to allow employee and customer centric processes.   Who We Are Looking For    A passionate coder, who is curious and always longs for learning something new, A dependable person, who trust us and who we can rely on, A creative mind that always looks for alternative tools and approaches to develop our stack, and A team player, who is looking for a great team to belong to.   Ideally, you have more than two years of experience working in a predominantly JavaScript-driven environment. If you are at the start of your career or switched stacks, we would still love to hear from you. Here are some of the things we look out for:   At least 1 year experience in ReactJS / Node.js Understanding of the RESTful/GraphQL architecture Experience working with relational and NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis,...) Mastery of TypeScript and React.js Experience with JavaScript ES5/ES6+, HTML5, CSS3 Familiarity with any server frameworks (ExpressJS/NestJS/SailsJS,...) Familiarity with any UI frameworks (AntD, Bootstrap, MaterialUI, ‚Ä¶)   Our current challenges  After starting to operate in 2019, we quickly grew to more than 150 employees and are now the fastest growing kitchen retailer in Europe. All of this growth is enabled and supported by a variety of internal and external tools. To support and accelerate our growth we need to continue to deliver intuitive and robust web-based solutions.    Who We Are    We are a great team of different backgrounds (coding, data science, mathematics, business studies, product design) who enjoy working together and helping each other to become the best we can be. We are dedicated to the team and keep it a safe space where everybody can follow his heart, speak his mind, and thus excel. We help each other if we fail and party together if we shine.   Your tasks  Your tasks will depend on your interests and your qualification. Currently we image your tasks to be:   Collaborate with project managers to scope and refine product ideas Technically review and refine tickets Implement new features across our products Review code from freelancers and junior developers Support users with technical questions    What We Expect From You In An Interview    Depending on your background and experience, develop an opinion about our current challenges on an appropriate level, so we can have a fun and thriving discussion about it.    What You Can Expect In Your Job    You will join a compassionate team, on which you can rely, so you can grow on the challenges we will face together. We offer you the flexibility and the resources you need to be your best and accompany on your journey.   Wer wir sind:  K√ºchenheld ist das smarte K√ºchenstudio von heute. Wir durchbrechen die klassische Art des K√ºchenverkaufs und setzen auf Effizienz, Transparenz und Fairness sowohl f√ºr unsere Kunden als auch unsere KollegInnen. Mit modernster Technik und pers√∂nlicher Beratung bieten wir unseren Kunden ein einzigartiges Kauferlebnis Ihrer Traumk√ºche. Klingt spannend? Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung inklusive Deines gew√ºnschten Eintrittsdatums an recruitment@kuechenheld.de. Deine Ansprechpartnerin ist Anna aus dem People & Culture Team.

Title: Software Developer (f/m/d)
Description: OCELL‚Äòs software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of hectares of forestry are managed by introducing data-based decision making to improve health and carbon storage capacity. Our products need to handle information at massive scale and extend well beyond classical geodata applications. We are looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system   design, networking and data storage, artificial intelligence, UI design and mobile. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to OCELL‚Äôs needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full stack as we continue to push technology forward. We believe that, in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services. We hire people who are smart and passionate, and we favor ability and willingness to learn over experience. We are hiring full time positions as well as part time positions for students that are currently enrolled in a master‚Äôs degree.   Aufgaben   Responsibilities    Utilize your expertise to engage in and enhance the development of our product‚Äôs software components in all fields of software engineering Collaborate on scalability issues involving large scale data and processing Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve software   Qualifikation   Minimum Qualifications    Bachelor‚Äòs degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience Experience in coding Python, Dart or JavaScript Ability to speak and write in English fluently Ability to work in a small and agile team with quick decision making    Preferred Qualifications    Experience with Flutter Experience with additional general purpose programming languages, such as: Kotlin, Swift, Typescript Strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design Experience with AWS and containerized processing workflows Experience with Git, software testing and release processes    Benefits    Benefits   We want our employees to benefit from the success of this company and thus involve you not only with salary but also with virtual shares Central location, with great startup vibes Once the pandemic allows it, we‚Äôre going back to regular team activities outdoors Have a large influence in the development of a meaningful solution to an urgent topic for humanity   Our Corporate Culture   OCELL is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender.

Title: Frontend Developer (f/m/x)
Description: Hello  We are looking for an experienced and passionate Frontend Developer to join our team in Berlin.   Please apply now if you have a strong passion for UI/UX and a very good understanding for fonts, designs and details.   What will you do?  Your day-to-day tasks include:   Building the next generation products which are efficient and reliable. Building UIs for end-user facing e-commerce sites, mobile first. Develop high quality User Interfaces for e-commerce partners to configure experiences. Working closely with the project management team to groom stories in an Agile environment.   Who are you?  The must:   3+ years of experience using modern frameworks such as React and Typescript. In-depth understanding of JavaScript frameworks/libraries, HTML5 and CSS. Demonstrated passion for user experience, improve usability and performance. Excellent communication skills in English (both written and spoken). Experience working in Agile environment. Problem solving skills and strong analytical skills. Bachelor‚Äôs/Master‚Äôs in Computer Science or related field.   The preferred:   Familiarity working with backend APIs (REST, JSON). Experience with Figma is a plus. Experience using AXIOS and REDUX.   Don‚Äôt match the above but still think you‚Äôd be a great fit? Apply anyway and let us know why you‚Äôre the right person for the job!   Who are we?  We are banbutsu ‚Äì the platform that connects everything under the sun. We are a digital technology and innovation company from Berlin connecting mobility, retail, services, logistics and IoT on our platform to create unique customer moments, enable new business synergies and unlock additional revenue streams. Most of the work which we do is green field design and development, not maintaining legacy systems. Our software-intelligence makes data driven decisions for relevant and contextual situations, and transforms individual products, services, and functional offers into cohesive user experiences! We consist of a small, dynamic and hands-on team with access to a gigantic network.   Joining banbutsu and therefore iconmobile group and WPP means you'll not only have access to the latest technologies - you‚Äôll play a hand in leveraging them for our Fortune 500 clients and join a global collective of more than 200 people with the common goal of doing incredible work for our clients!   What's in it for you?  Continuous development  is a key component of innovation  and since our people are our greatest strength, we know how important it is to provide development opportunities. banbutsu offers a substantial annual budget for skill training and expansion  . Also, you will have the chance to build a new brand, to work with new and exciting technologies and implement your ideas in many fields and areas. With so much diversity in the work we do, it‚Äôs nearly impossible not to learn something new every day - whatever your role.   Everything we do at banbutsu aims to support our employees in their pursuits in and out of the office. With  flexible working hours, ambitious and  bright colleagues and an innovative international environment, we allow our employees the chance to define their own authentic  work-life balance and help us stay innovative and forward-thinking. As we work hard and we strive for excellence, we also do our best to make our employees feel happy ‚Äì therefore we provide access to a  host of discounts, perks and deals coupled with  27+ days of paid vacation.__   Interested?  If you strive for excellence and love to collaborate in an international environment with some very cool people, then this might be the job for you! Click on the apply button and submit your application together with your salary expectations and start date as soon as possible. In case you have any questions, please don‚Äôt hesitate to contact us via recruiting@icongroup.com__

Deine Weiterentwicklung liegt uns sehr am Herzen. Wir bieten interne und individuelle Aus- und Weiterbildungsm√∂glichkeiten und unterst√ºtzen dich und deine Karriere auf dem Weg zum Next-Level. Zudem bieten wir dir eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge, eine dienstliche sowie private Unfallversicherung, die Teilnahme am Corporate Benefits-Programm, Beratungs- und Unterst√ºtzungsleistungen des VIVA Familienservices, mind. 28 Tage Urlaub und unz√§hlige weitere Mitarbeiter-Benefits. Description: At IONOS, the leading European provider of cloud infrastructure, cloud services and hosting services, you will work together with a wide range of teams. We are characterized by open structures, a friendly working culture and flat hierarchies with a strong team spirit. Title: Developer Full Stack (m/f/d)
Description: Who We Are    We develop software that promotes ideas and innovations in companies. This way, we help to open product development and make it collaborative. All relevant actors inside and outside the company can contribute directly.   Since the beginning of 2021, we are part of the French Questel Group. Together, we are pursuing our vision worldwide. To do this, we are always on the lookout for talents like you.   Aufgaben   Your Responsibilities    As a developer at innosabi you plan and develop new features for our software together with the Product and Customer Success Management Team. Instead of reporting directly to the customer, you will report to these teams. You will work in 2-week sprints and with Jira. We offer you the chance to work in the areas that interest you most. Every developer has access to our codebase, so we celebrate well structured and readable code in a special way! We review all changes to the code, but automatic testing is also mandatory. Besides the further development of the software, every developer shapes the technical vision and our stack of the future. More important than knowing a lot is the willingness to learn.   Qualifikation   What Sets You Apart    A minimum of 3 years of relevant professional experience   Secure handling of PHP, Doctrine, MySQL and JavaScript/Typescript Experience with MVC frameworks ‚Äì ideally with Symfony Knowledge of modern web applications ‚Äì ideally with Angular Know-how on best practices and standards Infinite thirst for knowledge and willingness to learn Fluency in English (spoken & written) ‚Äì best case you also speak German    Benefits    What to expect   An open and enthusiastic team that celebrates individuality and nerdiness Work-life balance through flexible working hours and flex office Company-wide & team-internal onboarding of new employees with the help of an own mentor Open and friendly communication across all levels as well as short decision-making processes The opportunity to try out new things and quickly take over responsibilities A steep learning curve in topics such as innovation management and innovation management software The chance to help shape not only innosabi processes, but digitalization as a whole Great location and a beautiful old office building in the heart of Munich ‚Äì directly at the Friedensengel   Your application  Sounds good?Show us who you are and tell us more about your skills.   We are looking forward to your application including:   ‚Äì CV‚Äì Cover letter‚Äì Certificates & references   ‚Äì Date of entry   ‚Äì Salary expectation   ‚Äì Source code or links to your GitHub profile highly appreciated

Title: Front End Web Developer (m/w/d)
Description: EMPOWERING PEOPLE TO BRING CREATIVE IDEAS TO LIFE   The Creative Club is the digital company behind Europe`s largest Do It Yourself platforms. In addition to stoffe.de and makerist.de, we conquer the international market with 13 more online shops and are on our way to become the global market leader.   With more than 40.000 DIY products and 70.000 pieces of online content, we offer a unique portfolio for our creative fans and inspire our community every day with exciting topics, ideas, special knowledge and expert tips.   We are looking for people who want to make a difference and revolutionize the DIY world with us. We do not have a 9 to 5 job for you with the same routine very day. We want to realize ideas, question and rethink processes, start unique projects and create a sustainable customer impact. We want to inspire, move forward and bring creative ideas to life. We offer flexibility and the possibility to adapt your job to your life.   Sounds interesting?   Join the club, get creative!   ‚Üí Your job ‚Üê   As our Specialist (m/f/d) for the Salesforce Commerce Cloud Development, you are working closely with our product owner aswell as with our cross functional team to design and engineer solutions, meeting customer B2C Commerce requirements. You design, code, unit test and code review iterative improvements to our platforms, aswell as improve and maintain the engineering guidelines. By staying current with digital commerce technology you support your team while your focus is on engineering and delivering new B2C commerce capabilities. To site the release strategy you drive technical process improvements and reduce technical complexion. You translate business and marketing challenges into well-designed solutions. Furthermore you understand the ins and outs of complex technology environments and know how to optimize solutions for efficiency and simplicity.  ‚Üí Your skills ‚Üê   You are holding a bachelors degree in computer science or a related education or degree or a similar qualification. You bring at least 4 years hands-on experience in web technologies including: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSON, AJAX, XML, web services (grpc/REST Apis), and open source packages/libraries. Knowledge of digital commerce components such as users, catalog, pricing, inventory and payment is a must. You are familiar with git source control and collaboration tool such as JIRA, Confluence and in addition have knowledge of digital commerce integration such as CMS, DAM, PIM, OMS, and ERP. Experience with web frameworks, interactive web development, responsive web design would be an advantage, aswell as an extensive development knowledge especially around Web Development is a plus. In addition you have experience with agile development methodology, site speed optimization and working knowledge of secure development practices. Knowledge in salesforce is a plus, but not a must. Ideally you are fluent in English and German.  ‚Üí You are important ‚Üê   We don't just offer you a job, but the opportunity to combine your passion with this job and make your ideas become reality.   You benefit from the most modern organizational structures that adapt ideally to your life situation, fast processes in cross-functional teams, a steep learning curve due to a lot of personal responsibility and flexible working hours with a stored overtime credit system. We are offering a permanent contract with 28 days of vacation leave. Your health is important to us. That is why we offer you yoga courses, subsidize your Urban Sports Club membership and provide regional fruit in the office. We subsidize your Job Ticket Ticket, but we also have very good parking facilities in front of the door in Schenefeld near Hamburg. You can take our internal language courses for German and English. We celebrate our flat hierarchies and are aware that we can only grow, if our employees grow too. That is why we attach great importance to training, conventions, congresses, meet-ups, etc. We love our corporate culture and your individuality. We actively position ourselves against any kind of discrimination and for equal opportunities and fairness. And of course we do have awesome team events ‚Äì because success has to be celebrated!  ‚Üí Do you want to join the club? ‚Üê   Then apply now via our online form.   Your contact person is Denise.   For more information about The Creative Club, check out thecreativeclub.com and stoffe.de. If you have any questions about the position or your application, feel free to ask us via WhatsApp message to 0151 - 1524 1958.   We are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Scientist (Natural Language Processing)
Description: We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet  Who We Are  Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.   We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.   Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.   Job Role  We are looking for a Data Scientist (Natural Language Processing) who can work on production-ready Artificial Intelligence (AI) to support our industry-leading AI publishing platform.   You will work in a department of Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers to develop cutting edge solutions with a focus on Natural Language Processing (NLP) to help us evolve our state-of-the-art AI Review Assistant (AIRA).   Key Responsibilities   Development, optimization and evaluation of ML models and algorithms Technological review of data science solutions and communication to non-technical stakeholders Proactive identification of opportunities for potential AI products within Frontiers Effective collaboration with Product Managers, ML Engineers, Software and Data Engineers to design scalable state of the art ML models    Requirements   Proficiency in Python Experience with SQL and big data platforms (e.g. Spark, Azure Databricks) Candidates are encouraged to share portfolio of NLP projects    Familiarity with:   Text pre-processing (e.g. lemmatization, stemming, stopwords, normalization) Word and document embeddings Language models, BERT and other transformer models Experience with K-means algorithms Dimensionality reduction techniques and Bayesian techniques NLP packages (SpaCy, AllenNLP, HuggingFace transformers, NLTK)    Benefits  With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.   Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.   This includes:  100% remote working  Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Business Support jobs due to nature of role).   Learning and development  All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.   Wellbeing  We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.   Volunteering opportunities  Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.   Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination ‚Äì including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

Title: React js. Developer at Caiz Development GmbH
Description: Caiz Development GmbH is a company offering innovative technology-based financial services and solutions for everyone. As we are building and exploring new markets with the world's first Islamic decentralized blockchain and cryptocurrency, we also want to expand our young and dynamic team. You will face a highly collaborative work environment that is very driven to convert our company values into a fast and cost-effective money transfering structure while complying with Islamic financial principles.   We are currently looking for a React.js Developer  to join our team.   Aufgaben  We are looking for a skilled react.js developer to join our front-end development team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and implementing user interface components using React.js concepts and workflows such as Redux, Flux, and Webpack. You will also be   responsible for profiling and improving front-end performance and documenting our front-end codebase. To ensure success as a react.js developer, you should have in-depth knowledge of JavaScript   and React concepts, excellent front-end coding skills, and a good understanding of progressive web applications. Ultimately, a top-class react.js developer should be able to design and build modern user interface components to enhance application performance.   React.js Developer Responsibilities:   Meeting with the development team to discuss user interface ideas and applications. Reviewing application requirements and interface designs. Identifying web-based user interactions. Developing and implementing highly responsive user interface components using react concepts. Writing application interface codes using JavaScript following react.js workflows. Troubleshooting interface software and debugging application codes. Developing and implementing front-end architecture to support user interface concepts. Monitoring and improving front-end performance. Documenting application changes and developing updates.   Qualifikation  React.js Developer Requirements:   Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, information technology, or a similar field. Previous experience working as a react.js developer. In-depth knowledge of JavaScript, CSS, HTML, and front-end languages. Knowledge of REACT tools including React.js, Webpack, Enzyme, Redux, and Flux. Experience with user interface design. Knowledge of performance testing frameworks including Mocha and Jest. Experience with browser-based debugging and performance testing software. Excellent troubleshooting skills. Good project management skills. 4+ years of experience is required   Apply today, if you want to become part of our young and dynamic team where you will be able to actively shape this fast-growing company in a highly developing sector.

Title: Software Engineer TypeScript - remote possible(f/m/d)
Description: Imagine if your doctors knew your medical history and your complaints in detail and could help you more quickly and reliably. Imagine that you could conveniently clarify all relevant questions via smartphone before your visit to the doctor and thus have more time for the essentials during the conversation with the doctor. That's exactly what we're building - and that's why we're looking for you!   Tasks  You are a passionate software developer and ...   actively create new ideas for Idana together with the product managers, product designers and software developers solve demanding challenges regarding our software architecture actively contribute to the development of the cloud architecture enjoy pair programming and pair code reviews Regularly extend our internal coding guidelines together with the team - we attach great importance to automated tests, code readability and clean code Become a tech evangelist for one of the technologies we use: MySQL/PostgreSQL, TypeScript, Vue.js or Angular 13+    Requirements    You use CI/CD (e.g. Github Actions) You love code readability and PR reviews Automated unit and integration tests are an integral part of your work You like to use stable technologies, but you are also open and interested in new technologies and like to educate yourself further    Benefits    You'll get a core position in a fast-growing, innovative company and can expect the following:   Honourable, useful work that you can be proud of Continuous personal development Transparent management system Hybrid model between on-site and home office work or full remote State-of-the-art IT equipment with height-adjustable desks and choice of operating system + software Possibility to work part-time (80%) with us Regular after-work events e.g. after-work get-togethers after webinars In addition, flexible working hours, bonuses for the company pension scheme, height-adjustable desks, unlimited coffee, tea and sparkling water, a monthly voucher of 50 EUR, 30 days annual leave and, of course, a competitive salary   Already more than 300 medical practices across Germany work with Idana on a daily basis, 500,000 patients have been surveyed with Idana so far and we are growing exponentially in all areas. But this is just the beginning. We have big plans!   Also feel free to consider our employer ratings, which we are proud of: 4.8 stars on Kununu | 5 stars on Glassdoor  Support us in our mission to bring doctors and patients closer together with digital medicine and be part of the exciting growth phase of a technology start-up that is aiming high.   Have we piqued your interest?  Then apply today.   We are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Junior Android Engineer (f,m,d)
Description:
What if you could do something meaningful about climate change? Immediately. Effectively. Collectively. At Klima that is exactly the impact you‚Äôll have. And we can measure it! Klima is the No. 1 App to fight climate change ‚Äî empowering anyone to take immediate climate action by neutralizing their carbon footprints and reducing their emissions sustainably. Our community has already taken 70,000 tons of CO2 out of the atmosphere. And we‚Äôre just getting started. After a successful Series A, we‚Äôre now looking for a Junior Android Engineer to join our team and boost the development of our app. Climate change is the biggest challenge humanity has ever faced. Join the fight and put your talent to work for good! Quick Info Company size: 30+ Sizable A-round financing, plenty of runway Bright office space in one of Berlin Mitte‚Äôs most beautiful neighborhoods Sustainable everything: Furniture, food, activities, benefits Our one success metric: Tons of CO2e taken out of the atmosphere What we offer A creative, friendly and purpose-driven team Ownership of a product with social impact and global reach High degree of autonomy Competitive salary and equity package Top-of-the-line equipment ‚Äì you tell us what you need! Subsidized gym membership, free public transportation ticket, bike subscription, and compensation of your personal CO2e footprint We value learning and a healthy engineering culture a lot ‚Äì You‚Äôll receive a yearly learning budget and join our regular exchanges with developers from other teams and backgrounds. Flexible hours and a remote-friendly environment Prefer to work 4 days a week? We‚Äôre open to that! Relocation assistance What we‚Äôre looking for You can demonstrate that you have been involved in Android projects, e.g. by having worked as a developer in a company, having built a side project and/or completed a coding bootcamp/course. Ideally, you can show us some of your code on GitHub or GitLab and/or apps you built. You have worked on apps in Kotlin, coroutines / async technologies would be a plus. You have a basic understanding of version control systems and their workflows (we‚Äôre using git). You are highly motivated and eager to learn a lot of new things. Plus points if you have experience with any of those: Compose UI, Kotlin Multiplatform, accessibility, internationalization, Gradle, and CI workflows. You don‚Äôt just blindly code whatever is handed to you but you‚Äôre interested in product and design decisions and leave the occasional suggestion for improvement and figure out some UI/UX details on your own. You are calm and focused under pressure and re-orient quickly in changing environments. When you don't fully understand something, you take it as an opportunity to learn and grow. You believe in clear and honest communication as the basis for effective and joyful teamwork. You consider work-life balance essential to long-term happiness and productivity. You speak English fluently. We‚Äôd like to explicitly encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply to this position. Please also apply if you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements above. What you‚Äôll do You will help us build features in all layers: user interface, domain, and low-level networking & storage. You will contribute to our internal design system by building and extending our Compose UI components that are used throughout the app. You will share and grow your skillset together with the rest of the engineering team, especially within the Android team (currently two senior engineers). You will join our weekly engineering discussions where we discuss tech decisions and show off what we‚Äôve learned. You will work in an agile manner. We currently do 3-week cycles (sprints) across all platform teams. You will write tests to make sure our business logic is stable and to release new features with confidence. We highly value the DRY principle and investing into technologies like Kotlin Multiplatform to share business logic across platforms. You will be encouraged to join this effort as well. What our tech stack looks like A modern, multi-module Kotlin Gradle project, with most of it architected to be re-used on various platforms. Model-View-Intent pattern powered by Kotlin coroutines. Our UI is almost 100% compose, and we're gradually migrating as we build new features. The infrastructure comprised of Dagger, Hilt, SQLDelight and Retrofit/OkHttp. Our CI pipeline takes less than 5 min ‚è± Our iOS efforts are powered by Swift, using shared logic built with Kotlin Multiplatform. Our backend utilizes Kotlin, Kotlin Multiplatform, Docker, jOOQ, in a Spring Boot ecosystem. Our web stack is powered by TypeScript and React. And guess what? It also makes use of our Kotlin Multiplatform efforts! Do you have some ideas about what we could do better? You‚Äôll always have the chance to bring them up and challenge the status quo. How our hiring process looks like We want to make the process efficient, relaxed and fun for everyone involved. No whiteboard tests will be involved. We‚Äôre looking forward to meeting you and answering your questions as well!
    First call with our recruiter Isabel Meet & greet with an Android engineer and another member of the team Coding challenge: You‚Äôll work on a challenge at home at your own pace (take-home assignment) Coding challenge debrief & pairing call with an Android Engineer and another member of the team Final (non-technical) call with our co-founder & CTO Andreas
We are committed to diversity and equity and seek to build an inclusive workplace that welcomes people from all different backgrounds. And we encourage you to apply even if you do not meet all of the requirements for the role. If you‚Äôre looking for an incredible opportunity, a great place to work, and a chance to make a difference, we‚Äôre excited to consider your application! A note on Covid-19 and WFH We want you to stay safe during the Covid-19 pandemic! Many of us are still working from home, and if you join us, we‚Äôll provide all the equipment you need to make your home office experience as productive and enjoyable as possible.

Title: Full Stack Developer (m/f/d)
Description: Since 2004 Storecast has been developing a wide range of digital sales tools for MediaMarkt and other software solutions for retail customers from all over Europe. Currently, the company employs over 20 qualified, ambitious and fun loving professionals. We are not only looking for a new employee with skills that fit our tech stack, but also for an agile-minded team player to join our Storecast family in Berlin. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and work together with open-minded people who are focused on sharing their knowledge and building great products.   We love the challenge to connect offline and online commerce successfully with each other. Our full stack team of 20 developers design the software that allows our clients to present information in a fast, efficient and engaging way. Our smart tools include electronic shelf labels, video walls, digital consultation tables etc.    Your Responsibilities    Work with the Product Owners to understand/refine requirements and provide rough estimations Groom requirements with your team (design architecture, identify dependencies, define a development plan, QA and deployment operations) Maintain and develop new backend/API services using Java/Kotlin/Spring Design, implement and maintain frontend features from the data layer to user experience and interaction. DevOps activities to deploy your services Be part of the Backend/Frontend Guilds, share your knowledge, discuss approaches and ideas with the rest of the team    Your Daily Tasks    Implement core features across our stack of backend/frontend applications Write unit/integration tests when it makes sense to Fix bugs that have slipped in "accidentally" ;) Review pull requests from your peers Deploy your work Share your knowledge and ideas with the rest of the team    Must Have    Fluent in English If necessary, a valid employment visa    Your Background    Proficiency on developing stable, well tested, monitored and well documented API and worker services RDBMS (Oracle and/or Postgresql) Flyway for DB migrations Good knowledge of Java SE 8 and enterprise development, using Spring Framework and Hibernate Proficiency in React and ecosystem around it. Proficiency in Typescript, you understand advantage of it and prefer to write strongly typed code always. Experience working with HTML, CSS, web APIs. Practical experience with Docker Some "Git-Kung fu" is also required. Jenkins (Maintenance, building pipelines) Understanding and experience with common API communication protocols You are not afraid to speak out your opinion, you know what an argument is. You know how to discuss in a friendly and thoughtful way.    Nice To Have (but Not Required)    Knowledge and experience with PWA Experience working with GraphQL Experience with ELK stack Raspberry / Low - Power Board development Experience with automation UI tests and tools such as Cucumber and Puppeteer is a plus.   What are the benefits of Storecast?   Comfortable offices in Berlin-Mitte Home-Office (full-time during Covid 19 lock down) Equipment and hardware of your choice, including height adjustable desks Regular team and off-site events Free drinks, coffee and fruits + wide variety of subsidized lunch options Opportunity to make great ideas come to life!

Title: Front End Developer (m/w/d) - Germany
Description: Become part of the company develops the software solutions for the real estate industry. As a successful start-up, our heart beats for energy management and sustainable software solutions. With our IT and industry know-how, we make the energy transition profitable for large real estate owners and thus contribute to the decarbonization of the real estate industry.   How do we do that? - Quite simply: With our innovative SaaS solutions consisting of an AI-based, energy management for properties and neighborhoods and an automated billing solution. And with a fat stack!   Aufgaben  YOUR ROLE   You will give our products a face and provide our back-end applications to the users As an all-rounder you will be needed at every point of the FrontEnd (UX, APIs, functionalities & of course by contributing your own ideas) You implement exciting visualizations You share your stack experiences with the team in order to grow the products together   Qualifikation   What You Bring With You    A university degree with a focus on IT or a comparable education Fluent German Skills Necessary (C1-C2 Level) Confident handling of JavaScript and ReactJS A clean and well-structured style in the programming Strong knowledge in dealing with web services, such as GraphQL and REST Experienced handling of common development tools, such as GIT and JIRA Openness to self-organized, agile working methods Nice to have: foosball & dart skills    Benefits    OUR OFFER   Home office & trust-based working hours: you decide when and where you are most productive Fully Remote working model Modern offices in the heart of Munich and Erfurt Personal and professional development - with a view beyond the silo Performance-based pay Free choice of hardware Promotion of own ideas Team spirit instead of trench warfare A job you can be proud of   Interview Process   First Interview (1 Hour Video Call) Coding Challenge (2 Hours Max) Final Interview (1 Hour Video Call) Offer

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description: At Laserhub, we have metal running through our veins, and with our procurement platform for metal parts we are leading the very traditional sheet metal industry into the glorious age of full digitalization. At laserhub.com, end customers, and metal parts manufacturers come together via a lean, digital process. Instead of spending many days or weeks on a single order, everyone can work with unprecedented efficiency, fulfilling their demands just in a few days and for multiple orders. Since 2017, our team of experts has demonstrated that our concept is well received by the market ‚Äì now we want to play a big part in making the entire metalworking industry digital. To achieve our goals, we are looking for an ambitious employee for our sales team as   Data Scientist (m/f/d)  In this position, you are an indispensable part of the Product team and a fundamental contributor to the product's success. You collaborate with cross-functional teams and work closely with Product managers, Metal tech experts, and Designers to create the best offers for our customers and enable the best fulfillment of orders. You contribute with understanding our data, building relevant models, and driving decision-making for topics such as offer creation, pricing, order allocation, fulfillment reliability, etc. You will help to create innovative and valuable solutions for the complex requirements of our B2B environment.   Your mission:   Become an expert in our domain - Gain a deep understanding of our business and processes; build strong relationships and trust with stakeholders, and recognize the biggest opportunities Create the pathway - Evolve the necessary infrastructure to support the data science initiatives, including liaising with the data team, defining data structures & pipelines, gathering & processing data, building necessary tools, etc. Design, deploy, evaluate, and update data-driven models and analytical solutions, considering the behavior of customers, suppliers, and relevant stakeholders Drive growth - Monitor key product metrics, confirm/disprove hypotheses, communicate insights, make recommendations, and contribute to decision making and requirements definition inside the Product team and organization. Collaborate strongly with creating the best commercial offer for customers and resource allocation models for order fulfillment Make customers the core - Put customers at the center of your initiatives, understanding their needs and deriving data science initiatives that will deliver real value to them Build the future - Create the foundations for future initiatives involving forecast models, machine learning, AI, etc   Your profile:   Completed studies (Bachelor, Master or PhD) in quantitative field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, or related fields 3+ years of practical work experience (not only academic) in quantitative analysis and statistical methods, including time series, hypothesis testing, clustering, regression analysis, forecasting, etc. Sound knowledge of programming, Python data science stack (pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow), SQL, cloud technologies (preferably GCP, AWS) Impressive problem-solving skills and critical mindset. Able to find patterns, analyze complex scenarios, execute tests and derive effective actions Enjoy working on a complex product while being entirely passionate about technology and the digitalization of the traditional manufacturing industry. You challenge the status quo everyday and strive to improve our products and processes Great written and verbal communication skills in English. You are well structured and able to interact with stakeholders inside and outside the company   Your milestones:   By 1 month: You‚Äôve become knowledgeable to a high degree of our data structures, tools, and main challenges. You understand our business model well By 3 months: You‚Äôve become an important collaborator of the Product team, by generating insights, making recommendations and contributing to decision-making By 6+ months: You‚Äôve become a fully knowledgeable Product team member, that drives growth and helps shape Data Science within the organization   Why Laserhub?   A one-time opportunity to help build an exciting B2B business model with scaling potential We believe in fairness, transparency and helpfulness in everyday work Your personal development is important to us, therefore we promote the internal transfer of knowledge and strengthen your ‚Äúzone of genius‚Äù All our employees hold company shares in Laserhub You can arrange your working day according to your needs with flexible working hours, home office days and the No-Meeting-Wednesday   Location:  Stuttgart / remote | When do you start?  As soon as possible   If you would like to bring in new ideas and take ownership, our startup environment seems to be the perfect fit. Let‚Äôs upload your application via the ‚ÄúApply button‚Äù at the job ad on our careersite!   Laserhub GmbH, Neckarstr. 189-191, 70190 Stuttgart, [  www.laserhub.com ](http://www.laserhub.com/)

Title: Data Scientist / Analyst (m/f/d) - Remote
Description: Collecting data is one thing, but evaluating it and drawing the right conclusions from it is crucial! At Xentral, we have a lot of data for you to sift through, search for hidden insights and their business implications. We want you to deeply understand what‚Äôs going on in our product, marketing and financial data and propose solutions to any inefficiencies you find.   You want to be analyzing which stories our data is telling us?   Apply now and tell us where the breadcrumbs of our data will take us!   Your Tasks   Conduct exploratory analysis and present key findings to stakeholders on all levels Work with your focus departments to create opportunities for data science projects (e.g., churn prediction, uplift model, conversion funnel) and own respective data products within our evolving data mesh Contribute to the development of our reporting environment and data lake Translate complex concepts into implications for the business via excellent communication skills, both verbal and written    Your Profile   Bachelors‚Äô or above in quantitative field: Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field Working experience in a comparable role You approach complex problems in a structured way You must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams and initiatives You can communicate your findings effectively to non-technical staff You are detail-oriented and can quickly shift priorities You thrive in a fast-paced environment and maintain a high level of output quality under time pressure You enjoy working in a team environment You have excellent project management and presentation skills You have experience in analyzing data and automating complex data handling through SQL and Python You are used to working with visualization tools such as Looker or Tableau Strong verbal and written communication skills Nice to have: Experience in working in a fast paced environment. Familiarity with Data Mesh Architecture. Experience in productionalizing machine-learned models     We offer    Remote first!  We grow all over Europe, join us fully remote or in one of our hubs in Augsburg, Amsterdam or Munich. You decide!   Xentral feels like home!  For us Xentral is not just a workplace. We make sure that our team feels at home even during work. We offer flexible working hours and home office.   Unique culture and structure!  We believe in flat hierarchies, short decision-making processes and appreciative communication at eye level.   With us to the very top!  With us there are many career paths and development opportunities for you, what you can't do yet, you can learn with us!   Planning ahead!  For our permanent employees we offer 50% subsidies to your private pension plan.   You have what it takes? Then apply now with your CV or LinkedIn profile.  We look forward to your application!  About Us  We are an established tech startup with major tech investors Frank Thelen, Sequoia Capital and Visionaries Club on our side. We are aiming at defining a new SaaS category and empower entrepreneurs and e-commerce vendors to automate their resource planning and focus on the things that matters most to them: their business. We grow all over Europe, join us fully remote or in one of our hubs in Augsburg, Amsterdam or Munich. You decide!

Title: (Junior) Data Scientist (w/m/d)
Description: Als (Junior) Data Scientist (w/m/d) analysierst und bewertest Du gro√üe Datenmengen und hilfst unseren Kunden und Kundinnen dadurch die besten Entscheidungen f√ºr ihr Unternehmen zu treffen. Ob im Bereich Tax, Audit, Consulting, Deal Advisory oder Finance - mit Dir werden Daten zu Informationen.   Deine Aufgaben  Du willst Big Data in Smart Data verwandeln? Dann kannst Du Dich hier einbringen:    Du schaffst aus gro√üen strukturierten und unstrukturierten Datenbest√§nden unterschiedlicher Datenquellen eine Datenbasis, analysierst und interpretierst diese. Mithilfe von Data Mining, Data Science und Machine Learning-Methoden erkennst Du Muster und erstellst daraus Prognosen f√ºr die Zukunft. Dein Profil   Um bei uns als (Junior) Data Scientist (w/m/d) an Bord zu kommen, hast Du Dein Bachelor- oder Masterstudium mit sehr guten Noten abgeschlossen ‚Äì vorzugsweise in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Statistik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Ingenieurwesen, Wirtschaftsmathematik, Mathematik oder Physik. Deine Expertise konntest Du bereits praktisch im Beratungsumfeld oder anderweitig in der IT unter Beweis stellen. Du besitzt erste Kenntnisse in funktionalen/objektorientierten Programmiersprachen, wie C/C++, Python, R, Java oder JavaScript sowie Kenntnisse in Cloud-Technologien, Business Intelligence-Tools wie Tableau, PowerBI, SAS, oder Umfeld von SAP oder SQL-Datenbanken. Du punktest mit einem soliden Methodenwissen in Statistik, Machine Learning und IT-Infrastrukturen, das es Dir erm√∂glicht, neuen Entwicklungen zu folgen und innovative L√∂sungen zu entwickeln. Deutsch und Englisch beherrschst Du auf C1-Niveau. Daneben bringst Du Reisebereitschaft mit, um unsere Kund:innen auch vor Ort beraten zu k√∂nnen.    Deine Benefits   Willkommen im Team  Damit Du von Beginn an voll bei uns durchstarten kannst, begleiten wir Dich mit strukturierten Onboarding-Ma√ünahmen w√§hrend der gesamten Orientierungsphase. Zudem f√∂rdert Deine F√ºhrungskraft gezielt Deine fachliche und pers√∂nliche Integration ins Team. Vielf√§ltige Karriereperspektiven  Wir legen Wert auf die individuelle Entwicklung Deiner fachlichen und pers√∂nlichen St√§rken: Deine eigenen Ambitionen reflektieren wir in strukturierten Entwicklungsgespr√§chen. Systematische und regelm√§√üige Feedback-Gespr√§che unterst√ºtzen Dich beim Erreichen dieser Ziele. Als Teil des weltweiten KPMG-.Netzwerks bieten wir Dir interessante Karrierem√∂glichkeiten im In- und Ausland und somit wertvolle Einblicke in die Vielfalt unserer T√§tigkeitsbereiche. Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Privatleben  Wir sind √ºberzeugt, dass es vor allem Vielfalt und Flexibilit√§t braucht, um Innovationen zu f√∂rdern und langfristige Erfolge zu sichern. Nur so k√∂nnen wir die besten Ideen entwickeln und wirklich innovative L√∂sungen finden. Mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, Homeoffice-Option, Zeitkonten und Auszeiten schaffen wir R√§ume, um Privat- und Berufsleben miteinander zu vereinbaren. Dar√ºber hinaus unterst√ºtzen wir Dich monatlich mit bis zu vier Stunden Freistellung f√ºr Dein soziales Engagement. Fort- & Weiterbildung  Durch regelm√§√üige Trainings, Workshops und Weiterbildungen entwickelst Du Dich stetig weiter. Zudem f√∂rdern wir Berufsexamina sowie berufsbegleitende Master-Studieng√§nge. Mit unseren Rotationsprogrammen erm√∂glichen wir Deinen fach√ºbergreifenden Einsatz. Diese Einblicke in die vielf√§ltigen Aufgabenfelder bei KPMG erweitern Deinen Horizont und f√∂rdern Synergien in der Zusammenarbeit. Die abgebildeten Leistungen k√∂nnen je nach Position und Standort leicht variieren.

YOUR PERSPECTIVE    Do you like to put your expertise to practical use? Then JOYNEXT is the right place for you. Software Engineer (m/f/d)   Your Tasks And Responsibilities    Be an integral part of the Bayer Crop Protection Innovation Lab team and support farmers worldwide to qualify and quantify weed, disease, and pest problems in their fields As a member of our team you will have the opportunity to design scalable and reliable cloud architectures to solve real world problems in farming Support the opportunity to tackle the world‚Äôs biggest challenges with us: Maintaining our health, feeding growing populations and slowing the rate of climate change. You have a voice, ideas and perspectives and we want to hear them. Because our success begins with you. Be part of something big. Be Bayer. Title: Frontend Engineer
Description:
Coleap is on a mission to make lifelong learning 10x more engaging, accessible and effective . We are building a platform to enable 1,000s of quality learning communities to be created. We aim to leverage life-changing step-changes for 100 million learners by 2030 . Your mission at Coleap Our ambition is high and we are searching for like-minded folks to help us on this journey. Our engineering team will be responsible for building a platform that makes this vision a reality, with great UX, performance and robustness. As an early Software Engineer in our team, you will have the possibility (and agency) to shape how we do things, the culture and the technology direction while creating a great experience for our creators and learners. PS: Please see everything here as a guide for the kinds of things we are looking for - we know that no candidate is ever perfect for the role and that there will be people out there who bring things to the table we haven't even thought of yet (and are super excited by this!). If you feel like your profile is close to this description but doesn't tick every box, please don't be afraid to apply Who We Are Looking For You have strong opinions on how to design, build and operate strong performing and resilient applications You are a great communicator, and able to give and receive constructive feedback You are driven by excellence and constant improvement of yourself as well as of others around you. You are excited by the prospect of a fast-growing startup and have the drive to solve problems in a highly ambiguous environment. You share our ambition to build a truly world-changing company.

Desired Skills and Experience

Experience That Matters To Us You have strong opinions on how to design and build state-of-the-art consumer tech products, ideally in the edtech, gaming and/or social networking space. You write high quality, maintainable and performant JavaScript (TypeScript is a big plus) You have significant production experience building web applications using modern JavaScript tooling and standards (ES6, React/Vue, NextJS/NuxtJS, PWA, ...) You have a track record of implementing complex UIs for all screen sizes You care deeply about UX and have a strong web performance mindset (extra) You don't shy away from the backend and are interested in building APIs Our frontend tech stack TypeScript React Next.js TailwindCSS Netlify

Title: Front-End Developer
Description: Are you a front-end developer who boasts the front-end creativity to build a website that is as beautiful as it is effective?   Can you define requirements, logic, and a framework to support the creative vision and custom build your own websites?   If you're ready to produce stunning websites for large and small brands and innovative startups, you may be our next developer.   Some things to know about us:   First, we're not like every other agency. We believe in the power of data. We embrace new tools and technology. We swoon over an elegant process or system. We love structured creativity. If it ain't broke, optimize it. As a result, we're growing faster than pretty much any other agency around.   Second, we work a little differently. In 48 marketing disciplines across 6 functional groups, we're redefining what a full-service digital and integrated marketing agency can be. Our agency teams create high-impact digital campaigns using both organic and paid techniques ‚Äî doing so with a global footprint in 20+ countries.   Does any of this get your blood pumping? Ready to skyrocket conversion rates? Or initiate hockey-stick growth? Wondering if this might just be the best job of your career?   Requirements   3+ years of professional experience in software development Good understanding of front-end technologies, including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery Experience building user interfaces for websites and/or web applications Experience designing and developing responsive design websites Ability to convert comprehensive layout and wireframes into working HTML pages Knowledge of how to interact with RESTful APIs and formats (JSON, XML) Proficient understanding of code versioning tools

Title: Frontend Engineer- React
Description: As a part of our frontend team, you will build awesome web experiences using React.js ! As Frontend Software Engineer, you will participate in technical architecture discussions from the early exploration of ideas to deciding on a concrete path forward. We want you to demonstrate best practices in your code and uphold them in your code reviews.   Tasks  Become part of the 4.screen team!  Our software development & architecture team is responsible for building the best marketing platform for in-car searches and display types ‚Äì by combining the assets of existing car UI with state-of-the-art usability. As part of the team, you will take responsibility for the development of the web portal on which marketing professionals can create and manage campaigns that will impact the driving experience of millions of people.   Your colleagues at 4.screen had leading positions at BMW, Daimler, Google and Bain and strive to build an amazing company where everything is new, disruptive and exciting!   You will be involved in making critical decisions that will influence not only your team but the overall achievement of our mission.   The position:  ‚Äç   As a React Software Engineer you will help us grow the 4.screen marketplace:   Build awesome web experiences using React.js Participate in technical architecture discussions from the early exploration of ideas to deciding on a concrete path forward Share what you have learned about crafting outstanding user experiences with your team mates, so we can all grow faster Demonstrate best practices in your code, and uphold them in your code reviews Work closely with Business to understand requirements and advise on technical trade-offs    Requirements    Who are we looking for?  Minimum requirements:   Degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience Thorough understanding of React.js & Typescript and their core principles You take pride in creating powerful experiences that are simple and intuitive for users English (and ideally German) language proficiency   Our Wishlist (Ideal Candidate):   Excellent communicator, who contributes in team discussions and can explain complex technical matters easily to the rest of the crew Experience with microservices architectures Experience along the whole SDLC    Benefits    What is waiting for you?   You will have an impact on shaping our product (no legacy code) and our company's vision Competitive compensation package (e.g. salary, employee stock options) Flexible work environment (days in office and home) + 30 days of vacation Top equipment for top talent: We¬¥ll hook you up with the best gadgets like a new MacBook Corporate discounts with external partners Regular fun team activities & events with our amazing team   We are 4.screen.  ‚Äç‚ÄçAt 4.screen, we build exciting technology to create truly connected cars. We are building the first scalable digital marketplace to connect businesses along the route with drivers in real-time. Drivers search and find gas stations, shops, parking garages, supermarkets in their cars every day. New voice assistants, better navigation systems and improved connectivity will significantly grow the number of in-car searches going forward.   Our platform enables automakers to monetize the time you spend driving and ensures that local businesses get found inside the car. By connecting brands seamlessly to drivers, we are building the best digital business model the automotive industry has ever seen!   We are partnering with large brands to realize our vision of truly connected cars! Are you ready to ride along and shape the future of mobility? Apply now!
