Title: Full Stack Developer (m/f/d)
Description: About Us    We are a technology leader in 3D-digitizing physical objects. Our clients use augmented reality, virtual reality and 3D to promote their products and revolutionise the online shopping experience. With us, the digital 3D objects are pin sharp, stunningly detailed, animated and at the same time compressed into a small file size. Unmatched anywhere in the world. That‚Äôs why customers from almost all industries are ‚Äúbeating down our doors‚Äù right now.   Therefore, we are looking for you to join our team as Full Stack Developer (m/f/d).   Your tasks   As a full stack developer, your main task will be to develop cloud applications and various microservices Planning and implementation of web-based projects Creating dynamic web applications for desktops and mobile devices Evaluation and use of current web technologies, frameworks and tools Implementation of interfaces to connect various systems Working as part of a team with backend developers and web designers, you have a certain level of communication skills You work in an agile, fast-paced environment and are intrinsically motivated to continuously educate yourself You meet the challenge and task of bundling the abundance of information in such a way that the programming code remains clear and thus pay attention to security vulnerabilities  Your profile   Experience in JavaScript and Python programming (Python 2 and 3) in Linux environments Your development environment is not complete without command line and Git A successful degree in computer science or equivalent and experience in professional web development Sound knowledge of Microsoft Azure, Python, PHP, JavaScript/REACT, HTML, CSS/LESS, MySQL Good understanding of databases and data modeling Confident in working with Linux and Windows systems Continuous integration, independent and result-oriented way of working Very good German and good English skills  We offer   Flexible working hours, above-average salary, full- or part-time Remote work possible Permanent employment Quick decisions with the opportunity to contribute and develop your own strengths Exciting and varied activities We are a fast-growing high-tech company - if you enjoy challenges and are committed to what you believe in, you can move up quickly with us and help shape the future The opportunity to see customer eyes "light up" more often due to rapid advancements in our technologies with augmented reality and virtual reality New, large offices in the new building and the possibility of a vehicle  Looking for a challenging job in a fast-growing high-tech company?   Apply today. Your contact person is Ms. Lena Paulsmeyer.   We can‚Äôt wait to hear from you!

Title: Fullstack Javascript Developer (w/m/d)
Description: K√ºchenheld Tech disrupts the kitchen industry developing tools to allow employee and customer centric processes.   Who We Are Looking For    A passionate coder, who is curious and always longs for learning something new, A dependable person, who trust us and who we can rely on, A creative mind that always looks for alternative tools and approaches to develop our stack, and A team player, who is looking for a great team to belong to.   Ideally, you have more than two years of experience working in a predominantly JavaScript-driven environment. If you are at the start of your career or switched stacks, we would still love to hear from you. Here are some of the things we look out for:   At least 1 year experience in ReactJS / Node.js Understanding of the RESTful/GraphQL architecture Experience working with relational and NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis,...) Mastery of TypeScript and React.js Experience with JavaScript ES5/ES6+, HTML5, CSS3 Familiarity with any server frameworks (ExpressJS/NestJS/SailsJS,...) Familiarity with any UI frameworks (AntD, Bootstrap, MaterialUI, ‚Ä¶)   Our current challenges  After starting to operate in 2019, we quickly grew to more than 150 employees and are now the fastest growing kitchen retailer in Europe. All of this growth is enabled and supported by a variety of internal and external tools. To support and accelerate our growth we need to continue to deliver intuitive and robust web-based solutions.    Who We Are    We are a great team of different backgrounds (coding, data science, mathematics, business studies, product design) who enjoy working together and helping each other to become the best we can be. We are dedicated to the team and keep it a safe space where everybody can follow his heart, speak his mind, and thus excel. We help each other if we fail and party together if we shine.   Your tasks  Your tasks will depend on your interests and your qualification. Currently we image your tasks to be:   Collaborate with project managers to scope and refine product ideas Technically review and refine tickets Implement new features across our products Review code from freelancers and junior developers Support users with technical questions    What We Expect From You In An Interview    Depending on your background and experience, develop an opinion about our current challenges on an appropriate level, so we can have a fun and thriving discussion about it.    What You Can Expect In Your Job    You will join a compassionate team, on which you can rely, so you can grow on the challenges we will face together. We offer you the flexibility and the resources you need to be your best and accompany on your journey.   Wer wir sind:  K√ºchenheld ist das smarte K√ºchenstudio von heute. Wir durchbrechen die klassische Art des K√ºchenverkaufs und setzen auf Effizienz, Transparenz und Fairness sowohl f√ºr unsere Kunden als auch unsere KollegInnen. Mit modernster Technik und pers√∂nlicher Beratung bieten wir unseren Kunden ein einzigartiges Kauferlebnis Ihrer Traumk√ºche. Klingt spannend? Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung inklusive Deines gew√ºnschten Eintrittsdatums an recruitment@kuechenheld.de. Deine Ansprechpartnerin ist Anna aus dem People & Culture Team.

Title: Frontend Engineer (React) @ E-Commerce Platform - Remote - Teilzeit Option
Description: Wir besetzen aktuell eine Stelle bei einer grossen deutschen E-Commerce Plattform. Wir suchen hier einen Javascript Frontend Engineer, der als Teil des Teams Entdecken mithilft, die Produktwelten unterhaltsam und informativ darzustellen.   Der Techstack:   React, JSX, Node.js, Pattern Library, Webpack, Jest, Microservices, Microfrontends, Reactive Programming, GitLab CI, Docker, AWS   Du kannst entweder komplett remote oder in einem der schicken B√ºros in Hamburg, Karlsruhe oder Berlin arbeiten. Eigentlich ist dies eine Vollzeitstelle, Teilzeit mit 4 Tagen pro Woche ist aber auch m√∂glich.    What You Will Get    // Die Veratwortung f√ºr die Weiterentwicklung einer der spannendsten E-Commerce Plattformen Deutschlands innerhalb eines voll remote-f√§higen und sehr eigenverantworlichen Team Setups mit viel Freiraum.   // Ein modernes Micro-Service- und Micro-Frontend-Umfeld mit motivierten Kolleg:innen und viel Spa√ü an kollaborativer Arbeit.   // Die M√∂glichkeit 20% deiner Arbeitszeit individuell frei zu gestalten: Egal ob mit Weiterbildung oder Basteln an neuem Code.   NEXT STEPS   Wenn du dich hier bewirbst dann schicken wir Dir zusaetzliche Infos zum Unternehmen und zur Rolle um deinen Entscheidungsprozess zu unterstuetzen. Wenn Du weiterhin interessiert bist, laden wir dich zu einem ersten Call mit dem Dev Lead ein.   Aufgaben  Qualifikation  #Javascript   #React   #Webpack

Title: App Developer
Description: We are a motivated team of people with different backgrounds, who intend to digitize the construction industry. Making the lives of craftsmen easier by developing a simple and user-friendly project management software.   We are partly in Hamburg, partly in Flensburg and Copenhagen, with most of them based in Hamburg. English is the main language used in the dev team.   About our company:  The Craftboxx is a modern SaaS product to connect project planning in the office with the team outside on site.   The project scheduling module is a cloud-based browser application based on Laravel and a natively developed smartphone app used on the go.   Our Tech Stack:  Our tech stack consists of PHP 8, Laravel 9, Bootstrap 5, MySQL 8 & Kotlin and Swift for Android & iOS.   Tasks   In this role, you develop and optimize the apps of our software You will develop new features together with our 4 developers and 3 employees from Sales & UX You will find bugs in existing software when implementing new features and propose solutions independently You work agile in a team and support the other developers Together with the founder, you coordinate an app agency that can support you with the app development You are jointly responsible for finding a balance between app stability and implementing new features    Requirements    Very good knowledge of Kotlin or Swift (3+ years) Good knowledge of Firebase Team spirit, creativity and a communicative approach A good sense of layout, colors and modern design Nice to have, but not a requirement: Experience with Figma and/or docker    Benefits    You work with experienced developers The chance to bring in your ideas and to manage your area close to the customer Flexible working hours and the option to work remotely A relaxed working atmosphere and plenty of freedom for development/own development As a (still) start-up, we offer you the space to contribute your knowledge and technologies 30 days vacation, market-based salary, opportunities for advancement, flexible flextime, and we are family-friendly. We are looking forward to your application!   We are looking forward to your application!

Title: Junior Frontend Developer*in - Vollzeit
Description: InnoNature ist ein junges Unternehmen aus Hamburg: unser Fokus liegt auf ganzheitlichen Nahrungserg√§nzungsmitteln, Superfoods und Naturkosmetik - verpackt in einer modernen Positionierung. Als derzeit reine D2C-Brand konzentrieren wir uns auf den Verkauf unserer Produkte in unserem Online-Shop.    Wir sind ein fr√∂hliches, dynamisches Team, das St√§rken aus nachhaltiger Gesundheitswissenschaft, hoch qualitativen und ehrlichen Produkten und modernem Marketing b√ºndelt. Mit voller Power stecken wir unser Herzblut in unsere Mission f√ºr ganzheitliches Wohlbefinden.     F√ºr unser weiteres Wachstum suchen wir eine*n Frontend Developer*in f√ºr das E-Commerce-Team.     Deine Aufgaben:   Du unterst√ºtzt bei der Optimierung und Weiterentwicklung unserer Onlineshops Du entwickelst unser Shopify-Theme in Liquid, HTML, CSS/SASS & Javascript Du optimierst unsere Web-Performance mit einem starken Fokus auf Website-Geschwindigkeit und mobile Benutzererfahrung Du unterst√ºtzt bei der Implementierung von Tools und Apps von Drittanbietern Du behebst Bugs     Wen wir suchen:   Du hast bereits erste Erfahrungen in der Theme-Entwicklung und -Customization mit Shopify Plus gesammelt (Erfahrung mit Klaviyo ist von Vorteil) Du hast starke technische und gestalterische F√§higkeiten - Du musst aber kein Designer sein Du schreibst Code unter Ber√ºcksichtigung von Performance und denkst ‚ÄúMobile First‚Äù Du bringst ein Verst√§ndnis f√ºr API-Integration mit Du verstehst die Wichtigkeit von AB Tests und hast Spa√ü am Testen Du arbeitest gerne und effizient mit Asana oder anderen Workload-Management-Tools Du hast die F√§higkeit, klar mit nicht-technischen Teammitglieder*innen zu kommunizieren und tust dies proaktiv Du hast ausgezeichnete Zeitmanagement und Probleml√∂sungs-Skills Du arbeitest selbstst√§ndig, analytisch und strukturiert Du hast Interesse an Optimierung und an der E-Commerce-Welt Du verstehst unsere Zielgruppe Du solltest Deutsch und Englisch beherrschen und in Hamburg angesiedelt sein     Was wir Dir bieten:   Eine verantwortungsvolle Aufgabe in einem jungen und sympathischen Unternehmen im Bereich Ern√§hrung und Lifestyle Die schnelle √úbernahme von Verantwortung Die Chance, eigene Ideen in Deinem Bereich umzusetzen und InnoNature voran zu bringen Gestaltungsspielraum, flache Hierarchien mit Kommunikation auf Augenh√∂he und ein harmonischer Umgang miteinander Moderner Arbeitsplatz (Stehschreibtische, Macbook, Obst, Produkt-Flatrate, Getr√§nke und das leckere, vegane Mittagessen unserer InnoKitchen an drei Tagen der Woche) mitten in Hamburg-Altona     Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung unter Angabe Deines fr√ºhestm√∂glichen Eintrittsdatums. Title: JavaScript (React/Node) Fullstack Developer (m/f/d)
Description: Your mission   You are part of one of our five product teams, with your team being one of the most cross functional ones with eight people across different competencies You take responsibility for new features and the development of those in our stack including React, Redux, Material UI and Nest.js all in Typescript You work closely with product owners and designers to create high quality features that delight our customers You work closely with other developers in continuous, collaborative development and review processes that also include automated tests   Your profile   You have at least two years of professional experience in React (and ideally Node.js) You focus on high quality results and you take validating them trough testing very seriously You love to work in a team and you are willing to take responsibility Your English is on a very good level   Why us?   An open-minded and friendly team working with agile methods - as proven by our Kununu Score of 4,8 Regular team events and sports offers (Table tennis, soccer, beach volleyball, Qualitrain) A modern office in the heart of Munich not far from Stiglmaierplatz Diverse personal development opportunities Hybrid work model and workation within the EU Company pension scheme and daycare allowance Language courses via Babbel Fruit, soft drinks, coffee and beer   You want to be part of our success story?  Then contact our Recruiting Manager Yumi and tell us why you are the right person for the role. We are looking forward to your application with CV, earliest start date and salary expectation.

Title: Web Developer
Description: Our mission is great open source   It is our mission to make open source software available to people everywhere. We create world-renowned software, impacting the lives of millions of people every day.   The web team works in a multi-disciplinary environment with visual designers, UX designers and other developers to improve our existing products and bring exciting new web projects to life. We help and learn from each other and constantly strive to improve both our work and our processes.    Required Skills And Experience    Demonstrable experience of work on modern web applications A strong understanding of HTML, CSS with SCSS and JavaScript Experience with Javascript components libraries Experience with TypeScript Experience with responsive user interfaces for a wide range of devices and browsers Experience with Git or other version control systems Awareness of SEO best practice Consideration of accessibility in all aspects of your work A strong understanding of web performance in complex user interfaces Ability to interact with UX, designers and server-side developers Curiosity about technology and a thirst to learn Based in EMEA timezones (Europe, the Middle East and Africa) University degree or equivalent education    Useful experience if you have it   Familiarity with Linux desktop technologies Server-side languages, such as Python or NodeJS Experience working on a large scale React (with TypeScript) project A history of open source contributions Relevant work experience    Who you are   We want a Web Developer who loves what they do. You are passionate about web standards and keep abreast of new developments in our industry. You always look for opportunities to improve your skills. You like to show off what you're working on and also learn from others. You have strong attention to detail and value the design of a product as much as you value the code. You have strong communication skills and maybe even blog once in a while. You're aware of the latest CSS techniques but also know the limitations that developing for a broad audience can bring - actually, you embrace the challenge.   In this team   You'll create high fidelity websites and web apps using the latest incarnations of HTML, CSS (SCSS) and Javascript (React and TypeScript) You'll help maintain existing projects including updating content and adding new pages You'll manage incoming requests for updates and liaise with or delegate to other people as necessary You'll ensure the standard of our output remains high and consistent across our whole product portfolio You'll ensure new pages are published according to specification and in compliance with our web style guide You'll participate in and contribute to our living style guide, Vanilla Framework. Work closely with UX designers and visual designers to implement exemplary user experiences.    What we offer   An opportunity to help shape a company and products with a strong influence in the open source community An inclusive work environment within a team of friendly people with a broad range of skill sets, from UX designers to copywriters Learning and development Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Annual leave Priority Pass for travel    Interview process   Your application will be reviewed by our team You will be sent a set of written interview questions which will be reviewed anonymously You will be asked to take a standardised personality test A short interview with a team member An HR interview You will be asked to complete a small coding test A series of four more detailed technical interviews Hiring manager interview Offer    We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: As a Data Scientist at QuantCo, you will learn what it takes to create impact from data: identifying the right framework to translate a business question into a statistical problem; locating and combining data sources as well as transforming large datasets; running in-depth analyses; building machine learning models that automate large-scale decisions and integrating them into live business processes; and interpreting, visualizing, and communicating results to internal and external stakeholders.    Aspiring data scientists should be team players with excellent quantitative abilities and:     A degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, industrial engineering or similar fields from a leading university Experience in coding and working with data using a wide range of tools and languages: Python (Pandas, XGBoost/LightGBM), R (dplyr, ggplot2), and git Bonus: SQL, Tensorflow/Keras, Cloud infrastructure, Docker, and a lower-level language like C/C++/C# In-depth understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts behind most common machine learning techniques Ability to see solutions and opportunities that others do not see High level of commitment and reliability, good balance of pragmatism and perfectionism Business proficiency in English and ideally conversational proficiency in German     Compensation  We are looking for exceptionally motivated and highly skilled candidates for available data scientist positions. We offer a generous compensation package that includes a base salary, bonus, and stock options along with additional benefits based on location.     About QuantCo  We leverage expertise in data science, engineering, and economics to help organizations turn data into decisions. Started by 4 PhDs from Harvard and Stanford, we are now more than 90 professionals with extensive quantitative, engineering, and business experience.    QuantCo‚Äôs product line includes algorithmic pricing, data-driven claims management, and high-dimensional forecasting solutions. Our clients are some of the largest financial, retail, and healthcare organizations in the U.S. and Europe.    We are excited about writing code that affects millions of people and impacts billions of dollars. If you feel the same way, we look forward to hearing from you.     QuantCo does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Title: Full Stack Developer (m/f/d) - Healthcare Startup
Description: Limedix envisions to improve the traditional language therapy through digitization. We built easy-to-use solutions that can profit both the therapists and patients alike (e.g. adults after stroke or kids with developmental disorders). We are a small, interdisciplinary team of very kind and dedicated people who aim to improve people's lives. We started our journey as a spin-off from LMU Munich in 2016. Since 2022, our training app for people after stroke is one of the few health apps in Germany that is reimbursed by all statutory health insurances.   Tasks  We are currently looking for a Full Stack Developer with 2+ years of experience to join our great team. You will contribute to rebuild our Aphasia-App with React Native with a strong focus on providing a good User Experience to help empower stroke patients to regain their language skills. Furthermore, you will discover and implement new technologies to support and improve our current system. In addition, you will learn more about Medical Product Development as well as technical communication with health insurances.    Requirements    Required skills:   Experience in React Native Experience in Node.JS Experience in maintaining a cloud-based infrastructure   Preferred skills:   Leadership experience Experience with developing medical products Experience in Angular / AngularJS Experience in Cordova / Ionic Fluent in German    Benefits    a job with social impact - we love to make a difference for people with our work work at one of the few health startups in Germany that get reimbursed by all statutatory health insurances an interdisciplinary, international, highly motivated and very friendly team responsibility for technical development start date 1st April or later permanent contract equipment and nice team office in Munich a very friendly and inspiring atmosphere, Spezi and coffee without limits   Want to join our great team and empower people with disabilities through digitization? We are excited to hear from you! Send your application via JOIN

Title: Software Engineer (Java) (m|f|x) - Team B2C Offers
Description: Job Description  We are team B2C Offers and we are responsible for the contents of the list of offers that are shown as a key-feature to our users in the apps and on our website. In our modern event-driven architecture, using current Java, message streams and NoSQL databases, we aggregate big data for different use cases in near real-time. We use Kafka topics and APIs to deliver information concerning the pricing and sorting of offers, as well as meta information and summaries, to several other teams at idealo and our partners. Our work has a measurable effect on hundreds of thousands of users daily!   Right now, our team is spearheading idealo‚Äôs move to AWS.   The position of Software Engineer (Java)(x|f|m) - Team B2C Offers  is available as a full-time or part-time position.   About Your New Role  Job requirements  We are a predominantly back-end team. We maintain upwards of 30 microservices along with all the resources required to deploy and run them. We expect you to be able to do some of the following when you join and to gradually work towards the rest with help from more experienced team members. Our team is international and English is our main communication language.   Design, develop, deploy, operate and improve our software. Embrace healthy, modern engineering practices through writing clean, well-tested and thoughtfully refactored code with the team. Drive continuous improvement. Develop and deploy our product continuously (CI/CD). Work closely with our product owner and team members to deliver high quality and fast APIs and streaming content. Work with agile methodologies like Kanban and pair programming. Participate in the complete software lifecycle. Collaborate with engineers from other teams on overarching high impact projects.    Skills & Requirements   Experience with Java and Springboot and you have solid grasp of algorithms and data structures. You are familiar with unit testing fundamentals. You have first experience with Git source control. You already gained experience with databases (SQL and/or NoSQL) You know the basics of writing clean code. Above all, you are curious and motivated to learn. You give and take open, constructive feedback.    Tools and Technologies we use   Integration testing, contract testing, performance and load testing Containers Continuous integration Microservices architecture Message queues and event driven architecture Kafka AWS MongoDB Agile methodologies    Your benefits at idealo   You don't live in Berlin and want to work from home? Our hybrid working model offers you the freedom to work from all over Germany in a mobile and flexible way. Together we will find the best solution that works for you. In return, you get everything you need for your work (noise-canceling headset, laptop, etc.). You need vacation? We offer you 30 days of vacation. Not enough? You can "buy" an additional 15 days every year by converting your salary. You want to further your education? We take your personal development goals seriously and, in addition to our idealo Learning Hub, eLearning offers (e.g., Udemy, DataCamp), coaching & mediation, we also offer you the opportunity to benefit individually from our training budget. And what about the office? Our office in the heart of Berlin offers free organic breakfast, excellent subsidized lunch, as well as free coffee, lemonades and after-work beer, in addition to the "standard foosball". At the same time, you can network with colleagues from our group of companies on our beautiful rooftop terrace. Do you like support outside of work? We offer free counseling and support in all areas of life (professional, private, family, health, etc.) in cooperation with the pme-Familienservice. You don't live in Germany yet? We support you in the visa process and with your relocation.    About Idealo  idealo is a Berlin success story: in 2000 we started out with the mission of helping consumers make the best purchasing decisions. Right in the heart of Berlin, over 1200 employees from 60 nations are working on the future of online shopping. We focus on agile and self-reliant work, sustainability and a healthy relationship between work and private life. These values are firmly anchored in our corporate culture and an integral part of our corporate philosophy.   As part of our team, you can look forward to freedom, an international and inspiring working environment. Your ideas are particularly important to us. Not only our product portfolio is diverse, but also the people who work on it. We want you just as you are! Origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation or a severely handicapped degree do not play a role.   Information for applicants with severe disabilities: As an applicant with a severe disability, you can get advice from our Severely Disabled Representation (SBV) during the application process. Please contact sbv@idealo.de.   Work in the office and from wherever you like.  idealo allows you to work from wherever you are. As part of our Hybrid Work at idealo, you decide whether and how often you work from our office in Berlin or remotely because you live in another city within Germany or the caf√© down the street makes the best coffee cream. Only about once a month, there will be mandatory office days to bring idealos together at company, department or team level, including stunning views from our roof terrace. Find out what Hybrid Work at idealo is all about here and in a personal conversation in the interviews!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (f/m/d)
Description: At IONOS, the leading European provider of cloud infrastructure, cloud services and hosting services, you will work together with a wide range of teams. We are characterized by open structures, a friendly working culture and flat hierarchies with a strong team spirit. We firmly believe that work and fun are compatible, and offer you the right environment for this. Our constant growth means that we are always looking for new colleagues. Become part of IONOS and grow with us.   Your Tasks:  Are you interested in product development in the field of machine learning? Then you have come to the right place. We develop ML products for use by end customers as well as internal customers. To build our products, we use Python, Java, Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Docker, and Kubernetes, among others. If you have hands-on experience with any of these products or are interested in learning how to use them, please apply to this job profile.   You will identify business requirements based on customer needs. You will prepare data for training machine learning models or select already trained models. You will select appropriate models (based on criteria such as performance and speed). You are responsible for the introduction and deployment of production-ready models.   We Appreciate:   You have a college degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Machine Learning or in a similar field of study. You have experience in application development in computer vision, text (NLP), audio and/or forecasting in cloud environments. You have had previous experience in software development using Python for cloud applications (microservices with REST APIs). You bring knowledge in continuous delivery on cloud platforms. You are fluent in German and can communicate in English    About IONOS    1&1 IONOS is Europe's leading platform for cloud services and hosting services. We successfully support our customers in their business development.   More than 4000 employees in several countries around the world are working to meet the requirements and wishes of our 8.5 million customers.   We promote the development of our employees and their different talents, interests and languages.   We value diversity and welcome all applications - regardless of, for example, gender, nationality, ethnic or social origin, religion, disability, age as well as sexual orientation and identity, physical characteristics, marital status or any other irrelevant factor subject to applicable law.

Title: Software Engineer, 3D graphics (m/f/x)
Description: You are a passionate Software Engineer, experienced with modern object-oriented design and the use of design patterns?  Do you enjoy working in an international, agile and dynamic environment?  Job Purpose  As part of our growth strategy, we have 3 newly created full-time vacancies as Software Engineers (Associate to Senior) with an immediate starting date, available at our Software Hubs in Madrid, Spain or Berlin, Germany. In this role you will assist in developing, maintaining, and deploying ClearCorrect's custom applications as part of a growing team of specialists, working for a world market leader in dental technology.   Main Responsibilities   Gathering requirements and translating them into designs, documentation, and ultimately working Software that delivers business value Developing and maintaining automated tests Developing stable, flexible, scalable, and maintainable product architectures, software, and infrastructure Planning and executing work in an incremental and iterative software development process Using, developing, and debugging on Linux Performing peer code reviews Identifying and researching new technologies and software development improvements Capturing and communicating best practices and recommending new technology solutions Mentoring other software engineer team members and supervising engineers building products Translating prototype algorithms into production code Maintaining a strategic point of view and keeping customer success in mind throughout the project lifecycle Collaborating with peers on software design, work estimation and implementation of new features Contributing ideas to continually improve the team's productivity & code quality   Qualifications   Degree in computer science, mathematics, or similar field. Master‚Äôs degree highly preferred for Senior roles 5+ years of experience developing software and web applications Proficiency in java, C++, javascript or typescript Experience in computational algorithms development Good understanding of 3D geometry (vectors, matrices) Ability to design, code, and debug applications in various software languages And to dive into a polyglot codebase and contribute while learning. Experience in Test Driven Development (TDD) Experience with good object-oriented design, design patterns, and domain driven design principles Broad knowledge of data structures and algorithms Excellent problem solving, communication and presentation skills Strong collaborative skills coupled with the ability to question Professional fluency in English   Desirable   Proficiency with ansible or other devops tool Experience in 3D engines and libraries (OpenGL, DirectX, WebGL, Unity) Experience with cloud computing: AWS, GCE, CloudStack, OpenStack or equivalent Experience developing on Unix Experience with SQL, RDBMS, and NoSQL concepts Experience working on large software systems, preferably distributed systems, event driven architectures, and microservice architectures Experience with machine learning Hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies, typically ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations   What We Offer   exciting and innovative projects for renowned customers in the medical technology sector short decision-making processes and a friendly, competent team of developers and dental technicians modern office with a familiar working atmosphere no dress code flexible working hours and the possibility for home office individual further training opportunities   All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability.   Employment Type:  Full Time   Alternative Locations: Madrid (Spain) or Berlin (Germany)  Travel Percentage:  0 - 10%   Requisition ID:  6061   6061

Title: Full Stack Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
Are you ready to be a technology leader in the SaaS space? Join epilot! epilot is building a SaaS product to sell complex products online, focusing first on solving ecommerce in the rapidly transforming energy market. Our mission: Make selling complex products as easy as selling a pair of shoes online. Our Unique Engineering Culture Is Defined By a Few Core Engineering Principles As Software Engineer at epilot you will be a driving force in shaping this mission. What makes working as a Software Engineer at epilot so special. Among others, you can expect freedom and responsibility because we hire smart people who we can trust. We operate by principles and expect our teams to cultivate a strategic mindset. We believe in ownership: you build it, you run it . We subscribe to this core principle of the DevOps movement. There is no dedicated Ops team who you can pass on the responsibility to take your code and make sure it runs reliably and scales to customers‚Äô needs. You should always show, don‚Äôt tell : Deliver working software early and frequently. We believe in the basic Agile principle of ‚ÄúRelease early and release often‚Äù. This approach helps us manage risk and make better decisions by creating fast feedback loops between ourselves and our users. We design software API First. Before we write a single line of code, we design the APIs of a service in a way that any other team, whether internal to epilot or external, can use the APIs interface with our service without prior knowledge. Does this sound like an environment you want to work in? Then you could bet the right person to be an engineer at epilot! Check out our promise to you: promise.epilot.cloud We "epilots" are a team of experts from the fields of software development, energy management, product management and sales. In order to bring our solution even faster to the top in the energy world, we are looking for you as a Full Stack Engineer (m/f/d).

Desired Skills and Experience

What awaits you You‚Äôll get familiar with our tech stack with microfrontends, serverless AWS and best-in-class developer tooling & automation. More info about our stack: Tech stack You are part of an agile cross-functional team of full-stack, backend and frontend developers, as well as designers and product managers who are growing together and helping one another You will participate in exciting and diverse development projects using agile methods and the chance to pair and collaborate You will coach others to learn more as well as be constantly learning new technologies yourself. In close collaboration with our product management and design teams, you deliver end to end features for our users You will not only help us to put our product vision into practice, but you will also play an active role in shaping it. What you bring Ideally you have experience with React or other JavaScript frameworks Experience crafting and implementing RESTful micro-services or GraphQL Understanding of SaaS, PaaS, IaaS industry with hands on experience with public OR private cloud offerings (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) You are familiar with microservices based architecture patterns Experience in taking ownership of features, with a team on short and long-running projects Practical knowledge of agile software development methodologies (e.g.,scrum, XP) You think like an entrepreneur - you understand our business goals and how your daily decisions influence them. You don't see problems as a problem, but as a great opportunity for you personally, your team and epilot. You are a doer and have a strong Do-IT mentality. You make quick, smart decisions and weigh the risk intelligently. You are a TEAM player, motivating and inspiring your colleagues. What we offer you The opportunity to help building the most successful SaaS platform in the energy market. Start-up mentality: dynamic atmosphere and great team spirit. A rapidly growing company with an open communication culture, motivated colleagues and an international corporate culture. Exponential learning curve - epilot is growing rapidly and we expect the same from you. You never stand still, you are permanently challenged, you learn from your mistakes a la Fail Fast and Often. Flexible working hours and remote work - You have an important appointment in the morning? No problem! You decide where and when you want to work. A central location in the heart of Cologne with cool cafes around the corner (But of course full remote jobs are also available). Performance is rewarded with us - We take your desired salary seriously and talk openly about it with you. Transparency - We maintain a very flat and open corporate culture, everything is visible and open for discussion. Regular team events such as carnival, the summer party, Christmas party, company breakfast and many more opportunities to get to know your co-epilots outside working hours. Our highlight event is our yearly epilot summit in the summer where you will meet your co-epilots from all over the world. Coffee, cold drinks, fruits and much appreciation. We are looking forward to your application!

Title: Full-Stack Developer ‚Ä¢ React/Node.js ‚Ä¢ FRANKFURT/Main + remote ‚Ä¢ Internationals welcome ‚Ä¢ m-f-d

To international candidates:    Please note that we are looking for people, who live in Germany (prefered) or at least in the EU and have a valid work permit already. Qualifikation  You offer ‚Ä¶   a senior level development experience (see explanation above) actual development experience in React (Angular, JQuery optional) backend-knowledge in Node.js a good understanding of usability principles fluency in English (German nice-to-have)    Benefits    The agency offers you ‚Ä¶   innovative projects for German and international customers flexible working hours ¬ªflat rate¬´ home office which means a partial remote working option, according to your needs an 80% option / 4 days per week (interesting for ex-freelances) a vivid office life with ¬ªgude¬´ humored colleagues plenty room for your personal development and ideas drinks, excellent coffee, fruits etc. relocation support to the Frankfurt Main area in Germany a good and competitive compensation   This is a modern development agency, using innovative technologies and ¬ªthe latest sh..¬´ to offer valuable services in digital transformation. The service portfolio extends along the digital value chain: Consulting, conception, UX architecture and interaction design, usability testing, UI design, technical implementation / software development, DevOps / infrastructure & maintenance.

Title: Software Engineer (d/f/m)
Description: Job Description    A vacancy for a Software Engineer (d/f/m)  has arisen within Airbus Defence and Space in Manching  .   If you are looking for a challenging task in a development team at Airbus Defence and Space in Manching and if you are interested in systems & software design around military aircrafts, you‚Äôre welcomed to our department.   We develop and maintain Electronic Warfare Ground Support Systems for our Tornado, A400M and Eurofighter platforms at the Airbus-sites in Manching.   Our systems enable Electronic Warfare mission data preparation, provide the interfaces to the flying platforms, and support the evaluation of the mission or flight.    Your Main Tasks And Responsibilities Will Include     Analysis of the use cases and needs in close cooperation with the various stakeholders of system engineering team Definition and realization of software architectures and the ability to evaluate different architectural solutions and choose the best solution Understand user workflows and define SW and Graphical User Interface (GUI) solutions using specific technologies to support and enhance different steps throughout the mission data production. Design and implementation of mission data preparation and validation solutions with the support of state-of-the-art technologies such as Eclipse, OSGI and Java. Preparation and execution of software tests to satisfy the different levels of verification and validation Integration of activities in the Software Development Lifecycle Develop according to Software Development Plan and accompanied standards     We are looking for candidates with the following skills and experience:     Bachelor degree in computer science or equivalent qualification Graduates and young professionals are welcome to apply Experience with Eclipse, OSGI and Java Good written and spoken German Good written and spoken English A proactive mindset and high teamwork Motivation for agile SW development processes and methods    Disabled applicants with equal qualifications will be given special consideration.    We Offer     Challenging tasks for/with unique services and products Pleasant working atmosphere in a professional and international work environment Exciting development opportunities and perspectives Extensive company training offers (eLearning and Classroom Trainings) Flexible working hours Compatibility of work and family life Attractive remuneration Company Pension Scheme Good connections to public transport and local parking facilities Catering facilities on site    This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company‚Äôs success, reputation and sustainable growth.    Company    Airbus Defence and Space GmbH    Contract Type    Permanent Contract / CDI / Unbefristet / Contrato indefinido    Experience Level    Entry Level / D√©butant / Anf√§nger / Reci√©n titulado    Job Family    Software Engineering   By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.   Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.   Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com.   At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Title: Junior Low Code App Developer (m/w/d)

Title: Full Stack Developer NodeJS/TypeScript/React (m/f/d)
Description: We are looking for a Full Stack Javascript Developer familiar with NodeJS, TypeScript, and React, who will drive our Web-Application. The Web-Application serves as the central place where stenon users are interacting with our data. It is responsible for collecting, evaluating, and visualizing spatial data over time, doing agronomic calculations like a fertilizer recommendation or how much CO2 equivalent is captured in soil, as well as exporting data into various formats, e.g. as a map that can be directly transferred onto a tractor. The application is written in TypeScript and consists of an Express backend that performs most of the heavy lifting with regards to geo-spatial data processing, handling file imports, and other functionality. The frontend is a React/Redux app (also written in Typescript) that handles GeoJSON data and renders it on a map using MapboxGL. We also utilize worker threads, socket communication, and d3 for data visualization.   Tasks   Design, build and maintain backend systems, including services and API interfaces that serve Web Front Ends as well as 3rd party DaaS-Integrations Improve our Single-Page Frontend(s) to make it easier for our users to plan measurement sessions, plot soil and satellite-based data on interactive maps, create actionable insights with very few clicks Be part of the ideation and product development together with Product and Design Define the technical roadmap together with the CTO and the VP of Software Engineering    Requirements    Customer Focused: You measure the success of your work with the actual value created for the user and the business. You don't consider your job to be done until you receive this feedback. Up To Code: You have more than 4 years hands-on experience with writing clean code in multiple languages (e.g. TypeScript/NodeJS, JavaScript) that not only works but is maintainable. You always strive to pick the appropriate tools and technologies for the given problem. End-to-end responsibility: If you work on a project, you care about the whole life-cycle: Ideation, planning, prototyping, coding, testing, deploying and fixing things in case they break. A Problem Solver: You enjoy solving challenging problems. You are comfortable starting with problems as the input to your work instead of highly detailed lists of tasks. You enjoy understanding problems in detail, becoming an expert in them and then working to implement solutions that can be validated with the team and our customers.    Benefits    A role within a highly productive and supportive team full of dedicated, hard-working professionals An agile work environment with flat hierarchies and an international team Working fully remote (within Germany) or from our Potsdam office The opportunity of being a valuable contributor to Stenon‚Äôs success Permanent full-time position with flexible work hours Laptop of your choice Coffee, tea, and snacks in our office ABC Berlin/Potsdam Travel pass   We are on a mission to make soil data accessible in real-time, thus changing how farmers can cultivate their land. To achieve this, we put our customers first and try to understand the challenges they have deeply. This understanding combined with world-class engineering has allowed us to build a game-changing product.We value transparency and honesty in our mission to develop an open and constructive company culture that allows our team to perform at the highest level. We strive to learn from each other and improve continuously.

Title: Full-Stack Web Developer (ReactJS/NodeJs)

This means high involvement in the design process and understanding what the customer wants. It also means that you enjoy technological decisions. You have the ability to work independently and take full ownership of your projects from day one. You are a quick learner and you love learning technologies as you go. You always want to find the right tool for the right job. You are solution-oriented. We are just starting our journey and need to find working solutions quickly. You're comfortable working with various types of APIs. You have a passion for good design. You are an excellent communicator, both online and offline.** Requirements:** Full-time: Minimum availability of at least 12 months Availability starting in July/August/September Remote-first Fluent in English Highly motivated to ship features and improvements weekly with us    Benefits    Our offer and benefits   Paid full-time contract (40k - 60k depending on experience and culture fit) Flexible working hours, fun working environment with a small team Regular social team gatherings across Germany. Be part of a fast growing team in a promising market.   How to apply:  Simply send us   the word ‚ÄúLemon‚Äù, so we know you actually read this text your CV portfolio site/side projects (website, github etc.)   or contact one of the founders on LinkedIn (Raji Sarhi or Anna Loerzer). Title: Full Stack Software Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: RapidMiner  is reinventing enterprise AI so that anyone has the power to positively shape the future. We‚Äôre doing this by offering an enterprise-ready data science platform for people of all skill levels.   RapidMiner has been designated as leaders in our white-hot market by both Gartner and Forrester, over the past 8 years. More than 40,000 organizations in over 150 countries rely on RapidMiner to increase revenue, cut costs, and reduce risk.   We are venture capital (VC) backed with a work from anywhere policy, though our headquarters is in Boston (MA, USA) and we have locations in Dortmund (Germany), Budapest (Hungary), and London (UK).   Job Description  Title:  Full Stack Software Engineer   Hiring office:  RapidMiner GmbH, Westfalendamm 87, 44141 Dortmund, Germany   RapidMiner builds machine learning and data science software and provides the leading unified data science platform for easy-to-use data science and for lightning fast business impact. Our visual user interface and software accelerate the process of creating predictive analytics models and makes it easy to automate processes and embed automatically generated predictions and results in business operations. We make data analytics teams more productive through a single platform that unifies data preparation, machine learning, model validation, automation, and deployment. The Java-based RapidMiner platform supports heterogenous teams and diverse user groups from experienced coding data scientist to application domain experts and business analysts without coding skills. For data scientists, RapidMiner seamlessly integrates Python, R, and Groovy scripts, provides a Java API, and allows easy-to-develop extensions. For non-coding data analysts and application domain experts, RapidMiner provides guided analytics, automated machine learning (AutoModel / AutoML) and optimization, as well as visual data mining process design, application templates, a built-in recommender system, and result visualization.   Our Research team  is part of our mission to take our existing machine learning platform to the next level. The team is focused on implementing innovative extensions to the platform and to deliver web-based solutions for data scientist who are keen on adding value to their work quickly, without compromises. The Research team at RapidMiner seeks passionate software developers to be part of our agile team, to develop innovative machine learning and predictive analytics solutions, shape the future of what is possible with machine learning, and to enable others to leverage these opportunities.   Your activities include:   Contribution to and responsibility for R&D projects with the goal to design and build innovative data mining algorithms, solutions, applications, and pilot projects. Collaboration with R&D project partners, i.e. universities, research organizations, and companies. Documentation of software, solutions, applications, and results. Support of the RapidMiner product development team and the overall RapidMiner team.    You will be contributing to one of our key projects by taking your fair share from conceptualizing an idea to bringing it into production. We understand that the developers are attached to the software they are building, so you are welcome to be vocal about your own ideas and about product decisions.   While we have a work-from-anywhere policy, we require the applicant to be in the same time zone as the rest of the team to support efficient collaboration. Since culture and in-person meetings are important to us as well, being located in Germany is preferred.   Major Responsibilities:   Work on innovative data mining and predictive analytics solutions in diverse industries. Cooperate with partners from various companies, research organizations, and universities. Develop innovative extensions for our predictive analytics software platform RapidMiner. Analyze new use cases and generalize your solution to create re-usable application templates. Take full responsibilities from the design and implementation of features to their delivery in our platform architecture. Help to ensure high source code quality and product quality by writing meaningful tests and reviewing your colleagues‚Äô pull requests. Participate in product related discussions like backlog refinement meetings, weekly reviews, user tests, and discovery sessions. Being a full-stack developer, you master frontend and backend infrastructure and development. Help to grow the organization together by supporting other teams which are affected by your work.    About You  Requirements  You‚Äôre passionate about Java and React. You are also a team player who loves to work within a small and agile team to quickly provide high quality results that improve the life of users. You have distinctive analytical and conceptual skills and you enjoy working with innovative technologies. Plus, the ease of use of the software you‚Äôve developed is important to you.   Required Skills  Here are some things we are looking for.   Keep in mind that this isn't a checklist ‚Äì if you think you would be a good candidate, apply!   Analytical skills and the ability to translate application problems into data mining solutions Strong programming skills with modern software architectures Knowledge of Java Experience of Java back-end development and JavaScript front-end development Experience with frontend and backend development for web-based applications Experience with modern cloud architectures (SpringBoot etc.) Good verbal and written communication skills in English Ability to work in an agile team as well as autonomously    Nice to Have  We welcome applications by experienced software developers as well as by fresh graduates.   Experience in any of the following areas is a plus:   Experience with Spring offerings (Boot, Security, Data, etc.), Hibernate Experience with any of the modern JavaScript frontend frameworks, preferably React Experience with messaging and distributed services architecture Experience with any of the cloud providers, preferably AWS Experience building complex web applications using React Experience with Gradle, Jenkins, Jenkinsfile, Git, Docker Experience with Machine Learning algorithms and implementing ML-based solutions Experience with performing data science and machine learning projects Experience with the RapidMiner platform (e.g. as a user or as an extension developer) or other modern data science platforms and tools Machine learning libraries like scikit-learn, MLPy, TensorFlow, Keras, DL4J, etc. German language skills (optional)    Benefits  RapidMiner offers highly competitive salaries and development opportunities ‚Äì all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment:   Flexible working hours and possibility to work from home if desired Modern office equipment (e.g. standing desks) Free beverages, fruit, and other goodies Table tennis and football table to challenge your peers after lunch Social events (e.g., escape rooms, office golf) Fantastic team of people    RapidMiner is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.   RapidMiner doesn't accept unsolicited agency resumes and won't pay fees to any third-party agency or firm that doesn't have a signed agreement with RapidMiner.

Title: React Developer | Technologist (f/m/x) | Stuttgart or Berlin
Description: zigzag is an independent, international design agency with a focus on user experience and digital product design. We accompany and guide our clients through the entire product development process, from strategy, user research, interaction, and visual design, to prototype and software development. Since our foundation in 2012, our team has been working for Fortune 500 companies and start-ups in various industries such as financial services, automotive, transportation, health care, and more. Awards including the iF Design Award, Red Dot Design Award, and the German Design Award testify to the excellence of our work.    We believe this excellence is rooted in collaboration, trust, curiosity, passion, and diverse teams based on mutual respect. That is why zigzag is all about people; people who share our values and jointly strive to bridge user needs, business, technology, community, and the planet.     Want to join? Currently we are seeking Technologists (f/m/x) with a focus on React Development to join our multidisciplinary team in Stuttgart or Berlin (Berlin office coming soon), partly remote option. The position is available at different career levels: entry-, mid-, and Senior-level.     ÔªøRESPONSIBILITY - What you will do   You participate in/ are responsible for technology platform research and experimentation, prototyping and software development, as well as ideation within the creative process for designing user experiences in software. You collaborate closely with our creative team to express concepts and designs in the form of interactive prototypes, user experience simulations, technical proof-of-concepts, and UI/presentation layer components and templates as reference material for design validation and the software development process. For some projects, we go all the way which means you get to develop and implement production quality frontend software components in our agile development team.     SKILLS - What you must have   Professional experience collaboratively designing and developing user interfaces, UX concepts, and/or software applications on diverse technology platforms: up to 3 years (entry-level), 2 to 5 years (mid-level), or more than 4 years (Senior-level) A strong understanding of web development with an emphasis on frontend implementation Experience with React, JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML, and CSS Experience with building custom reusable UI components Thorough experience with state of the art web development technology: npm / Node.js, Postman (or similar), Jlint (or similar) and others Familiarity with RESTful APIs Familiarity with collaborative development and version control (Git) Experience in any of the following technologies is a plus: Other Web technologies (AngularJS, Vue.js), iOS development, Android development, Flutter, Unity (C#), Microsoft .NET Experience in creating animations (e.g. with CSS Animation or in JavaScript) Experience with Sketch/Zeplin, Figma or Abstract Experience with creating Progressive Web Apps (e.g. with IONIC) or Electron Apps is a plus An eye for state-of-the-art UI designs Proactive team player with strong written and verbal communication skills in English, German a plus Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äòs degree in software development, engineering, or a creative discipline     BENEFITS - What we offer   Building your skills within a team of multidisciplinary and international professionals Challenging projects for global clients in a surrounding without hierarchies and restraints Opportunity to pursue your interests and to implement own ideas Competitive and fair salary plus a performance-based bonus Part-time options available on request (full-time is 40 hours/week) 30 vacation days per year (for full-time positions) Work in a modern and welcoming studio atmosphere located in the heart of Stuttgart or join our emerging team in Berlin (office coming soon) Option to work partly remote from a location in Germany (details on demand) Support with German work permit and relocation to Stuttgart/Berlin, if needed Corporate pension plan Financial support and paid leave for further education and training Business mobile, state of the art hardware and equipment Financial support for public transport tickets and job bikes Benefits like regular team events, free drinks, coffee, sweets, and fruit     Sounds like you?    Please apply online using the "Apply" button on top of the ad or send us an e-mail along with your CV and portfolio to play@zigzag.is.    By sending an e-mail you confirm to our data privacy statement for e-mail applications. Find more information here: https://zigzag.is/data-policy-for-applications/    Any open questions? We are looking forward to hearing from you!     Sophie Frank   Operations & HR    zigzag GmbH  Kronprinzstr. 11  70173 Stuttgart  Germany     play@zigzag.is   +49 711 504 547 12     Ôªøwww.zigzag.is

Title: C++ Software Engineer
Description: Job Description    Committed, dynamic and with a passion for precision, we revolutionize the world of mapping and survey.   Do you love doing research, design and implementation of product features? Are you skilled in full lifecycle software development? Do you thrive in performing within and across disciplinary teams? If this description suits you, join our development team and take your career journey to the next level.   A very exciting opportunity awaits you within our Geospatial Content Solutions (GCS)  business unit at Hexagon‚Äôs Geosystems  division. We develop and produce innovative technologies that revolutionize aerial data acquisition, processing, and services. You will be part of an agile team of 500+ talented and progressive individuals that innovate our industry.   This is the role  We are currently looking for a Software Engineer  to be a part of our growing and talented Germany/Berlin  based team.   In this role, you will handle the following key areas of excitement:   Handle research, design and implementation of new product features. Work as a member of a small development team that develops high performance cluster applications to process large amount of raw data from digital imaging (frame, line and oblique) and LiDAR sensors to create GIS ready end-products for complex analysis and visualization. Perform full lifecycle of software development using iterative agile software development methodologies including requirements gathering, object-oriented analysis and design (OOAD), implementation (including unit testing), deployment, and maintenance. Assist with maintenance and enhancement of existing HPC software products including debugging and diagnosis of software defects.    Desired Skills    This is you   Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Geomatics, Computer Science, Engineering or related scientific fields 2+ years of professional C++ experience Effective verbal and written communication skills in English Experience working in both Windows and Unix/Linux environments Solid expertise building complex desktop applications with C++ programming language and its development tools Strong understanding of object-oriented techniques, refactoring and design patterns Able to constructively evaluate and discuss design alternatives in a team environment  In addition, the following skills are highly desirable:   Agile development methodologies like Scrum or XP Unit and/or mock testing including test driven development Geospatial sciences and/or developing applications for GIS/CAD a plus RDBMS (Oracle or Postgresql) Cloud Computing Enterprise applications for streaming data using application servers and distributed systems. Open-source technologies including QT, boost, cppunit, log4cxx, geos, etc.   This is us  As part of the Hexagon brand network, consisting of a 20,000 strong global workforce, we encourage our employees to grow with our company. It is important to us that our employees have the opportunity to make a valuable contribution to the business while at the same time developing their own talents and careers.    How To Apply    If you are interested in this challenging and varied position, then we look forward to receiving your online application! Due to the privacy policy, we accept applications only via the application form.   Job Family  Information Technology   City  Berlin

Title: Software Engineer / Software Developer (m/f/d)
Description: Overview    As one of the world‚Äôs leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker covers a broad spectrum of advanced solutions in all fields of research and development. All our systems and instruments are designed to improve safety of products, accelerate time-to-market and support industries in successfully enhancing quality of life. We‚Äôve been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 60 years now. Today, worldwide more than 7,200 employees are working on this permanent challenge, at over 70 locations on all continents.   the job holder has the responsibility to develop and maintain the Control Software that is used to collect data from our surface plasmon resonance (SPR) devices. The software processes images from an optical detector and communicates to several additional hardware components. It also allows to create and run batch jobs on those devices. You will work relatively independently in a small team that is located partially in Hamburg and partially in Santiago de Compostela.    Responsibilities    Maintenance and further development of the Control Software that is used to run our instruments Integrating a new device platform into our existing code base Developing a web client application to execute basic funcionalities of the Control Software using an API Supporting our technical service team Specifying software subcomponents and implementing them Writing unit tests Documenting your work Supporting customers and our technical service team in case of urgent problems    Qualifications    University degree or PhD (informatics, engineering disciplines, or natural science) Experience with hardware-related programming Some years experience in an object-oriented programming language. We mainly develop in C# using WPF and Windows Forms for the front end Nice to have: experience with any kind of web development You are enthusiastic not only about coding but also technology in general Logical and scientific thinking and a deep understanding of the idea of object oriented programming Interest in natural science. It is important to get a comprehensive understanding about what our instruments are used for in pharmaceutical research Good English skills since you will also work with colleagues in other countries

Title: Software Engineer (Mobile / React Native) / Remote

Our community has the choice of more than 2,000 products delivered to their homes within 10 minutes. Delivery takes place exclusively on e-bikes and happens from one of our micro warehouses, centrally located in the urban area. As a very fast growing Start-Up we want to be present in all major cities in Europe.   To strengthen our back office team we are looking for you as a Content Creator   Tasks   You work in high cross-functional teams including our Founders, CFO, CTO, and Head of Operations You will be an experienced React Native developer, and will deeply understand the iOS and/or Android development and app store ecosystems. This will include experience with mobile app testing and CI/CD for mobile apps, as well as staying on top of changes for new versions of iOS and Android as they are released. Ensuring that the development processes are optimised for our customers: fast delivery, regular releases and an amazing user experience Maintaining quality control and performance of the mobile application Participate in ERP Projects including information gathering, analysis, design, implementation, migration, upgrades, testing and go live support    Requirements    You have extensive professional experience in either React Native (minimum 3 years) Knowledge in use of Firebase services (Cloud Messaging, In-App Messaging, Crashlytics, Analytics); ability to write well-documented, clean Javascript code; Integrate with our backend API Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to explain complex concepts in a simple manner You‚Äôre in a country which is GMT +/- 3 and fluent communicating both verbally and in writing in English Improve performance of the current app You‚Äôll support our CTO in measuring how happy our customers and business users    Benefits    Fair and competitive salary Flat hierarchies - own ideas can be implemented immediately Steep learning curve in a fast paced environment Focus & support on personal development from the whole team Engagement with large network of founders and investors Hands on company culture with many fun off-side events. Fast Scaling and high competive market enviroment, having no limit for your carreer. Possibility to work from different countries in Europe.   grovy is an employer that gives its applicants equal opportunities, regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, religion or ethnicity. We evaluate only skills and willingness to perform. We stand for diversity, inclusion and the fight against discrimination.   Become part of our team to become part of developement and change. That is grovy.

Was du bei uns machst   Du entwickelst mit deinen Kollegen moderne, interaktive und responsive Webportal- und Mikro-Frontends sowie Web-Applikationen und programmierst diese mit einem H√∂chstma√ü an Qualit√§t und Effizienz. In der Frontendentwicklung gehst du gerne neue Wege und stellst auch Altbew√§hrtes infrage. Den daf√ºr notwendigen Freiraum bieten wir dir gerne!   Wann du zu uns passt   Du bist ein echter Teamplayer. Einer f√ºr alle, alle f√ºr einen ‚Äì das ist dein und unser Motto. Du bringst ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Wirtschafts-/Medieninformatik, Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation mit. Du hast den Willen, zu lernen, dich kontinuierlich weiterzuentwickeln ‚Äì und dein Wissen weiterzugeben. Dabei unterst√ºtzen wir dich gerne mit einer Vielzahl an Weiterbildungsma√ünahmen und internen Angeboten!    Was du von uns hast    Deine Erfolgsmomente sind unsere Inspiration. Bei uns bist du Mensch ‚Äì und keine Nummer!  Wir legen sehr hohen Wert auf einen freundschaftlich-kollegialen, aber auch ehrlichen Umgang miteinander. Respekt, Vertrauen und Verantwortung werden bei uns gro√ügeschrieben. Ellenbogenmentalit√§t findest du bei uns nicht. Jedes Projekt bringt neue, spannende Herausforderungen mit sich. Wir wissen, dass wir diese erfolgreich nur im Team meistern und helfen uns daher gegenseitig. Das gemeinsame Arbeiten, Aust√ºfteln, Umdenken, Umsetzen und Optimieren macht uns Spa√ü und wir lernen jeden Tag dazu. Bei uns gewinnen die besten Ideen und deine sind uns jederzeit willkommen. Deine Work-Life-Balance nehmen wir sehr ernst. Viele von uns haben gerade eine Familie gegr√ºndet oder zeitintensive Hobbys. Wir glauben, dass ausgeglichene Mitarbeiter das Team deutlich weiterbringen, als wenn wir ihnen √úberstunden aufb√ºrden. Daher achten wir darauf, dass diese m√∂glichst gar nicht erst anfallen, setzen dich auf m√∂glichst wenigen Projekten parallel ein und unterst√ºtzen dich beim eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten ‚Äì und im Umgang mit deinen eigenen Ressourcen.   Deine Vorteile   Flexible Arbeitszeiten: Wir tun alles daf√ºr, damit du Privatleben und Beruf unter einen Hut bringen kannst. Freie Zeiteinteilung und mobiles Arbeiten geh√∂ren dazu. Du passt zu uns? Dann bewirb dich!  Du hast Lust auf tolle Kunden, mit denen du spannende Web-Projekte realisieren kannst? Du bl√ºhst bei Teamwork erst so richtig auf? Du brennst f√ºr das, was du tust und wagst dich aus der eigenen Komfortzone? Du willst unsere Zukunft aktiv mitgestalten? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!  Ein Anschreiben ben√∂tigen wir nicht, aber wir sind schon neugierig, was dich an dieser Stelle interessiert. Nach Bewerbungseingang melden wir uns schnellstm√∂glich bei dir. Passt der erste Eindruck, findet ein erstes Gespr√§ch in der Regel schon innerhalb einer Woche statt. Und wenn da die Chemie stimmt, machen wir einen zweiten Termin, in dem du im Rahmen einer kleinen Fallstudie deine fachlichen Skills unter Beweis stellen und das Team und deine Arbeitsumgebung kennen lernen kannst.   Du hast noch Fragen?  Fragen zum Bewerbungsablauf beantwortet dir Sandra Rang aus dem HR-Team. Sie freut sich auf deinen Anruf +49 89 954590 33 oder deine E-Mail an hr@diva-e.com! Title: Software Engineer (EU)
Description: About Us  Committed to making a difference, InDebted was founded to change the world of consumer debt recovery for good. We're disrupting a broken industry and creating a better way for businesses to recover debt - where the customer comes first.   We‚Äôre a global, digital first and customer-obsessed team of over 270 people, living and working across 11 different countries.   And we‚Äôve also recently been named the AFR BOSS Best Place to Work! By focusing on the happiness and wellbeing of our people, we‚Äôve created a truly flexible, purpose driven and engaging workplace. We‚Äôre all here with one shared vision - to remove barriers to financial freedom for all people.   About The Role  Our engineering team at InDebted are comprised of full stack developers who primarily work in collaboration via Pair Programming, small feedback loops with Test Driven Development, Trunk based Development, Continuous Deployment, backed by a foundational layer of Infrastructure as Code, Observability, a Zero Bug Attitude and accountability with Collective Ownership.   As part of the engineering team, you will have exposure to work in the Research and Development teams of Product, Engineering and Data as we continuously revolutionise the collections industry.   Reporting to our Engineering Manager - Europe, we are looking for experienced full stack Software Engineers to help Indebted expand across different markets in Europe. InDebted has ambitious plans and goals and we are looking for someone who matches our values. We thrive on problem solving, and working with our wider Engineering teams as well as other areas of InDebted to continuously improve on our product strategy for our customers and end-users.   This role is open remotely for candidates based anywhere in Europe.   What will you do day to day?   Own end-to-end product features from ideation, automated testing, and implementation to deployment and monitoring. Embrace ‚ÄúYou build it, You run it‚Äù with ownership of the entire infrastructure across multiple deployment environments. Continuously learn new domain and technical concepts to maintain a deep understanding of the product strategy and system architecture. Leverage diverse partners in the multi-cloud ecosystem to maximize productivity and empower the business to focus on building our core intellectual property. Improve our code standards, maintainability, developer experience, data privacy, security, scalability, resilience and fault tolerance.    Experience And Skills   Significant exposure to running end-to-end projects. Significant experience with developing highly scalable, resilient applications. Deep understanding of computer science fundamentals, engineering principles, automated testing, networking protocols, and distributed systems. Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to understand and explain complex concepts to technical and non-technical audiences.    Tech Stack   Go, AWS Serverless, Event Sourcing, Lambda, SQS, SNS, Dynamo, Aurora Postgres, Terraform, DataDog, BuildKite, GitHub, Trello, Netlify, React JS    Our Benefits  At InDebted, you get a lot more than just a highly rewarding and exciting career. We also offer:   4DWW  - Not a compressed working week, but actually work 4 days, be paid for 5   Work wherever -  We‚Äôre a global team working in flexible locations - choose to work from home, in a co-working space, a bit of both, or see where the role takes you   Employee equity  - Access to share options in something big   Flexible paid leave  - We offer a trust based leave model - choose when you take leave, how much you take, and what you take it for   Remote Work Stipend  - A quarterly budget to spend on the items you need to create a working environment that supports your success and productivity   Uprise  - Our EAP Provider supports your physical, social & psychological wellbeing    At InDebted, we respect and celebrate the unique attributes, characteristics, and perspectives that make each person who they are. We also believe that bringing diverse individuals together allows us to build better products and a better overall company. InDebted is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
