Title: Full Stack Developer (m/f/d)
Description: Are you a passionate, experienced developer that wants to contribute to the evolution of the Internet?  We are a small team with big ambitions to improve Internet performance by improving how traffic behaves on Internet Provider Networks. If you are a creative problem-solver who wants to work with a world-class team, and enjoys learning new skills regularly, then we are interested in you!   Tasks   You develop high-performance, tested back-end web application components and data-processing microservices You contribute in a supporting role to front-end web application development You develop and maintain continuous integration/deployment and automated code quality assurance processes You understand and help lead design and architectural cost/benefit trade-off decisions   Our TECH STACK:  Languages: Python 3, JavaScript, TypeScript, Rust   Tools & Frameworks: React, Django Rest Framework, pytest, cypress, Docker Compose, ClickHouse (SQL-based DBMS), GitLab, GitLab CI/CD, Linux/Shell    Requirements    You have 3+ years of professional experience with backend development and software architecture You have advanced knowledge of Python 3, JavaScript, TypeScript and some knowledge of Rust You have a solid understanding of good API design, web technologies, tooling, and testing frameworks You are familiar with statistical processing and data visualization You are a thoughtful, self-driven team player who collaborates effectively   NICE-TO-HAVE:   You have knowledge of internet topology and mechanisms behind internet transport You have a good idea of network traffic behavior and possibilities of its visualization    Benefits    Learning Opportunities:  Lifelong learning is essential for us. We offer the opportunity to develop not only software, but also yourself!   Flexible Working Hours:  We know you have a life outside of work, which is why we allow you work whenever it suits you as long as you are available during our core working hours.   Health Offers:  Your health is important to us. We offer free health checks, regular preventive medical checkups, seasonal flu vaccines, free beverages and fruits.   Company Pension Scheme:  Be well positioned for the future - we offer a company pension scheme and pay monthly contributions.   Virtual Stock Options:  Be part of a success story and benefit from the company‚Äôs growth.   JobRad:  Join our bike leasing program to get a new bicycle at a reduced cost.   Shopping Discounts:  Products and services at a discount from numerous providers and partners.   Please email us your CV, a cover letter, and any relevant reports and/or work references you may have.   We are committed to a diverse workforce and strongly welcome all applications regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, disability or age.

Zudem unterst√ºtzen wir immer wieder gern StartUps bei der Realisierung ihrer digitalen Gesch√§ftsmodelle oder sind technischer Umsetzungspartner von innovativen Hochschulprojekten. Am Ende kommt eine App, eine Webanwendung, ein Pr√§mienshop oder ein ganzes Kundenbindungsprogramm dabei raus - was uns da jetzt so besonders macht? Unser Anspruch ist es, dass unsere Produkte f√ºr unsere Kunden einen sp√ºrbaren Mehrwert bieten. Dabei sind wir pragmatisch, aber verl√§sslich im Kleinen und wollen auf den Punkt abliefern. Bei der Auswahl unserer Kunden z√§hlt f√ºr uns eine geradlinige, offene Zusammenarbeit auf Augenh√∂he.     Hast du Lust, mit uns gemeinsam an neuen Aufgaben zu wachsen?  Dann bewirb Dich jetzt, am besten direkt √ºber unser Bewerbermanagementsystem auf der Webseite, per E-Mail an jobs@leanera.net oder kontaktiere uns direkt hier via LinkedIn.

Title: Software Developer (f/m/d)
Description: At IONOS, the leading European provider of cloud infrastructure, cloud services and hosting services, you will work together with a wide range of teams. We are characterized by open structures, a friendly working culture and flat hierarchies with a strong team spirit. We firmly believe that work and fun are compatible, and offer you the right environment for this. Our constant growth means that we are always looking for new colleagues. Become part of IONOS and grow with us.   Your Tasks:  In one of Europe's largest IT companies, we offer you the opportunity to use state-of-the-art technologies and develop innovative solutions based on diverse data volumes. In our interdisciplinary Competence Center, we are driving the harnessing of Big Data and artificial intelligence in collaboration with a wide range of business units. For IONOS SE - Europe's largest web hoster - we are building a data lake and an associated BI organization using the latest technologies. If you want to be part of such a project from the very beginning and help shape state-of-the-art technology, then apply to this job profile.   You will develop distributed applications in a high-load environment from data analysis to regular operation of data-based value chains. You will advise our customers in designing contemporary technical solutions for complex market challenges. You implement data-driven applications in compliance with European data protection standards (DSGVO) for millions of users. You will strike a balance between innovation and stability when selecting current technologies for the continuous further development of the platform (e.g.: use of cloud / containers or machine learning). You act independently in interdisciplinary, agile teams. You enjoy working on the challenges of a highly innovative environment and build bridges to established standards and technologies.   We Appreciate:  As the ideal candidate, you bring a degree (preferably in computer science) or comparable training and several years of professional experience. You round off your profile as follows:   Experience in one of the main areas of activity Big Data, high load applications or distributed systems is an advantage. You have very good knowledge in at least one of the languages Java, Python, R and SQL. You bring good knowledge in data modeling, design patterns and enterprise architecture patterns. You are experienced in BigData technologies such as Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, Tensorflow, Druid, Presto or have knowledge of GitLab version control. You have experience and enjoy agile processes and approaches as well as the ability to develop optimal solutions together in a team.    About IONOS    1&1 IONOS is Europe's leading platform for cloud services and hosting services. We successfully support our customers in their business development.   More than 4000 employees in several countries around the world are working to meet the requirements and wishes of our 8.5 million customers.   We promote the development of our employees and their different talents, interests and languages.   We value diversity and welcome all applications - regardless of, for example, gender, nationality, ethnic or social origin, religion, disability, age as well as sexual orientation and identity, physical characteristics, marital status or any other irrelevant factor subject to applicable law.

Title: Full Stack Developer
Description:
Do you see yourself as a member of a multinational team shaping the future of Europe‚Äôs leading secondary debt market for distressed loans, claims and receivables? On its way to cover most of the European jurisdictions by 2022, Debitos supports listed companies, banks and SME‚Äôs, to sell their exposures on the market through its auction-based online transaction platform. As the NPL market is receiving strong focus from institutional and governmental entities, the impact of our work will receive high visibility. Join our growing team in the heart of Frankfurt and seize the opportunity to be part of revolutionizing the way Europe tackles the non-performing loans crisis while enjoying what you do. Responsibilities You will act as a key contributor in all discussions regarding development, user experience, software and data architecture. Together with the project manager, scrum team, and other team members, you will design and develop software in short sprints, create documentation, data structures, and processes to meet the designated needs. As experienced Full-Stack Developer, you are passionate about building software the "right" way and teaching that software craftsmanship mentality to others. You understand the full development life-cycle and can cover all bases, from back-end to front-end there are no secrets for you. Ensure we deliver high quality software by writing clean code and utilizing TDD, continuous integration and code reviews. As a self-learner, you stay actively engaged in the technology industry and understand how the evolving technologies can benefit our organization. Your input will be crucial for further development and enhancement of our technology stack, life-cycle development, testing and deployment procedures. You will also build integrations with third party applications and be responsible for performance tuning through testing and iterative development You will need a strong awareness of best practice development including Agile methodologies, web application security, and scalability. You should have a strong analytical mindset, be self-organized and strongly believe in software craftsmanship and ensure the highest quality by following and improving processes and standards, and using automated unit tests, continuous integration and similar tools. What We Offer We‚Äôre all about cutting edge technology and you will be working with top-of the line IT equipment and best-in-class technologies. We are based in a modern, bright, easy-to-reach office location in central Frankfurt at walking distance from the main train station and a many food and shopping amenities. 28 days annual leave + public holidays (Germany), office snacks and drinks, table games, Friday drinks, team events, training. Discount online benefit portal, offering a wide range of discounts for high street retailers We offer a competitive salary, a start-up culture with a great work-life balance and lots of opportunity to grow, learn and be awesome. Life-work balance with flexible home office options

Desired Skills and Experience

We are looking for someone who is ambitious, focused and dedicated, a passionate problem solver who is willing to take on any challenge, is innovative with a wide array of technical proficiencies, and can managing multiple tasks or priorities simultaneously. You will enjoy working with a small international, talented and interdisciplinary team, with a strong creative culture, and be instrumental in helping us deliver high impact work at the cutting edge of financial technology and make our solution the industry standard. You bring strong expertise in at least a few of the following technologies: Web Languages / Frameworks: Node.js, Python with Django, PHP Front-End: React, Redux, Webpack, HTML5, CSS API / Web Services: RPC, JSON, REST SQL (MySQL, PostgreSQL), NoSQL (MongoDB, Redis) Unit-testing frameworks You Are Experienced In Rapid application development and building of prototypes Agile development methodologies Continuous Integration and automated deployment and configuration tools Minimum Qualifications EU residency Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or similar experience 3+ years of software development experience 1+ years of experience developing single-page applications and modern Front-End development using React Experience using distributed version control systems (such as Git) Strong written and verbal communication skills (English or German) Demonstrated ability to implement robust and effective software solutions Proven experience and skills in multiple facets of software engineering A strong drive and interest to learn new technologies quickly and work in a fast-paced software development environment Good understanding of all aspects of the product development life-cycle Familiar with basic security and infrastructure design, oAuth and single-signon authentication methods Desired Skills (not required but a bonus if you have them) Software development experience in a highly regulated environment such as the financial industry Experience designing software according to TDD / BDD principles Automated deployment and configuration tools (Docker, Jenkins) Experience working with DevOps tools like JIRA, GitHub, Slack and Trello Experience working with micro-service architectures and cloud computing (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud) Project management experience

Title: Full Stack Engineer (Growth Team) - Remote
Description: Mattermost is an open source platform for secure collaboration across the entire software development lifecycle. Hundreds of thousands of developers around the globe trust Mattermost to increase their productivity by bringing together team communication, task and project management, and workflow orchestration into a unified platform for agile software development.   Founded in 2016, Mattermost‚Äôs open source platform powers over 800,000 workspaces worldwide with the support of over 4,000 contributors from across the developer community. The company serves over 800 customers, including European Parliament, NASA, Nasdaq, Samsung, SAP, United States Air Force and Wealthfront, and is backed by world-class investors including Battery Ventures, Redpoint, S28 Capital, YC Continuity. To learn more, visit www.mattermost.com .   We value high impact work, ownership, self-awareness and being focused on customer success. If these values match who you are, we hope you'll learn more about working at Mattermost and apply!   Mattermost is seeking an experienced full stack Software Engineer who excels at React frontend development and has an aptitude for backend‚Äîideally Golang‚Äîdevelopment to join the Engineering Growth team. You‚Äôll be designing, developing and delivering critical features to expand Mattermost‚Äôs user base and usage.    Responsibilities    Own the end-to-end design, iteration, development, testing, and release of new features to support Mattermost‚Äôs product growth Implement, analyze and deploy A/B tests for experimenting feature impact on performance metrics Work seamlessly with product managers and designers to understand, define, and improve product requirements Write thoughtful and high quality code in React and Go Develop unit and end-to-end test cases Provide quality code review feedback to peers and community members Evaluate and recommend new technologies and tools to solve emergent challenges    Required Background/Skills    BS in Computer Science or related fields, or significant professional software development experience 3+ years of experience as a full-stack software engineer with a user product focus Front-end experience with React, Redux, Javascript and Typescript or related technologies Experience developing and interacting with Restful services Back-end experience with Go or related technologies Familiarity with relational databases, particularly MySQL and PostgreSQL Excitement for solving problems and providing workable solutions Ability to work independently in an asynchronous team environment Passion for communicating clearly, concisely and correctly: whether it's code, documentation, or even just a post in Mattermost    Preferences    Experience with automation frameworks like Cypress Experience with A/B testing frameworks like Split.io Working knowledge of cloud native applications for Kubernetes Experience with distributed application systems using HTTP, WebSockets, RPC, pub/sub at scale Comfortable with Docker, GitHub, Jira, CircleCI Experience working in open source communities.    We Are Currently Hiring Staff In These Countries/regions    Mattermost is a remote-first company with staff living and working across the globe.   Australia - Bangladesh - Brazil - Bulgaria - Canada - Chile - Colombia - Finland - Georgia - Germany - Greece - India - Ireland - Mauritius - Mexico - Norway - Pakistan - Philippines - Poland - Portugal - Spain - South Korea - Suriname - Turkey - Uganda - Ukraine - United Kingdom - United States  We are constantly working towards adding more countries/regions to this list, but first we need to make sure we are compliant with local laws and regulations, which takes time.   Mattermost is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people from all walks of life. We don't discriminate against staff or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate!

Title: Software Development Engineer SSD*
Description: Become a member of the BioNTech Family!  As a part of our team of more than 2.500 pioneers, you will play a key role in developing solutions for some of the most crucial scientific challenges of our age. Within less than a year, we were able to develop our COVID-19 mRNA vaccine following the highest scientific and ethical standards ‚Äì writing medical history.   We aim to reduce the suffering of people with life-changing therapies by harnessing the potential of the immune system to develop novel therapies against cancer and infectious diseases. While doing so, we are guided by our three company values: united, innovative, passionate. Get in touch with us if you are looking to be a part of creating hope for a healthy future in many people's lives.   Software Development Engineer SSD*  As part of the CMC Project ManagementSoftware Solution Development team at BioNTech, you will be responsible for development of software according to BioNTech requirements with a focus on GxP area    Your Main Responsibilities Are    Participation in the design and development of software. Web and desktop applications, front- and backend, user applications or services. For quality assurance: unit tests, regular code reviews at check-in (four-eyes principle), participation in risk analyses, support in creating functional and integration tests. Creation of development and validation-relevant documentation such as functional specifications, detail design, descriptions of APIs, etc. Design and development of interfaces for secure and stable communication and interaction between different systems. Clarification of implementation details with end users or other stakeholders as well as training of end users for the newly developed software.    What You Have To Offer.    Degree in Computer Sciences or similar faculties or vocational training in informatics. Experienced (at least 3 years after graduation or 5 years after training) in Software Development. Wide knowledge and experience in C# / .NET, ASP.NET, MSSQL, EF, web frontend frameworks like Angular or React, etc. Experiences with agile development in cross-functional teams (e.g. Scrum) as well as development in regulated environments (e.g. pharma, finance, automotive) is very appreciated. Good communication, and presentation skills. Excellent English skills, written and orally (German skills are also desirable but not essential).    Benefits For You.    Company Pension Scheme Childcare Jobticket Company Bike Leave Account Fitness Courses Mobile Office Special Vacation  ... and much more.   Have we kindled your pioneering spirit?  Then apply now for our location and simply send us your application documents using our online form.   If you have any further questions, our Talent Acquisition Team will be happy to answer them on + 49 (0) 6131-9084-1291 (monday-friday, from 12 noon to 4 pm).   Job-ID 5286  (please indicate for inquiries)   We look forward to your application!   BioNTech does not differentiate on the basis of gender, race or ethnicity, religion, color, sexual orientation or identity, disability, age and other protected statuses as given by applicable law. We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Most important ‚Äì it‚Äôs a match!   BioNTech  - As unique as you

Title: Software Frontend Engineer
Description: We are one of Europe‚Äôs fastest-growing tech startups with 500+ team members representing over 40 nationalities at our headquarters in Frankfurt am Main, Germany.   Our work culture is built on strong values promoting community, agility, and ownership. Growth and excellence in all areas are important to us, which is why we offer our team members opportunities to develop and advance professionally and personally.   We proudly celebrate diversity. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to promoting inclusion in our workplace. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, ethnic origin, religion or belief, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or age.   Tasks   Architect, design and implement our technology platform, supporting our growth Implement product features that will support our core business Implement modern, mobile-first web frontends using UI+UX that delights our customers Fully own, i.e. develop, maintain and operate (full DevOps) your team‚Äôs tech stack Be a team player as part of an agile, empowered team and contribute to the development of fellow engineers Contribute to the improvement of our cloud-based CI&CD and DevOps & SRE practices Taking part in recruitment processes to grow our tech team    Requirements    Experience designing and delivering modern, reactive & responsive web frontends meeting highest software quality standards You gained UI/UX experience and bring knowledge of best practices for conversion optimization as well as cross-browser testing tools and A/B testing Extensive knowledge of computer science fundamentals, incl. data structures, object-oriented programming and software design patterns (GoF and cloud-native) Several years of proven experience in software development and operation practices covering the full software development lifecycle, ideally in an E-commerce business Deep understanding of JavaScript and/or TypeScript and HTML5 / CSS3 and CSS Preprocessors Experience in React.js or Vue.js (or similar frameworks/libraries), Webpack or Gulp.js Experience in implementing Design Systems jointly with design teams is considered a plus Understanding of the importance of well-organized codebase and documentation Capability of implementing unit, integration, end-to-end and load tests Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Computer or Electrical Engineering, Business Informatics or equivalency in relevant work experience You are highly self-organized and interested in taking over ownership and bringing the team to the best solution Experience in legacy E-commerce stacks (i.e. Magento and PHP) is considered a plus You have strong analytical skills and are an open-minded and creative team player    Benefits    Responsibility and decision-making authority from your first day The opportunity to work on challenging tasks that contribute to your professional growth Work independently and as part of a dedicated, international team The opportunity to help shape our company culture Make an impact initiating new ideas Work with and learn from experts in diverse fields Get to know your team members at our exciting company events

Title: Software Engineer (m/f/d) Sea Logistics
Description: It‚Äôs an exciting time to join Kuehne+Nagel - our business is growing‚Ä¶ FAST! We are now looking for a Software Engineer (m/f/d) to join our established and friendly team based in Hamburg, Germany on a Full time permanent basis.    Your Role  With a keen interest in the development field, your main objective will be to develop software in accordance with the strategy of the Kuehne + Nagel group. This software development role will incorporate the initial design, development & writing of code alongside suitable & appropriate testing and effective implementation. Whether you have extensive experience in this field or you are a graduate with some experience looking for a development opportunity in a global organisation, we would be interested in hearing from you.    Your Responsibilities   Develop code and solutions for your allocated products ‚Äì these projects are varied and generally small scale writing of bespoke systems for contracts / suppliers and internal stakeholders Utilize industry best practices, adhere to our documented coding standards and keep relevant internal documentation up to date Test all software before launch to eliminate risk of disruption to the business Operations & monitoring of delivered artifacts and products Close cooperation with the dedicated product owner 3rd level support Special responsibilities e.g. release management    Your Skills And Experiences   Core Java skills ‚Äì knowledge of Java + and Java Script (client and web server and HTML) Practical experience in software development with Java Ideally experience of J2EE server side development, especially Hibernate and Spring Front-end web development knowledge especially of JavaScript, Angular or Vue.js is a benefit Openshift / AWS knowledge is advantageous Experience / knowledge of the full development life cycle Experience of working in an agile team based development environment Fluent written and spoken English.   Good Reasons to Join   We want you to feel comfortable in your working surroundings. Therefore, we are offering you modern offices in the announced Hamburg Hafencity directly adjacent to the Elbe, flexible working hours, mobile working arrangement, a subsidized job ticket for the public transportation as well as a canteen with a broad range of menus. K√ºhne + Nagel is offering you a custom-made career ‚Äì through individual planning and supervisors who support and advice you in every way. Personally, you get supported by a lot of work-life-balance offerings, a company pension and a supplementary health insurance. req85208

Title: Software Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: F√ºr unseren Unternehmensbereich Defence & Intelligence mit Standort K√∂ln suchen wir neue Kollegen f√ºr ein umfangreiches Softwareentwicklungsprojekt.   Abh√§ngig von deiner Rolle bist du hierbei als Teil eines agilen Teams in zahlreiche Produktentwicklungs- als auch Entwicklungsumgebungsleistungen involviert. Von der Architektur und den Requirements bis zum UX/UI Design hin zu der Entwicklung und dem agilen Coaching decken wir alles intern ab und du kannst hautnah mitwirken und dabei sein.   Bei uns bist Du Member eines Teams und nicht nur Mitarbeiter!   Ergreife die Chance zu einem erfolgreichen Team in einem globalen Unternehmen mit mehr als 75000 Mitarbeitern zu geh√∂ren.   Aufgaben   Entwicklung / Programmierung von Software entsprechend den ben√∂tigten Anforderungen Unterst√ºtzung beim Requirements Engineering Ausarbeitung der Software Architektur und Design Dokumentation von Architekturentscheidungen Vorstellung & Begleitung der Entwicklungsteams und ggf. Anpassung der Architektur / Design Einsch√§tzung von Sicherheitsrisiken und Erarbeitung von Mitigationen Konzeption und Automatisierung von End-to-End Funktionstests Eigenst√§ndige Entwicklung von Testszenarien sowie Testfallermittlung und deren automatisierte Testdurchf√ºhrung Weiterentwicklung der bestehenden automatisierten Tests Erstellung und Pflege von Testdokumentationen Wartung des Quellcodes    Qualifikation   Je nach Seniorit√§t bringst Du unterschiedlich ausgepr√§gte Kenntnisse in den unten genannten Themenfeldern mit.   Wir freuen uns √ºber Bewerbungen von Werkstudenten und Berufseinsteigern mit ersten Ber√ºhrungspunkten oder Grundkenntnissen in der Softwareentwicklung, ebenso aber auch von Experten mit fundierter Berufserfahrung.   Du bringst erste Kenntnisse / fundierte Berufserfahrung in mindestens einer von den folgenden Programmiersprachen mit (mit absteigender Gewichtung):   Java, C#, Python, C++ Kotlin, Swift, Objective-C Javascript, Typescript    Du kennst / beherrschst mindestens eins von den folgenden Techniken sowie Frameworks zur Softwareerstellung:   RESTful, GraphQL, Webservices Spring, Spring Boot React, Angular Relationale und dokumentenbasierte Datenbanken (SQL, noSQL)    Du kennst / beherrschst mindestens eins der folgenden Tools:   Gitlab Gitlab CI, Jenkins SonarQube Maven, Ansible Komponententest mit z.B. JUnit. Testautomatisierungstools wie z.B. Selenium, Espresso API Dokumentation & Design Tools wie z.B. Swagger JIRA, Confluence Kubernetes    WAS WIR BIETEN   Bei uns findest du Kolleg*innen, mit denen die Zusammenarbeit Spa√ü macht. Wir begegnen uns offen, duzen uns √ºber alle Positionen hinweg und denken nicht in Hierarchien oder Silos. Dank unseres ‚ÄûMetro Market‚Äú-Modells kannst du meist dort arbeiten, wo du lebst. Du profitierst von flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und hast je nach Kundensituation die M√∂glichkeit, von zuhause zu arbeiten. Einen Teil deines Bruttogehalts kannst du in CGI-Aktien investieren ‚Äì bis maximal 3 % des Monatsgehalts geben wir f√ºr jeden Euro einen weiteren hinzu. Au√üerdem beteiligen wir dich am Unternehmenserfolg: Du erh√§ltst eine Gewinnbeteiligung, die sich nach deiner individuellen Leistung richtet sowie danach, wie wir als Unternehmen unsere finanziellen Ziele erreichen konnten. Wir bieten verschiedene Modelle, damit du mobil sein kannst: z. B. Bahncard, Dienstfahrrad oder Firmenwagen. Sabbatical oder Elternzeit werden unterst√ºtzt. Sie sind bei uns kein Karriere-Stopper! Wir unterst√ºtzen dich, auch wenn es einmal nicht so gut l√§uft: Du kannst Sonderurlaub nehmen, und unsere Beratungshotline steht dir mit Rat und Tat zur Seite. Eine Vielzahl an Events und Freizeitaktivit√§ten st√§rkt deine Verbundenheit mit deinen Kolleg*innen.    Insights you can act on  Der Motor f√ºr die digitale Transformation unserer Kunden ist die Technologie ‚Äì der Antrieb f√ºr den Erfolg unseres Unternehmens sind die Menschen.   Als Berater:in bei CGI genie√üt du das Vertrauen deiner Kolleg:innen und Kunden. In der Zusammenarbeit gewinnst du Erkenntnisse, die zu wertvollen und nachhaltigen L√∂sungen f√ºhren. Unsere Mitarbeitenden hei√üen ‚ÄûMember‚Äú, weil sie am Erfolg beteiligt werden und gemeinsam ein Unternehmen gestalten, auf das wir alle stolz sind. Diesen Traum haben wir seit 1976, und er hat uns dorthin gef√ºhrt, wo wir heute stehen: Wir sind einer der weltgr√∂√üten unabh√§ngigen Dienstleister f√ºr IT und Business Consulting.   Bei CGI erkennen wir den Mehrwert von Vielfalt. Wir wollen ein Arbeitsumfeld schaffen, dem sich alle zugeh√∂rig f√ºhlen, und f√∂rdern zusammen mit unseren Kunden die Inklusion. Bei uns haben alle die gleichen Chancen, erfolgreich zu sein und sich weiterzuentwickeln. Solltest du im Recruiting-Prozess Unterst√ºtzung ben√∂tigen, sind wir f√ºr dich da.   Bist du bereit, Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte zu werden? Komm zu CGI ‚Äì wo du mit deinen Ideen und deinem Engagement etwas bewirkst.

Title: Software Developer Full Stack (m/f/d) - remote option
Description: Hi! We‚Äôre happy that you‚Äôre here.  PRIOjet Logistics, the SaaS-platform for arranging and processing extremely time-critical logistics orders, is the trusted partner all over the world for companies, logistics agencies, service providers, and on-board couriers AND possibly your next great place to work.   What if spare parts, important production components, documents for immediate and safe delivery or medicines must be transported around the world directly, no matter what? In time-critical logistics, a courier jumps on the next plane for the delivery. PRIOjet Logistics brings all parties on one platform and offers them all the tools they need to excel. What has previously been a tangled combination of phone calls, SMS, chats, emails and faxes, is now conducted via a mobile and scalable SaaS solution.   Tasks  The Challenge  Our cross-discipline team builds and run a leading-edge platform for the international very sensitive emergency logistics sector. Hence, for our success, high-quality software development is a very important aspect.   We are looking for a great Software Developer with some years of experience as Full Stack Developer working on Backend, Web and Mobile, and anything it takes to delight users and solves problems, to join our growing team in Hamburg or part-remotely. This position offers the opportunity to possibly receive company shares (VSOP).    Your Key Responsibilities    Build across the full stack, from backend APIs to mobile and web frontend user interfaces to deliver end-to-end solutions based on user requirements and objectives by working on our NestJS (Node) backend written in Typescript in connection with out React Native (expo . io, also Typescript) frontend apps. Plan, architect and implement new features in our backend. Be a part of decisions about architecture and features of the apps. Influence the development roadmap with the development team and be able to prioritize. Implement, iterate and release features in a cross-functional team. Be self-driven and come up with new ideas on how to improve our product. Connect the dots on your own and be able to fill in the gaps as necessary. Pay attention to detail when needed and break complex tasks into smaller chunks without losing sight of the bigger picture. Don't accept quick and inaccurate solutions but find a good balance in software development (usability, maintainability, extensibility, usability, acccuracy, reliability, etc.). Extend and maintain our GraphQL API. Integrating third-party services and APIs into our system. Work with our product owners to deliver high-quality UI and UX. Build reusable, scalable, and reliable software solutions. Build the technical documentation and contribute to the internal knowledge and codebases.   But that¬¥s not all.  There is also a part which is up to you: What are you passionate about? What do you want to learn, and where else would you like to contribute?    Requirements    What we‚Äôre looking for:   3+ years of relevant experience as a Full Stack Software Engineer in building scalable backends (e.g. Python, NodeJS, Ruby, Go) as well as frontend apps using React/ReactJS/ React Native or similar frameworks. Experience in functional, object-oriented and other programming paradigms as well as the appropriate use and application of software patterns in the code. B.Sc or M.Sc in Computer Science, Information Systems or similar technical discipline. Additional experience in HTML, CSS, Javascript, Typescript, Expo. io, Mobile apps, CI/CD, DevOps, Docker, functional approach in React using Hooks. Experience as a software architect (database, APIs, service architectures) with a profound database knowledge (e.g. Postgres, MySQL, NoSQL), Linux/Unix skills, Cloud Services (Azure, AWS or/and Google Cloud), Git Workflows, and Dev/Ops is required. Knowledge of security best practices and understanding the most common security vulnerabilities. Experience with Agile Software Development Techniques and Tools. Experience in debugging, testing, and problem-solving skills. Professional written and verbal fluency in English, same in German will be a plus but not a must have.   Who you are:   You have a hands-on attitude as a builder and maker ‚Äì not a theorist. You are self-motivated. You take initiative, are naturally curious, and can learn new things quickly while continuing to deliver value on the job. You are a shipper. You respect deadlines, accomplish your work autonomously, and have experience setting a positive example for self-management to your team members. You are people-centric. You can thrive in a collaborative environment involving different stakeholders and subject matter experts, and enjoy helping others grow. You are open to new ideas, demand and act upon feedback, are always constructive and are radically honest about the state of things.   It would be great if you also have:   Experience to work in a small and high motivated team of developers. Experience working with international and/or distributed teams. Knowledge in Data Science and/or Business. Professional written and verbal fluency in German.    Benefits    A chance to work in a great start-up on an exciting problem space that becomes more and more important in an ever more connected world and supply chain. A diverse international team backed by international investors. Flexible schedule & remote-friendly workplace culture. Team activities. In addition to the salary, we have the option of a VSOP program. Optionally, we offer cash allowance for lunch or private internet connection. And sure, free warm and cold drinks and some fruits in our office in Hamburg and Frankfurt ;)   PRIOjet's mission enables a wide scope for personal growth and development for experienced, creative and motivated talents who work independently and reliably towards the common goal.   If this looks like a great match for you to be a part of a growing Start-up, please get in touch with us as soon as possible.  Quick tip: Please make sure to send us your CV and to tell us briefly and informally why you are the perfect match for PRIOjet.   Looking forward to getting to know you. Talk soon!

Title: Frontend Developer
Description: Clinomic is a dynamic, fast-growing MedTech startup developing innovative technological solutions for critically ill patients. With over 60 employees' located in offices in the heart of Aachen, we offer a positive collaborative work environment in an interdisciplinary and international team with flat hierarchies and many attractive perks. We were recently recognised as one of the Top 50 start-ups in Germany, 2021.   We developed 'Mona', short for Medical On-Site Assistant, an intelligent assistance and telemedicine system for intensive care medicine that supports doctors and nurses directly at the patient's bed. The device facilitates voice-controlled documentation, identifies relevant data, and thus contributes to the faster and better treatment of the critically ill.   The Opportunity  As a Frontend Developer in the technology team, you will play an essential role in the development processes and experience working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.   Your Responsibilities   Work on the architecture, design and implementation of our frontend Create a user experience focused, fast and reliable conversational interface driven user interface Coordinate our external technical partners for integrations with third party systems Implement the communication with our REST based backend API Creating and maintaining our architecture and software documentation Guidance / mentorship of junior team members with prospect of leading the product development team in the future Ensure integrity of end product by implementing and maintaining development best practices    About You   Minimum of three years of experience as a software engineer for a minimum of three years Previous experience in end-to-end software development from idea to market-ready, tested and maintainable code Being pragmatic in your decisions, you know how to avoid scope creep and going down rabbit holes Sense of leadership and mentoring mentoring junior team members Experience working in an agile environment Proficiency in Angular and TypeScript and experience with creating user focused web applications Experience with state management is a must Experience with unit & e2e testing is a must    Bonus   Experience working in Healthcare-IT Experience with Electron Experience with developing design systems with Storybook    What We Offer   No micromanagement! You work independently in the team and as a part of a rapidly growing medtech company Competitive salary, commensurate with experience. Support in personal development and reaching your career goals in a flat hierarchy surrounding 30 vacation days Home-office agreement JobRad Company pension scheme / betriebliche Altersvorsorge with a 50% company match A multicultural, engaged and cool team Positive working environment based on trust, empowerment and inclusion    At Clinomic, we know that diversity inspires innovation and creativity, and we welcome people from all backgrounds and experiences.  Sounds great?   Please send us your CV with your start date and salary expectations.

Title: Software Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Your working environment at K√∂rber    K√∂rber Pharma helps pharma & biotech manufacturers to improve production processes for medicines such as tablets or vaccines. Our new and fast growing business unit Digital & Enterprise Products is on a mission to extend our product portfolio in the context of Industry 4.0 and Digitalization. We are building up a comprehensive data driven product portfolio that, together with our market leading Manufacturing Execution System PAS-X, addresses the needs of our customers on their journey towards the digital pharma factory. Title: Software Engineer - Java/Angular (f/m/d)
Description: Job Description    In the 1950s, global trade changed for good. The invention of the standardized container suddenly meant that transporting goods across the world became affordable. And with that, paved the way for globalization and global wealth. But contrary to the container, most surrounding processes have not been standardized nor innovated‚Äîand are still frustratingly complex, manual, and error-prone.   That‚Äôs why our ambition is to use technology to simplify the logistics of global trade, making the processes around the container as simple as the container itself. We do that by providing a neutral infrastructure that connects all logistics companies to remove friction and create economic opportunity.   Software Engineer (f/m/d)  Our Tech team is the backbone of xChange, developing highly scalable products to not only disrupt a whole industry but to set a new standard when operating containers worldwide. As our Software Engineer, you will be joining a highly collaborative, agile team with skilled, customer-focused colleagues who strive for best code quality, highest tech standards and pushing xChange‚Äôs product forward.   We aim for teams who take full ownership and are seeking tech-savvy Software Engineers who are passionate about teamwork, collaboration and building amazing products, ready to tackle new challenges every day.    Your Responsibilities In a Nutshell    Create and implement features in our backend (Java) and/or frontend (Angular) Keep proven features up to date, identify technical debts and suggest solutions Apply and improve our current code, test and documentation practices Be a go-to person for your colleagues and support them with your expertise Share your knowledge proactively to drive the success of xChange and our Software Engineering team    Requirements    What we‚Äôre looking for   Proven practical experience in Software Engineering experience in Java or Angular with a focus on web application Excellent coding skills in Java and/or Angular 2+ (TypeScript) paired with hands-on experience in JavaScript, CSS, HTML, Spring, Hibernate, MySQL, Maven and Git Deep understanding of development processes and best practises - you strive for efficient processes, highest code quality and tech standards Self-starter attitude with a high personal drive ‚Äì you are excited about being a part of rapid growth and not afraid to take initiative You are a great communicator (our company language is English) and listener    What We Offer    Ownership and trust from day one! You will take full responsibility of your code and get the chance to actively shape our products Attractive salary ‚Äì including a competitive equity package A team of highly motivated colleagues who strive for highest quality and can‚Äôt wait for you to join A start-of-the art tech stack Highly scalable products with a proven product-market fit ready to change the industry A modern office the heart of Hamburg and flexible home-office Extremely flat hierarchies in a tremendously collaborative culture A great working atmosphere with an open -minded and collaborative culture   If this sounds like your future job, all we need is your CV which you can submit through the application link!

Title: Frontend Developer (m/f/d)
Description:
About Venture Leap We are a team of experienced entrepreneurs and developers who enjoy building new things together. We help our clients to implement data-sensitive digital applications. Our clients range from start-ups to established companies across all industries, especially GovTech and HealthTech. Our product and client portfolio includes Probatix (https://probatix.de), Civical (https://civical.de), and GovMind (https://govmind.tech). For this purpose, we use our custom-built platform LEAP.one. About LEAP.one With the help of our API-first development platform LEAP.one, sophisticated web applications can be implemented securely and stably on complex and sensitive data. The individual modules of the platform can be flexibly combined and form the basic building blocks of every solution. This allows companies and institutions to get their digital ideas up and running quickly and scalably, and to concentrate on the essentials. About You Role As Frontend Developer, you will be in charge of improving the ease-of-use and visual appearance of our clients‚Äô applications. What Is Your Mission Leading all frontend development-related processes Writing clean, well structured and maintainable code Ensuring stable application performance across devices Cooperating with your back-end colleagues Introducing new technologies and improving development processes to deliver first-class digital products based on our LEAP.one platform

Desired Skills and Experience

Who You Are Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or related/relevant technical field 2+ years of working experience with product development practices, including software testing (e.g. unit testing, regression testing) Provable record of mastering front-end challenges of web applications (using modern JavaScript and/or TypeScript frameworks, React, ReactNative, Vue.js, Angular) Experience with building systems such as webpack A background in HTML5 and CSS3 and experience with UI layouts, SASS, LESS Knowledge of continuous Integration/delivery pipeline for cloud, including Jenkins or Docker is a plus A bias for action and ownership as well as the drive to learn and share your knowledge with the team Our Mission Digital Products - Done Right resonates with you Very good knowledge of English, both written and spoken; German is a plus You are currently based in Berlin or willing to relocate What We Offer You A highly entrepreneurial environment where everyone has ownership and freedom to move towards our ambitious goals while getting strong enablement from the founders Constant learning and progress of your tech knowledge through weekly tech talks and company supported Udemy, Coursera, etc. courses An open and international company culture with 15 different nationalities Flat hierarchies for creative ideas and unconventional approaches 25 days of paid leave Are you up for the challenge? Let‚Äôs change the world of digital products together and provide entrepreneurs and innovators with the best digital products out there! We value diversity of perspective and seek to build an inclusive workplace that welcomes people from all different backgrounds.

Title: Fullstack Developer
Description: Project Lary is an Innovation Builder - we build unique innovations together with our customers, starting from the idea through the MVP to long-term operating systems. For this, we created a process using design thinking, rapid prototyping and lean startup methodology. As a fullstack developer you will be part of our tech team which implements this process and therefore solves real-world problems for our users.   Tasks   You develop, deploy and operate web-apps and mobile cross platform applications based on React (Native) or similar frameworks You develop, deploy and operate our serverless and microservice based backend architecture based on AWS or similar providers You work with the team on continuously improving our processes and technology You work closely with design / product to understand the user context and deliver a product which our users will love    Requirements    Computer Science graduate or similar Experience Minimum 2.5 years experience in Web or mobile app development, for example with HTML/CSS, React (Native), Angular, Vue, Ember, Flask, Django, NodeJS Minimum 2.5 years experience with Cloud Service Providers like AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc. in the areas of Microservice Architecture, Containerized Services, Serverless, databases You are passionate about superior user experience and you want to deliver our users good Software which they want to use and that solves their problems Nice to have: Experience to work on a scrum or kanban team Nice to have: German language proficiency    Benefits    100% Start-up spirit - we win as a team, we lose as a team A place and ressource for your own ideas, suggestions, discussions. From the beginning you will be included in technology decisions. A well-maintained developer culture with a strive for excellence. Peer-Programming Sessions, Code Reviews and much exchange regarding new concepts and technologies. An open, international, diverse und interesting team Team-Office in top location (T√ºrkenstra√üe 38, Munich) with free coffee und drinks as well as regular team events Trust-based working hours, home office and fair compensation   Sounds interesting? Apply now with your CV! If there is a fit, as a next step we will invite you for lunch to get to know the team

Title: R&D Software Engineer
Description: We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet  Who We Are  Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.   We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.   Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.   Who Are We Looking For  We are looking for a smart, communicative person with a dynamic mindset who is able to work independently in a highly innovative and fast-paced environment to fulfil the role of an R&D Software Engineer and expand our Publishing Operations ‚Äì Core Architecture team.   We believe that the right person should have a natural curiosity to learn new things and should be happy to share the knowledge and act as a trainer when needed.   Strong development background with an inclination towards good development practices, good knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming, SOLID principles, design patterns will be most important.   What You Will Do/role Description   As an R&D Software Engineer with .NET, you will be working together with the Solutions Architect, other Software Engineers, Data Engineers, and others as part of the Core Architecture team within the Publishing Operations development unit. You will research and develop cross-product components, prototypes, frameworks, or applications to support the other Product Development teams or to be used by business users. You will also rebuild parts of our platform using Microsoft based technologies (.NET Core/C#, Azure, MSSQL) as well as open source (Hasura, PostgreSQL, Camunda, Kafka, MongoDB) and share ownership of the cross-product architecture layer. You will work in a fast-paced environment while juggling several different tasks and initiatives simultaneously. Innovation and green-field development will become part of your daily job. You will be expected to support product teams‚Äô developers in using your components as well as collaborating with other external teams to accomplish cross-team goals. You will be expected to explore new technologies that you never worked with and to go outside your comfort zone, to use fast-prototyping methods to deliver your result.    We make conscientious decisions to adopt new technologies so your work will revolve around .NET, MSSQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Camunda, Azure, DevOps Server but we are also considering adopting Java or NodeJS as a part of our future stack. Our newest adoption to the tech stack is Hasura and our newest assessments are for the adoption of CloudEvents, Kafka, Camunda Cloud.  You can have a look at our full technology stack by visiting our Technology Radar web page: Tech Radar | Frontiers  .   Requirements  :   Masters or bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, related field, or equivalent experience Outstanding problem-solving abilities Good written/verbal communication in English, presentation, listening, and decision-making skills, with strong ability and passion for interacting with engineering as well as business teams Knowledge of ‚Äúclean-code‚Äù best practices, SOLID principles, and software design patterns Experience with .NET/C# in the context of web applications and microservices architecture Experience with any messaging platforms (RabbitMQ, Azure Service Bus, Kafka, etc.) Experience with any relational database engines (e.g. MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and any non-relational database engines (e.g. MongoDB, CosmosDB, Elastic Search) Familiarity with cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, GCP) Basic knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes Basic understanding of DevOps practices    Nice to have Requirements:   Experience with Event-Driven Architecture Experience with Kafka/Kafka Connect/kSQL Experience with Workflow Automation Engines or business process modelling tools (Camunda or similar)    Benefits  With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.   Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.   This includes:  100% remote working  Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Business Support jobs due to nature of role).   Learning and development  All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.   Wellbeing  We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.   Volunteering opportunities  Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.   Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination ‚Äì including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description: At Bayer we‚Äôre visionaries, driven to solve the world‚Äôs toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none‚Äô is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We‚Äôre doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‚Äòimpossible‚Äô. There are so many reasons to join us. If you‚Äôre hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there‚Äôs only one choice.  Data Scientist (m/f/d)   Your Tasks And Responsibilities    Be an integral part of the Bayer Crop Protection Innovation Lab team and support farmers worldwide to qualify and quantify weed, disease, and pest problems in their fields Collaborate with designers, product managers, and other engineers to identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive business solutions Develop and operate our data lakes and meshes as highly scalable services in the cloud to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques, and business strategies Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy Design and ensure data quality and data governance standards Quality-driven software development: writing reusable and clean code to automate our pipelines and workflows Develop guidelines and best practices through teamwork, mentoring and code reviews    Who You Are    Master of Science in Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields Deep understanding of data architectures, e.g., data lake/ mesh architectures Professional experience with technologies such as cloud (AWS, GCP), Elasticsearch, Spark, Kafka, Dask/ Pandas, SQL and NoSQL databases Professional experience developing enterprise-grade production software using object-oriented programming languages such as Python, Java, Scala, or Go Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/ drawbacks Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications. Experience in modern software development processes, software architecture, quality assurance, testing and CI/ CD (Git) Several years of experience with agile development models (Scrum, Kanban, XP, etc.) Passion for delivering high quality and robust solutions and learning new technologies Very good command of English, both written and spoken   YOUR APPLICATION  This is your opportunity to tackle the world‚Äôs biggest challenges with us: Maintaining our health, feeding growing populations and slowing the rate of climate change. You have a voice, ideas and perspectives and we want to hear them. Because our success begins with you. Be part of something big. Be Bayer.   Bayer welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, union membership, religion, family status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or any unlawful criterion under applicable law. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.   Location:  Leverkusen   Division:  Crop Science   Reference Code:  623882

Title: Software Engineer in Test (all genders) for ESR Labs
Description: ESR Labs is an embedded automotive software company and part of Accenture Industry X. In other words, we develop innovative embedded software for high-tech cars. Within only six years, we have achieved the status of a Tier 1 software supplier providing us with the opportunity to work directly with some of the most respected and distinguished premium car manufacturers and suppliers in the market. Our work is already part of millions of vehicles and enables those vehicles to take advantage of what has become state of the art in consumer electronics: internet connectivity, artificial intelligence, autonomy, cloud computing, and over-the-air feature updates. Does this sound right up your alley?   Then live your passion in a position where you can learn more about software test automation in the field of embedded software.   If you would like to tell us more about yourself as a developer, feel free to hand in a brief Developer Abstract along with your CV in the application process.   This position is available in full time and part time.   Job Description  You accept the challenges of an agile software development process this is based on continuous integration and leads to continuous testing.  Your primary responsibility is the specification, implementation, automation, and execution of tests.  You create tests in common scripting languages and analyze the results of your testsdaily.  Qualifications  Completed degree in Information Technology or comparable education  Experience with scripting languages (Ruby or Python), CAN bus, HIL/SIL Testing, GIT, FlexRay, and LIN.  You are interested in Software-Testing and have strong analytical skills.  Fluent English language skills are required.  Your Benefits At ESR Labs & Accenture Industry X  Creative freedom through flat hierarchies, flexible working-time models and the option of an individual home-office hybrid model.  Competitive salary and an extensive company social benefit package including a company pension scheme, employee discounts, the option to participate in our employee share purchase plan and much, much more!  A comprehensive training catalogue to optimally qualify our employees for the demands of the market and inhouse training sessions from colleagues to colleagues.  An unlimited supply of coffee, drinks and bugs to fix.  Contact  If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact Hedieh Vardal of our recruiting team via email at hedieh.vardal@accenture.com.   We are looking forward to your application via our online application form!

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description: Freudenberg is a global technology group, with a history spanning over 170 years, that strengthens its customers and society long-term through forward-looking innovations. Together with its partners, customers and research institutions, the Freudenberg Group develops leading-edge technologies and excellent products and services for about 40 markets and for thousands of applications: seals, vibration control components, technical textiles, filters, cleaning technologies and products, specialty chemicals and medical products.   The Freudenberg Group employs some 50,000 people in around 60 countries worldwide and generates sales of nearly 9 billion euros.   Weinheim   Freudenberg Technology Innovation SE & Co. KG   You support our team as   Data Scientist (m/f/d)   Responsibilities   Analysis and evaluation of technologies in the field of data analysis, design of experiments, machine learning and AI with regard to their relevance for the Freudenberg Group Application and implementation of these technologies Preparation of project proposals, collaboration, implementation and management of projects - in cooperation with the Business Groups Advising internal customers on the analysis and evaluation of relevant data    Qualifications   Completed studies in IT, engineering, physics, mathematics or comparable qualification In-depth knowledge of statistics, data analysis algorithms, numerical methods and artificial intelligence (AI) Good knowledge of Microsoft Azure based IT infrastructures/architectures for data flows and data analytics Solid knowledge of relevant languages such as Python, R, MATLAB, C++, and common frameworks (e.g., Databricks) Ideally, experience with virtualization and Big Data Advantageous: knowledge in the IT environment of continuous data flows and distributed computation (e.g. cloud applications in Azure, Spark) Teamwork skills, independently and self-motivated Good knowledge of German and English    Your Benefits   Cafeteria/Canteen:  Fresh food on-site, both hot and cold   Company pension:  Save for retirement with the company's help   Gym:  Stay fit with easy access to an on-site center   Sustainability / Community service:  Making a difference with sustainability, community service   Diversity & Inclusion:  Enter a diversity-driven world of innovation   The Freudenberg Group is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion. Title: SOFTWARE DEVELOPER PYTHON/PHP (M/F/D): JOB OFFER FOR UKRAINIANS INCL. APARTMENT IN BERLIN AND SUPPORT WITH OFFICIAL MATTERS at GoldenTech GmbH
Description: New beginning in Berlin, Germany  We at Golden-Tech GmbH show solidarity with the Ukrainian people and offer you a new start in Berlin. In addition to a permanent job with a salary of 40,000 euros per year, we offer you and your family a two-room apartment in Berlin free of charge. We also support you with all administrative procedures. No German or English language skills are required for the job.   Who we are?  The Golden-Tech GmbH is a diverse group of lawyers, consultants, creative people and developers. Our goal is to help shape the digitization of the legal industry by merging IT processes and legal services. We offer you a creative working environment, a modern office in the center of Berlin, collaboration on exciting projects and the opportunity to work independently and develop your professional skills.   Aufgaben  Responsibilities:  In cooperation with the SCRUM team you are responsible for the design and implementation of Python applications. These form interfaces to external systems and are used for data import and export.   You will also provide APIs, validate, prepare and transform the data for import into central business systems (Datev, CRM, CMS).   Using PHP you create backend services for cloud applications and further develop the CMS for internal tracking and reporting. You will also be involved in the further development of the SCRUM process.   Qualifikation  Requirements:   Experience in creating, maintaining and testing Python and PHP applications, ideally also in the backend area, e.g. for providing REST interfaces Experience in agile software development according to SCRUM/Kanban Knowledge of .NET/Java is just as beneficial as experience in ETL processes and tools   What sets you apart:   Proactive and independent action You bring in ideas, think outside the box and are always interested in improving processes and software development Creating stable and robust software is your goal You are confident in communicating with stakeholders Dealing with ticket systems, Git, central build tools and the documentation of your tickets is a matter of course for you.   Are you interested in the exciting area of LegalTech and would you like to contribute to digitization and innovation in the legal system? Then get in touch with us.

Title: Software Engineer - Foundations tribe - HR Assistant squad
Description: Who are we? üöÄ   PayFit is one of the fastest growing SaaS startups in Europe with 500 employees and over 5,000 customers in just a few years, in France, Germany, the UK, Spain and Italy. Backed by a group of highly reputable institutional investors, PayFit is revolutionizing HR software by automating payroll and simplifying HR management for SMEs.   Our mission is to support the digital transformation of SME's Human Resources through a reliable SaaS solution that offers a unique experience to its users. We leverage our own coding language to customise our software quickly to each market, so that our customers can easily process pay slips, request holidays and manage their expenses.   We're passionate and enthusiastic about our mission, and committed to maintaining a culture that cares deeply about its employees and customers.   You'll be joining HR-Assistant Squad üè°   Our team (HR-Assistant) is part of the Foundations  tribe whose mission is to "make PayFit easy to build, easy to use". The tribe operates in two main fields core SaaS  (validations, authentication, permissions, and roles...) and core HRIS  (the foundations for HR verticals to offer a good experience and assistance to our users) .  Our mission   HR-Assistant  operates mainly in the core-HR field but keeps the other teams' enablement at the heart of its mission. Our main focus this year is to increase revenue üí∏ and customer satisfaction üòç.   To give you more context, we are currently working on:   Building new features to display useful employees' data to a HR or a manager Offering automatic guidance and support to our customers in their daily job as HR or managers Improving and developing, documents access and display in the app as well as enabling other teams to use/upload/download files in PayFit app using our services We also have the ownership and impact on other features used in different scopes in the application.   Our people üòç   You will be working everyday with 4 other happy üòä , passionate üíô and dynamic üî• software engineers, as well as the squad tri-force : the engineering manager üë©üèΩ‚Äçüíª, the product manager üßëüèΩ‚Äçüíª and the product designer üë©üèº‚Äçüé®. The main spoken language in our team is English üá¨üáß   Our daily work   The topics we work on require an important part of discussions, system design and planning with different teams at PayFit.    For The Day To Day Work, We Use    Technical stack: TypeScript, React, Node.js , MongoDB, GraphQL, Jest (with testing library) Code collaboration: GitHub, CircleCI, Docker, K8 Design tool: Figma Project management and knowledge: JIRA, Notion, Miro, Whimsical Communication: Slack, Zoom   Your mission üí™üèº    You Are Expected To    You role is to contribute to the whole process of the features creation (from system design to delivery and monitoring).   Challenge our current architecture and design new systems with the team Participate actively in our agile ceremonies Participate in workshops for transversal tech initiatives Handle eventual bugs with the team Monitor errors - SLO analysis and updates Contribute in team release (CI/CD) Code high quality features with the team and give/receive code reviews Participate in giving design reviews and running some discoveries with the product team   This job has been tailored for you if... ü¶Ñ   You have a very good knowledge of web development principles You are experienced in designing clean architectures for projects, making them performant and scalable while taking into account business <> tech tradeoffs You have a good knowledge and experience with Domain Driven Design You are able to make optimal choices for used technologies (DB, languages, CI pipelines...) You are good at performance monitoring and incident management You have a good experience with Node and TypeScript (or at least Javascript) You know how to engage your team in staying positive and focused You have a strong growth mindset: you love coaching and being coached and you have good communication skills You are sensitive to the impact of our product and you care about our users experience and point of views   What we offer ‚ù§Ô∏è   An amazing working environment, designed for kindness and blossoming An attractive remuneration package An international and dynamic team with the opportunity to visit our different offices (Paris, Berlin, Barcelona, London, Milano) WFA (work from anywhere policy) A gym inside the office and Gymlib subscription with preferential rate Regular team and global events (workshops for a big variety of topics, sport, well-being, time and priority management, sophrology...) Restaurant tickets 4 weeks of paternity leave (fully covered) and 20 weeks of maternity leave (fully covered) Henner insurance Great coffee, fruits, snacks, foosball, MPG Teams or even team yoga classes, MacBooks are our standard, but we'll provide whatever equipment you need to help you get your job done!   Hiring process ‚öôÔ∏è   1Ô∏è‚É£ Applicant initial validation: added value, key achievements, motivations, job match   2Ô∏è‚É£ Phone introduction with Ghizlane, Engineering manager of the team: experience check, motivation and potential evolution, mindset fit   3Ô∏è‚É£ Short pair programming session with two engineers of the team   4Ô∏è‚É£ System design interview with two engineers of the team (we share with you the topic that will be discussed few days before the test)   5Ô∏è‚É£ Meet Joann and Pierre, Product designer and Product Manager   6Ô∏è‚É£ Meet Amal, the Engineering director of Foundations tribe
