Title: Data Scientist (*)
Description: At DB Schenker, you are part of a global logistics network that connects the world. A network that allows you to shape your career by encouraging you to contribute and truly make a difference. With more than 76,000 colleagues worldwide, we welcome diversity and thrive on individual backgrounds, perspectives and skills. Together as one team, we are Here to move.   The Global Data Strategy & Analytics department is on a mission to turn DB Schenker into a data-driven company. Our Data Science team focuses on designing advanced analytics solutions to solve potential business use cases in logistics utilizing Machine Learning, AI techniques, Data Visualization tools and Big Data technologies in cooperation with our Software Engineering team, internal business units and global IT.   Your tasks:   Co-operate with internal business units to find use cases that potentially can be supported by data analytics and machine learning solutions Identify, gather and process required data sets Perform data analysis, communicate insights to our stakeholders and create prototypes to solve business problems Design and deploy scalable advanced analytics components in co-operation with software engineering team and internal IT departments Define key performance indicators and evaluation techniques to measure the impact of our products    Your profile:   Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Finance or similar Preferably a PhD in a quantitative field Several years of industrial experience in data analytics or machine learning projects Hands-on experience with SQL, Python and relevant data science libraries such as Scikit-Learn, Keras, TensorFlow Demonstrated ability to translate business needs into quantitative analytics problems Experience in software development and deployment (Docker, Git, CI/CD) Clear and succinct verbal and written communication skills in English Passion to learn new technologies and analytical methodologies Experience in agile methods such as Kanban, Scrum or The Spotify Model    Benefits:   With seminars, trainings and further qualifications we offer our employees (m/f/d) individual and long-term development and career opportunities on professional, project and management levels. Fascinating national and international projects and tasks such as sports and events logistics, trade fair logistics or special transports enrich the work environment. We take social responsibility for our employees (m/f/d). DB Schenker offers a comprehensive workplace health management with programs for health promotion and prevention.

Title: Frontend Developer (m/f/d)
Description: We are shaping the energy revolution. Our innovative heating and ventilation systems save thousands of tons of CO2 per year, increase living comfort and are leaders in user-friendliness. To ensure that this works optimally, we are close to our customers and build the necessary digital tools and products.   Drive the digital transformation at WOLF with us and apply as a   Frontend Developer (m/w/d)  Your Role   Implementation of modern Frontend Frameworks on the base of our Core Framework Pimcore and Symphony Development of Frontend Components based on the Atomic Design approach Development of Responsive-Floating Layouts for Multi-Device Solutions (Desktop, Mobile, Tablet, Hybrid Apps, TV, etc.) Intense work with Product Owners and Screen designers already at the conception start Lead of frontend test and change processes    Your Profile   Deep experience in developing component based Multi-Device Solutions Experience with development following the Atomic Design Approach; Storybook knowledge is an advantage SASS/ LESS Typescript and PHP Twig Webpack, Yarn UIkit or other frontend frameworks Deep knowledge and experience in JavaScript, especially React (Single Page Applications) Experience working with REST APIs or/and GraphQL EXT JS 5.x would be nice (Pimcore Admin Backend) Experience with CI/CD Frontend Pipelines, Frontend Compiling Tools, Automatization Tools and Integration-Tool-Chains Frontend testing and test automations; experience with Cypress is an advantage Experience in guiding and developing frontend developers Self-responsible, self-learning, teaming person that love to work in matrix teams in complex environments Ownership character for our frontend stack English is a must    Our Tech Stack  Atomic Design Architecture, Storybook, Javascript, Typescript, CSS, SASS, LESS, UIkit, Webpack, Composer, NodeJS, npm, Yarn, jQuery, React, Twig    How We Work    We have separated Frontend and Backend Development which allows us to develop requirements in two different speeds and give more responsibilities compared to classical frontend teams to adjust and enhance the frontends.   We are producing HTML following the atomic design approach. Designs are broken down in atoms, molecules and organisms. As we use Pimcore as system stack, the integration components are built in Twig by the frontend team.   Everything fits together and due to this approach, we have a pretty strict integration process.   Further the components we integrate follow a MVC pattern. Our backend developers directly use the components an provide the data model to ‚Äúfill‚Äù these with the output.   The components are managed within a storybook repo and updates are transferred via release pipelines directly into our application.   Within this production model a high participation and responsibility belongs to the frontend developers. Every frontend change or bug fix needs to be provided initially by the frontend team.   Our team is therefore looking for the person to take over this responsibility inhouse in our team and manage with our partner. If you are interested, here is more information.   Contact Data Recruiter:  Julia Zott   Email:   Julia.Zott@wolf.eu   Phone:   +49 (08751) 741660

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Job Description    DXC Technology ist der weltweit f√ºhrende unabh√§ngige Anbieter von End-to-End-IT-Dienstleistungen der n√§chsten Generation. Unser Ziel ist es, f√ºr unsere Kunden die digitale Transformation zu gestalten und so Mehrwert f√ºr ihr Gesch√§ft zu generieren.   Innerhalb unserer strategischen Ausrichtung fokussieren wir uns unter anderem auf die Bereiche Umwelt, Soziales und Governance. Innerhalb der Umweltziele geht es u.a. auch darum, sich in der Kreislaufwirtschaft zu engagieren und Kunden in ihren Nachhaltigkeitszielen zu unterst√ºtzten. Um nun DXC als verantwortungsvolles und nachhaltiges Unternehmen zu etablieren und gemeinsam in einem Netzwerk an diesen Zielen zu arbeiten, kollaborieren wir im Rahmen des Forschungsprojektes ‚ÄûCyclometric ‚Äì Model-based Decision Support for Proactive and Lifecycle-oriented Development of Vehicle Components‚Äù gemeinsam mit Fraunhofer, der Universit√§t Stuttgart und weiteren Industriepartnern zusammen.   Du hast Interesse an dem Thema Nachhaltigkeit/ Sustainability/ ESG?  Du m√∂chtest an einem  aktuellen Forschungsprojekt mitarbeiten Du interessierst dich f√ºr die Themen Data Analytics und Data Science?  Mit deiner Arbeit bei DXC kannst du dein Wissen in die Praxis umsetzen und Hands-on an einem Forschungsprojekt mitarbeiten. Wir suchen immer talentierte und motivierte Nachwuchskr√§fte, die kundenorientiertes Denken genauso wichtig nehmen, wie die Begeisterung und Leidenschaft f√ºr die IT! Daher bieten wir dir auch √ºber die Werkstudentent√§tigkeit hinaus spannende Entwicklungsm√∂glichkeiten und Perspektiven. Werde ein Teil von uns!   Zeitrahmen:  Oktober-Dezember 2022, Januar-Juni 2023   Deine Aufgaben   Arbeiten mit unserer MLOps Plattform, CI/ CD Pipelines, Modelltraining Mitwirkung an der Tool-Entwicklung Aufbereitung und Visualisierung von Daten Entwicklung von L√∂sungsans√§tzen zum Finden von Anomalien oder Besonderheiten innerhalb der Datens√§tze Verst√§ndliche Kommunikation der Ergebnisse   Was wir erwarten   Erste Erfahrung in der Verarbeitung, Transformation und Aufbereitung von Datens√§tzen Interesse an der Visualisierung und aussagekr√§ftigen Darstellung von Daten Grundkenntnisse zu mathematischen und statistischen Methoden Grundkenntnisse zu maschinellem Lernen und zu K√ºnstlicher Intelligenz (Pr√§dikatenlogik, etc.) Kommunikations- und Pr√§sentationsf√§higkeiten Grundkenntnisse zu Neuronalen Netzen und Graph-Datenbanken Hohes Interesse Neues zu lernen und neue Kenntnisse selbstst√§ndig anzueignen Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind w√ºnschenswert    Das Bieten Wir Ihnen    Flexible Arbeitszeiten Mobiles Arbeiten gerne aus dem Home-Office oder jedem Ort in Deutschland. Wir bieten Abwechslung durch attraktive Projekte Teamspirit und keine starren Hierarchien Attraktive Karrierechancen in einem Wachstumsmarkt Ein DXC Pate steht dir gerade am Anfang f√ºr alle deine Fragen zur Verf√ºgung. Title: (Junior) iOS Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Our LOVOO iOS chapter is strongly passionate about the whole spectrum of building an iOS project. This includes topics like the development of new features, keeping the code base modern, and automating crucial steps of the development and release flow.    You want to join our lovely iOS team and have a direct impact on millions of people connecting with each other? Then apply now and join the team‚Äôs mission.     At LOVOO, we work side by side on our shared vision and especially want to strongly encourage people of color, transgender people, queer, gay, and non-binary people, parents, and people with disabilities to apply to join us. Everyone is welcome at LOVOO.     If you prefer, please share your pronoun directly in your application with us (e.g. he/him, she/her, they*he/him*him, etc.).     What you can expect:   Hands-on conception and development of new features for our dating app Implementing a great UI with UX best practices and Apple‚Äôs human interface guidelines in mind Writing high quality and well scalable code with the appropriate test coverage Taking responsibility for continuous refactoring and optimization of our iOS app together with your teammates Continuously monitoring of the latest technology standards, evaluating current trends, and contributing new ideas and suggestions to enhance the direction of the product Ongoing knowledge sharing with your iOS buddies as well as through regular company-wide knowledge time meetings     Your profile:   Professional work experience as a native iOS Developer Very good knowledge of Swift and Objective-C as well as confident handling of development tools from the field of iOS development Know-how in app modularization, databases and build automation via CI/ CD are an advantage Ideally practical experience in agile software development (Scrum/Kanban) Interest in open source as well as willingness for further education and for learning new technologies A strongly pronounced goal-getter mindset as well as a proactive and target-focused way of working An autonomous, structured, and reliable approach to work as well as very good communication skills Passion for teamwork in an agile cross-functional and international work environment Very good spoken and written English

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Who is Preisenergie?   Preisenergie develops pricing software for energy vendors. We help our customers calculate fair prices for a fully renewable and digital energy system. We model energy prices, simulate millions of alternative prices and choose optimal ones that best fit the goals of our customers (not always profit!). Our prices recover costs of individual consumers' energy consumptions and keep margins low enough to be competitive.   We are a team of 10, with 3 CDTM and 1 M&M and like to celebrate with cake rather than with champagne.   What does the tech stack look like?   Our current data science tech stack revolves around R (we like data.table & tidyverse), while Python is in its infancy but will be growing quickly (pandas, numpy). We welcome your input on any other libraries that can make development fun, effective and enjoyable.   What will I be working on?   Your tasks will revolve around building different (statistical) models, testing them and ultimately integrating them in the respective backends. We work a lot with regression, bayesian models, LPs & QPs, not with Neural Nets or NLP. You will have the opportunity to work on greenfield projects and create the initial structure that will be adopted by future projects within the company.    About You    We don‚Äôt want you to be a rock star, a ninja, or a superhero, but to have solid experience with web technologies and software architecture in a professional context and with working and communicating with teams. We are looking for someone who makes well-founded, pragmatic decisions about what competencies to develop and what technologies to use.  Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science (with a focus on Data Science), Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent experience Working knowledge of statistics  Python and the main data science libraries  processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis  Experience with data visualisation tools Exposure to R (nice to have)   Why should I join your team?   Make energy consumption more sustainable Nerd out over optimization algorithms, bayesian statistics & co. Get your hands dirty on BIG data (energy consumptions, market prices) Build a company together with an experienced team (MIT, HEC, CDTM, M&M, Simon-Kucher) and a proven business model

Title: (Junior) Data Scientist (w/m/d)
Description: Als (Junior) Data Scientist (w/m/d) analysierst und bewertest Du gro√üe Datenmengen und hilfst unseren Kunden und Kundinnen dadurch die besten Entscheidungen f√ºr ihr Unternehmen zu treffen. Ob im Bereich Tax, Audit, Consulting, Deal Advisory oder Finance - mit Dir werden Daten zu Informationen.   Deine Aufgaben  Du willst Big Data in Smart Data verwandeln? Dann kannst Du Dich hier einbringen:    Du schaffst aus gro√üen strukturierten und unstrukturierten Datenbest√§nden unterschiedlicher Datenquellen eine Datenbasis, analysierst und interpretierst diese. Mithilfe von Data Mining, Data Science und Machine Learning-Methoden erkennst Du Muster und erstellst daraus Prognosen f√ºr die Zukunft. Die Betreuung von nationalen und internationalen Kund:innen in Projekten an der Schnittstelle zwischen Fachbereich und IT f√§llt ebenfalls in Deinen Aufgabenbereich. Du arbeitest an der Entwicklung neuer Analysemethoden, um die Datenbasis optimal zu pr√ºfen und zu interpretieren. Du konzipierst, erstellst und modellierst Datenbankanwendungen.    Dein Profil   Um bei uns als (Junior) Data Scientist (w/m/d) an Bord zu kommen, hast Du Dein Bachelor- oder Masterstudium mit sehr guten Noten abgeschlossen ‚Äì vorzugsweise in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Statistik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Ingenieurwesen, Wirtschaftsmathematik, Mathematik oder Physik. Deine Expertise konntest Du bereits praktisch im Beratungsumfeld oder anderweitig in der IT unter Beweis stellen. Du besitzt erste Kenntnisse in funktionalen/objektorientierten Programmiersprachen, wie C/C++, Python, R, Java oder JavaScript sowie Kenntnisse in Cloud-Technologien, Business Intelligence-Tools wie Tableau, PowerBI, SAS, oder Umfeld von SAP oder SQL-Datenbanken. Du punktest mit einem soliden Methodenwissen in Statistik, Machine Learning und IT-Infrastrukturen, das es Dir erm√∂glicht, neuen Entwicklungen zu folgen und innovative L√∂sungen zu entwickeln. Deutsch und Englisch beherrschst Du auf C1-Niveau. Daneben bringst Du Reisebereitschaft mit, um unsere Kund:innen auch vor Ort beraten zu k√∂nnen.    Deine Benefits   Willkommen im Team  Damit Du von Beginn an voll bei uns durchstarten kannst, begleiten wir Dich mit strukturierten Onboarding-Ma√ünahmen w√§hrend der gesamten Orientierungsphase. Zudem f√∂rdert Deine F√ºhrungskraft gezielt Deine fachliche und pers√∂nliche Integration ins Team. Vielf√§ltige Karriereperspektiven  Wir legen Wert auf die individuelle Entwicklung Deiner fachlichen und pers√∂nlichen St√§rken: Deine eigenen Ambitionen reflektieren wir in strukturierten Entwicklungsgespr√§chen. Systematische und regelm√§√üige Feedback-Gespr√§che unterst√ºtzen Dich beim Erreichen dieser Ziele. Als Teil des weltweiten KPMG-.Netzwerks bieten wir Dir interessante Karrierem√∂glichkeiten im In- und Ausland und somit wertvolle Einblicke in die Vielfalt unserer T√§tigkeitsbereiche. Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Privatleben  Wir sind √ºberzeugt, dass es vor allem Vielfalt und Flexibilit√§t braucht, um Innovationen zu f√∂rdern und langfristige Erfolge zu sichern. Nur so k√∂nnen wir die besten Ideen entwickeln und wirklich innovative L√∂sungen finden. Mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, Homeoffice-Option, Zeitkonten und Auszeiten schaffen wir R√§ume, um Privat- und Berufsleben miteinander zu vereinbaren. Dar√ºber hinaus unterst√ºtzen wir Dich monatlich mit bis zu vier Stunden Freistellung f√ºr Dein soziales Engagement. Fort- & Weiterbildung  Durch regelm√§√üige Trainings, Workshops und Weiterbildungen entwickelst Du Dich stetig weiter. Zudem f√∂rdern wir Berufsexamina sowie berufsbegleitende Master-Studieng√§nge. Mit unseren Rotationsprogrammen erm√∂glichen wir Deinen fach√ºbergreifenden Einsatz. Diese Einblicke in die vielf√§ltigen Aufgabenfelder bei KPMG erweitern Deinen Horizont und f√∂rdern Synergien in der Zusammenarbeit. Title: Frontend Developer (m/f/d)
Description:
Are you ready to be a technology leader in the SaaS space? Join epilot! epilot is building a SaaS product to sell complex products online, focusing first on solving ecommerce in the rapidly transforming energy market. Our mission: Make selling complex products as easy as selling a pair of shoes online. Our Unique Engineering Culture Is Defined By a Few Core Engineering Principles As Software Engineer at epilot you will be a driving force in shaping this mission. What makes working as a Software Engineer at epilot so special. Among others, you can expect freedom and responsibility because we hire smart people who we can trust. We operate by principles and expect our teams to cultivate a strategic mindset. We believe in ownership: you build it, you run it . We subscribe to this core principle of the DevOps movement. There is no dedicated Ops team who you can pass on the responsibility to take your code and make sure it runs reliably and scales to customers‚Äô needs. You should always show, don‚Äôt tell : Deliver working software early and frequently. We believe in the basic Agile principle of ‚ÄúRelease early and release often‚Äù. This approach helps us manage risk and make better decisions by creating fast feedback loops between ourselves and our users. We design software API First. Before we write a single line of code, we design the APIs of a service in a way that any other team, whether internal to epilot or external, can use the APIs interface with our service without prior knowledge. Does this sound like an environment you want to work in? Then you could bet the right person to be an engineer at epilot! Check out our promise to you: promise.epilot.cloud We "epilots" are a team of experts from the fields of software development, energy management, product management and sales. In order to bring our solution even faster to the top in the energy world, we are looking for you as a Frontend Developer (m/f/d).

Desired Skills and Experience

What awaits you As a frontend developer you will work on the new and further development of our React applications You are responsible for implementing user interfaces based on wireframes and screen designs by our UX designers. You write unit and end-to-end tests for the features and applications you develop. You help your team to analyze and correct errors You are involved in the conception of new features as well as in the optimization of existing features You are part of an agile, cross-functional team of backend and frontend developers as well as designers and product managers. You will also work with other teams to make epilot an even better product You‚Äôll get familiar with our tech stack with microfrontends, serverless AWS and best-in-class developer tooling & automation. More info about our stack: Tech stack What you bring You have at least 3-4 years professional experience with JavaScript You have experiences with React (Hooks, global state management, routing), ES6, TypeScript, Webpack, ESLint You enjoy implementing highly responsive user interface components using react concepts Nice to have: Experience with GraphQL, Node.js, AWS You have fun creating user-friendly UIs with CSS and HTML Ideally you have already gained experience in an eCommerce environment Tech Stack: React, Svelte, TypeScript, GitLab CI/CD What we offer The opportunity to help building the most successful SaaS platform in the energy market. Start-up mentality: dynamic atmosphere and great team spirit. A rapidly growing company with an open communication culture, motivated colleagues and an international corporate culture. Exponential learning curve - epilot is growing rapidly and we expect the same from you. You never stand still, you are permanently challenged, you learn from your mistakes a la Fail Fast and Often. Flexible working hours and remote work - You have an important appointment in the morning? No problem! You decide where and when you want to work. A central location in the heart of Cologne with cool cafes around the corner (But of course full remote jobs are also available). Performance is rewarded with us - We take your desired salary seriously and talk openly about it with you. Transparency - We maintain a very flat and open corporate culture, everything is visible and open for discussion. Regular team events such as carnival, the summer party, Christmas party, company breakfast and many more opportunities to get to know your co-epilots outside working hours. Our highlight event is our yearly epilot summit in the summer where you will meet your co-epilots from all over the world. Coffee, cold drinks, fruits and much appreciation. We are looking forward to your application!

Title: Software Developer (IHP, Haskell)

Our customers and partners particularly appreciate our comprehensive technical expertise in digital product development and our fast implementation speed. So it's best if you're a pragmatic person with experiences in various software technologies and stacks and have built and operated digital products over the full application lifecycle.   Tasks  You'll work on interesting software projects, transforming ideas into practial solutions    Requirements    Experience with various software technologies and stacks, ideally experience in Haskell and IHP Experience in building and operating digital software products over the full life cycle, from prototype to production to discarded Interest in pragmatic and fast problem solving Passion for building great software Good communication skills and customer orientation    Benefits    You can help make haskell mainstream with IHP Best Hardware: own MacBook Pro or better, 5k screens, standing desks, great coffee A bright, quiet office with a good working atmosphere A young team, we're currently 7 people A fast-growing environment where you will learn and experiment a lot Other Benefits: free snackbar, free drinks (Water, Coffee, Club Mate, more), team events

Title: C++ Junior Software Engineer (gn)
Description: Your mission  Integrate all known robot platforms into the Wandelbots solution!  Wandelbots develops an easy-to-use software platform that enables its users to control any robot. As part of the robotics integration team, you will mainly focus on our vision to integrate all robot platform into the Wandelbots Solution.   What you do:  You will integrate controller platforms in the Wandelbots solution: Analyze new robot platforms to use them beyond their common use-cases  Advance the existing software architecture  Extend the capabilities of existing integrations  Regular interaction with different industrial robots  Develop and maintain embedded applications running on the robot controller (C, Java,‚Ä¶)  You will advance our internal framework used for application development and integration API design, implementation and tests  Regularly work with Git, CMake, C++17  You will share your experience and skills in our regular knowledge sharing sessions   Your profile  What you need:   You preferably studied Computer Science or similar You have good C++ knowledge, at least C++14 (STL data-types and algorithms) You are experienced using Git You are eager to learn and improve   Nice to have:   Experience with one of the following technologies: gRPC, MQTT, UDP, TCP, Protobuf CI/CD experience Automation experience in the field of robotics (more than native script writing) Experience with real-time systems   Why us?  Make an impact!  Work on an innovative, deep tech product that adds value to the robotics world and to society! Become a crucial part of something new, big and exciting where you can truly make an impact!   Our teams inspire!  Cross-functional communication is key. You'll get to know many of your 140+ colleagues. Collaborate with great people on our international teams who value knowledge sharing and unique ways of doing things!   Be authentic!  Work in a value-driven environment where everything may not be perfect, but we're working on it! Your feedback is required while you receive feedback and appreciation for your work!   Choose your flexibility!  Work remotely from all around Europe or in our beautiful HQ in Dresden. We live flexible working hours, according to your personal needs and those of your team! If you live far away, we offer mobility support for your Dresden job ticket.   Help others!  You can have up to 3 days of volunteer time off to help your favorite charity.   Develop yourself!   We offer training and mental health opportunities so that you can develop both mentally and professionally.   _ _And there is even more!  Enjoy our free lunch, snacks and drinks, team events, 30 days of annual vacation + additional rest during Christmas season until New Year. If your child gets sick, we assure that a 100% of your usual earnings will be paid while you take care of your little one.__

Title: Android Engineer - Consumer Experience
Description: Delivering the best Spotify experience possible. To as many people as possible. In as many moments as possible. That‚Äôs what the Experience team is all about. We use our deep understanding of consumer expectations to enrich the lives of millions of our users all over the world, bringing the music and audio they love to the devices, apps and platforms they use every day. Know what our users want? Join us and help Spotify give it to them.   We are looking for thoughtful, well-rounded Android engineers to join our team and help build an application that millions of people use every day to discover and listen to music. You will play an important part in our mobile engineering practice, implementing new features, improving performance, and building beautiful user interfaces. Above all, your work will impact the way the world experiences music.   What you‚Äôll do   Collaborate with a small, autonomous team of developers, designers, and product owners to find end-to-end solutions to important problems Implement these solutions for our Android client, adhering to Android development best practices Help your team solve problems in a way that makes sense for Android users and our codebase Join dozens of other developers and help to shape the direction of Android development at Spotify    Who you are   You have a deep understanding of modern Android development. You know how to write readable, maintainable, performant object-oriented Kotlin. You are experienced with Android development tools. You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code. You have released at least one app or have a project in the works that you can tell us about. Open source experience is a huge plus!    Where you‚Äôll be   We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them! Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the EMEA region in which we have a work location and is within working hours. Working hours? We operate within the Central European and GMT time zones for collaboration and ask that all be located that time zone. Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here.    Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what‚Äôs playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It‚Äôs in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.   Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world‚Äôs most popular audio streaming subscription service.    Global COVID and Vaccination Disclosure    Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.

Title: Frontend Engineer (React) @ E-Commerce Platform - Remote - Teilzeit Option
Description: Wir besetzen aktuell eine Stelle bei einer grossen deutschen E-Commerce Plattform. Wir suchen hier einen Javascript Frontend Engineer, der als Teil des Teams Entdecken mithilft, die Produktwelten unterhaltsam und informativ darzustellen.   Der Techstack:   React, JSX, Node.js, Pattern Library, Webpack, Jest, Microservices, Microfrontends, Reactive Programming, GitLab CI, Docker, AWS   Du kannst entweder komplett remote oder in einem der schicken B√ºros in Hamburg, Karlsruhe oder Berlin arbeiten. Title: Frontend Developer Angular (f/m/d) Braunschweig/ remote
Description: We are looking for a Frontend developer with experience in Angular. You   will work within a multidisciplinary team composed of: product managers,   designers, frontend and backend developers, devops engineers and QA   engineers.   Tasks   As part of an agile product team you‚Äôll be responsible with the development and operation of a modern SaaS total cost management solution for Airlines Working closely with the product managers , product specialists and UX engineers you will design and deliver a state-of-the-art UI Develop elegant, usable, flexible , performant and maintainable front end.    Requirements    Essential:   Strong JavaScript knowledge Angular experience HTML5 and CSS (Saas) skills, with cross-browser, cross-platform compatibility Bootstrap / other foundational frameworks Knowledge of general UX concepts Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process.   Desired:   Proficiency in Photoshop, Sketch, Illustrator for visual design and wireframing Solid knowledge of Twitter Bootstrap / jQuery Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction Up-to-date with the latest UX/UI trends, techniques, and technologies Able to translate visual design from mockups to HTML/CSS templates.    Benefits    Work from anywhere Attractive, contemporary remuneration package Talented team and environment A great ecosystem of customers Join us at an exciting time as we embark on our next phase ‚Äî we are well funded, profitable, and gearing up for growth Contract type: full-time / permanent position   We are on a mission to transform fuel and cost management for   airlines so they can maximize success. Success could mean increasing   profitability, improving efficiency, staying competitive, or growing   sustainably. We use our cloud-based, next-generation platform to do   this, combined with our expertise in fuel and cost management best   practice.   Our company was formed in 2021 following the merger of two leaders in   the aviation fuel and cost management space. Together, we have over 100   customers, 20+ years of experience in the field, and well-established   strategic partnerships with industry bodies like IATA.   Every year, we manage over 28% of commercial aviation fuel and more than $76bn of direct flight charges for airlines.   The headquarters and development center is in Europe, but we operate   worldwide, with customers in the Middle East, Africa, the Americas,   Asia, and Europe.

Title: Front-End Web Developer, User Experience
Description: Loudly is an AI music-tech company based in Berlin with a mission to become the #1 music engine for the Creator Economy! We currently serve millions of users and have just launched ‚ÄòSoundtracks‚Äô - a revolutionary new service aimed at Video Creators around the world.     Your mission  We are now looking for an exceptional Front-End Web Developerto join our agile team with a goal to deliver an incredible experience for our audiences. Your core mission will be to implement new designs, optimize the user funnel and improve organic reach.    You will implement and maintain the next generation of Loudly Soundtracks front-end platform using your knowledge of domain driven design. Consistently write production-ready code and deliver maintenance/improvements that are easily testable, easily understood by other developers. Join in code review providing insight into ideals and risks of any given approach. Collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, product, design to create new value.     Your skills  We assume that you have 2-3 years of relevant professional programming experience, however, individuals with extreme talent will always be considered.     Deep knowledge of JavaScript/TypeScript Profound knowledge of React.js (or any other modern JS frameworks) Knowledge of HTML, CSS Experience with state management tools like Redux Familiarity with version control tools like Git Experience with responsive design and best practices Knowledge of current web accessibility standards and requirements Knowledge of information architecture, interaction design, and user-centered design Strong knowledge in core web and browser concepts (eg. how the browser parses and constructs a web page) Experience using design software to collaborate with designers and create pixel perfect web pages (eg. Figma, Sketch) Experience with performance and optimization problems and a demonstrated ability to both diagnose and prevent these problems     Bonus Skills   Experience building mobile browser optimized applications Experience with Google Optimize Experience working on a SaaS product Experience with WordPress development     About you   Self-motivated, collaborative/team-player mentality and experience working in a multicultural environment Understands the value of being user-driven + proactively considers user insights & data to achieve goals Has a proven track record of execution and the desire to always be hands-on Optimistic, ambitious and prefer the feeling of a startup over a big company Has patience when working with others and proactively makes things better Ability to challenge the status quo and equally self-assess Tackling daily tasks with a growth mindset and inspiring others to do the same Proficiency in English as a working language     Why Loudly?   The Loudly team is full of talented, diverse, multicultural individuals from around the world who share a common passion for how music and creativity intersect with technology For most opportunities, we also offer visa & relocation support We take care of our employees and offer flexible working hours Join the #1 AI Music company in the world, innovating and inventing the future of music within the Creator Economy Join company parties, lunches and meetups     Our company  We are a team of dreamers. We look for individuals who dream big, work hard and above all stay humble. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do and through our work together we hope to create a supportive, welcoming, and innovative environment. We strive to play as a team to win and create a better version of ourselves everyday. If this sounds like something that excites you, we want to hear from you!    We are an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion amongst our audiences, artists and employees. We believe that in order to deliver the best experience we rely on a range of backgrounds, experiences, and ideas.    Please send your CV and cover letter to jobs@loudly.com and highlight Front-End Web Developer, User Experience.    If this sounds like you, please send us your CV!    Your application must be in English.

Title: Data Scientist (*)
Description: At DB Schenker, you are part of a global logistics network that connects the world. A network that allows you to shape your career by encouraging you to contribute and truly make a difference. With more than 76,000 colleagues worldwide, we welcome diversity and thrive on individual backgrounds, perspectives and skills. Together as one team, we are Here to move.   The Global Data Strategy & Analytics department is on a mission to turn DB Schenker into a data-driven company. Our Data Science team focuses on designing advanced analytics solutions to solve potential business use cases in logistics utilizing Machine Learning, AI techniques, Data Visualization tools and Big Data technologies in cooperation with our Software Engineering team, internal business units and global IT. We are looking for a talented Data Scientist who can contribute to our projects with solid theoretical background, engineering mindset and eagerness to learn how our logistics business works. You will be part of a multicultural team with other data scientists and operations researchers who will help you to learn and grow. Our project portfolio is diverse and ranges from traditional time series forecasting up to computer vision or NLP.   Your tasks:   Understand the business problem and related use cases of analytics and AI in the projects where you are involved Explore, process, and analyze potential data assets, and share your findings using dashboards or data visualization tools Investigate, apply, and fine-tune state-of-the-art machine learning models to deliver a proof of concept for a given use case Take part of the development of prototypes and production services with other senior team members in a cross-functional agile team setup Learn, grow and be an active member of our internal data science community by sharing best practice and success stories    Your profile:   Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Quantitative Economics, or a related field Experience in data analysis, visualization, and storytelling Solid background in Python programming and corresponding data science libraries (e.g., scikit-learn) Profound theoretical overview of machine learning and AI approaches Ability to understand business needs and translate them into machine learning or analytics problem Clear and succinct verbal and written communication skills in English Passion to learn new technologies and analytical methodologies High degree of motivation and ability to collaborate in a team    Benefits:   In addition to diverse fringe benefits and a company pension scheme, we offer our employees (m/f/d) additional attractive benefits. With seminars, trainings and further qualifications we offer our employees (m/f/d) individual and long-term development and career opportunities on professional, project and management levels. We take social responsibility for our employees (m/f/d). DB Schenker offers a comprehensive workplace health management with programs for health promotion and prevention.

Title: Frontend-Developer (m/w/d)

Daf√ºr braucht es neben einer guten Portion Teamplay ein respektvolles Miteinander, flache Hierarchien und kurze Kommunikationswege. Title: Junior Frontend Developer (m/w/d) Berlin

Besonders stolz sind wir auf unsere Unternehmenskultur.   Respekt, Vertrauen und Verantwortung werden in unseren Teams im t√§glichen Miteinander gelebt ‚Äì und das √ºber den Arbeitsplatz hinaus.   Zur Verst√§rkung unseres Teams suchen wir dich als   Junior Frontend Developer (m/w/d) in Berlin  unbefristet, in Vollzeit   Gemeinsam mit einem bunt gemischten Team aus CMS- und Applikationsentwicklern, UX und UI, SCRUM Coach und Product Ownern treibst du die Umsetzung anspruchsvoller Web-Projekte voran und hilfst unseren Kunden dabei, ihre Marke auf UX-optimierten   Oberfl√§chen online besser zu pr√§sentieren. Schwerpunktm√§√üig nutzen wir HTML5, CSS3 und JavaScript in der Entwicklung. Dar√ºber hinaus auch React und Vue. Hier findest du einen √úberblick √ºber unsere Referenzprojekte in der Frontendentwicklung!   Was du bei uns machst   Du entwickelst mit deinen Kollegen moderne, interaktive und responsive Webportal- und Mikro-Frontends sowie Web-Applikationen und programmierst diese mit einem H√∂chstma√ü an Qualit√§t und Effizienz. Du arbeitest eng mit unserem Konzept- und UX-Team zusammen und unterst√ºtzt die Kollegen bei der Erstellung von Konzepten und der Architektur. Dein Gesp√ºr f√ºr Technologie, √Ñsthetik und Usability hilft dir dabei. Als Mitglied eines Scrum Teams √ºbernimmst du die Verantwortung f√ºr User Stories, gibst Aufwandssch√§tzungen f√ºr Kundenanforderungen ab und beteiligst dich aktiv an Sprint Plannings, Reviews und Retrospektiven. Du unterst√ºtzt au√üerdem bei der Pflege und Weiterentwicklung bestehender Portale und Applikationen sowie bei der Erstellung von Aufwandssch√§tzungen. In der Frontendentwicklung gehst du gerne neue Wege und stellst auch Altbew√§hrtes infrage. Den daf√ºr notwendigen Freiraum bieten wir dir gerne!   Wann du zu uns passt   Du bist ein echter Teamplayer. Einer f√ºr alle, alle f√ºr einen ‚Äì das ist dein und unser Motto. Du bringst ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Wirtschafts-/Medieninformatik, Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation mit. Au√üerdem hast du schon erste Erfahrungen mit Frontend-Technologien wie z.B. CSS, HTML oder Javascript sowie mit Frontend-Frameworks wie React oder Vue sammeln k√∂nnen. Du bist kommunikationsstark, mindestens auf Deutsch. Gutes Englisch ist w√ºnschenswert. Technologische Neuerungen sind dir eine Freude, keine Last. Du hast den Willen, zu lernen, dich kontinuierlich weiterzuentwickeln ‚Äì und dein Wissen weiterzugeben. Dabei unterst√ºtzen wir dich gerne mit einer Vielzahl an Weiterbildungsma√ünahmen und internen Angeboten!    Was du von uns hast    Deine Erfolgsmomente sind unsere Inspiration. Bei uns bist du Mensch ‚Äì und keine Nummer!  Wir legen sehr hohen Wert auf einen freundschaftlich-kollegialen, aber auch ehrlichen Umgang miteinander. Respekt, Vertrauen und Verantwortung werden bei uns gro√ügeschrieben. Ellenbogenmentalit√§t findest du bei uns nicht. Jedes Projekt bringt neue, spannende Herausforderungen mit sich. Wir wissen, dass wir diese erfolgreich nur im Team meistern und helfen uns daher gegenseitig. Das gemeinsame Arbeiten, Aust√ºfteln, Umdenken, Umsetzen und Optimieren macht uns Spa√ü und wir lernen jeden Tag dazu. Bei uns gewinnen die besten Ideen und deine sind uns jederzeit willkommen. Deine Work-Life-Balance nehmen wir sehr ernst. Viele von uns haben gerade eine Familie gegr√ºndet oder zeitintensive Hobbys. Wir glauben, dass ausgeglichene Mitarbeiter das Team deutlich weiterbringen, als wenn wir ihnen √úberstunden aufb√ºrden. Daher achten wir darauf, dass diese m√∂glichst gar nicht erst anfallen, setzen dich auf m√∂glichst wenigen Projekten parallel ein und unterst√ºtzen dich beim eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten ‚Äì und im Umgang mit deinen eigenen Ressourcen.   Deine Vorteile   Flexible Arbeitszeiten: Wir tun alles daf√ºr, damit du Privatleben und Beruf unter einen Hut bringen kannst. Freie Zeiteinteilung und mobiles Arbeiten geh√∂ren dazu. Hardware frei w√§hlbar: Bei uns kannst du die Hardware, mit der du arbeiten m√∂chtest, aus unserem Hardwarekatalog frei w√§hlen. Fachwissen: Wir haben einen sehr hohen Anspruch an die Qualit√§t unserer Frontendentwicklung und an die Fortbildung unserer Mitarbeiter. Deswegen gibt es auch‚Ä¶ Weiterbildung satt: Ob interne Chapter Sessions, Hackathons, die diva-e Akademie oder der Besuch von Konferenzen und Barcamps ‚Äì f√ºr deine Weiterbildung tun wir alles und sind dabei offen f√ºr deine W√ºnsche.   Du passt zu uns? Dann bewirb dich!  Du hast Lust auf tolle Kunden, mit denen du spannende Web-Projekte realisieren kannst? Du bl√ºhst bei Teamwork erst so richtig auf? Du brennst f√ºr das, was du tust und wagst dich aus der eigenen Komfortzone? Du willst unsere Zukunft aktiv mitgestalten? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!  Ein Anschreiben ben√∂tigen wir nicht, aber wir sind schon neugierig, was dich an dieser Stelle interessiert. Nach Bewerbungseingang melden wir uns schnellstm√∂glich bei dir. Passt der erste Eindruck, findet ein erstes Gespr√§ch in der Regel schon innerhalb einer Woche statt. Und wenn da die Chemie stimmt, machen wir einen zweiten Termin, in dem du im Rahmen einer kleinen Fallstudie deine fachlichen Skills unter Beweis stellen und das Team und deine Arbeitsumgebung kennen lernen kannst.   Du hast noch Fragen?  Fragen zum Bewerbungsablauf beantwortet dir Sandra Rang aus dem HR-Team. Sie freut sich auf deinen Anruf +49 89 954590 33 oder deine E-Mail an hr@diva-e.com! Vernetze dich gerne direkt auf XING oder Linkedin mit ihr oder schau dir an, was Mitarbeiter und Bewerber auf kununu √ºber uns sagen.

Title: Software Engineer
Description: Daedalus is a different kind of startup. We are a team of Robotics, Artificial Intelligence, and Software Engineers building the factory of the future.   With our world-leading technical experience from OpenAI, SpaceX, MIT and more, and venture backing from some of the biggest names in tech, we believe that revolutionary results can be built by a small group of creative minds working in concert. Join us on our journey to build a completely autonomous manufacturing system for the production of precision CNC metal parts for medical devices, robotics, industrial machinery, and aerospace and defense.   Tasks   Tackling difficult technical design and development challenges on a wide range of tasks: from distributed systems and network infrastructure, to real-time robot perception and control Leading development projects from design through robust deployment Working together in a highly collaborative and multidisciplinary environment of software, mechanical, and robotics engineers    Requirements    You work independently and diligently, and enjoy dissecting complex problems to find the most important projects to work on You own your work end-to-end, and are interested in learning new things based on whatever needs doing at any given moment You know your way around a Unix shell and are proficient using at least one major programming language (though you could probably pick a new one up quickly)    Benefits    Working on a uniquely innovative and first-principles-based technical system with great potential for industry innovation A working environment of passionate, creative, agile, conscientious and smart coworkers Motivating work climate with large degrees of autonomy, leadership opportunities and a collaborative atmosphere Great collaborative office with a fun group of creative minds Free lunch and snacks every day   We're extremely excited to hear from you!

Title: Backend Engineer (Fortnite Creative)
Description: WHAT MAKES US EPIC?   At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.   Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.   ENGINEERING   What We Do  Driving the plug-in power behind Unreal Engine. We bridge connections for licensees and our own internal game teams to online services. This allows games like Fortnite to utilize a combination of platform online services as well as Epic‚Äôs own online services to build cross-platform online features. Login, parties, voice chat, matchmaking, purchasing, cloud storage, and analytics are just a few examples of online features that our Online Game Services team helps games utilize.   What You'll Do  We are looking for a Backend Engineer to join the Fortnite Creative team. You will craft highly available, high throughput, low latency services at scale, synchronous and asynchronous services, persistent connection services, and a variety of other systems. These will all help to power our internal products and enable external development teams all over the world. The Online services team is a collaborative environment and a successful candidate will help to foster an open, supportive culture in which everyone can be successful and their authentic self. Learn more at https://dev.epicgames.com/.   In this role, you will   Write distributed systems to handle large scale challenges (we use Node.js and Scala) Work with public cloud infrastructure to facilitate a fast moving ecosystem (we use AWS) Own the entire lifecycle of services, including live operations and deployment Craft solutions using modern SQL and non-relational databases (we use MongoDB, Dynamo and Redis) Work together with both upstream and downstream service owners, producers and other cloud, infrastructure and embedded DevOps engineers to ship solutions    What we‚Äôre looking for   Proficiency with Scala and Node.js (bonus points for experience with AWS, Kubernetes or C++) Experience developing online systems Proven track record of operating live services You‚Äôre user-focused, passionate, scrappy, solutions-focused, and innovative. These traits equal success at Epic and influence everything we do    EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE   Our current benefits package includes higher employer contribution on public health insurance, 100% employer paid annual health check ups, supplemental company supported pension, survivors benefit and LTD. We also offer a robust mental well-being program through Modern Health, which provides free therapy and coaching for employees & dependents.   About Us  Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we‚Äôve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic‚Äôs award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.   Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!   Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Learn more about our Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy here.

Title: Software Engineer - eBPF developer
Description: About Datadog:  We're on a mission to build the best platform in the world for engineers to understand and scale their systems, applications, and teams. We operate at high scale‚Äîtrillions of data points per day‚Äîallowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops and Security teams globally for tens of thousands of companies. Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way.   The Team:  The Networks Monitoring team is developing an eBPF based platform to provide complete visibility into Layer 7 network protocols in order to build new products without requiring users to deploy additional agents or libraries in their stacks. The team is composed of a set of engineers with expertise in eBPF and networking, contributing to open source projects such as Cilium or Linux.   The Opportunity:  Be a part of creating and defining a new industry standard for how to build best in class monitoring solutions based on eBPF. Join a fast-moving team working on hard problems deep in the Linux stack. In this role, you will wear many hats from writing eBPF code, to contributing to the Datadog agent, partnering with our platform teams, and working closely with our customers to understand our use cases. You will:   Own new feature development end-to-end from ideation to implementation Build low-overhead data collection tools based on eBPF that collect important metrics from the kernel and in particular the network stack Develop solutions to instrument L7 protocols such as HTTP/S, DNS, gRPC, but also application specific protocols such as Kafka Be a driving force in product decisions    You Are:   You have experience working with and developing in the Linux kernel, either using eBPF, as a kernel developer, or building low level programs in C You have have a deep understanding of the various layers of the protocol stack and have hands-on experience troubleshooting networking or API related issues You have significant experience building high throughput/low latency systems You have been building applications and tooling for 5+ years and know the systems you‚Äôve worked on in depth You are motivated by solving problems for our customers first and foremost and building beautiful products that our customers love    Bonus Points:   You have contributed to the Linux kernel You have experience building and troubleshooting large distributed systems You have experience with Golang You have worked at a very high scale environment (e.g. ~thousands of payloads/sec)    Is this you? Let's chat!   This is a remote position   Equal Opportunity at Datadog:  Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.   Your Privacy:  Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog‚Äôs Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.

Title: Full Stack Developer (w/m/d)

Title: Full-Stack Software Developer - Remote possible (f/m/x)
Description: Code with purpose  , join Cozero.   Cozero is a Berlin-based ClimateTech startup that transforms every company into a low-emission business. Our SaaS platform offers a fully digital end-to-end Carbon Action Platform (CAP) to track, forecast, and manage corporate emission  data and most effectively match  them to low-emission solutions  on the market to reduce their carbon footprint. Based on our platform, carbon reduction becomes actionable. Become part of a ClimateTech startup empowering companies to master their path to carbon neutrality. Together, we reduce a major share of global carbon emissions and turn around climate change  .   Tasks   Working on problems that will positively impact the sustainability of our climate Be a hands-on engineering contributor, using our state of the art tech stack Make architecture decisions as a key member of our engineering team Promote best practices in our Agile processes    Requirements    3+ years of experience working in agile tech teams Analytical mindset and excellent problem-solving skills Ability to work autonomously while maintaining attention to detail An eye for quality (automated tests, clean code, striving for improvements) Good English communication skills in word and speech Bias for taking responsibility - bias for action. You have a track record of doing whatever it takes to get things done. You have accomplished things that others thought were impossible. You are ceaselessly creative and impactful.   Tech Stack   Languages: Typescript Backend: NodeJS, Express, MongoDB, NestJS, Postgresql Frontend: React, Ant design, Next.js DevOps: Kubernetes, Helm, Docker, AWS, Terraform   See more here: https://stackshare.io/cozero-io/tech    Benefits    Working at an early stage and fast-paced startup such as Cozero means that all your contributions will have a direct impact on the product and by extension on lowering the carbon emissions of companies.   As an early hire of the company, you will also be able to grow together with us and be a very influential part of the company. We are an open-minded team that works closely together in a non-hierarchical manner.   You would join us in our beautiful office in the heart of Berlin, and we offer the possibility of working remotely.   And there is more...   Joining a dynamic environment that is driven by our core values - Candor, Commitment, Clarity, Collaboration and Creativity - being driven by impact and highly motivated to make a change for the better You can join us in our beautiful office in the heart of Berlin or you can work remotely if you are based in Europe.Regular team events and 1-2 offsite events p.a. (summer event & Cozero's closing of the year) Being an elementary part of one of the fastest-growing ClimateTech startups in Europe, with critical responsibility and influence on product and overall venture development   How does the interview process look like?  The process follows the same procedure for every candidate: getting to know team members through three to four conversations about Cozero, your experience, and your interests. As part of the process, we usually run through a skills screening (e.g. a coding challenge for a developer, a case challenge for a carbon accounting expert, a portfolio discussion for a designer). A final reference call with a former colleague / manager of yours gives additional insight into your needs and wishes that we aim to factor in for your personal development plan. We emphasize transparency and the absence of surprise throughout the process.   Kick it off!  We are psyched about getting to know you - join our team of Cozero and shape the future of digital corporate carbon management!

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Junior Physicist / Data Scientist    NDT Global is the leading provider of ultra-high-tech diagnostic inspection solutions, advanced data analysis and integrity assessment services for ensuring the safety and longevity of energy-sector infrastructure assets. Recognized as the forerunner in ultrasonic inspection technologies comprising Pulse Echo, Pitch-and-Catch and Phased Array, as well as Acoustic Resonance (ART Scan) methodologies, the company also deploys a range of non-ultrasonic technologies, such as Inertial Measurement Units, with more under development. NDT Global strategically applies its inspection technologies to detect, diagnose and model various types of threat‚Äîcircumferential or axial cracks, metal loss, geometry, mapping, and more‚Äîacross diverse classes of assets. By providing predictive, decision-ready insights driven by the world‚Äôs most accurate data, NDT Global enables the conditions for asset owners to optimize infrastructure health and drive operational efficiencies while reducing risk and minimizing their carbon footprint.    NDT Global is part of Eddyfi/NDT, a fast-growing, innovative industrial technology group focused on advanced diagnostic technologies to monitor the world‚Äôs infrastructure health. The Group serves asset owners, large engineering firms, and service companies globally in markets such as Aerospace, Civil Infrastructures, Energy, Mining, Power Generation, and Rail. Eddyfi/NDT believes that advancing science and technology via sensors, hardware, robotics, and software makes the world more productive and safer for people, business and nature. The company employs over 1,300 people throughout 28 offices worldwide and serves clients in more than 110 countries     Responsibilities   Purpose  For our algorithm development team, we are searching fresh minds to face the challenges of the future. We are working in the domains of signal and image processing, applying enhanced data reduction methods, searching for new visualization methods, and inventing and training models to get the best out of the various ultrasound methodologies the company uses. We are searching for you to bring the next generation to success. As entry point your responsibilities will be   Participate in the research and development of prototypes for improving data handling, analysis accuracy and/or efficiency for all NDTG technologies (UT, ART, Phased Array, Gas CD, ...) Test, evaluate and document developed solutions     Requirements   A Master's degree in Natural Sciences, Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or similar Experience with research and/or data science projects is preferable Advanced experience in programming; preferable in python Spirit and skills to understand complex measurement technologies, i.e., to understand the physics, the related algorithms, and limitations Proficient in spoken and written English     Benefits   Great long-term career prospects and development opportunities Challenging tasks in innovative and diverse teams Attractive compensation system Flexible working environment    Please apply via LinkedIn or our webpage. If you have any further questions please do not hesitate to contact Tom Sander.

Title: Software Developer - Core Search (m|f|x)
Description: Job Description  Our team helps millions of customers every day to find the right products at the best price. The search team focuses on finding new ways and technologies to serve the most relevant results for our users. You will be part of a team that‚Äôs constantly exploring and improving solutions in query understanding, result ranking and recommendations to name just a few. To achieve this, as Software Developer - Core Search (m|f|x) in full-time or part-time, you‚Äôll be working together with Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers and Java Engineers ‚Äì as we strongly believe a cross-functional team finds the best solutions!   About Your New Role   As a Search Engineer you are responsible for idealo‚Äôs business critical B2C search and matching for millions of customers internationally, based on an organically grown complex custom solution (Lucene based). You design, develop, operate and maintain AWS cloud infrastructure to run our search services. You will also help migrating on premise solutions into the cloud. You build up knowledge and share best practices in search for continuous improvements and innovation for our solutions. You improve search query understanding/interpretation and search result generation/ranking. In order to personalise our customer's search experience, you make use of our data lake infrastructure and Customer Data Platform.    Skills & Requirements  Job requirements   You are experienced and knowledgeable with Lucene based search services (Lucene, Solr, Elastic). You are proficient in establishing and maintaining AWS cloud services and applying Infrastructure as Code principles. You are proficient with Java and the Spring ecosystem. Message streaming platforms such as Apache Kafka and NoSQL databases like MongoDB are a plus. You need to be proficient in German and English to contribute to our core markets. You are comfortable with remote teamwork.    Helpful   You understand concepts of semantic modelling in graph databases. You're comfortable communicating and collaborating with cross-functional teams and roles to achieve the team's goals.    At idealo you can expect   You don't live in Berlin and want to work from home? Our hybrid work model offers you the freedom to work from all over Germany in a mobile and flexible way. Together we will find the best solution that works for you. In return, you get everything you need for your work (noise-canceling headset, laptop, etc.). You need vacation? We offer you 30 days of vacation. Not enough? You can "buy" an additional 15 days every year by converting your salary and it's seen as a positive thing. You want to further your education? We take your personal development goals seriously and, in addition to our idealo Learning Hub, eLearning offerings (e.g., Udemy, DataCamp), coaching & mediation, we also offer you the opportunity to benefit individually from additional learning and development budget. And what about the office? Our office in the heart of Berlin offers free organic breakfast, excellent subsidized lunch, as well as free coffee, lemonades and after-work beer, in addition to the "standard foosball". It also has a fabulous rooftop terrace with view of the whole of berlin where you can network with colleagues from our group of companies You want full flexibility on your way to work and beyond? No problem with a job bike or BVG company ticket - and it's environmentally friendly, too! You don't live in Germany yet? We support you in the visa process and with your relocation.    About‚ÄØidealo  idealo‚ÄØis a Berlin success story: in 2000 we started out with the mission of helping consumers make the best purchasing decisions. Today, with 1.5 million visits per day, 50,000 shops, and more than 330 million product offers, we are one of the most popular German e-commerce websites and one of the leading European shopping and comparison platforms. We are active as a price comparison platform in six countries (Austria, France, Germany, Great Britain, Italy, and Spain).   We‚ÄØare located in the heart of Berlin and offer a unique idealo spirit. Your ideas are the driving force that moves our business forward. Not only our product portfolio is diverse, but also the people who work on it. We want you just as you are! Origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, or a degree of disability are irrelevant.   If‚ÄØyou are passionate about improving the world of online shopping alongside 1200 idealos from 60 nations, apply with us today.   Work in the office and from wherever you like.  idealo allows you to work from wherever you are. As part of our Hybrid Work at idealo, you decide whether and how often you work from our office in Berlin or remotely because you live in another city within Germany or the caf√© down the street makes the best coffee cream. Only about once a month, there will be mandatory office days to bring idealos together at company, department or team level, including stunning views from our roof terrace. Find out what Hybrid Work at idealo is all about here and in a personal conversation in the interviews!

Title: Fullstack Developer (f/m/d)

Title: Software Engineer
Description: About us  3T has one mission: To build the finest NoSQL tools available. We have firmly established ourselves at the forefront of NoSQL innovation and the NoSQL tooling market with over 100,000 active users of our MongoDB IDE ‚Äì Studio 3T.     3T is growing!    In the last 12 months (and for the second time) we outgrew our office space. We now have lots of room to grow in our brand new office in Prenzlauer Berg, Berlin. Our office language is English, with teammates from 30 nationalities.    We are currently looking for a passionate Software Developerto join our growing Development team.    As a part of the team, you will be involved in the full life cycle of the development of our desktop and online tools, with a chance to proactively contribute to our products and have a real impact on their many users.     Who you are  First and foremost, you are a passionate software developer. You love coding and you take pride in producing clean, elegant, performant solutions that are robust and easy to maintain. Ideally, you are a motivated self-starter and have a drive to meaningfully impact our product suite.     What you‚Äôll achieve   Design and implement solutions for MongoDB-focused features and tools Evaluate their effectiveness and incorporate customer feedback into further iterations Collaborate with our Quality Assurance team to ensure robust and high-quality results Contribute to the constant improvement of our development processes and tools     What we need you to bring to the table   Professional software development experience A good understanding of algorithms, data structures, and how to use them efficiently Practical knowledge of the most important concepts of object-oriented programming Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English     Extra credit if you also have‚Ä¶   Experience with developing in Java Experience of MongoDB, or other NoSQL databases Proven skills in developing and working with large, object-oriented code bases Experience of desktop development, using SWT, JavaFX or similar technologies Experience of backend development, e.g. using the Spring Boot framework Practical knowledge of SQL databases, e.g. Oracle, PostgreSQL etc.     What we‚Äôll bring to the table   A chance to work on our exciting MongoDB tools Want to move to Berlin? The relocation package is ready Flexibility with regards to working hours and working from home in Berlin, so you can nurture your work/life balance 30 days of annual vacation plus 24.12 and 31.12 off ‚Äì and yes, all vacation days can be taken at once if you wish so Free weekly German and English language courses for all employees on company time We sponsor 50% of the cost of your monthly public transportation ticket (for the Berlin area) You will surely have fun at our regular Team Events such as Team Quiz Nights, Summer and Christmas Party Planning to buy a new gadget? We are offering discounts on various products through the corporate benefits program We also offer the opportunity to have a real impact on our products and in shaping the team: as a team, we have built a strong foundation of process and strategy, but being a scaleup we want to hear and try your ideas  We have already mentioned that we have great space to work: Our new, modern office space offers free breakfast, fresh fruit and vegetables, soft drinks, beers, and snacks And finally, we will not forget to emphasize that our team is sociable, diverse, and most of all, welcoming.    Our approach to hiring is transparent and uncomplicated. As we respect your time and effort, we will do our best to have ‚Äò‚Äôjust necessary‚Äù conversations and to provide all relevant information about the role and your development within the company.    If we have intrigued you enough, please apply via LinkedIn or send a Cover Letter and CV in English to dev-jobs@studio3t.com.    We would love to hear from you.

Getting this innovative strength on the road requires a strong team ‚Äì and you can be part of it. Find out more about us and fast-track your career with Hella Gutmann. WHAT WE ARE OFFERING TO MAKE YOUR EVERYDAY WORK EVEN MORE ENJOYABLE   Interesting tasks, innovative products and great colleagues An open and cooperative business culture with direct and friendly communication and cooperation Attractive remuneration in a company subject to a collective agreement, along with holiday pay and a Christmas bonus A safe workplace in a continuously growing company Development measures and further education that is tailored to you personally Modern infrastructure at the workplace A modern company restaurant - subsidized by our company Company pension scheme with subsidy "Fit with HGS": Free fruit and water, running events "Eldercare": care program for relatives The option to charge your electric vehicle for free during working hours An attractive location where the borders of three countries meet with good connection to public transport network Employee discounts and much more   Take the opportunity to reveal your potential within a global, family-run company that offers you the best possible conditions for progressing in your career.   HELLA Gutmann Solutions GmbH  Arkadius Birkner   Am Krebsbach 2   79241 Ihringen   +49 (0) 7668/9900-1995
