Title: üßë‚Äçüíª Flutter Developer (m/f/d) (Germany only)
Description: Hello human üëã  We're looking for new team members to work on and contribute to our multi-platform Flutter applications.   Tasks  You will be working in an international, remote team of talented and experienced engineers and closely with the product & design teams. The team will follow common principles and understandings of what good code looks like. We value positive work ethics, a high level of self-organization, and self-governance in our development team.    Requirements    You have deep knowledge and are intrinsically motivated to build great mobile and/or desktop apps You have a customer-first approach, understanding that every detail in an application is there to provide a great experience for our end-users and that it's our responsibility to be the users' advocate You value pragmatic solutions You agree that communication skills are as important as technical knowledge Some experience in Flutter and Dart. We'd love to talk about your latest pet project. It's a plus if you have native experience for desktop (Windows/macOS) or mobile platforms (Android/iOS). Understanding their SDKs, knowing their languages (C++, Swift, Kotlin, JS), and being comfortable with their very own release processes You are willing to try, push and explore new technologies You are fluent in English You live in Germany You are bot-friendly and not allergic to AIs    Benefits    Learning is an everyday task. We grow together by reviewing each others code, during pair-programming, in dedicated breakout sessions such as coding dojos and hackathons Developers at phntm are equipped with the best soft- and hardware for the best developer experience Don't fear breaking something. Starting from week 1, you'll be working on production code. Tests, code reviews and CI/CD prevent regressions and allow us to sleep at night Together, we'll be working on your personal career roadmap, making sure you evolve towards your goals   Our team is a remote-first, international and experienced group of individuals (and highly-trained AIs). We value self-organization and taking over responsibilities and new challenges. Our goal is to constantly evolve and redefine our development process, improve our coding standards, challenge technical decisions, and push the boundaries to make sure we build the best products possible.   We work flexible hours, believe in a healthy work/life balance, and will always allow working remotely. We require you to be a full-time employee, but we can discuss reduced workweeks.

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/x)
Description: Overview    We are creating a future where unlimited machine uptime is the norm, by automating machine diagnostics for the manufacturing industry with a scalable and easy-to-use AI sensor solution. AiSight is featured in the Forbes 30under30 2020 Europe Manufacturing category. We are growing our brand and customer base to achieve our ambitious company goals. To strengthen our team even more we are looking for a Data Scientist (m/f/x).  Tasks  Your mission  As a member of this team, you‚Äôll be working on various projects of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning areas. The work may also include large (Big Data) data sets used to providing data-driven insights to help our customers.   You are responsible for crafting algorithms and features for our customer-facing prediction tool. Build, train, run, own and validate predictive and explorative analytical AI models. Analyze large and complex data sets to derive valuable insights. Write and develop production-level code/pipelines. Experience with cloud services. Actively monitor AI models during their lifecycle and intervene in case of trouble. Presentation of qualitative and quantitative results obtained during development and running of these models. Delivery of fast, stable, scalable, robust and future-proof AI microservices.    Requirements    What would make you a perfect match   Proficiency and broad experience in programming in Python. At least 3+ years of experience in the Data Science field. Completed studies in the area of Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics Information Technology or equivalent. Working knowledge of a variety of currently used Machine Learning algorithms. Experience from projects relating to Predictive Maintenance and good understanding of Signal Processing. Good applied statistics skills with understanding of distributions, statistical testing, regression etc. Data visualisation skills, using eg. Matplotlib Experience with cloud services. Bringing ML models to production. Working knowledge of Git, SQL. Problem-solving attitude. Exposure to research. Fluency in English   It would be great if you bring this additional knowledge to the team  :   Working knowledge TensorFlow, Keras, or preferably PyTorch. Knowledge of manufacturing, IoT and time series. Experience in other programming languages will be an asset eg. R or JavaScript. Experience in tools for big data processing will be an asset eg. Hadoop and/or Spark.    Benefits    A unique collaborative working atmosphere in a young & international team with regular team events and off-sites. 26 paid holidays + 2 extra days paid by AiSight. Flexible working hours and the possibility to work remotely. You can choose one of our benefits pool: Swapfiets, BVG, Urban Sports or Naturstrom. Annual Learning Budget of 1.000‚Ç¨ and a Learning Day every 6th week, because continuous learning is very important for us. Monthly food allowance. Flat hierarchies with a lot of personal responsibility. Dogs are welcome in the office. Drinks, fruit & snacks in the office and the advantages of a central office location in the heart of Berlin.# We value equality of opportunity regardless of gender, age, nationality or any other type of non-professional classification and we highly encourage women to apply. We would love to hear from you! :)    About Us    AiSight builds a plug-and-play hardware and software solution that uses machine data, to predict and prevent machine malfunction using self-learning AI algorithms. This tremendously increases machine uptime, output and productivity and significantly cuts companies service and maintenance costs.   Our company was founded in July 2018 by Matthias and Max, they made it into the world‚Äôs largest hardware Accelerator Program, based in San Francisco and Shenzen - HAX - and received its first Investment from SOSV. At this time they met Renan who joined AiSight as CTO, and together they participated in the HAX program in Shenzen for 3 months to develop the first sensor prototypes. In October they received a seed round of $2.5 milion closed with Palo Alto-based Merus Capital and HAX/SOSV signing on as investors. Many major multinational companies started using the AiSight solution.   In September 2021, AiSight was acquired by Sensirion which is a leading global manufacturer of high quality sensors and systems. We are proud and happy to be part of Sensirion's success story and look forward to the time ahead. At the moment we are a team of 40 people and the team is getting bigger and bigger, we expect to be 100 employees by the end of 2022.   Our Team is holding master‚Äôs degrees from respected universities such as ETH Zurich, ESCP Europe, UC Berkeley and Zeppelin University. Additionally, we have many years of professional experience at companies like Porsche, ABB, MTU Aero Engines, Holtzbrinck Digital, BASF, BTG Pactual or and multiple startups in Silicon Valley, Southeast Asia, Brazil and Berlin.

Title: Software Developer Full Stack (m/f/d)
Description: Hi! We‚Äôre happy that you‚Äôre here.  PRIOjet Logistics, the SaaS-platform for arranging and processing extremely time-critical logistics orders, is the trusted partner all over the world for companies, logistics agencies, service providers, and on-board couriers AND possibly your next great place to work.   What if spare parts, important production components, documents for immediate and safe delivery or medicines must be transported around the world directly, no matter what? In time-critical logistics, a courier jumps on the next plane for the delivery. PRIOjet Logistics brings all parties on one platform and offers them all the tools they need to excel. What has previously been a tangled combination of phone calls, SMS, chats, emails and faxes, is now conducted via a mobile and scalable SaaS solution.   Tasks  The Challenge  Our cross-discipline team builds and run a leading-edge platform for the international very sensitive emergency logistics sector. Hence, for our success, high-quality software development is a very important aspect.   We are looking for a great Software Developer with some years of experience as Full Stack Developer working on Backend, Web and Mobile, and anything it takes to delight users and solves problems, to join our growing team in Hamburg or part-remotely. This position offers the opportunity to possibly receive company shares (VSOP).    Your Key Responsibilities    Build across the full stack, from backend APIs to mobile and web frontend user interfaces to deliver end-to-end solutions based on user requirements and objectives by working on our NestJS (Node) backend written in Typescript in connection with out React Native (expo . io, also Typescript) frontend apps. Plan, architect and implement new features in our backend. Be a part of decisions about architecture and features of the apps. Influence the development roadmap with the development team and be able to prioritize. Implement, iterate and release features in a cross-functional team. Be self-driven and come up with new ideas on how to improve our product. Connect the dots on your own and be able to fill in the gaps as necessary. Pay attention to detail when needed and break complex tasks into smaller chunks without losing sight of the bigger picture. Don't accept quick and inaccurate solutions but find a good balance in software development (usability, maintainability, extensibility, usability, acccuracy, reliability, etc.). Extend and maintain our GraphQL API. Integrating third-party services and APIs into our system. Work with our product owners to deliver high-quality UI and UX. Build reusable, scalable, and reliable software solutions. Build the technical documentation and contribute to the internal knowledge and codebases.   But that¬¥s not all.  There is also a part which is up to you: What are you passionate about? What do you want to learn, and where else would you like to contribute?    Requirements    What we‚Äôre looking for:   3+ years of relevant experience as a Full Stack Software Engineer in building scalable backends (e.g. Python, NodeJS, Ruby, Go) as well as frontend apps using React/ReactJS/ React Native or similar frameworks. Experience in functional, object-oriented and other programming paradigms as well as the appropriate use and application of software patterns in the code. B.Sc or M.Sc in Computer Science, Information Systems or similar technical discipline. Additional experience in HTML, CSS, Javascript, Typescript, Expo. io, Mobile apps, CI/CD, DevOps, Docker, functional approach in React using Hooks. Experience as a software architect (database, APIs, service architectures) with a profound database knowledge (e.g. Postgres, MySQL, NoSQL), Linux/Unix skills, Cloud Services (Azure, AWS or/and Google Cloud), Git Workflows, and Dev/Ops is required. Knowledge of security best practices and understanding the most common security vulnerabilities. Experience with Agile Software Development Techniques and Tools. Experience in debugging, testing, and problem-solving skills. Professional written and verbal fluency in English, same in German will be a plus but not a must have.   Who you are:   You have a hands-on attitude as a builder and maker ‚Äì not a theorist. You are self-motivated. You take initiative, are naturally curious, and can learn new things quickly while continuing to deliver value on the job. You are a shipper. You respect deadlines, accomplish your work autonomously, and have experience setting a positive example for self-management to your team members. You are people-centric. You can thrive in a collaborative environment involving different stakeholders and subject matter experts, and enjoy helping others grow. You are open to new ideas, demand and act upon feedback, are always constructive and are radically honest about the state of things.   It would be great if you also have:   Experience to work in a small and high motivated team of developers. Experience working with international and/or distributed teams. Knowledge in Data Science and/or Business. Professional written and verbal fluency in German.    Benefits    A chance to work in a great start-up on an exciting problem space that becomes more and more important in an ever more connected world and supply chain. A diverse international team backed by international investors. Flexible schedule & remote-friendly workplace culture. Team activities. In addition to the salary, we have the option of a VSOP program. Optionally, we offer cash allowance for lunch or private internet connection. And sure, free warm and cold drinks and some fruits in our office in Hamburg and Frankfurt ;)   PRIOjet's mission enables a wide scope for personal growth and development for experienced, creative and motivated talents who work independently and reliably towards the common goal.   If this looks like a great match for you to be a part of a growing Start-up, please get in touch with us as soon as possible.  Quick tip: Please make sure to send us your CV and to tell us briefly and informally why you are the perfect match for PRIOjet.   Looking forward to getting to know you. Talk soon!

Title: Software Engineer
Description: Apex Tool Group is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.   Software Engineer - Westhausen  Key Responsibilities:   Implement software for embedded tightening system (including front- and backend software) - mainly written in C Evaluate and create software specifications from use cases, marketing requirements, and customer requirements Derive software design from requirements Work with software testers, system testers, product technical specialists and customers to troubleshoot, debug and optimize software Document work results in technical documentations and user manuals    Critical Skills & Qualifications:   Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or similar Solid experience in C or C++ programming Basic understanding of networking protocols (like TCP-IP, WiFi) Understanding of embedded hardware preferred Good German and English skills    Behavioral Skills:   Process Oriented Proactive Cross-functional collaboration Intellectual horsepower Leads Innovation    At Apex Tool Group (www.apextoolgroup.com), we‚Äôre passionate about innovation. Whether that be products, processes or operations, our associates strive to find new ways each day to help our end-users solve their most complex challenges. By harnessing our global resources, unprecedented insights and spirit for service, we build more than just tools for the job site ‚Äì we help build the future.   ATG is a global manufacturer of hand and power tools, tool storage and accessories, chain, and electronic soldering solutions with more than $1.4 billion in annual revenues. Our 6,900 global associates have built powerhouse brands like GEARWRENCH¬Æ, SATA¬Æ, Crescent¬Æ, Cleco¬Æ, Weller¬Æ and APEX¬Æ that professional trades and DIY enthusiasts alike can trust to get the job done. With our roots dating back to the 1800s, our tools have driven technological advancements that drive efficiency, speed and end-user safety in a broad range of commercial and consumer markets.   As part of the ATG team, you will move fast, think globally, learn from your colleagues and grow your career. You‚Äôll enjoy competitive benefits, a healthy work/life balance and have opportunities to give back to the communities we serve.   Our six core values ‚Äì Customers come first, Integrity in all we do, Continuous improvement, Innovation for growth, Passion to succeed and Best talent, one team - drive our daily decisions. Sauce Labs is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. Title: Full Stack Developer - Germany Based
Description: Growth Opportunities  As a market leader in DevOps and test automation for SAP, demand for our products continues to grow. We are an established business with a global customer base, and this is an excellent opportunity to join a company during an exciting growth phase and enjoy a fully supported career.   Our development team is globally distributed and organised around product outcomes following the principles of Agile, Scrum & Kanban. You can expect to work on a variety of projects and with customers from many different industry sectors.   Overall Purpose of Role  The position will see you undertaking a day to day role to develop and test software around our certified SAP solutions suite. All developers are expected to support your peers with code reviews and constructive feedback.   Position within the Organization   Developers report to the Development Lead The Development Lead has responsibility for the performance appraisal, mentoring, training and career development of the technical staff Product Management will be responsible for defining Product & Sprint goals, so you can expect to work closely with this key stake holder    Key Areas of Responsibility   Develop, test and implement our middleware NodeJS layer Develop and test our UI layer in SAPUI5 Creation of innovative, robust and supportable solutions Attend daily stand-up progress meetings and backlog / requirements refinements meetings Other duties may be assigned    Essential Skills And Attributes   Strong interpersonal skills, quick-learning, attention to detail Fluent written and spoken English Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills Experience in NodeJS using both JavaScript and TypeScript Ability to work on both server and client code Ability to learn a keep up with latest web technologies Proven track record in writing unit tests    Education and Training   General degree or equivalent/recognized professional qualifications    What We Offer   The chance to join a market-leading, vibrant technology business that is growing rapidly, working with some of the most innovative products, clients and partners in the world Competitive salary package and annual bonus Flexible working arrangements Career growth and personal development in a dynamic and expanding business

Title: React Native Mobile Engineer
Description: MoonPay  builds payments infrastructure for cryptocurrencies. Our on- and off-ramp suite of products provides a seamless experience for converting between fiat and crypto using all major payment methods in over 160 countries. Our mission is to make cryptocurrencies accessible to over a billion people by 2030! üöÄ   We are trusted by 250+ leading wallets, websites, and applications. Some of the biggest crypto brands in the world, including Bitcoin.com, Dapper Labs, OpenSea, Argent, ZenGo, Trust Wallet and Spot, rely on our technology. Through these partnerships alone, our products are used by over 5 million users worldwide. üåé   One of the great things about working at MoonPay is that we are remote first. Our global team spans 25+ countries, and we pride ourselves on having a connected and inclusive culture that empowers people to do their best work. We give our team autonomy to move fast, innovate and take responsibility. Join us in our mission to build a better financial world!   We are very proud of our values and expect all those who join us to help us proactively drive and improve our culture, aligned to these values.   B - Be Humble L - Lead with Empathy O - Own It C - Communicate Clearly K - Kaizen    The Discipline ‚ù§Ô∏è  Our engineering discipline builds the technology that enables MoonPay to learn quickly and scale easily. We organise in small cross-functional squads of 4-6 engineers and an embedded Product Manager, Product Data Analyst and QAE. We currently have squads across Crypto / NFT / Payments / KYC / Core Product and others. We‚Äôre pragmatic and believe in having fluid structure, this means people can move between teams or specialise.   Tech Stack üíª   Typescript as our programming language of choice React Native for our mobile app Node.js as our backend platform Postgres as our core database New Relic, Coralogix and Sentry for logging and monitoring GitHub to manage our source code    What You‚Äôll Do üëÄ   Become a leader in defining methodologies for how mobile engineering is done at MoonPay. Work with Product Managers to come up with the best solutions and implementation plans for new features or changes to existing ones. Implement UX and UI in our customer facing app and sometimes design it yourself based on our existing design system and components. Contribute to the estimations, planning and execution of projects, features, and integrations. Maintain and improve our existing codebase. Write fully tested, high quality and performant code.    You should apply if ‚úÖ   You have extensive mobile engineering experience at leading startups or fast growing tech companies. You have experience setting up the infrastructure required for React-Native (CI pipelines, test environments etc). You have experience managing and deploying apps through the App and Play stores. You are confident in developing, releasing and maintaining mobile applications in a fast paced, iterative environment. You have either had experience with some of our tech stack or are confident you can cross train and up skill quickly. Bonus points if you make open-source contributions or have experience in Payments, Wallet or Web3    Research has shown that women are less likely than men to apply for this role if they do not have solid experience in 100% of these areas. Please know that this list is indicative and that we would still love to hear from you even if you feel you only are a 75% match. Skills can be learnt, diversity cannot.   We promote a diverse and inclusive culture at MoonPay.   Logistics üõ†  Unfortunately, we are unable to offer visas of any kind at this time!  Our interview process takes place on Google Hangouts and tends to consist of the following stages:   Recruiter call (20-30 minutes) Initial screen (30-45 minutes) Remote take-home task (role dependent) Final interview (2 hours)    Please let us know if you require any accommodations for the interview process, and we‚Äôll do our best to provide assistance.   Benefits üí∞   Stock options üìà Unlimited holidays üèù Home office equipment allowance of $600 USD (or local equivalent) ü™ë Working in a disruptive and fast-growing industry where the possibilities are endless üöÄ Fully remote: your life, your way of working üåé Freedom, autonomy and responsibility üí™

Title: Frontend Developer
Description: There is no planet B.  Humans must reduce greenhouse gas emissions. We take action together with our clients in the chemical sector which by itself contributes up to 40% of global industrial GHG emissions. Join us on our mission to lead the way to a zero-carbon economy and boost innovation to make chemical companies climate neutral.   Our solution is   Industry-specific: Handling the complexity of chemical value chains is our daily business Business-focused: We make sustainability data available to a broad range of users and empower them to take action Data-driven: We offer a fast and cost-effective calculation of sustainability metrics   Are you keen on joining our team, building a great product, and growing with us? Get in touch!   Tasks   Work closely with product managers and other developers to build and continuously extend our application Give and receive constructive feedback to teammates through code reviews You challenge the status quo and proactively identify product areas that require attention You have a passion to write clean, testable, and documented code and a ‚Äúnever-stop-learning‚Äù attitude Improve engineering standards, tools, and processes    Requirements    Residence and work permit in the EU German or English language, at least C1 level 1-5 years of experience in collaborative software development Strong background in writing frontend code, preferably with VueJS or SPAs in general Experience using Docker Experience with cloud computing (AWS, Azure) and writing Infrastructure as Code is a big plus Experience in larger software development projects is a plus    Benefits    Almost unlimited growth opportunities Exposure to renowned clients and relevant business problems Competitive compensation and benefits package   Equal Opportunities for Everyone  We are open to all groups of people without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristics.   Work mode  To enable our remote work mode, we work with:   MS Teams for synchronous communication GitLab for project management Daily project standup meetings, one engineering meeting each week Bi-monthly face-to-face meetings of our team

Title: Software Engineer - SDK Development (fulltime)
Description: At voize we develop an app that allows professionals like healthcare workers and inspection engineers to fill out forms via domain-specific speech recognition. Healthcare workers speak freely and our AI automatically generates the correct structured forms.   We are YC-funded and grow quickly. Our customers like Caritas, Contilia, and T√úV NORD create thousands of documentation records every single day.  Today speech recognition is primarily used as a ‚Äúfun‚Äù gimmick for consumers, who set kitchen timers with their Alexa speaker. We build a completely new class of speech-powered applications, to supercharge the professional workforce. By focusing on individual workflows like healthcare or vehicle inspections, we create truly magical user experiences and save each user 30 minutes per day in administrative work. Don‚Äôt believe it? See for yourself in our 3-minute product demo (https://youtu.be/AlkVD4OwCQk).   The entire system is built in-house, giving us full control over the user experience, product design, NLP models, and speech recognition. Our custom speech recognition models already outperform Google with 10x lower error rates and we are just getting started!   If you ever wanted to work at the bleeding edge of product design, applied machine learning research, and MLOps, you should apply.  You get to build products with daily user feedback, train AI models on real-world data, and ship to production on a daily basis.   At voize new software is deployed to production every 5h on average! We deploy new AI models every 24h and have one of the largest speech data sets for medical documentation.   Tasks  We‚Äôre looking for team members who enjoy talking to customers, iterating & shipping quickly.  As an SDK developer, you will take responsibility for our development kits to allow anyone to integrate voize‚Äôs AI technology into their system. You design intuitive native APIs to our core functionality and write and maintain clean and expressive documentation. You work closely with developers and end-users to get feedback to iterate, review analytics, and ideate new SDK features.    Requirements    You should be comfortable with the following tech stack   Kotlin (Bonus: Kotlin Multiplatform) React Native & Typescript Gradle & NPM build configuration Android Native App Development (Bonus: iOS Development) Typical Software Engineering skills like Git, Docker, etc.   Team Work & Personal Skills:   You have to be able to work in a team, communicate clearly, take ownership over your work and share feedback with your teammates. You need to feel empathy for the user and have a deep passion for great product experiences. You will talk to users, listen to their feedback, understand their daily challenges, and translate those insights into product decisions. You need great time management skills and be self-sufficient. Your colleges have to be able to rely on you.   Language & Region   You need to be able to speak German fluently. (especially to talk to customers) You need to live in Germany and be legally allowed to work in Germany.    Benefits    voize is based in Berlin and has a remote-friendly workplace. We offer flexible work hours and believe that you know best when you want to work We have an open culture and regular team events As a fast-growing startup, there are new challenges daily and plenty of learning opportunities for your personal development Own part of the company through stock option packages   Interview Process  To help us determine that we are both a great fit for each other and are happy to change the world together for years to come, we run a 4 stage interview process. This process is usually completed in 2-3 weeks.   First Call with the founder (Remote):   This is a more informal video call with you and one of our founders, to get to know you, and share more details on the role. Together we want to determine if this role is a great fit for you and get a basic understanding of your personal interests and technical & soft skills.   Technical Interview with CTO (Remote):   In this video call, we want to learn more about your technical skills and past projects you have worked on.   The best way to impress us is by showing us a project you‚Äôve built and walking us through the 2 hardest technical/design decisions you had to make.   Mostly, we want to know that you can code and ship fairly involved systems, and speak to them with clarity on the details. This tends to be a good indication that an engineer had strong ownership and showed autonomy in making a product or technical decisions.   Pair Programming Challenge (Remote):   At this stage, we want to show you the kind of challenges we are facing on a daily basis. In a pair programming setting, you will get access to a portion of our system and will debug an Error we‚Äôve introduced or build a prototype of a new feature.   Onboarding   If you and our team both see a great culture and technical fit, we will send you a job offer and walk you through our onboarding process.   In your first week, you will ship your very own first feature to production! We will prepare a great first task, help you along the way and celebrate the release and direct user feedback.

Title: Software Engineer (100% Remote)
Description: We are looking to hire a passionate Engineer with 1-8 years experience and a track record of methodically and creatively adding value to both the business and their organization in a strategic and caring way. This is a full-time position available for immediate start.   The Software Engineer should be a strategic and analytical thinker, you should also be an effective communicator, an expert in the domains and systems that you have built, comfortable working with other experts on complicated risk analyses and operational flows, and be willing to directly dig in yourself as we expand our internal resources. You should be a thoughtful collaborator, with a deep appreciation for systems design, and a passion for building amazing and powerful experiences while knowing the tradeoffs of moving quickly and getting things working vs. going deep and perfecting a product for the long-term   We are looking for strong engineers in many areas: data and data infrastructure, full-stack web application development, front-end wizards, as well as machine learning and natural language processing specialists. You should be a deeply curious individual, and have demonstrated continuous effort to satisfy that curiosity, through research, tinkering, organizing, and teaching.   Responsibilities:   Internalize the company‚Äôs goals and vision, understanding critical and minimal needs, foreseeing potential needs, and coming up with solutions that fit the context Apply state of the art technology solutions, including data API development, modern integration patterns, frameworks for building beautiful, responsive applications, machine learning, natural language processing, and explicable AI - in partnership with key partners Support all business lines, including sales and business development, by enabling those teams while balancing competing goals, and making difficult trade-offs when required Partner effectively with Product, User Experience, Growth, and Operations toward building best-in-class systems Support the technology needs of various departments by creating a data-literate ecosystem, and helping the wider organization understand how the technology helps them and how to think about their initiatives in terms of our capabilities Be a leader, taking initiative and ownership as needed, and connecting across the organization to come up with the best solutions that combine people, process, and software    Why we think this job is great:   It‚Äôs a remote full-time, 100% remote position where you‚Äôll work from home with tech provided by the company You‚Äôll have clear goals and the training resources you need to deliver. How you execute and deliver is up to you    Qualifications:   1-8 years of experience in performing results-driven development in a collaborative environment A proven ability to conduct research and internalize user needs, in partnership with Product and User Experience Able to adjust the level of specificity and context for different audiences, either in the interest of achieving common goals efficiently or to educate others For data engineers - experience in Python, relational databases and data warehouses, business intelligence tools, containers, cloud platforms, command line scripting For web back-end engineers - experience in Python, relational databases, cloud platforms For web front-end engineers - experience in React JavaScript/Typescript, CSS, cloud platforms Experience with Data API development, AI, ML and NLP A degree in computer science, engineering, applied math or a related field; or have demonstrated significant growth and impact as an engineer, regardless of your education    Preferred Experience:   Healthcare, insurance or financial technology experience Experience with startups is not necessary, but you should be looking forward to bringing order, power, and role definition to an initial blank slate Not afraid to dive into devops as needed and help us iterate on an efficient build/deploy process and a solid infrastructure    About Us   Bold Business is a remote-first, global outsourced-solutions company with over $7B in service solutions over the past 25 years. Our international team helps the world‚Äôs leading companies transform their ideas into bold impacts. From Fortune 500 organizations looking to reduce operational costs by 40%-60% to fast-growth startups looking to scale, we work behind the scenes and empower companies to do more for less.   If you like to move fast and have a bias for action, you‚Äôll fit right into our fast-paced, results-based environment. We‚Äôre a 100% remote/virtual team environment where you can work from wherever you are.

Title: JavaScript/TypeScript Fullstack-Entwickler (m/w/d)
Description: Beschreibung   Welche Aufgaben erwarten dich?  Als Fullstack-Entwickler (m/w/d) bist du aktiver Part eines eigenverantwortlich agierenden Teams und entwickelst neue NewsMedia Cloud-Anwendungen. Hierbei setzt du responsive Webapplikationen mit Vue.js, TypeScript und Node.js anhand von Wireframes, Designs und technischen Spezifikationen um und arbeitest mit Docker in einer CI/CD Umgebung. Solltest du Spa√ü an einer Microsoft-Architektur, Vue.js, Node.js, Unit/Integration-Tests, Webcomponents, GraphSQL, und Atomic-Design haben, bist du hier genau richtig!   Was wird dir geboten?   unbefristete Festanstellung und zukunftssicherer Arbeitsplatz flexible Arbeitszeiten, Home-Office, 30 Tage Urlaub freigestaltbarer Arbeitsplatz mit modernster Hard- und Software sehr angenehmes Arbeitsumfeld und sympathische Kollegen Weiterbildungen, Entwicklermeetings und Wissensaustausch mit Kollegen Firmenkantine, verm√∂genswirksame Leistungen, Job Rad, Parkplatz   Was wird von dir erwartet?   mind. 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Entwicklung von komplexen Webapplikationen fundierte Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Node.js, JavaScript und TypeScript Erfahrung im Umgang mit Vue.js oder React.js sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse und Teambereitschaft runden dein Profil ab   Wo wirst du arbeiten?  Dein zuk√ºnftiger Arbeitgeber ist eine hundertprozentige Tochtergesellschaft eines renommierten Medienunternehmens aus Mainz, welches mit seinen regionalen Tageszeitungen rund eine Millionen Leser/innen in Rheinhessen, S√ºd- und Mittelhessen erreicht und insgesamt 1400 Mitarbeiter an 27 Standorten besch√§ftigt. Die Tochter betreut die gesamten Internet-Pr√§senzen des Unternehmens und ist dar√ºber hinaus eine Full-Service-Agentur, die eine professionelle, allumfassende Projektbetreuung und den reibungslosen Ablauf bei der Realisierung von digitalen Projekten garantiert.   Interessiert? Dann bewirb dich mit deinem Lebenslauf direkt per Mail bei Mido Gasoos an mido.gasoos@ardekay.com   Nat√ºrlich kannst du mich auch direkt unter der +49 69 1200 6673 erreichen. Ich unterst√ºtze dich gerne w√§hrend des gesamten Bewerbungsprozesses!

Title: (Junior) Data Scientist (w/m/d)
Description: Als (Junior) Data Scientist (w/m/d) analysierst und bewertest Du gro√üe Datenmengen und hilfst unseren Kunden und Kundinnen dadurch die besten Entscheidungen f√ºr ihr Unternehmen zu treffen. Ob im Bereich Tax, Audit, Consulting, Deal Advisory oder Finance - mit Dir werden Daten zu Informationen.   Deine Aufgaben  Du willst Big Data in Smart Data verwandeln? Dann kannst Du Dich hier einbringen:    Du schaffst aus gro√üen strukturierten und unstrukturierten Datenbest√§nden unterschiedlicher Datenquellen eine Datenbasis, analysierst und interpretierst diese. Mithilfe von Data Mining, Data Science und Machine Learning-Methoden erkennst Du Muster und erstellst daraus Prognosen f√ºr die Zukunft. Die Betreuung von nationalen und internationalen Kund:innen in Projekten an der Schnittstelle zwischen Fachbereich und IT f√§llt ebenfalls in Deinen Aufgabenbereich. Du arbeitest an der Entwicklung neuer Analysemethoden, um die Datenbasis optimal zu pr√ºfen und zu interpretieren. Du konzipierst, erstellst und modellierst Datenbankanwendungen. Title: Software Engineer - Python Integrations
Description: About Starburst  Starburst is the fastest, most efficient analytics engine for a data warehouse, data lake, or data mesh. Our software provides fast and easy access to data, no matter where it lives, with a best-in-class MPP SQL engine that shortens the path to value for data. The Starburst Enterprise Platform leverages the power of the open source Trino (formerly PrestoSQL) to query data across any database, making it instantly actionable for data-driven organizations. Our SaaS offering, Starburst Galaxy provides all the benefits of Trino and Starburst in an easy to use, fully-managed enterprise-ready multi-cloud SaaS platform designed by Trino‚Äôs original creators and experts.   With Starburst, teams can lower the total cost of their infrastructure and analytics investments, prevent vendor lock-in, and use the existing tools that work for their business. Though Starburst has achieved a unicorn status and raised $414M in venture funding from top investors, we were founded with customers and revenue from the very beginning. Our customers love us, we operate globally, and we are proud to be named a Best Place to Work . Come join our team of All-Stars!   About The Role  To complement Starburst‚Äôs ability to access data anywhere, our goal is to make it easy for any data integration or business intelligence tool to connect to Starburst. Our vision is that any data engineer or business analyst should be able to access and process data from any data source through the tool of their choice. We are looking for a Python Engineer to help us make that a reality. This role will allow you to directly contribute to the advancement of Starburst Enterprise and open source Trino .   Responsibilities:   Design: Research and design integrations in the Python Ecosystem Develop: Improve the Trino Python client, build custom integrations for tools like DBT and Airflow Test: Implement test automation, design and write tests Collaborate: Collaborate with teams globally across multiple time zones and operate in an Agile development environment    Some things we will look for:   At least 3 years of experience developing software Experience writing Python production code (optional Java) Hands-on experience with Python data tools like DBT, Airflow, Dagster and Great Expectations Proficiency with SQL Knowledge of SQLAlchemy and DBAPI Experience with JDBC and ODBC integrations An understanding of authentication mechanisms like LDAP, Kerberos, OAuth2.0 Familiarity with Git and CI/CD pipelines Experience working with one of the main cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP) Comfortable with Linux and scripting languages Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and Python testing frameworks    Bonus points:   Familiarity with Trino Contribution to open source software Experience with Docker and Kubernetes Experience working as Python Data Engineer Knowledge of BI tools like Tableau, PowerBI, Looker    Benefits  At Starburst, we‚Äôre constantly striving towards building a place where people come first by creating an environment of transparency, honesty, and respect. We take care of our global workforce by making sure employees enjoy competitive salaries and attractive stock grants, remote-friendly work options, access to quality and affordable insurance, and flexible and generous paid time off to start a family, travel, or just relax!   Headquartered in Boston MA with offices in Warsaw and London and employees across Europe and the Americas, we are committed to hiring where the talent is.   Starburst provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.   #BI-Remote

Title: Fullstack Developer (Remote in Germany)
Company Name: devterm IT Solutions GmbH & Co. KG
Description: We love to create great software for the needs of customers ranging from the next big startup to major corporations. Our goal is to deliver a product that isn‚Äôt only great today but also builds a solid foundation for whatever happens in the future.   We founded as a team of 5 software engineers devterm in 2020, have been growing since and now need your help to strengthen our team as a fullstack developer.   Tasks   What The Job's Like    You will be developing web, mobile, or cloud apps for a wide variety of customers while being responsible for testing and documenting your code properly. Since we aim for the best codebase possible, you‚Äôll be taking care of code reviews for other members of the team while they review your contributions. You will take care of specifying user stories from feature requests and triaging bug reports so that these can be picked up for development.    Requirements    What we‚Äôd want from you   You should have a good understanding of an object-oriented language (e.g. Java, C#) as well as modern HTML, (S)CSS, TypeScript and a frontend framework, such as Angular, Vue or React. As every piece of code has to be tested properly, experience with testing and test driven development would be great. We‚Äôd be truly excited if you have experience with DevOps tools or UX/UI design.    Benefits    How we work   Though we work remotely, we‚Äôre going to speak to each other at least once a day in daily stand-ups or in our planning sessions and retros. We value quality in our work and products, hence we‚Äôve developed processes and guidelines to aid with that. But since nothing‚Äôs ever perfect, we‚Äôre constantly improving these and want your input as well. Inspired by open source software projects, continuous integration and delivery pipelines help us find issues before they become problems while getting the finished product out of the door as quickly as possible. The most important thing for us is giving and accepting feedback so that we can grow together.    What We Can Offer You    You‚Äôre free to work wherever and whenever you want, but if you ever feel the need to work out of an office, we can always get another desk in one of the coworking spaces we‚Äôre using (currently in Stuttgart or Darmstadt). We‚Äôll be paying you a fair wage depending on your skill level in a 35h/week contract with 30 days vacation/year. You‚Äôll get a budget to choose the equipment you‚Äôre happy to work with as well as the software you need to do your job. You'll get a subsidy for office furniture. You'll get an education budget of 2000‚Ç¨ per year. We‚Äôre happy for you to use part of your time on the job to develop your professional skills and pursue your goals.   All we need from you to prepare for a talk to get to know each other is your CV and if applicable your GitHub account or other references.

Title: Backend Software Engineer (fully remote)
Description: About Us  Platform engineering is revolutionizing how enterprises build and run their cloud-native setups. Humanitec is at the core of this revolution, enabling teams to build Internal Developer Platforms (IDPs) and reach true developer self-service. Through our community-led efforts (platformengineering.org, PlatformCon) and roster of enterprise customers, we are hitting an inflection point in the adoption of IDPs. We are looking to aggressively scale the team to meet the increasing demand.   We're looking for people who could land a job at Google, Amazon, or Microsoft - but prefer the excitement, challenge, and daring of being part of a disruptive startup. We focus on your talents and personality - your background, origin, or gender will never make a difference to us.   We are looking to hire remote Backend Engineers as individual contributors to develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve Humanitec. You should have professional experience in building high-quality software. CS degree and experience in dev productivity tools are a plus. Languages: predominantly Go. Everything is on Kubernetes.   We pay top 5% in the market, stocks are part of the package. Work is fully remote and we work exclusively with senior engineers in small, lean, and self-organized teams. We currently prefer time-zones UTC-1 to UTC+3.   Requirements   Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent practical experience. Hands-on experience writing software in professional environments. Passion for clear, clean, well-factored code. Software development experience in C/C++, C#, Java, Python, Go, or similar. Remote & work from a timezone UTC-1 to UTC+3 (Berlin time +/- 2 hours).    Responsibilities   Develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve the software. Contribute to designs and perform code reviews for your peers. Comfort in working in short, agile, iterative development cycles and strong desire to work in an unstructured, fast-moving startup environment.    How to Apply   We are looking forward to hearing from you. Our application process is very straightforward and we like to make a decision quickly if the fit feels right on both sides. Your first call will be with our Talent Partner so that we can learn more about you and you can find out everything you need about the role and company. This first screening is followed by 2 interviews with the leadership team and your future colleagues/team members. Interviews are typically 30 to 60 minutes, fully remote, and without any take-home assignments. We will talk through your background, your approach to work, and dive into your knowledge. The final interview is with one of our founders to give you the chance to understand Humanitec even better.

Title: IT Citizen Data Scientist (all genders welcome)
Description: Your Work Moves People.  Goodyear is much more than a tire company. We‚Äôre a company dedicated to enabling mobility.   For more than 120 years, we‚Äôve developed the technology that keeps people moving. From today‚Äôs vehicles to the driverless fleets of the future, we‚Äôre not just putting tires on cars; we are fueling the future science of motion. Because people will never stop moving and we will be there to help them reach their destinations ‚Äì as we have throughout our history.   Get started right away ‚Äì join the EMEA IT Advanced Analytics Team at our one of our sites in Germany (Hanau or Fulda), Luxembourg, Poland or Spain  as   IT Citizen Data Scientist (all genders welcome)  You will be working working within the Advanced Analytics and Digitalization Domain, joining the team in charge of designing, supervising and driving data science driven projects in our advanced analytics department. Together with our team you will champion the development and implementation of key initiatives within the line of business and lead data drive international IT projects. You will contribute to the understanding of high level, loosely specified requirements and transform Data into Value for our business through integration, consolidation and presentation of the information in the most relevant possible way. In addition, with your ambition to use data science methodologies you will contribute to developing new data driven forecasting solutions in a mobility driven industry.   As a main focus for the function, you will lead the discussions with business stakeholders and translate complex business requirements into technical specifications with the alignment of our analytics department.    Your Tasks & Responsibilities    Liaise with business partners to anticipate and help formulate analytics driven requirements and identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions like new forecasting models Be a technical advisor for our team and key stakeholders on using data science methodologies, create data science models and implement them Mine and analyze data by using state-of-the-art methods from company databases to drive optimization, automation, and improvement of key deliverables Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes and design data modeling processes to create algorithms and predictive models and perform custom analysis Establish with the team realistic project plans and facilitate the application of proper Project Management principles incl. leading data driven IT projects Facilitate, and when needed, manage the technical relationship with external development partners Facilitate and lead requirement / process (re-)design workshops that involve eliciting process requirements and liaising with business stakeholders Showcase ability to see the big picture, understand project objectives and be able to document, estimate and communicate them to the technical team    Your Experience & Skills    Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Data Science, Business Informatics, or similar technical field; Master‚Äôs degree preferred Understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with 5+ years of experience in data driven IT environment / a technical role At least 3-4 years of experience in the field of Data Analysis, Data Engineering or Data Science Experience in leading international data driven IT projects is a must (working with project management tools Jira, Confluence, etc.) Experience in creating data science models in forecasting driven related projects Knowledge of at least one programming language, preferably Python, and experience with relational databases (SQL) Basic experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks Familiarity with Data Visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Qlik etc.) Experience with Cloud Services (AWS, Azure or GCP) is considered a plus Experience with Geographic Information System (GIS) is considered a plus (e.g., PostGIS) Good understanding of DevOps methodology and automation toolsets (Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery) is considered a plus English is a must; other European language is an asset    Who You Are    Well-rounded professional, being able to prove concepts and assumptions by identifying relevant datasets and presenting the results in a clear and meaningful way Data expert with strong analytical thinking and innovative mindset Collaborative, experienced in facilitating meetings, working groups, or large groups of people with varying opinions Communicative with proven ability to communicate decisions clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders as well as good presentation skills Proactive with excellent customer service engagement and enthusiasm Adaptable, flexible, enjoying challenge and bringing new ideas forward   Goodyear is one of the world's largest tire companies. It employs about 72,000 people and manufactures its products in 57 facilities in 23 countries around the world. Its two Innovation Centers in Akron, Ohio, and Colmar-Berg, Luxembourg, strive to develop state-of-the-art products and services that set the technology and performance standard for the industry. For more information about Goodyear and its products, go to www.goodyear.com/corporate.   Goodyear is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

Title: Software Engineer (Java) (x|f|m) ‚Äì Team Checkout
Description: Job Description  We are team Checkout and we provide idealo customers with a secure and convenient purchase experience. We're transforming our price comparison shopping site into an e-commerce platform that gives optimal advice to our customers in their online purchase decisions and allows them to directly purchase on our platform. We‚Äôre looking for a product minded software engineer who can help to evolve our architecture and at the same time cares about the customer experience our checkout provides.   The position of Software Engineer (Java)(x|f|m) - Team Checkout  is available as a full-time or part-time position.   About Your New Role  Job requirements   You own together with your team the whole software lifecycle (requirements management with stakeholders, architecture, implementation, test automation, operation, CI/CD pipelines and monitoring). You drive for technical excellence and innovation. You embrace and promote healthy modern engineering practices through clean, well-tested and well-structured code. You like to think in terms of microservice-oriented architecture and its patterns as well as antipattern, domain-driven design and event-driven architectures. Teamwork is important to you. You like to participate in pair programming and code reviews. Additionally, you embrace constructive feedback and knowledge sharing.    Skills & Requirements   You have professional experience as a software engineer of modern web applications and backend services. You have a passion for professional software development (like design patterns, clean code & agile processes) and embrace software craftsmanship. You are proficient with Java 11+ and Spring ecosystem (Boot, Cloud, Data) and you are curious to explore modern frontend technologies like TypeScript and React. You are eager to work in all aspects of software engineering (frontend, backend & DevOps), don‚Äôt' worry, we don‚Äôt expect you to know everything. You have excellent communication skills in English both written and verbal.    You are an especially good match if you ...   ‚Ä¶have previous e-commerce experience. ...you had a chance to deal with production systems hosted in AWS. ...have worked with message streaming platforms such as Apache Kafka and NoSQL databases like MongoDB. ‚Ä¶have a passion to learn new things.    At idealo you can expect   You don't live in Berlin and want to work from home? Our hybrid working model offers you the freedom to work from all over Germany in a mobile and flexible way. Together we will find the best solution that works for you. In return, you get everything you need for your work (noise-canceling headset, laptop, etc.). You need vacation? We offer you 30 days of vacation. Not enough? You can "buy" an additional 15 days every year by converting your salary. You want to further your education? We take your personal development goals seriously and, in addition to our idealo Learning Hub, eLearning offers (e.g., Udemy, DataCamp), coaching & mediation, we also offer you the opportunity to benefit individually from our training budget. And what about the office? Our office in the heart of Berlin offers free organic breakfast, excellent subsidized lunch, as well as free coffee, lemonades and after-work beer, in addition to the "standard foosball". At the same time, you can network with colleagues from our group of companies on our beautiful rooftop terrace. Do you like support outside of work? We offer free counseling and support in all areas of life (professional, private, family, health, etc.) in cooperation with the pme-Familienservice. You don't live in Germany yet? We support you in the visa process and with your relocation.    About Idealo  idealo is a Berlin success story: in 2000 we started out with the mission of helping consumers make the best purchasing decisions. Right in the heart of Berlin, over 1200 employees from 60 nations are working on the future of online shopping. We focus on agile and self-reliant work, sustainability and a healthy relationship between work and private life. These values are firmly anchored in our corporate culture and an integral part of our corporate philosophy.   As part of our team, you can look forward to freedom, an international and inspiring working environment. Your ideas are particularly important to us. Not only our product portfolio is diverse, but also the people who work on it. We want you just as you are! Origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation or a severely handicapped degree do not play a role.   Information for applicants with severe disabilities  : As an applicant with a severe disability, you can get advice from our Severely Disabled Representation (SBV) during the application process. Please contact sbv@idealo.de.   Work in the office and from wherever you like.  idealo allows you to work from wherever you are. As part of our Hybrid Work at idealo, you decide whether and how often you work from our office in Berlin or remotely because you live in another city within Germany or the caf√© down the street makes the best coffee cream. Only about once a month, there will be mandatory office days to bring idealos together at company, department or team level, including stunning views from our roof terrace. Find out what Hybrid Work at idealo is all about here and in a personal conversation in the interviews!

Title: Web Frontend Developer (f/m/d)

Title: Junior Frontend Developer
Description: , Berlin.   At JustWatch (www.justwatch.com), we are striving to become the world‚Äôs largest movie and TV show streaming guide, with a goal of over 100 million monthly SEO visits. We are looking for a motivated Junior Frontend Developer with a hands-on mentality to support us in reaching this goal.   Curiosity, drive, and passion are the core ingredients we are looking for. We only want people who are willing to constantly learn through challenging themselves and others, and love getting things done.   On our team, we are constantly questioning everything and love challenging goals. We prioritize learning and aim for excellence in execution. We believe in the 80/20 rule and try to apply common sense and pragmatism to everything.    Here‚Äôs What You Will Be Doing    Together with our Designer and Head of SEO you‚Äôll be building interesting landing pages and streaming tools to acquire press coverage and new users Conducting A/B tests and implement successful tests into our product Supporting our expansion plans by launching JustWatch in new countries and improving our presence in existing ones Enhancing internal linking, performance and crawlability at scale Building internal SEO tools helping us monitoring and optimising a multi-million page's website at scale    What You Will Need    1+ years experience in Frontend development Knowledge of HTML, CSS and Javascript (Typescript is a plus) Experience with VueJS (preferred), React or any modern framework Ideally some experience with UI/UX design (using tools like Figma) Basic understanding of SSR, SEO, SQL, relational databases and D3.js is a plus Strong details orientation and intrinsic motivation Passion and ambition (big plus if you own a hobby project like a blog, an affiliate-site, app, etc.) You like to work in a challenging yet rewarding environment with an open feedback culture Fluency in English   We have started to slowly get back to our new offices at the historic Backfabrik, where we will work in a hybrid mode. If you do not live in Berlin, we provide relocation and visa support but are not a remote-only company.   We embrace our entrepreneurial responsibilities. Through our 6-figure environmental and social impact budget, we offset every employee‚Äôs carbon footprint, give back to the community, support causes that matter, and have recently implemented a well-being and mental health program.   Read more about our culture in our blog post and Talent page: https://www.justwatch.com/de/Talent   _ _How to apply:  Our application process is simple: send us whatever you have or just your Linkedin and a brief message explaining why you are a great fit for this role.

Title: TypeScript Toolkit Engineer - Apps Framework
Description: Parity Technologies  builds core infrastructure for blockchains and Web 3.0 technologies. This means dealing with P2P networking, consensus algorithms, cryptography, databases, and decentralised applications. We strive to write the fastest, lightest, and safest core technology in Blockchain and write lots of open-source code.   At Parity Technologies, we have built and launched live networks like Kusama and Polkadot atop the Substrate blockchain framework. We want to bring to these networks first-class end-to-end user experiences which tell a story of how easy it is to use these next-generation blockchains. For example, improving how users participate in network staking, how members of our governance systems present and vote on proposals, enabling simple integration of Substrate systems into web pages, improving how new users onboard into our ecosystem, and more‚Ä¶   In this role, you'll help bring to life an open-source TypeScript toolkit to enhance the Substrate / Web 3 developer experience  . The aim of this toolkit is to reduce friction in creating efficient interactions with many chains. You will work in a small functional team with two front-end developers, one backend developer, and one designer to create core utilities, pattern libraries, and examples. This will be the basis for a new open source community, of which you'll be a steward. We will all share the responsibility of triaging issues, engaging with developers, and assessing their needs. This role will surely evolve, and hopefully, you'll help drive its evolution. There will be many ways to help the toolkit and its users succeed.   About You:   You have experience building both browser and NodeJS applications with TypeScript. You think deeply about paradigm-shifting tools, such as React and GraphQL. Well-designed APIs bring you immense joy. You have excellent communication skills. Writing legible, maintainable code is more important to you than are your stylistic preferences. To you, release announcements from the TypeScript team feel like special occasions. Maybe you even follow along with notes from the TypeScript team's design meetings. You don't need to be a blockchain expert. Just excited and willing to learn!    Responsibilities:   Collaborating with the team on design, roadmap and overall strategy Writing both low-level and high-level code Modeling chain interactions as type-safe, composable building blocks Documenting your creations Identifying bugs, bottlenecks and opportunities for improvement Actively participating in / supporting a new community in open source    Good to have:   Language design, compiler, interpreters. Creating and releasing open source Effect-oriented programming (ZIO, effect-ts) Knowledge of Web Assembly    Not a perfect match to our requirements? We're happy to receive your application anyways and hear how you think you can help us achieve our mission.  To see how we use your data please see our Applicant Notice.

Title: Software Engineer for Release Train (m/f/diverse)
Description: Description  We are looking for you to support our Business Area Autonomous Mobility at the location Neu-Ulm.   Your tasks will focus on the following activities:    Working with product managers, product owners and other stakeholders to secure alignment between the strategy and its execution and coach them in understanding the agile mindset Identification of own and remove impediments of the agile release train to optimize the flow of value through the teams Collaboration with respective stakeholders to derive an optimized setup of the agile release train according to the individual development needs (e.g. selecting the proper SAFe configuration, executing a tailoring of the organizational processes or providing standardized documents and practices) Drive of the agile release train efforts in relentless improvement (e.g. via inspect and adapt workshops) and challenge the team actively to improve its efficiency Facilitating agile ceremonies e.g. the product increment planning event, inspect and adapt workshop and system demo Bringing the agile release train into a self-sustaining state (self-organizing, self-managing and collaborating teams) Assistance for tracking the execution of features and capabilities by monitoring the overall performance of the agile release train in order to ensure a continuously improving development flow in assistance to the product management Ensurement of qualitative development by implementing built-in quality principles, following agreed upon methods, processes and tools (e.g. following DoD, using test-driven-development etc.)    Qualifications   University degree in computer science, economics or in a related field Several years of professional experience Advanced competence in software engineering, project management and software tooling Advanced competence in automotive processes and agile development methdology (based on SAFe framework) Advanced experience with agile framework is an advantage Strong experience with managing or facilitating teams is an advantage Experienced in working in intercultural teams Very good English language skills written and spoken, German language skills are desirable Highly self organized and capable to handle also difficult customer environments in a tight time schedule Flexibility in solution finding to solve impediments for your release train    Applications from severely handicapped people are welcome.   What We Offer   An attractive, performance-based compensation package, that comes along with unique flexible working conditions like mobile work, flexible working hours and sabbaticals, that helps you to balance work, family and spare time An inspiring, open and rewarding company culture driven by our values freedom to act, trust, passion to win and for one another Various career paths and numerous opportunities for longterm personal and professional development in a fast-growing business unit with over 21 locations worldwide Highly professional software environment and the opportunity to work on exciting and challenging ADAS projects Let us not forget the opportunity to shape our vision towards autonomous driving You would like to learn more about our additional services? Click here.

Title: No-Code Developer (bubble‚Ä§io) (m/f/d)
Description: Are you excited about what is possible with tools like bubble‚Ä§io, Webflow or Integromat and believe that no-code development will be one of the main drivers for innovation in the next few years? You want to turn your hobby into a profession? This is your chance to become a full-time No-Code Developer (bubble‚Ä§io) (m/f/d).   Drive innovation with us  Using the latest low-code technologies only, we can realize projects in a fraction of time compared to regular dev teams. Where others need months, we only need weeks - enabling startups and corporates to bring innovations to market particularly quick and move faster. Although we just have started to become Europe's leading low-code powerhouse, in the last year our startups, such as Avi Medical or Caronsale, already raised about USD 120 million. We develop first-moving digital products.   Tasks  We are looking for someone to support our team with implementing complex no-code projects. Experience with no-code tools like Webflow, Integromat, bubble‚Ä§io or Shopify is an advantage, but experience with other no-code tools is also sufficient. What matters most is that you want to learn a more efficient way of developing digital products. In general, your tasks will be to:   Create digital products You will be developing innovative digital products with tools such as bubble‚Ä§io or Webflow in close collaboration with your project peers. Increase value-added When developing, one of our core values is to always drive value-added. That means you are not only developing but actively consulting our clients, helping to create the best version possible. Foster internal products Aiming to become Europe's leading low-code powerhouse, our company cannot be optimized enough. You will be helping to develop internal tools or create own products developed with no-code from ideation to market entry.    Requirements    Below you can find soft requirements that we recommend having when starting at 02100 Digital.   Basic no-code understanding You have first experience with creating digital products using low- or no-code tools such as bubble‚Ä§io or Webflow. Ideally, you have completed the bubble‚Ä§io or Webflow university. Find solutions fast You are goal-oriented and have solid communication skills. Agile way of working You know how to collaborate in digital projects and ideally have worked with agile principles before.    Benefits    At 02100 Digital we know that each and everyone in our team is what drives success so we try to give as much back as possible.   Join a team of makers If you join 02100 Digital you will become part of a young team that consists of certified no-code experts (Webflow, bubble‚Ä§io, Shopify and Integromat). As part of your journey with us, you will be trained to become a top-notch no-code dev and join forces with like-minded professionals. Revenue share Every month EVERYONE in our team can receive a payout of up to ‚Ç¨500 from the revenues if goals are met. Training budget We provide an annual budget of ‚Ç¨1.000 EUR for each employee to participate in workshops, courses or other events teaching new skills. Brand new office In 2021 we moved into our new 200m¬≤ office in one of Hamburg's prime locations and made it as cozy as possible. In our two-story backyard house located at Hamburg's well-known "Mittelweg", the ground floor is dedicated to spending your free time, relaxing and eating while the first floor is equipped for a productive and creative work environment. Team events we have team events such as team dinner, TGIF meetings and various other after-work events. Besides, we are leading multiple Meetup Groups that will become more active after the pandemic. Hybrid working If you are not working remotely, we offer a hybrid way of working. Mondays for example are always remote (if you wish).   Are you interested in joining our team and willing to help us become Europe's leading low-code powerhouse? Then quickly apply using the contact form on the right or via email. If you are applying, please name 1-2 reasons why you want to work in the given position and tell us about yourself.

Title: Fullstack/back-end JS developer in Green-Tech Startup
Description: At Green Fusion, we develop software for remote monitoring and optimization of   renewable energy systems for buildings. We are looking as well for frontend-, backend as for full-stack JavaScript developers to push our product to the next level by creating usable customer-friendly tools to control and optimize renewable energy systems. At this company, by improving UX and developing usable tools, you will directly enable the green energy revolution!   Tasks   The first major task would be to build a drag-and-drop interface to create energy system schemas. Therefore you could use a library such as jsPlumb or React Diagrams to create this frontend. This will necessarily include an interface with the backend to show live data from these energy systems and to save preferences about them. We are looking for someone who can own most of the stack on this feature (with guidance). Work on either improving or building new features on the energy management system we have built. This will be a roughly 50:50 frontend-to-backend ratio. Our front-end projects are designed by our dedicated UX team and implemented in XD before any coding takes place. Work with the frontend team to review pull requests and create a consistent and clean codebase    Requirements    Most importantly, a great mentality. The desire to collaborate and create a friendly and effective workplace, as well as being self-motivated and eager to learn new things. Experience with developing in JavaScript. Experience with frontend development (React, Next.js, Node-RED) Backend development (Node.js, REST API, SocketIO)   Nice to have:   IoT protocols (OPC-UA, MQTT) VPN technologies Cloud engineering (AWS EC2 & S3) relational databases (PostgreSQL) DevOps tasks, full-stack experience    Benefits    A vibrant office in the newly built Creon Campus A flat hierarchy with a culture of open and honest feedback A friendly working environment with collaboration and teamwork given the highest priority Flexible working (partial home office, 4-days a week possible, something else) Employee Stock Option Plan The ability to work on cool technology that helps reduce carbon dioxide emissions Possibility to work on open-source software   We look forward to receiving your complete application (cover letter, CV), even if you   cannot meet all the requirements.

Title: Fullstack Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Digital communication between companies and customers is outdated and complicated. We at Flexperto are working on changing that. Everything that your sales employees have done so far offline, is now also available online with Flexperto. Set up customer appointments, clarify questions in the video chat, edit documents, co-browse websites, sign contracts or say ‚Äúhi‚Äù to customers through WhatsApp.   We have gained considerable momentum in the last 3 years. Among our customers are international players in the insurance and banking sector. Our 30 employees are mainly located in Berlin.   We are further developing our instant messaging experience, which aims to centralize WhatsApp, Telegram & Co. in one single, enterprise-grade omnichannel messenger. Therefore, we are looking for Fullstack Engineer (m/f/d) to strengthen our team.   Tasks   Be an incremental part of a young but experienced and passionate team Developing new microservices that evolve our platform and enable new use cases Lead and manage the implementation of architected solutions till production and beyond Maintain your code in a smart and modern test- and release-environment that automatically ensures test-coverage, code-style, and process integrity    Requirements    3+ years experience in web development Experience with Microservices / Service-Oriented Software Architecture NodeJS/ES6 PHP7.X Be self-driven, enthusiastic about learning new cutting-edge technologies, willing to take ownership and be passionate about what you are doing EU Working-Permit Fluent in English    Skills That Are Nice To Have    Experience with the SCRUM methodology Experience with Real-Time Data (in the context of messaging and communication) is a plus Knowledge about Moleculer Framework, Swagger/OpenApio, RabbitMQ. MongoDB, Ejabberd/XMPP, React, Ansible    Benefits    A passionate and dedicated team with people from several countries, always willing to broaden their horizon We have a dedicated budget for education programs and conferences you can attend An attractive remuneration package Flexible work hours and a home office policy that focuses on people and not on numbers A working environment in which your contribution will make the difference A fun place to work with regular team events and activities besides the office An amazing office centrally located in Berlin, the vibrant tech capital Heavy discounts on Urban Sports   Our Tech Stack   ‚ÄûSmall teams, exciting projects, and flat hierarchies‚Äú are statements from your future colleagues when asked what makes working at Flexperto special. We‚Äôre in the process of transforming our monolithic PHP stack into small, cloud-ready microservices for Node.js (with the Moleculer Framework) and React (with redux-saga) and we have a messaging backend (based on XMPP) for our self-built multi-channel messenger (WhatsApp, Telegram, Facebook, etc.). Standards for us are Scrum, CI (Jenkins), Unit Tests (partially 100% coverage required), Code Reviews, QA / AC Testing, Containerization in Docker.

Title: Software Developer C++ (f/m/d)
Description: Responsibilities   Development of robot monitoring functions based on agile methods (SCRUM) Design and optimization of software architecture Documentation in a requirement management system Implementation of real-time software in C++ Integration of the implemented solutions on a robot system Development of test concepts and fully automated tests    Application Requirements   Completed degree in one of the following fields: informatics, electrical engineering, mathematics, physics, automation technology or similar degrees Well-founded knowledge of object-oriented software programming Very good knowledge of C++ programming language Very good knowledge of software architecture principles Knowledge of real-time software development Experience in the development with Linux and container technologies Confident with well-established software development tools for version control, build management, continuous deployment and documentation Experience in the development of safety related systems preferable Structured and methodical approach Good English language skills, German language skills preferable Good communication and team capability    What We Offer  Cafeteria   Flexible working hours   Great working environment

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description: Du willst die digitale Zukunft mitgestalten? Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig! Wir bei CGI arbeiten in gemischten Teams aus erfahrenen Mitarbeiter:innen und Berufseinsteiger:innen sowie zusammen mit unseren Industrieexpert:innen in agilen Projektteams an der Entwicklung von L√∂sungen f√ºr die Digitale Transformation.
