Allein in Deutschland sind wir an 25 Standorten mit rund 4.500 Mitarbeiter:innen vertreten.   Wir wollen dir beste Bedingungen f√ºr deine Karriere in der IT bieten. Wir begegnen uns offen, duzen uns √ºber alle Positionen hinweg und denken nicht in Hierarchien oder Silos. Dank unseres ‚ÄûMetro Market‚Äú-Modells kannst du meist dort arbeiten, wo du lebst. Au√üerdem beteiligen wir dich am Unternehmenserfolg: Du erh√§ltst eine Gewinnbeteiligung, die sich nach deiner individuellen Leistung richtet sowie danach, wie wir als Unternehmen unsere finanziellen Ziele erreichen konnten. Wir bieten verschiedene Modelle, damit du mobil sein kannst: z. B. Bahncard, Dienstfahrrad Sabbatical oder Elternzeit werden unterst√ºtzt. Sie sind bei uns kein Karriere-Stopper! Title: Frontend Developer (all genders)

Title: Junior Online Programmer
Description: As a Junior Online Programmer, you will work on the core technology that enables Star Citizen‚Äôs large-scale dynamic universe. You will collaborate with network and backend engineers to work on our cloud-based entity streaming technology and other online services such as chat, player inventories, player groups/organizations and other service powered (gameplay-) features.   You will join the team that is building our high-fidelity realtime 3D engine (StarEngine) and you will work and interact with CloudNative tech, such as gRPC, kubernetes, docker, all while using latest top end PC Hardware and Cloud Technology.   For some insight into Star-Citizen‚Äôs unique persistent streaming and server mesh architecture follow this link: https://youtu.be/TSzUWl4r2rU   Founded in 2012, Cloud Imperium Games creates cutting-edge videogames that defy expectations. We‚Äôre currently developing Star Citizen, a record-breaking multiplayer online space sim, and Squadron 42, a cinematic single-player adventure set in the same universe. Join us as we break boundaries and make videogame history.   We are a crowdfunded company and have a dedicated and enthusiastic community of backers who are helping us create the ‚ÄúBest Damn Space Sim Ever‚Äù.   For more information about life at CIG, follow this link: https://youtu.be/fivfcXexyyU   What do our Junior Online Programmers do?   Design and implement well-engineered, reliable, maintainable, and bug-free code. Collaborate with team members to develop various (gameplay-) systems. Keep up to date on state-of-the-art software engineering methods, practices, and technologies. Working with QA, effectively track, diagnose and solve a variety of complex issues.   What would we expect from our Junior Online Programmers?   Comfortable working with C++ in a large, shared codebase. Have a good knowledge of 3D mathematics. A passion for making and playing games. Work well in a co-located yet collaborative team environment. Willingness to learn new technologies.   Diversity Statement  CIG is a global company, staunchly committed to cultivating a culture and workplace that celebrates all backgrounds, lifestyles, and perspectives. Together, we are creating a space where authentic recognition, appreciation, and understanding of the importance of diversity is fostered by everyone. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we strive to build a team that represents all walks of life, and we want every employee to bring all the things that make them unique to the work environment. The universe is as vast and varied as the people in it, and it‚Äôs our differences that make it special.   Fraud Statement  We are aware of people receiving job offers that fraudulently allege to be from CIG. These types of fraud can be carried out through false websites, fake email addresses claiming to be from our company, or social media. We do not ask for your personal info like bank account numbers, identification numbers, etc through social media or chat-based apps, nor do we request or send money for the purchase of business equipment.   If you suspect fraud, please report it to your local authorities, as well as reaching out to us at info(@)cloudimperiumgames.com with any information you may have.

Title: Junior Software Entwickler

Title: Backend Engineer (f/m/d) - Payment/Accounting
Location: Cologne Bonn Region, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany
Description: Anstellungsdetails  Permanent contract, full-time or part-time, Cologne / Darmstadt / Remote   Info   Who We Are    We operate Kaufland.de: Several thousand sellers and millions of products make us one of the fastest growing online marketplaces. Our work is characterised by a dynamic corporate culture, with a start-up mentality and the opportunities offered by a large corporation in the background. We combine knowledge and many years of experience in e-commerce with flat hierarchies and a highly motivated team. Whether as an intern or an executive: We take every idea seriously, because we want to work together in shaping the future of e-commerce!   We love flexibility!  We offer you the best environment to work in a flexible and focused way: You decide whether you want to work in our office in Cologne // Darmstadt while at the same time having the opportunity to work remotely. We want to offer you the most attractive workplace in e-commerce and a maximum of flexibility for your personal work-life balance.   Day-by-day, our development team of about 190 experts pursues the goal of creating the best-possible customer shopping experience for the Kaufland.de marketplace. We are here to inspire millions of customers, to help them find, purchase and get the things they love. To enrich the lives of our customers, we collaborate in cross-functional teams, in which product owners, product designers, frontend and backend engineers, data scientists and lean managers join forces. Details regarding the challenges of the respective product areas can be found here: https://kaufland-ecommerce.com/en/team/tech/   Detail   Your Tasks ‚Äì This Is What Awaits You In Detail    You work in a collaborative environment where you develop great products that bring a positive impact to our customer journey You will contribute to ensure that our payment or accounting backends are ready to handle a large scale of users You have the chance to take responsibility and work autonomously - from discovery to implementation to deployment You write clean and maintainable code that is easy to test and that you can be proud of Together with your experienced team you work in a challenging environment and look for chances to improve existing workflows and processes You continuously share your knowledge and experiences with your colleagues in pair programming sessions, code reviews and retrospectives    Your Profile ‚Äì This Is What We Expect From You    You have successfully built several PHP backends in mid to large scale software projects and are familiar with using several frameworks You are able to build solid architecture in event-driven systems and distributed systems You are confident in working with SQL databases You love solving problems and are a curious and quick learner, especially when it comes to new software applications and tools You are an experienced engineer used to solving engineering problems with the tools & frameworks that make sense both for the problem domain and the engineering organization. Our tech stack is predominantly PHP, with growing use of Node.js and Go You have the drive to continuously develop both yourself and your team further in order to become a bit better every day You have passion for what you do and a great interest in e-commerce You have excellent communication skills, are willing to embrace our company culture and values and enjoy working in an international, english-speaking team    What We Offer    Create your own work-life! We offer you the best possible flexibility in terms of working hours and location A highly-motivated and qualified team from different fields and numerous nations The future is digital - Develop the e-commerce of the future with us and work on a product with millions of users with a broadly-based technology stack Power meets dynamic - flat hierarchies and start-up mentality meet and the power of a big corporate group and offers you an agile and secure working environment at the same time Free choice of hardware ‚Äì we provide you with the development environment of your choice Personal & team growth: We love to have flexibility in terms of working location, but we also believe that personal interactions are important. That‚Äôs why we organize company events, and cover the costs to bring you there and to other (approved) get togethers with your peers. The same applies to conferences and other learning opportunities. We want everybody to grow personally and professionally, as a team and as a company. Top conditions at the Urban Sports Club for fitness, team sports, yoga and more   Check out our Principles & our blog for even more insights into our company culture!   Refer an Engineer Program  You want to work for us, but not without your dearest colleague? Join us as a team and earn money by referring your buddy for one of our open Tech positions! Depending on the level we offer a bonus up to 1.300,- ‚Ç¨ per referral, which will be paid after successful recruitment (the first part with your first salary, the second part after your buddy passes the trial period).   Bewerben  Why are you the perfect fit for this position? Don't bother with cover letters - we're interested in facts and figures!   As we have very international teams, we would highly appreciate it to receive your CV or profile link in English.   Ansprechpartner  _ _Your contact person: Laura Granrath  Kaufland e-ecommerce   Kaufland e-commerce Services GmbH   Postal address:   Habsburgerring 2   50674 K√∂ln   We're looking forward to your application!__

Title: AI Backend Engineer (f/m/d)
Description: At paretos, we deliver Data Science to go. This means, that we are eager to make data-informed decision-making available for everybody. As a ‚Äúremote-first company‚Äù with team members all over the world, we strongly believe that this ambitious path is only possible with a great and diverse team.   Paretos is an inclusive company with equal opportunities for everybody. Our culture is guided by the principles of GUNG HO ‚Äì we believe in the synergy of worthwhile work, being in control of achieving a shared goal, and the importance of cheering each other on. We are proud to have brought together passionate, high-performing, and caring individuals of all genders, cultures, backgrounds, and viewpoints. All together, we make up the heart of the company and push us to the next level on a daily basis.   Tasks  At paretos, you are part of the engineering team to develop and operate the paretos software. As a part of this product-focused team, you will work together with our geeks (mathematicians, physicists and AI specialists) and engineers on the solutions of tomorrow. Your focus is to make the great ideas of our geeks accessible for our current and future customers!    Requirements    2+ years of experience as a backend or full-stack developer, preferably in an AI or mathematic intensive environment Good knowledge in Python (especially Flask), relational Databases and HTTP API Design would be a great fit Knowledge in infrastructure technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) and system engineering (12-Factor-App, system quality attributes) would be appreciated You are used to work autonomously and self-determined Motivation to work together in a team of brilliant minds Bonus Point: You follow the SRE (Site Reliability Engineering as Google calls it) practices and mindset    Benefits    These little perks will be waiting for you if you become part of the paretos-family:   We are a remote first company ‚Äì nevertheless you‚Äôre still very welcome to work at the office and enjoy the great view over Heidelberg At the office you can test your barista skills and brew some great coffee to keep you going throughout the workday or enjoy some coffee talks with your fellow paretoneers. (You might even be awarded the next ‚Äúparetos office barista of the year‚Äù at our Christmas party!) Talking about the team: you‚Äôll complement a highly skilled & motivated team of paretoneers ready to hit the road and have fun along the way We regularly enjoy professional and fun events online and IRL with the whole team You‚Äôll get the office equipment you need to show off your full potential. We believe that your capabilities shouldn‚Äôt be limited by hardware components Work whenever it fits best for you with flexible working hours Receive a mobility budget to access various kinds of transportation whilst setting off your carbon emissions If you are part of the paretos dog club, feel free to bring your furry friend to the office   We are continuously expanding our benefits as we grow to ensure an environment where our team members feel comfortable and happy to work at.   This is it from our side for now. What about you? Are you ambitious to disrupt the AI and Optimization world with us? Then send us your application!   Note: We encourage you to apply for this role, even if you don‚Äôt match all the requirements 100%. As long as you inherit the eagerness to learn, we are happy to be convinced that you are the right fit for us.

Title: Software Engineer (100% Remote)
Description: We are looking to hire a passionate Engineer with 1-8 years experience and a track record of methodically and creatively adding value to both the business and their organization in a strategic and caring way. This is a full-time position available for immediate start.   The Software Engineer should be a strategic and analytical thinker, you should also be an effective communicator, an expert in the domains and systems that you have built, comfortable working with other experts on complicated risk analyses and operational flows, and be willing to directly dig in yourself as we expand our internal resources. You should be a thoughtful collaborator, with a deep appreciation for systems design, and a passion for building amazing and powerful experiences while knowing the tradeoffs of moving quickly and getting things working vs. going deep and perfecting a product for the long-term   We are looking for strong engineers in many areas: data and data infrastructure, full-stack web application development, front-end wizards, as well as machine learning and natural language processing specialists. You should be a deeply curious individual, and have demonstrated continuous effort to satisfy that curiosity, through research, tinkering, organizing, and teaching.   Responsibilities:   Internalize the company‚Äôs goals and vision, understanding critical and minimal needs, foreseeing potential needs, and coming up with solutions that fit the context Apply state of the art technology solutions, including data API development, modern integration patterns, frameworks for building beautiful, responsive applications, machine learning, natural language processing, and explicable AI - in partnership with key partners Support all business lines, including sales and business development, by enabling those teams while balancing competing goals, and making difficult trade-offs when required Partner effectively with Product, User Experience, Growth, and Operations toward building best-in-class systems Support the technology needs of various departments by creating a data-literate ecosystem, and helping the wider organization understand how the technology helps them and how to think about their initiatives in terms of our capabilities Be a leader, taking initiative and ownership as needed, and connecting across the organization to come up with the best solutions that combine people, process, and software    Why we think this job is great:   It‚Äôs a remote full-time, 100% remote position where you‚Äôll work from home with tech provided by the company You‚Äôll have clear goals and the training resources you need to deliver. How you execute and deliver is up to you    Qualifications:   1-8 years of experience in performing results-driven development in a collaborative environment A proven ability to conduct research and internalize user needs, in partnership with Product and User Experience Able to adjust the level of specificity and context for different audiences, either in the interest of achieving common goals efficiently or to educate others For data engineers - experience in Python, relational databases and data warehouses, business intelligence tools, containers, cloud platforms, command line scripting For web back-end engineers - experience in Python, relational databases, cloud platforms For web front-end engineers - experience in React JavaScript/Typescript, CSS, cloud platforms Experience with Data API development, AI, ML and NLP A degree in computer science, engineering, applied math or a related field; or have demonstrated significant growth and impact as an engineer, regardless of your education    Preferred Experience:   Healthcare, insurance or financial technology experience Experience with startups is not necessary, but you should be looking forward to bringing order, power, and role definition to an initial blank slate Not afraid to dive into devops as needed and help us iterate on an efficient build/deploy process and a solid infrastructure    About Us   Bold Business is a remote-first, global outsourced-solutions company with over $7B in service solutions over the past 25 years. Our international team helps the world‚Äôs leading companies transform their ideas into bold impacts. From Fortune 500 organizations looking to reduce operational costs by 40%-60% to fast-growth startups looking to scale, we work behind the scenes and empower companies to do more for less.   If you like to move fast and have a bias for action, you‚Äôll fit right into our fast-paced, results-based environment. We‚Äôre a 100% remote/virtual team environment where you can work from wherever you are.

Title: Mobile Developer (f/m/d)
Description: As a Mobile Developer, you will further evolve our marketing automation, attribution, and tracking SDK installed more than a million times a day.  At justtrack, we build a SaaS business that provides app and game publishers an attractive toolset to handle their entire global marketing growth process. Starting from managing, analyzing, and automating marketing processes justtrack enables gathering deep mobile product insights.   As part of the Applike Group (financially backed by media powerhouse Bertelsmann), justtrack has access to industry experts and funding with a long-term growth mindset.   For our app developers, we provide the justtrack SDK on Android and iOS. Besides native integrations, we also support React Native and Unity apps. We are looking for someone who steers our SDK forward with feature and improvements ideas. Our SDK developers are placed within the justtrack Core team. Our mission is to effortlessly gather, aggregate, and instantly provide all in-app event and marketing data to developers and marketers. Besides profound Kotlin/Java and Swift knowledge, our ideal candidate is interested in learning Golang and thus over time becomes the vital link between SDK and backend.  Tasks   You will implement and further develop of innovative features in our justtrack SDK Design and specification of functional requirements for Android and iOS Define our future software architecture together with other developers Improving our automated test strategy implemented via CI pipeline Collaborate with QA in order to push automated testing Close cooperation with our product managers, UX designers, and developers    Requirements    Sound knowledge of Kotlin or Java and Swift Deep understanding of underlying Android and iOS operating systems Hands-on experience to improve network security Willingness to get in touch with backend topics and therefore learn Golang Optional: Knowledge of Android NDK, React Native (TypeScript), Unity (C#), and Flutter (Dart)    Benefits    Work-Life Package: 2 remote days / week, 30 days vacation, flexible hours, kick-ass office in the center of the city, dog-friendly Relocation Package: Visa & legal support, relocation bonus, free german class in the office Happy Belly Package: Company & team lunches, breakfast, tons of free snacks and drinks Physical & Mental Health Package: Gym membership, Yoga classes Activity Package: Regular team events, hackathons, company trips Education Package: 1500‚Ç¨ Budget on top to visit conferences + online training opportunities   Skip writing cover letters. Tell us about your most passionate personal project, your desired salary and your earliest possible start date. We are looking forward to your application!   We celebrate diversity and are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Title: Software Developer .net (m/f/d) (99_CL_8_5) Hybrid-Remote offer
Description: For our client in Dortmund, we are looking for passionate Software Developers (m/w/d) to work with an amazing team to shape the future of intralogistics for forward-thinking customers.   What is your role?   You are part of a multidisciplinary team that develops and realises robot-based products. You work with state-of-the-art technologies in the field of image-based industrial robotics. Remote/Hybrid working policy   Who are we looking for? You have sound experience with object-oriented software development. You have good analytical skills and can deduce requirements from customer-specific problems You have several years of experience in C# and .net programming You have experience in user interface as well as backend development Microservices, Docker and Linux are part of your everyday working life You work in a structured manner and live the processes required for the care, maintenance and continuous development of existing code. Experience with unit testing is advantageous You have basic German and good English language skills. Other foreign languages are an advantage.

Title: Full-Stack-Developer:in (m/w/d)

Title: Software Developer .net (m/f/d) (99_CL_8_5) @Swisslog
Description: About Our Customer ‚Äì Swisslog    Swisslog is shaping the #future of #intralogistics. As part of the KUKA Group, we work on the latest technologies that are changing the world. We are a team of 2,000 professionals from 50 countries serving some of the world‚Äôs biggest and most exciting brands. Together we are working on revolutionizing intralogistics in a smart way and with new perspectives. With our flexible #robot-based and #data-supported automation solutions, we drive the supply chain and advance the industry. #Joinourteams and bring ideas to life!   Apply now for free in one minute and receive a direct interview with the client.   As part of our client‚Äôs #softwaredevelopment team with a strong team spirit, you will harness the power of technology to shape the future of intralogistics for forward-thinking clients. We are offering a talented person the opportunity to join our amazing team and reach their full potential ‚Äì could it be you?   What is your role?   You are part of a multidisciplinary team that develops and realises robot-based products. You work with state-of-the-art technologies in the field of image-based industrial robotics. You maintain and improve existing algorithms for path planning of industrial robots You test your work results integratively and in test facilities The amount of travelling is approx. 20%. Remote/Hybrid working policy   Who are we looking for?   You have a master‚Äôs degree or diploma in computer science or electrical engineering or can otherwise demonstrate the required competence and experience in software development. You have sound experience with object-oriented software development. You have good analytical skills and can deduce requirements from customer-specific problems You have several years of experience in C# and .net programming You have experience in user interface as well as backend development Microservices, Docker and Linux are part of your everyday working life You work in a structured manner and live the processes required for the care, maintenance and continuous development of existing code. Experience with unit testing is advantageous You have basic German and good English language skills. Other foreign languages are an advantage.   Salary: ‚Ç¨50,000 ‚Äì ‚Ç¨80,000 (or negotiable based on experience level)   Swisslog offers you the opportunity for personal development while you work with us on a groundbreaking mission: to change the future of intralogistics by creating an era of robot-based and data-driven solutions that create outstanding customer value. We‚Äôre proud of our Swiss roots, while the opportunities we offer span the globe. We don‚Äôt expect perfection, but we do expect collaboration, commitment, clarity and competence (our core values) from all of our employees. In return, we offer you the chance to be part of the driving force behind solutions that change the future.   ‚Äì Onboarding   ‚Äì Free parking   ‚Äì Access to public transport   ‚Äì Job bike   ‚Äì Flexible working options (hybrid/remote)   ‚Äì Great team spirit

Title: UI/UX developer
Description: We're changing the world - and you'll be an instrumental part of helping us to do this. You live user interfaces and design? You love to improve designs and analyse the impact of them? You love observing users to optimize their workflows? And you know the true way of communication is giphys? Join us at retraced  !   üíª Work  : remote, working in CET   üìç Location  : Europe or willingness to relocate to Germany after 1 year   üí∞ Salary  : Let us know   üöÄ Your mission   As a UI/UX web developer you shape our user interfaces to have a fantastic user experience. You will work on anything from design to final execution of design in code. Coding up your designs and bringing them to life is your special skill and will be your main responsiblity.   A typical workflow could be working on future product features and influence their UI/UX with your expertise. Another big area is the ever improving of all user interfaces to be ever more intuitive and pleasureful to use.   You will work with a highly ambitious team that strives to build the world's leading sustainability management platform. You will be an integral part to shape all our user interfaces so that together we make sustainability management a pleasure.   üó∫ What is retraced   We are building the platform to manage sustainability information for every participant in the fashion industry. The platform provides ways to communicate sustainability for fashion brands in their online stores, but especially all the back-office tasks to maintain and overview the sustainability standards. The functions include high level certificate management and goes deep down to farmer entering data into our app to trace origins of raw materials.   üéØRequirements   class Employee { constructor() { this.skillSet = { required: [ {type: "Javascript", status: "expert"}, {type: "React", status: "expert"}, {type: "UX design", years: 5}, {type: "CSS", status: "expert"}, {type: "XD/Balsamiq/Sketch/Figma", status: "expert"}, ].every(v => v === true), optional: [ hasBuildComponentFramework(), hasUsedWebComponents(), hasSEOoptimizedPages(), ].some(v => v === true), frameworks: [ "Bulma", "ANT design", "Tailwind", "Material UI" ].any(v => v === true) } } }   üõ† Skillset   JavaScript, CSS, HTML ‚â•6y Expert in UX design ‚â•3y Worked with styling frameworks like Bulma, ANT, Tailwind or Material UI Expertise in ReactJS ‚â• 3 years Very good English    Very nice to have   Worked with HTML web components Build a component framework with storybook or similar TailwindCSS    üé≠ Personal   Everyone is different. We accept your personality as it comes. You might feel especially comfortable with us, if you:   You like to take responsibly for what you build You turn your camera on in Zoom You embrace feedback into your design and you let yourself being challenged on design decisions    ü•≥Benefits you will love   ü§∏‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Work flexibility  Besides some core working hours, you have the flexibility to adjust your working times. As long as you are well reachable and it does not clash with meetings, it's up to you when you work!   üè° Home office  You can always work from home. But if you ever wish to work from the office in Dusseldorf, we also support relocation.   üëï Sustainable clothing  Enjoy sustainable clothing with a family & friends discounts at nearly all our clients - From swim wear, children shoes over to evening dresses!   üåè Impactful code  The goal of our platform is to ensure proven sustainability and eradication of greenwashing. Every line of code you contribute will make impact on this world as it improves sustainability management.   üå¥ 24 paid holidays  Enjoy sunshine and beach, or cottage and fireplace with a generous 24 paid holidays per year. We believe regular holidays are important.   üìÖ German public holidays  You will have all German holidays! Don't be sad, because it's one of the countries with the most holidays!   üî™ Cutting edge stack  We support anything new in tech - any time. You are an expert in Cloudflare functions? Or you know a new form management library in React? Why not give it a try.   üé® Mini hackathons  We do at least one tech spike or mini hackathons per month to rapidly develop new product features. They are super exciting and allow you to let your creativity flow.   üìΩ Remote culture  To compensate our physical distance, we regularly meet for a tea or cold beer. And if you are up for it, why not watch a movie in sync together!   ü§ù Vendor relationship  We have very strong bonds with Oracle product management and the ability to talk directly to the product management of Oracle in San Francisco!   üß≥ Paid trips to our office  If you ever plan to visit the our main office in Dusseldorf the trip is on us! Also, Peter our CTO is in Cyprus, you might want to pass by there.   üë®‚Äçüè´ Learn compliance in fashion industry  Trust us, it only sounds boring when you hear it. But the content of compliance is fascinating and surprisingly interesting! It affects us every day.   üìü Visa sponsorship  We do support visa sponsorships if you have an existing working permit in Europe.   üíª Equipment of your choice  You want to use your own hardware? Fine! You want new hardware? Fine! We will organize something.   üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Fast leading possibility  Our company structure allows fast tracking to take ownership of projects or small teams.   ü•á Support certifications  We support personal growth and provide support for you to make certifications and grow further in any kind of direction.   üéØFacts about us   22üë®üèø‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèø  team members   8üåç  nationalities   9500‚òï  coffee cups per year   ‚ú®How does your first week look like?   You will get your own mentor  within the team. This is the person who will introduce you to the system, what we do and how the basic infrastructure looks like. They will also guide you to setup everything locally.   Usually the first goal for development is to have your first change  in our system live by the end of the first week  ! It sounds ambitious, but we have met the goal 100% of the times. And you will feel proud having a direct impact.   Further, you will also be able to participate as a listener in a sales call  . This way, you get an introduction to the system through sales perspective and you will feel like a client who will use the system in the future!   üíΩOur tech stack   üíæ Backend  We are running all our NodeJS microservices in Oracle Kubernetes Engine. We are not using Typescript.   üíÖ Frontend  We have a backoffice in React, two mobile apps developed with ReactNative, a homepage with NextJS and shop integrations in customer languages whereas the actual components placed in the shops are web-components build with Preact.   üíø Database  We have an Oracle Autonomous Transaction Processing - or more simple Cloud SQL database üòÄ.   ‚òÅÔ∏è Cloud providers  We have AWS services for routing and DNS management, CloudFlare for deployment of web-components and Oracle for the service infrastructure and networking part.   üíñOur values   üå≥ UN Sustainable Development Goals  - Our work and our mind is committed to strive and fulfill the sustainable development goals from the UN by 2030. This includes our platform we are building, but also each of our personal attitudes.   üå± We believe in a sustainable corporate  - We are part of of the UN Global Compact program and are committed to the ten principle to corporate sustainability - Including human rights, labour, environment and anti-corruption.   üèÜ We are ambitious -  We do not just want to be a platform. We want to the  platform for sustainability management. The sky is the limit. We reach for all stars possible to build a better solution than anyone else.   üôã‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è We strive for constant growth and always learn  - Good is not good enough. We bet on and invest in the growth of our people. We are aware of the compounding effects of becoming 1% better every day.   ‚öñ We bank on fundamentals  - Hard truths. We constantly question our solution approaches and actions to be at the forefront of innovation.   üîÑ We believe fast iterations  - Move to improve. We are impatient and execute fast. We don't believe in perfect results with the first iteration but we celebrate every win and loss to get better.   Hi there üëã   I am Peter, CTO and co-founder of retraced. We at retraced are a big family and together, aim to change the fashion industry for the better. Our development crew is a diverse bunch from Philippines, Greece, New Zealand, Germany, Vietnam and elsewhere!   We all share together the vision to empower consumers to make educated choices when buying fashion items. And to do so, we built the tool for any fashion company to collect, process and share their sustainability information in an easy manner.   My background is in computer science and I am a geek. I love technology and my instrinsic goal is to use tech to innovate the world. My foremost goal is actually ensure the cool possibilities so that our engineers can everytime build something more amazing and more impactful. This is also my perception of how we will work together and extend retraced's functionalities together.   Hope to receive your application soon!   Best regards, Peter   ‚öôÔ∏èHiring process   Submit your application üìë Just use the form below CV, LinkedIn profile or Github profile. Whichever you find reflects you most. We will anyways google you ü§™ Your salary range expectations Your earliest starting date Explain in two three sentences what is (in your opinion) the best technology you have worked on so far Get to know each other üëã In our first call, we want to exchange expectations and clear up your most urging questions. Furthermore, we want to excite you about our mission and product. Interview case ‚úçÔ∏è This might be the most fun part. Develop a program to solve a small but tricky problem. We will catch up a couple of days later and let you walk us through your stellar work. Meet the team ‚òï Right after your interview case, we want you to meet 1-2 of your potential colleagues during a peer interview. We deeply value team chemistry and want to give you the opportunity to get to know each other before working together. Et voil√†: Offer! üíÉ We aim to finish the entire process as soon as possible.

Title: Full-Stack Developer - Recruiting Dashboard (m/w/d)
Description: Arbeiten bei Kooku  "Die Arbeitsatmosph√§re, mit den super Kollegen, ist absolute spitze. Auch bei intensiverem workload ist man f√ºr einander da. Du hast Erfahrung mit g√§ngigen Backend-Frameworks wie Spring Boot und kennst dich mit Java und OOP aus. Dir bereitet es Freude, UI zu designen und immer im Hinterkopf zu haben, dass der User an erster Stelle steht. Du arbeitest am liebsten im Team und √ºbernimmst auch gerne Hands-on Verantwortung. Du bist zuverl√§ssig, kommunikativ und motiviert, gemeinsam mit uns und √ºber dich hinauszuwachsen. Dein Ausdruck ist einwandfrei und du bist besonders sicher in deutscher, aber auch in englischer Rechtschreibung und Grammatik. Idealerweise hast du erste Erfahrungen mit Git, REST API, Responsive Design, Tailwind oder √§hnlichem (Bootstrap, UI Libraries)   Dein/e Ansprechpartner/in  Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung! Bei Fragen kannst Du Dich jederzeit an unser Recruiting Team wenden.   Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich sehr bald n√§her kennenzulernen!   √úber Uns  Als Recruitment-Agentur f√ºr digitales Recruiting und Interim HR Management durchleuchten und optimieren wir Recruiting-Prozesse und unterst√ºtzen ganzheitlich bei der Besetzung offener Vakanzen ganz ohne Headhunter-Pr√§mien oder -Provisionen. Title: Software Developer Java (M/F/X)
Description:
What we do As IoT pioneers, we now develop complete IoT solutions for our customers with over 40 colleagues at three locations. Currently, more than 500,000 devices and systems worldwide are equipped with our solutions for machine-to-machine communication. Our expertise lies in the development of customer-specific IoT solutions, based on our experience, our proven software modules and a large number of projects already implemented. Our Team Since the company was founded in 2004, we have grown steadily and established ourselves as a strong partner in this market over the years. To keep it that way, we are continuously expanding our team with talented and qualified developers. We take our team to the next level by offering a wide range of training opportunities, participation in conferences and workshops, and a strong feedback culture. To strengthen our backend team, we are looking for a Software Developer Java (M/F/X) at the BERLIN location as soon as possible. Your tasks as a Software Developer Java You develop software in a team with tools like GitLab, Maven, JIRA, Confluence, etc. You develop microservices in Java. You program high-quality and well-tested software. You participate in the successful commissioning of the developed software at the customer's site. You supervise and support our customers in ongoing projects.

Desired Skills and Experience

You have a degree or completed vocational training in the following areas: Informatics, electrotechnology, physics, mathematics or another comparable area You already have experience in software development. You have good knowledge of Java or another object-oriented programming language Experience in one or some of the following areas: Cloud Native, Microprofile, Quarkus Hibernate, JPA RESTful Webservices, OIDC, JWT Git, Maven Docker or Kubernetes Relational, object-oriented or NoSQL-Databasesystems Google Maps API You work independently, goal- and solution-oriented. Personality competence, ability to work in a team and quality awareness characterize you. You have fluent German or English skills.

Title: Software Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Global Savings Group is Europe's largest and most trusted shopping rewards platform, empowering millions of people to make better purchase decisions.   GSG values a culture of belonging, where you can join a talented team of 600+ people from more than 50 countries in 12 office locations. With us, you will reach millions of customers worldwide, connecting them directly to the brands they love.   You will become a part of the agile, fast-growing team of experts, including tech enthusiasts, online marketers, key account managers, and editors. You will have the opportunity to work on projects with an international footprint where we value your input and allow you to become a driver of change.    What We Offer...    A culture that cherishes your individual and professional development An open-minded team that embraces new ideas, perspectives, and methodologies Healthy and safe work environment enrolled into a hybrid working model with the flexibility of working from home or from the office Possibility to work up to 6 weeks per year from all over the globe Local and international get-togethers - subject to local Covid-19 regulations    We are currently looking for a Software Engineer (m/f/d)  to join our Engineering team in our office in Berlin  . Our Product and Technology team  is autonomous and co-functional, operating in an agile environment with a customer focus. Our engineers, product managers, designers, QA, and analysts target outcomes rather than outputs, using OKRs to deliver our vision.   You should have:   BS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience 3-6 years of experience in developing complex modular applications from technical planning to implementation Strong knowledge of Java (8 or higher) and object-oriented programming Strong exposure to API development and microservice architecture Logical, analytic thinking, structured and target-oriented approach, very good problem solving skills Passion for delivering clean code, unit/integration tests and maintainable documentation Good understanding of common design/architectural patterns Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies and DevOps best practices Good communication skills in English    The following skills are a plus:   Experience with or interest in AWS, ElasticSearch, Relational and NoSql DBs, messaging and queuing solutions, GraphQl Knowledge of common frameworks (Hibernate, Spring, Jersey, Liquibase), VCS (Git), Docker, CI/CD solutions    Are you up for it?  Send us your CV in English  .   Any questions? Get in touch with Viktoria.  At Global Savings Group, we want to ensure that all employees can thrive in an inclusive environment. Our employment opportunities are open to every gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, ability, place of origin, or socioeconomic status. We remain committed to a culture of diversity, equity and belonging, where all employees are welcomed, respected, connected, and engaged.

Title: Gameplay Programmer
Description: As a Gameplay Programmer you will be working with our bespoke, cutting edge, multi-threaded engine to create gameplay mechanics and systems, which immerse players within the vast, yet highly detailed spacescapes of some of the most ambitious games ever developed.   Working with the latest PC hardware, technology and APIs, we develop an extensive range of highly realistic and systemic features to simulate gameplay ranging from multi-crew space flight combat to planetary first-person shooter, asteroid mining to cargo running, and bounty hunting to cinematic storytelling.   Founded in 2012, Cloud Imperium Games creates cutting-edge videogames that defy expectations. We‚Äôre currently developing Star Citizen, a record-breaking multiplayer online space sim, and Squadron 42, a cinematic single-player adventure set in the same universe. Join us as we break boundaries and make videogame history.   We are a crowdfunded company and have a dedicated and enthusiastic community of backers who are helping us create the ‚ÄúBest Damn Space Sim Ever‚Äù.   For more information about life at Cloud Imperium Games, check this out - https://youtu.be/cXjp7SRBpIA   What do our Gameplay Programmers do?  The day to day responsibilities of our Gameplay Programmers vary, but in short, you will be:   Designing and implementing well-engineered, reliable, scalable and robust code. Collaborating with other team members and disciplines to develop various gameplay systems. Peer-reviewing technical designs and documentation with the help of the wider team. Identifying technical and developmental risks and obstacles while creating innovative solutions to overcome them. Driving engineering principles and practices for their teams, pushing boundaries and promoting new and innovative ways of working. Supporting our growth culture and advocating knowledge sharing.   What would we expect from our Gameplay Programmers?  A true passion for making games is a must, and we would also like it if you:   Are comfortable working with C++ in a large, shared codebase. Have a good knowledge of 3D mathematics. Have experience with programming game features and systems. Work well in a co-located yet collaborative team environment. Can explain and present technical solutions to both programmers and team members from other disciplines. We are always keen to hear from passionate gameplay programmers, so join the ‚Äòverse and become our latest Star Citizen!   CIG Diversity Statement  CIG is a global company, staunchly committed to cultivating a culture and workplace that celebrates all backgrounds, lifestyles, and perspectives. Together, we are creating a space where authentic recognition, appreciation, and understanding of the importance of diversity is fostered by everyone. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we strive to build a team that represents all walks of life, and we want every employee to bring all the things that make them unique to the work environment. The universe is as vast and varied as the people in it, and it‚Äôs our differences that make it special.   Fraud Statement  We are aware of people receiving job offers that fraudulently allege to be from CIG. These types of fraud can be carried out through false websites, fake email addresses claiming to be from our company, or social media. We do not ask for your personal info like bank account numbers, identification numbers, etc through social media or chat-based apps, nor do we request or send money for the purchase of business equipment.   If you suspect fraud, please report it to your local authorities, as well as reaching out to us at info{@}cloudimperiumgames.com with any information you may have.

Title: Javascript Software Developer (m/f/x) @ VC-Backed Clean-Tech Venture
Description: We are Klim, a Berlin-based Clean-Tech startup on the mission to scale up Carbon Farming as fast as possible across Europe and beyond. With an ambitious and mission-driven team, strong VC-backing, and great B2B partnerships we are ready to grow. We believe that Carbon Farming is the key to the future of agriculture and our planet. Don‚Äôt believe us? Watch ‚ÄúKiss the Ground‚Äù to change your mind.   Our business model: We are enabling farmers to take on climate change, while turning their businesses more profitable and sustainable. This is made possible by the world's first digital platform for carbon farming as well as related B2B carbon offsetting services, including a Klim food label.   Backed by leading European investors, including Atlantic Food Labs, Ananda Impact Ventures and Wi Venture, and after building an MVP (iOS & Android hybrid app and web app), we are now looking for a passionate Javascript developer to add to our tech team.    Please note:    No recruiters or agencies wanted. Do not contact us. If you don't receive a response, then please consider your application unsuccessful. You may apply again to future postings. Please don't contact us by other means.   Tasks  As a Javascript Engineer, you will be working directly with our CTO and other team members to rapidly build new features and improve existing ones in our current MVP. Later, you'll be working on our web app, React Native app, and backend Node API.   Our tech stack:   ReactJS for our web platform NodeJS & Express for our backend API Postgres for relational DB & Sequelize ORM Cordova for our hybrid MVP app (our replacement React Native app will start development soon) AWS and related services for our infrastructure    Requirements    Min 2 - 3 years of experience working with React in a production environment Min 1 year of experience working with Node Experience with agile development Ability to ensure that your code is clean and bug free! Fluent/good English Experience with React Native is a plus Experience with AWS is a plus Experience and passion for startups is a huge plus    What You Need To Succeed In This Role    You must be comfortable working in a small team and by yourself where necessary - we‚Äôre a small startup and we trust each other to do great work! You enjoy the challenges and rewards of working in a startup environment. You should have good knowledge and experience of translating product feature ideas into working components. You must be passionate about deploying tested and bug free code that works in every edge case.    Benefits    Job can be based in our office in Berlin (remote possible in the EU only) A rewarding role in an already funded, high-impact startup Opportunity to build a real-world solution used by thousands of farmers A trusting environment with more challenges and freedom than a corporate gig We are only just starting out - at Klim, you can shape the vision with us and bring in your own fresh ideas Perks include team lunches (if in Berlin), regular team events, a great office with a rooftop and our office-grown fruit & vegetables   We look forward to your application, and don't forget to keep being awesome!

Title: Backend Developer (Python)
Description: The time is now to start your next career step at Process&, one of the most innovative global data science and tech companies.  At Processand, we are building a market  leading product  that defines the new category of Data Intelligence Platforms  (DIP).   We give data-driven & AI technologies  context and let them speak in a wholly new way based on our innovative intelligence graph technology,  which is powered by our in-house developed Real-Time  Parsing Engine  . The Processand Data Intelligence Platform can be placed right on top of any existing IT landscape to automatically extract, manage, and distribute critical data knowhow to data workers who need it the most. In addition, our Intelligence Graph is deeply integrated with a set of instruments and applications that help companies drastically increase efficiency in every facet of data engineering, from data transformation and documentation, to governance, and automations.   Our technology helps bring immediate value  to the biggest enterprises around the globe, and makes a direct impact  on how people work day-to-day. For Global 2000 companies, transforming to an intelligent enterprise has become a key strategic priority. Processand has many global customers including BMW, Swisscom, DB, Sabic, Eon, R+V, or Rational. All of them rely on Processand knowhow and technology to unlock their full analytics capacity and drive change to business processes.   Processand has grown massively in 4 years with over 200% in the past year. We are continuously expanding, especially in Europe, US and Asia, to be able to serve local markets. We have offices in Prague (Czech Republic), Austin (Texas), and Taipei (Taiwan) as Centers of Excellence for international tech talent. Our current headquarters are in Munich, Germany.   At each and every Processand office, we get things done quickly  by cultivating an open-minded culture with creative, collaborative, autonomous teams  in which the best ideas win. As part of Product & Engineering you will have the opportunity to grow  with a steep learning curve,  being equipped with responsibility  from day 1.   At Processand, we believe that every company can unlock their full data intelligence - and for that we need you as a Backend Engineer  .   Be ready to participate & join a multicultural family at Process&!  You are passionate about data analytics & developing web applications? Read on!  Tasks  As BE Engineer at Processand, you are responsible for optimizing & implementing existing product features  & winning our users through your brilliant applications. You will work with Python, SQL and various micro-services  creating innovative and intelligent data solutions. You will further work on our in-house developed components library that is being used by multiple teams & applications.   You will be working in a cross-functional team closely with our UX designer, Product Manager and Frontend Engineers. You will also get a chance to improve and share your skills among our backend guild.    Requirements    have 2+ years of experience in building Python applications professionally write clear, understandable and testable code with continuous focus on maintainability have strong algorithmic and problem-solving skills with a good understanding of complex data structures (optionally) have experience with graph theory and machine learning libraries such as Pytorch, Tensorflow or Scikit-learn show a high level of motivation and commitment have excellent English skills (German optional)    Benefits    Benefits (at) Process&:   A highly ambitious and skilled team of international talents Chance to become one of the first employees in a fast-growing venture-backed tech startup Opportunities to actively shape and accelerate your professional and personal development Very fast decision-making processes and flat hierarchies cutting-edge tech stack: Docker, Node.js, React+Redux, Redis, GraphQL, Cypress, Kafka, AWS/GCP/Azure and many more training from experts in the field of data science and intelligence applications Flexible working hours, work from home and a top-equipped workplace in the middle of Munich An attractive compensation package and multiple career development paths fresh fruit, drinks, water, and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) A multicultural, open-minded team with start-up spirit, company retreats & events   Processand is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.   Apply today! We are happy to receive your CV & application documents and learn more about you.

Damit Du auf dem neuesten Stand bleibst:  Modern ausgestattete Arbeitspl√§tze, Nutzung neuester Technologien, umfassendes Angebot an internen und externen Weiterbildungsma√ünahmen sowie Knowledge Upgrade Lectures und kostenfreie ebooks . Title: Backend Developer ‚Äì Remote in Germany possible (m/f/d)

The platform connects farmers, equipment dealers, inspection companies, financial institutions, logistics providers as well as insurance companies to eliminate current trading barriers.   E-FARM‚Äôs competitive edge originates in a data-driven approach to exploiting market inefficiencies across borders and industry segments. Having just closed a financing round with a leading farm equipment manufacturer and a tech-focused venture capital company, E-FARM is looking for motivated and open-minded talents to further scale its operations. Applied technologies are Node.js, NestJS, TypeScript, Docker, AWS, MongoDB.   Your challenge   You will be responsible for our website and will re-build it as a greenfield project in close collaboration with the Marketing and the Sales Team You will implement state of the art Web Apps and Microservices You will build a performant, scalable, well-tested, and maintainable website You are responsible for the whole development process from refinement to implementation, delivery and future iterations You are a strong driver in the team, take responsibility and are able to make decisions independently You want to be a part of something big, always proactive and want to take our products to the next level   Your profile   You have deep expertise in Node.js, backend frameworks and microservices You have experience in TypeScript You are familiar with automated testing, CI/CD pipelines and Docker You know how to build and execute tech projects from the scratch You‚Äôre curious and always willing to learn new things and share your knowledge, trying to improve yourself with every opportunity An agile mindset, a well-structured working style and a strong team and problem-solving skills characterize you You like to work in a cross-functional team You are familiar with Kanban or Scrum, pair-programming, TDD and code reviews You are based anywhere in Germany or want to relocate Fluency in English, German is a plus   Our proposition   State of the art tech stack, tools and work methodologies The chance to grow with us and to build a successful company together A well-equipped workplace with a company laptop, monitors and headphones Subsidized Swapfiets membership or HVV Ticket (ProfiCard) An appreciative atmosphere with fast decision-making processes, in which your ideas are always welcome An open, supportive and fun team from different nations: With us, you will always find someone to help you when questions arise or simply to challenge you to a game of FIFA and Ping Pong A welcoming office in the heart of Hamburg A monthly company meeting with pizza and drinks to share successes, challenges and progress A special annual company trip Two friendly office dogs and lots of fun at work

Title: Software Engineer (m/f/x)

Title: Software Engineer Backend
Description: Einleitung  To strengthen our Backend Development Team we are looking for a Software Engineer (m/f/d) for the next possible date who not only wants to work with us, but also wants to actively shape the area. Title: C++ developer in Berlin and REMOTE. 130 000 euro per year
Description: A wide array of extremely challenging C++ development tasks  An international team of brilliant minds A competitive salary from the start and a raise to EUR 130,000 annually  after only one year A working environment that makes this team stay and grow Enough time  to make sure that every detail of your solution is perfect A flat organization and plenty of room for your ideas No scheduled meetings  Family-friendly working hours, no deadlines, no overtime Support for relocation to Berlin or remote work  opportunity!     About this job  We are looking for smart, creative developers with a solid theoretical background. You should be able to look at a problem from the user's perspective, discuss abstract concepts with fellow developers, as well as produce an elegant implementation. Developers we have hired in the past mostly hold an exceptional master's degree in computer science or even a doctorate.    At think-cell, we like flat hierarchies. You will work largely independently and will be responsible for the whole range of activities when implementing a new feature. We expect each of our developers to do architecture, design, implementation and bug fixing, rather than splitting these activities between several people. We thus minimize communication losses and put everyone in control of their own work. Your ideas are welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better.    We have published several scientific articles in the areas of Artificial Intelligence and Computer Graphics and we will encourage you to do the same. We sponsor visits to conferences and have close connections to universities and research institutes in the U.S. and Germany.    think-cell encourages a healthy work-life balance. We do not work at night or on weekends, and support our staff's families with a full-time company nanny. She is available for free when children are sick, or if you just feel like spending an evening out.    We pay very competitive salaries, and offer our developers EUR 130,000 annually following one year of employment. If necessary, we will go out of our way to help you relocate to Berlin, and will do what we can to help you acquire a work permit.     Remote work is now also possible!     About our software  Since 2002, think-cell produces graphics software that performs most of the painstaking work of creating data-driven slides for professional Excel and PowerPoint users. PowerPoint slide creation is one of the most popular things professionals use a computer for. Thus, it is rather surprising that while intelligent software has revolutionized many things we frequently do, such as web search in our browser, or telephone speech recognition in a call center, office productivity software has not changed much over the past decade or so.    think-cell is out to change this. We stand out from the crowd of other presentation software because we are willing to do the leg work of developing sophisticated algorithms and refining our user interface, which makes working with our software so satisfying for our users. Here are some highlights of what we have done.     Algorithmic highlights   We developed a new algorithm for automatic point cloud labeling that allows labels to be positioned away from the actual points. We developed a new algorithm for automatic column chart labeling. We are working with John Forrest ‚Äì author of the linear solver CLP ‚Äì to make his simplex code faster on our kind of problems. We developed quite a few generic data structures that are not in C++ or Boost, for example partitions.     Hacking highlights   To do things that are not possible via the documented Microsoft Office API, we do lots of reverse engineering with the disassembler IDA from Hex-Rays. We wrote probably the best function hooking engine out there. On each start of our software, we patch the Microsoft Office executables in memory. We search for small chunks of assembly code rather than hard-coding patch addresses to be robust against minor code modifications. We redirect PowerPoint's and Excel's window contents into offscreen buffers and use Direct3D 9.0 to render our user interface on top.     Other highlights   We fund the working group for programming languages of the German Institute for Standardization (DIN). Some of our employees are members of this committee and vote in the international standardization process of ISO/IEC C++. We closely track the latest versions of our compilers, Visual C++ and Xcode, so we can always use the latest C++ standard features as soon as they become available. We use Boost throughout our code, e.g., Boost.Spirit for most of our parsing needs. We have our own range library, in the same spirit as Boost.Range or Eric Niebler‚Äôs range-v3, but going further, for example, by unifying internal and external iteration. We gave a talk about it, and most of the code is public. We have our own reference-counting and persistence libraries to save and restore whole object trees. We wrote a parser and writer for the Excel .xls format. We have an extensive bug reporting infrastructure. Assertions and error checks stay in the release code, and our software automatically reports bugs to our server. The server analyzes the bug, categorizes it and files it in a database that all developers can access. If an update fixes the bug, the user can download the update directly from a bug response web page.     Interested?  If you are the one missing from our team then please send us your electronic application via hr@think-cell.com     We will only accept applications that contain a CV.
